1388.arabic: إِنَّما مَثَلُ الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا كَماءٍ أَنزَلنـٰهُ مِنَ السَّماءِ فَاختَلَطَ بِهِ نَباتُ الأَرضِ مِمّا يَأكُلُ النّاسُ وَالأَنعـٰمُ حَتّىٰ إِذا أَخَذَتِ الأَرضُ زُخرُفَها وَازَّيَّنَت وَظَنَّ أَهلُها أَنَّهُم قـٰدِرونَ عَلَيها أَتىٰها أَمرُنا لَيلًا أَو نَهارًا فَجَعَلنـٰها حَصيدًا كَأَن لَم تَغنَ بِالأَمسِ كَذٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ الـٔايـٰتِ لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
1388.en: The example of the life of this world (which has enamoured you into becoming heedless to Our signs) is that of water that We sent down from the heaven which causes the vegetation of the earth, which sustains men and cattle, to grow luxuriantly. But when the earth took on its golden raiment and became well adorned and the owners believed that they had full control over their lands Our command came upon them by night or by day, and We convened it into a stubble, as though it had not blossomed yesterday. Thus do We expound the signs for a people who reflect.

1389.arabic: وَاللَّهُ يَدعوا إِلىٰ دارِ السَّلـٰمِ وَيَهدى مَن يَشاءُ إِلىٰ صِرٰطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
1389.en: (You are being lured by this ephemeral world) although Allah calls you to the abode of peace and guides whomsoever He wills to a straightway.

1390.arabic: لِلَّذينَ أَحسَنُوا الحُسنىٰ وَزِيادَةٌ وَلا يَرهَقُ وُجوهَهُم قَتَرٌ وَلا ذِلَّةٌ أُولـٰئِكَ أَصحـٰبُ الجَنَّةِ هُم فيها خـٰلِدونَ
1390.en: For those who do good there is good reward and more besides; neither gloom nor humiliation shall cover their faces. They are the people of the Garden and in it they shall abide.

1391.arabic: وَالَّذينَ كَسَبُوا السَّيِّـٔاتِ جَزاءُ سَيِّئَةٍ بِمِثلِها وَتَرهَقُهُم ذِلَّةٌ ما لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن عاصِمٍ كَأَنَّما أُغشِيَت وُجوهُهُم قِطَعًا مِنَ الَّيلِ مُظلِمًا أُولـٰئِكَ أَصحـٰبُ النّارِ هُم فيها خـٰلِدونَ
1391.en: Those who do evil deeds, the recompense of an evil deed is its like, and humiliation shall spread over them and there will be none to protect them from Allah. Darkness will cover their faces as though they were veiled with the dark blackness of night. These are the people of the Fire and in it they shall abide.

1392.arabic: وَيَومَ نَحشُرُهُم جَميعًا ثُمَّ نَقولُ لِلَّذينَ أَشرَكوا مَكانَكُم أَنتُم وَشُرَكاؤُكُم فَزَيَّلنا بَينَهُم وَقالَ شُرَكاؤُهُم ما كُنتُم إِيّانا تَعبُدونَ
1392.en: And the Day when We shall muster them all together, We shall say to those who associated others with Allah in His divinity: 'Keep to your places # you and those whom you associated with Allah.' Then We shall remove the veil of foreignness separating them. Those whom they had associated with Allah will say. 'It was not us that you worshipped.

1393.arabic: فَكَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهيدًا بَينَنا وَبَينَكُم إِن كُنّا عَن عِبادَتِكُم لَغـٰفِلينَ
1393.en: Allah's witness suffices between you and us that (even if you worshipped us) we were totally unaware of your worshipping us.

1394.arabic: هُنالِكَ تَبلوا كُلُّ نَفسٍ ما أَسلَفَت وَرُدّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ مَولىٰهُمُ الحَقِّ وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
1394.en: Thereupon everyone shall taste the recompense of his past deeds. All shall be sent back to Allah, their true Lord, and then all the falsehoods they had fabricated will have forsaken them.

1395.arabic: قُل مَن يَرزُقُكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ أَمَّن يَملِكُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصـٰرَ وَمَن يُخرِجُ الحَىَّ مِنَ المَيِّتِ وَيُخرِجُ المَيِّتَ مِنَ الحَىِّ وَمَن يُدَبِّرُ الأَمرَ فَسَيَقولونَ اللَّهُ فَقُل أَفَلا تَتَّقونَ
1395.en: Ask them: 'Who provides you with sustenance out of the heavens and the earth? Who holds mastery over your hearing and sight? Who brings forth the living from the dead and the dead from the living? Who governs all affairs of the universe?' They will surely say: 'Allah.' Tell them: 'Will you, then, not shun (going against reality)?"

1396.arabic: فَذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُمُ الحَقُّ فَماذا بَعدَ الحَقِّ إِلَّا الضَّلـٰلُ فَأَنّىٰ تُصرَفونَ
1396.en: Such, then, is Allah, your true Lord. And what is there after truth but error? How, then, are you being turned away?

1397.arabic: كَذٰلِكَ حَقَّت كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ عَلَى الَّذينَ فَسَقوا أَنَّهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
1397.en: Thus the word of your Lord is fulfilled concerning the transgressors that they shall not believe.

1398.arabic: قُل هَل مِن شُرَكائِكُم مَن يَبدَؤُا۟ الخَلقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ قُلِ اللَّهُ يَبدَؤُا۟ الخَلقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ فَأَنّىٰ تُؤفَكونَ
1398.en: Ask them: 'Is there any among those whom you associate with Allah in His divinity who brings about the creation of all beings in the first instance and will then repeat it?' Tell them: 'It is Allah Who brings about the creation of all beings and will then repeat it. How are you, then, being misled?

1399.arabic: قُل هَل مِن شُرَكائِكُم مَن يَهدى إِلَى الحَقِّ قُلِ اللَّهُ يَهدى لِلحَقِّ أَفَمَن يَهدى إِلَى الحَقِّ أَحَقُّ أَن يُتَّبَعَ أَمَّن لا يَهِدّى إِلّا أَن يُهدىٰ فَما لَكُم كَيفَ تَحكُمونَ
1399.en: Ask them: 'Are there among ones whom you associate with Allah in His divinity those who can guide to the truth? Say: 'It is Allah alone Who guides to the truth.' Then, who is more worthy to be followed # He Who guides to the truth, or he who cannot find the right way unless others guide him to it? What is wrong with you? How ill do you judge!

1400.arabic: وَما يَتَّبِعُ أَكثَرُهُم إِلّا ظَنًّا إِنَّ الظَّنَّ لا يُغنى مِنَ الحَقِّ شَيـًٔا إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ بِما يَفعَلونَ
1400.en: Most of them only follow conjectures; and surely conjecture can be no substitute for truth. Allah is well aware of whatever they do.

1401.arabic: وَما كانَ هـٰذَا القُرءانُ أَن يُفتَرىٰ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَلـٰكِن تَصديقَ الَّذى بَينَ يَدَيهِ وَتَفصيلَ الكِتـٰبِ لا رَيبَ فيهِ مِن رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
1401.en: And this Qur'an is such that it could not be composed by any unless it be revealed from Allah. It is a confirmation of the revelation made before it and a detailed exposition of the Book. Beyond doubt it is from the Lord of the universe.

1402.arabic: أَم يَقولونَ افتَرىٰهُ قُل فَأتوا بِسورَةٍ مِثلِهِ وَادعوا مَنِ استَطَعتُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم صـٰدِقينَ
1402.en: Do they say that the Messenger has himself composed the Qur'an? Say: 'In that case bring forth just one surah like it and call on all whom you can, except Allah, to help you if you are truthful.

1403.arabic: بَل كَذَّبوا بِما لَم يُحيطوا بِعِلمِهِ وَلَمّا يَأتِهِم تَأويلُهُ كَذٰلِكَ كَذَّبَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عـٰقِبَةُ الظّـٰلِمينَ
1403.en: In fact they arbitrarily rejected as false whatever they failed to comprehend and whose final sequel was not apparent to them. Likewise had their predecessors rejected the truth, declaring it falsehood. Do observe, then, what was the end of the wrong#doers.

1404.arabic: وَمِنهُم مَن يُؤمِنُ بِهِ وَمِنهُم مَن لا يُؤمِنُ بِهِ وَرَبُّكَ أَعلَمُ بِالمُفسِدينَ
1404.en: Of those some will believe and others will not. Your Lord knows best the mischief#makers.

1405.arabic: وَإِن كَذَّبوكَ فَقُل لى عَمَلى وَلَكُم عَمَلُكُم أَنتُم بَريـٔونَ مِمّا أَعمَلُ وَأَنا۠ بَرىءٌ مِمّا تَعمَلونَ
1405.en: And if they reject you as false, tell them: 'My deeds are for myself and your deeds for yourselves. You will not be held responsible for my deeds, nor I for your deeds.

1406.arabic: وَمِنهُم مَن يَستَمِعونَ إِلَيكَ أَفَأَنتَ تُسمِعُ الصُّمَّ وَلَو كانوا لا يَعقِلونَ
1406.en: Of them some seem to give heed to you; will you, then, make the deaf hear even though they understand nothing?

1407.arabic: وَمِنهُم مَن يَنظُرُ إِلَيكَ أَفَأَنتَ تَهدِى العُمىَ وَلَو كانوا لا يُبصِرونَ
1407.en: And of them some look towards you; will you, then, guide the blind, even though they can see nothing?

1408.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَظلِمُ النّاسَ شَيـًٔا وَلـٰكِنَّ النّاسَ أَنفُسَهُم يَظلِمونَ
1408.en: Surely Allah does not wrong men; they rather wrong themselves.

1409.arabic: وَيَومَ يَحشُرُهُم كَأَن لَم يَلبَثوا إِلّا ساعَةً مِنَ النَّهارِ يَتَعارَفونَ بَينَهُم قَد خَسِرَ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِلِقاءِ اللَّهِ وَما كانوا مُهتَدينَ
1409.en: (But today they are oblivious of everything except enjoyment of worldly life.) And on the Day when He will muster all men together, they will feel as though they had been in the world no more than an hour of the day to get acquainted with one another. (It will then become evident that) those who called the lie to meeting with Allah were utter losers and were not rightly#directed. underlies this sharp remark is the faint hope that perhaps such people would be shaken out of their slumber.

1410.arabic: وَإِمّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعضَ الَّذى نَعِدُهُم أَو نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِلَينا مَرجِعُهُم ثُمَّ اللَّهُ شَهيدٌ عَلىٰ ما يَفعَلونَ
1410.en: Whether We let you see (during your lifetime) some of the chastisement with which We threaten them, or We call you unto Us (before the chastisement strikes them), in any case they are bound to return to Us. Allah is witness to all what they do.

1411.arabic: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ رَسولٌ فَإِذا جاءَ رَسولُهُم قُضِىَ بَينَهُم بِالقِسطِ وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
1411.en: A Messenger is sent to every people; and when their Messenger comes, the fate of that people is decided with full justice; they are subjected to no wrong.

1412.arabic: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هـٰذَا الوَعدُ إِن كُنتُم صـٰدِقينَ
1412.en: They say:'If what you promise is true, when will this threat be fulfilled?'

1413.arabic: قُل لا أَملِكُ لِنَفسى ضَرًّا وَلا نَفعًا إِلّا ما شاءَ اللَّهُ لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌ إِذا جاءَ أَجَلُهُم فَلا يَستَـٔخِرونَ ساعَةً وَلا يَستَقدِمونَ
1413.en: Tell them: 'I have no power to harm or benefit even myself, except what Allah may will. There is an appointed term for every people; and when the end of their term comes, neither can they put it off for an hour, nor can they bring it an hour before.

1414.arabic: قُل أَرَءَيتُم إِن أَتىٰكُم عَذابُهُ بَيـٰتًا أَو نَهارًا ماذا يَستَعجِلُ مِنهُ المُجرِمونَ
1414.en: Tell them: 'Did you consider (what you would do) were His chastisement to fall upon you suddenly by night or by day? So why are the culprits seeking to hasten its coming?

1415.arabic: أَثُمَّ إِذا ما وَقَعَ ءامَنتُم بِهِ ءالـٔـٰنَ وَقَد كُنتُم بِهِ تَستَعجِلونَ
1415.en: Is it only when this chastisement has actually overtaken you that you will believe in it? (And when the chastisement will surprise you), you will try to get away from it, although it is you who had sought to hasten its coming.'

1416.arabic: ثُمَّ قيلَ لِلَّذينَ ظَلَموا ذوقوا عَذابَ الخُلدِ هَل تُجزَونَ إِلّا بِما كُنتُم تَكسِبونَ
1416.en: The wrong#doers will then be told: 'Suffer now the abiding chastisement. How else can you be rewarded except according to your deeds?'

1417.arabic: وَيَستَنبِـٔونَكَ أَحَقٌّ هُوَ قُل إى وَرَبّى إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ وَما أَنتُم بِمُعجِزينَ
1417.en: They ask you if what you say is true? Tell them: 'Yes, by my Lord, this is altogether true, and you have no power to prevent the chastisement from befalling.'

1418.arabic: وَلَو أَنَّ لِكُلِّ نَفسٍ ظَلَمَت ما فِى الأَرضِ لَافتَدَت بِهِ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّدامَةَ لَمّا رَأَوُا العَذابَ وَقُضِىَ بَينَهُم بِالقِسطِ وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
1418.en: If a wrong#doer had all that is in the earth he would surely offer it to ransom himself. When the wrong#doers perceive the chastisement, they will feel intense remorse in their hearts. But a judgement shall be made with full justice about them. They shall not be wronged.

1419.arabic: أَلا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ ما فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ أَلا إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
1419.en: Indeed all that is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. And most certainly Allah's promise will be fulfilled, though most men are not aware.

1420.en: He it is Who gives life and causes death, and to Him shall you all be returned.

1421.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا النّاسُ قَد جاءَتكُم مَوعِظَةٌ مِن رَبِّكُم وَشِفاءٌ لِما فِى الصُّدورِ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةٌ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
1421.en: Men! Now there has come to you an exhortation from your Lord, a healing for the ailments of the hearts, and a guidance and mercy for those who believe.

1422.arabic: قُل بِفَضلِ اللَّهِ وَبِرَحمَتِهِ فَبِذٰلِكَ فَليَفرَحوا هُوَ خَيرٌ مِمّا يَجمَعونَ
1422.en: Tell them (O Prophet!): 'Let them rejoice in Allah's grace and mercy through which this (Book) has come to you. It is better than all the riches that they accumulate.

1423.arabic: قُل أَرَءَيتُم ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ لَكُم مِن رِزقٍ فَجَعَلتُم مِنهُ حَرامًا وَحَلـٰلًا قُل ءاللَّهُ أَذِنَ لَكُم أَم عَلَى اللَّهِ تَفتَرونَ
1423.en: Did you consider that the sustenance which Allah had sent down for you of your own accord you have declared some of it as unlawful and some as lawful? Ask them: 'Did Allah bestow upon you any authority for this or do you forge lies against Allah?

1424.arabic: وَما ظَنُّ الَّذينَ يَفتَرونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الكَذِبَ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَذو فَضلٍ عَلَى النّاسِ وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَشكُرونَ
1424.en: Think how those who invent lies against Him will be treated on, the Day of Judgement? Allah is bountiful to men yet most of them do not give thanks.

1425.arabic: وَما تَكونُ فى شَأنٍ وَما تَتلوا مِنهُ مِن قُرءانٍ وَلا تَعمَلونَ مِن عَمَلٍ إِلّا كُنّا عَلَيكُم شُهودًا إِذ تُفيضونَ فيهِ وَما يَعزُبُ عَن رَبِّكَ مِن مِثقالِ ذَرَّةٍ فِى الأَرضِ وَلا فِى السَّماءِ وَلا أَصغَرَ مِن ذٰلِكَ وَلا أَكبَرَ إِلّا فى كِتـٰبٍ مُبينٍ
1425.en: (O Prophet!) Whatever you may be engaged in, whether you recite any portion of the Qur'an, or whatever else all of you are doing, We are witnesses to whatever you may be occupied with. Not even an atom's weight escapes your Lord on the earth or in the heaven, nor is there anything smaller or bigger than that, except that it is on record in a Clear Book.

1426.arabic: أَلا إِنَّ أَولِياءَ اللَّهِ لا خَوفٌ عَلَيهِم وَلا هُم يَحزَنونَ
1426.en: Oh, surely the friends of Allah have nothing to fear, nor shall they grieve #

1427.en: the ones who believe and are God#fearing.

1428.arabic: لَهُمُ البُشرىٰ فِى الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا وَفِى الـٔاخِرَةِ لا تَبديلَ لِكَلِمـٰتِ اللَّهِ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الفَوزُ العَظيمُ
1428.en: For them are glad tidings in this world and in the Hereafter. The words of Allah shall not change. That is the supreme triumph.

1429.arabic: وَلا يَحزُنكَ قَولُهُم إِنَّ العِزَّةَ لِلَّهِ جَميعًا هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
1429.en: (O Prophet!) Let not the utterances of the opponents distress you. Indeed all honour is Allah's. He is All#Hearing, All#Knowing.

1430.arabic: أَلا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَمَن فِى الأَرضِ وَما يَتَّبِعُ الَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ شُرَكاءَ إِن يَتَّبِعونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَإِن هُم إِلّا يَخرُصونَ
1430.en: Verily whoever dwells in the heavens or the earth belongs to Allah. Those who invoke others beside Allah, associating them with Him in His divinity, only follow conjectures and are merely guessing.

1431.arabic: هُوَ الَّذى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الَّيلَ لِتَسكُنوا فيهِ وَالنَّهارَ مُبصِرًا إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايـٰتٍ لِقَومٍ يَسمَعونَ
1431.en: It is Allah alone Who has made the night that you may rest in it, and has made the day light#giving. Surely in that there are signs for those who give heed (to the call of the Messenger).

1432.arabic: قالُوا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ وَلَدًا سُبحـٰنَهُ هُوَ الغَنِىُّ لَهُ ما فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَما فِى الأَرضِ إِن عِندَكُم مِن سُلطـٰنٍ بِهـٰذا أَتَقولونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
1432.en: They say: 'Allah has taken a son. Glory be to Him. He is self#sufficient! His is all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Have you any authority to support (that Allah has taken a son)? Do you ascribe to Allah something of which you have no knowledge?

1433.arabic: قُل إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَفتَرونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الكَذِبَ لا يُفلِحونَ
1433.en: Tell them (O Muhammad!): 'Indeed those who invent lies against Allah will never prosper.

1434.arabic: مَتـٰعٌ فِى الدُّنيا ثُمَّ إِلَينا مَرجِعُهُم ثُمَّ نُذيقُهُمُ العَذابَ الشَّديدَ بِما كانوا يَكفُرونَ
1434.en: They may enjoy the life of this world, but in the end they must return to Us, and then We shall cause them to taste severe chastisement for their disbelieving.'

1435.arabic: وَاتلُ عَلَيهِم نَبَأَ نوحٍ إِذ قالَ لِقَومِهِ يـٰقَومِ إِن كانَ كَبُرَ عَلَيكُم مَقامى وَتَذكيرى بِـٔايـٰتِ اللَّهِ فَعَلَى اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلتُ فَأَجمِعوا أَمرَكُم وَشُرَكاءَكُم ثُمَّ لا يَكُن أَمرُكُم عَلَيكُم غُمَّةً ثُمَّ اقضوا إِلَىَّ وَلا تُنظِرونِ
1435.en: And narrate to them the story of Noah when he said to his people: 'My people! If my living in your midst and my effort to shake you out of heedlessness by reciting to you the revelations of Allah offend you, then remember that I have put all my trust in Allah. So draw up your plan in concert with those whom you associate with Allah in His divinity, leaving no part of it obscure, and then put it into effect against me, and give me no respite.

1436.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّيتُم فَما سَأَلتُكُم مِن أَجرٍ إِن أَجرِىَ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ وَأُمِرتُ أَن أَكونَ مِنَ المُسلِمينَ
1436.en: When you turned your back on my admonition (what harm did you cause me?) I had asked of you no reward, for my reward lies only with Allah, and I am commanded to be of those who totally submit (to Allah)

1437.arabic: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَنَجَّينـٰهُ وَمَن مَعَهُ فِى الفُلكِ وَجَعَلنـٰهُم خَلـٰئِفَ وَأَغرَقنَا الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِـٔايـٰتِنا فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عـٰقِبَةُ المُنذَرينَ
1437.en: But they rejected Noah, calling him a liar. So We saved him and those who were with him in the Ark, and made them successors (to the authority in the land), and drowned all those who had rejected Our signs as false. Consider, then, the fate of those who had been warned (and still did not believe).

1438.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثنا مِن بَعدِهِ رُسُلًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِم فَجاءوهُم بِالبَيِّنـٰتِ فَما كانوا لِيُؤمِنوا بِما كَذَّبوا بِهِ مِن قَبلُ كَذٰلِكَ نَطبَعُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِ المُعتَدينَ
1438.en: Then We sent forth after him other Messengers, each one to his people. They brought to them clear signs, but they were not such as to believe in what they had rejected earlier as false. Thus do We seal the hearts of those who transgress.

1439.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثنا مِن بَعدِهِم موسىٰ وَهـٰرونَ إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِ بِـٔايـٰتِنا فَاستَكبَروا وَكانوا قَومًا مُجرِمينَ
1439.en: Then, after them, We sent forth Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our signs, but they waxed proud. They were a wickd people.

1440.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَهُمُ الحَقُّ مِن عِندِنا قالوا إِنَّ هـٰذا لَسِحرٌ مُبينٌ
1440.en: And when truth came to them from Us, they said: 'Indeed this is plain sorcery.

1441.arabic: قالَ موسىٰ أَتَقولونَ لِلحَقِّ لَمّا جاءَكُم أَسِحرٌ هـٰذا وَلا يُفلِحُ السّـٰحِرونَ
1441.en: Moses said: 'Do you say this about the truth after it has come to you? Is this sorcery? You call this sorcery although sorcerers never come to a happy end.

1442.arabic: قالوا أَجِئتَنا لِتَلفِتَنا عَمّا وَجَدنا عَلَيهِ ءاباءَنا وَتَكونَ لَكُمَا الكِبرِياءُ فِى الأَرضِ وَما نَحنُ لَكُما بِمُؤمِنينَ
1442.en: They replied: 'Have you come to turn us away from the way of our forefathers that the two of you might become supreme in the land? We shall never accept what the two of you say.'

1443.arabic: وَقالَ فِرعَونُ ائتونى بِكُلِّ سـٰحِرٍ عَليمٍ
1443.en: And Pharaoh said (to his) men: 'Bring every skilled sorcerer to me.'

1444.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قالَ لَهُم موسىٰ أَلقوا ما أَنتُم مُلقونَ
1444.en: And when the sorcerers came Moses said to them: 'Cast whatever you wish to cast.'

1445.arabic: فَلَمّا أَلقَوا قالَ موسىٰ ما جِئتُم بِهِ السِّحرُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَيُبطِلُهُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُصلِحُ عَمَلَ المُفسِدينَ
1445.en: Then when they had cast (their staffs), Moses said: 'What you have produced is sheer sorcery. Allah will certainly reduce it to naught. Surely Allah does not set right the work of the mischief#makers.

1446.arabic: وَيُحِقُّ اللَّهُ الحَقَّ بِكَلِمـٰتِهِ وَلَو كَرِهَ المُجرِمونَ
1446.en: Allah vindicates the truth by His commands, howsoever much the guilty might detest that.'

1447.arabic: فَما ءامَنَ لِموسىٰ إِلّا ذُرِّيَّةٌ مِن قَومِهِ عَلىٰ خَوفٍ مِن فِرعَونَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِم أَن يَفتِنَهُم وَإِنَّ فِرعَونَ لَعالٍ فِى الأَرضِ وَإِنَّهُ لَمِنَ المُسرِفينَ
1447.en: None but a few youths of Moses' people accepted him, fearing that Pharaoh and their own chiefs would persecute them. Indeed Pharaoh was mighty in the land, he was among those who exceed all limits.

1448.arabic: وَقالَ موسىٰ يـٰقَومِ إِن كُنتُم ءامَنتُم بِاللَّهِ فَعَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلوا إِن كُنتُم مُسلِمينَ
1448.en: Moses said: 'My people! If you believe in Allah and are truly Muslims then place your reliance on Him alone.'

1449.arabic: فَقالوا عَلَى اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلنا رَبَّنا لا تَجعَلنا فِتنَةً لِلقَومِ الظّـٰلِمينَ
1449.en: They replied: 'We place our reliance on Allah. Our Lord! Do not make us a trial for the oppressors,

1450.en: and deliver us, through Your mercy, from the unbelievers.'

1451.arabic: وَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ وَأَخيهِ أَن تَبَوَّءا لِقَومِكُما بِمِصرَ بُيوتًا وَاجعَلوا بُيوتَكُم قِبلَةً وَأَقيمُوا الصَّلوٰةَ وَبَشِّرِ المُؤمِنينَ
1451.en: And We directed Moses and his brother: 'Prepare a few houses for your people in Egypt, and make your houses a direction for men to pray, and establish Prayer, and give glad tidings to the men of faith.

1452.arabic: وَقالَ موسىٰ رَبَّنا إِنَّكَ ءاتَيتَ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَأَهُ زينَةً وَأَموٰلًا فِى الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا رَبَّنا لِيُضِلّوا عَن سَبيلِكَ رَبَّنَا اطمِس عَلىٰ أَموٰلِهِم وَاشدُد عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم فَلا يُؤمِنوا حَتّىٰ يَرَوُا العَذابَ الأَليمَ
1452.en: Moses prayed: 'Our Lord! You bestowed upon Pharaoh and his nobles splendour and riches in the world. Our Lord! Have You done this that they may lead people astray from Your path? Our Lord! Obliterate their riches and harden their hearts that they may not believe until they observe the painful chastisement.

1453.arabic: قالَ قَد أُجيبَت دَعوَتُكُما فَاستَقيما وَلا تَتَّبِعانِّ سَبيلَ الَّذينَ لا يَعلَمونَ
1453.en: Allah responded: 'The prayer of the two of you is accepted. So keep steadfast, and do not follow the path of the ignorant.

1454.arabic: وَجـٰوَزنا بِبَنى إِسرٰءيلَ البَحرَ فَأَتبَعَهُم فِرعَونُ وَجُنودُهُ بَغيًا وَعَدوًا حَتّىٰ إِذا أَدرَكَهُ الغَرَقُ قالَ ءامَنتُ أَنَّهُ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلَّا الَّذى ءامَنَت بِهِ بَنوا إِسرٰءيلَ وَأَنا۠ مِنَ المُسلِمينَ
1454.en: And We led the Children of Israel across the sea. Then Pharaoh and his hosts pursued them in iniquity and transgression until Pharaoh cried out while he was drowning: 'I believe that there is no god but Allah in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am also one of those who submit to Allah.

1455.arabic: ءالـٔـٰنَ وَقَد عَصَيتَ قَبلُ وَكُنتَ مِنَ المُفسِدينَ
1455.en: (Thereupon came the response): 'Now you believe, although you disobeyed earlier and were one of the mischief#makers.

1456.arabic: فَاليَومَ نُنَجّيكَ بِبَدَنِكَ لِتَكونَ لِمَن خَلفَكَ ءايَةً وَإِنَّ كَثيرًا مِنَ النّاسِ عَن ءايـٰتِنا لَغـٰفِلونَ
1456.en: We shall now save your corpse that you may serve as a sign of warning for all posterity, although many men are heedless of Our signs.

1457.arabic: وَلَقَد بَوَّأنا بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ مُبَوَّأَ صِدقٍ وَرَزَقنـٰهُم مِنَ الطَّيِّبـٰتِ فَمَا اختَلَفوا حَتّىٰ جاءَهُمُ العِلمُ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقضى بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ فيما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
1457.en: We settled the Children of Israel in a blessed land, and provided them with all manner of good things. They only disagreed among themselves after knowledge (of the truth had) come to them. Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning their disagreements.

1458.arabic: فَإِن كُنتَ فى شَكٍّ مِمّا أَنزَلنا إِلَيكَ فَسـَٔلِ الَّذينَ يَقرَءونَ الكِتـٰبَ مِن قَبلِكَ لَقَد جاءَكَ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ فَلا تَكونَنَّ مِنَ المُمتَرينَ
1458.en: Now, if you are in doubt concerning what We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Book before you. It is the truth that has come to you from your Lord, so do never become one of those who doubt,

1459.arabic: وَلا تَكونَنَّ مِنَ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِـٔايـٰتِ اللَّهِ فَتَكونَ مِنَ الخـٰسِرينَ
1459.en: or reject the signs of Allah as false, for then you shall be among those who will be in utter loss.

1460.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ حَقَّت عَلَيهِم كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ لا يُؤمِنونَ
1460.en: Surely those against whom the word of your Lord has been fulfilled will not believed

1461.arabic: وَلَو جاءَتهُم كُلُّ ءايَةٍ حَتّىٰ يَرَوُا العَذابَ الأَليمَ
1461.en: even if they witness every single sign that might come to them until they are face to face with the painful chastisement,

1462.arabic: فَلَولا كانَت قَريَةٌ ءامَنَت فَنَفَعَها إيمـٰنُها إِلّا قَومَ يونُسَ لَمّا ءامَنوا كَشَفنا عَنهُم عَذابَ الخِزىِ فِى الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا وَمَتَّعنـٰهُم إِلىٰ حينٍ
1462.en: Did it ever happen that the people of a town believed on seeing God's chastisement and its believing profited them? (There is no such instance) except of the people of Yunus. When they believed We granted them reprieve from humiliating chastisement in this world, and We let them enjoy themselves for a while.

1463.arabic: وَلَو شاءَ رَبُّكَ لَـٔامَنَ مَن فِى الأَرضِ كُلُّهُم جَميعًا أَفَأَنتَ تُكرِهُ النّاسَ حَتّىٰ يَكونوا مُؤمِنينَ
1463.en: Had your Lord so willed, all those who are on the earth would have believed. Will you, then, force people into believing?

1464.arabic: وَما كانَ لِنَفسٍ أَن تُؤمِنَ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ وَيَجعَلُ الرِّجسَ عَلَى الَّذينَ لا يَعقِلونَ
1464.en: No one can believe except by Allah's leave, and Allah lays abomination on those who do not use their understanding. and conduct.

1465.arabic: قُلِ انظُروا ماذا فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما تُغنِى الـٔايـٰتُ وَالنُّذُرُ عَن قَومٍ لا يُؤمِنونَ
1465.en: Tell them: 'Observe carefully all that is in the heavens and the earth.' But no signs and warnings can avail those who are bent on not believing.

1466.arabic: فَهَل يَنتَظِرونَ إِلّا مِثلَ أَيّامِ الَّذينَ خَلَوا مِن قَبلِهِم قُل فَانتَظِروا إِنّى مَعَكُم مِنَ المُنتَظِرينَ
1466.en: What are they waiting for except to witness the repetition of the days of calamity that their predecessors witnessed? Tell them: 'Wait; I too am waiting with you.

1467.arabic: ثُمَّ نُنَجّى رُسُلَنا وَالَّذينَ ءامَنوا كَذٰلِكَ حَقًّا عَلَينا نُنجِ المُؤمِنينَ
1467.en: Then, (when Allah's wrath falls upon the wicked) We save our Messengers and also those who believe. It is incumbent on Us to deliver the believers.' set fire to the whole city and its environs. The Assyrian king set his own palace ablaze and was himself burnt to death.

1468.arabic: قُل يـٰأَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِن كُنتُم فى شَكٍّ مِن دينى فَلا أَعبُدُ الَّذينَ تَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَلـٰكِن أَعبُدُ اللَّهَ الَّذى يَتَوَفّىٰكُم وَأُمِرتُ أَن أَكونَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
1468.en: (O Prophet!) Tell them: 'Men! If you are still in doubt concerning my religion, know that I do not serve those whom you serve beside Allah. I only serve Allah Who will cause (all of) you to die. I have been commanded to be one of those who believe,

1469.arabic: وَأَن أَقِم وَجهَكَ لِلدّينِ حَنيفًا وَلا تَكونَنَّ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
1469.en: and to adhere exclusively and sincerely to the true faith, and not to be one of those who associate others with Allah in His divinity.

1470.arabic: وَلا تَدعُ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَنفَعُكَ وَلا يَضُرُّكَ فَإِن فَعَلتَ فَإِنَّكَ إِذًا مِنَ الظّـٰلِمينَ
1470.en: Do not call upon any apart from Allah on those who have no power to benefit or hurt you. For if you call upon others than Allah you will be reckoned among the wrong#doers.

1471.arabic: وَإِن يَمسَسكَ اللَّهُ بِضُرٍّ فَلا كاشِفَ لَهُ إِلّا هُوَ وَإِن يُرِدكَ بِخَيرٍ فَلا رادَّ لِفَضلِهِ يُصيبُ بِهِ مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ وَهُوَ الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
1471.en: If Allah afflicts you with any hardship, none other than He can remove it; and if He wills any good for you, none can avert His bounty. He bestows good upon whomsoever of His servants He wills. He is AllForgiving, All#Merciful.'

1472.arabic: قُل يـٰأَيُّهَا النّاسُ قَد جاءَكُمُ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكُم فَمَنِ اهتَدىٰ فَإِنَّما يَهتَدى لِنَفسِهِ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّما يَضِلُّ عَلَيها وَما أَنا۠ عَلَيكُم بِوَكيلٍ
1472.en: Tell them (O Muhammad): 'Men! Truth has come to you from your Lord. Whosoever, then, follows the true guidance does so for his own good; and whosoever strays, his straying will be to his own hurt. I am no custodian over you.

1473.arabic: وَاتَّبِع ما يوحىٰ إِلَيكَ وَاصبِر حَتّىٰ يَحكُمَ اللَّهُ وَهُوَ خَيرُ الحـٰكِمينَ
1473.en: And follow, (O Prophet!), whatever is revealed to you, and remain patient until Allah brings forth His judgement. He is the best of those who judge.'

1474.arabic: الر كِتـٰبٌ أُحكِمَت ءايـٰتُهُ ثُمَّ فُصِّلَت مِن لَدُن حَكيمٍ خَبيرٍ
1474.en: Alif. Lam. Ra. This is a Divine Command whose contents have been made firm and set forth in detail from One Who is All#Wise, All#Aware

1475.arabic: أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ إِنَّنى لَكُم مِنهُ نَذيرٌ وَبَشيرٌ
1475.en: that you may worship none but Allah. Verily, I have come to you as a warner and a bearer of good news from Him

1476.arabic: وَأَنِ استَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ يُمَتِّعكُم مَتـٰعًا حَسَنًا إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى وَيُؤتِ كُلَّ ذى فَضلٍ فَضلَهُ وَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَإِنّى أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ كَبيرٍ
1476.en: that you may seek forgiveness of your Lord and turn to Him in repentance whereupon He will grant you a fair enjoyment of life until an appointed term, and will bestow favour on everyone who merits favour. But should you turn away (from the truth), I fear for you the chastisement of an Awesome Day.

1477.arabic: إِلَى اللَّهِ مَرجِعُكُم وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ قَديرٌ
1477.en: Unto Allah is your return, and He has power to do everything.

1478.arabic: أَلا إِنَّهُم يَثنونَ صُدورَهُم لِيَستَخفوا مِنهُ أَلا حينَ يَستَغشونَ ثِيابَهُم يَعلَمُ ما يُسِرّونَ وَما يُعلِنونَ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
1478.en: Lo! They fold up their breasts that they may conceal themselves from Him. Surely when they cover themselves up with their garments Allah knows well what they cover and what they reveal. Indeed He even knows the secrets hidden in the breasts.

1479.arabic: وَما مِن دابَّةٍ فِى الأَرضِ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ رِزقُها وَيَعلَمُ مُستَقَرَّها وَمُستَودَعَها كُلٌّ فى كِتـٰبٍ مُبينٍ
1479.en: There is not a single moving creature on the earth but Allah is responsible for providing its sustenance. He knows where it dwells and where it will permanently rest. All this is recorded in a clear Book.

1480.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى خَلَقَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضَ فى سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ وَكانَ عَرشُهُ عَلَى الماءِ لِيَبلُوَكُم أَيُّكُم أَحسَنُ عَمَلًا وَلَئِن قُلتَ إِنَّكُم مَبعوثونَ مِن بَعدِ المَوتِ لَيَقولَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن هـٰذا إِلّا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
1480.en: And He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six days # and \[before that\] His Throne was upon the water that He may test you, who of you is better in conduct If you were to say (O Muhammad): 'All of you will surely be raised after death', then those who disbelieve will certainly say: 'This is nothing but plain sorcery.

1481.arabic: وَلَئِن أَخَّرنا عَنهُمُ العَذابَ إِلىٰ أُمَّةٍ مَعدودَةٍ لَيَقولُنَّ ما يَحبِسُهُ أَلا يَومَ يَأتيهِم لَيسَ مَصروفًا عَنهُم وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِءونَ
1481.en: And were We to put off the chastisement from them for a determined period, they will cry out: 'What withholds Him from chastising?' Surely when the day of the chastisement will come, nothing will avert it and the chastisement which they had ridiculed shall encompass them.

1482.arabic: وَلَئِن أَذَقنَا الإِنسـٰنَ مِنّا رَحمَةً ثُمَّ نَزَعنـٰها مِنهُ إِنَّهُ لَيَـٔوسٌ كَفورٌ
1482.en: If We ever favour man with Our Mercy, and then take it away from him, he becomes utterly desperate, totally ungrateful.

1483.arabic: وَلَئِن أَذَقنـٰهُ نَعماءَ بَعدَ ضَرّاءَ مَسَّتهُ لَيَقولَنَّ ذَهَبَ السَّيِّـٔاتُ عَنّى إِنَّهُ لَفَرِحٌ فَخورٌ
1483.en: And if We let him taste favour after harm has touched him, he says: 'All my ills are gone', and he suddenly becomes exultant and boastful,

1484.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذينَ صَبَروا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ أُولـٰئِكَ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَأَجرٌ كَبيرٌ
1484.en: except those who are patient and act righteously. Such shall have Allah's forgiveness and a great reward.

1485.arabic: فَلَعَلَّكَ تارِكٌ بَعضَ ما يوحىٰ إِلَيكَ وَضائِقٌ بِهِ صَدرُكَ أَن يَقولوا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ كَنزٌ أَو جاءَ مَعَهُ مَلَكٌ إِنَّما أَنتَ نَذيرٌ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ وَكيلٌ
1485.en: (O Messenger!) Let it not happen that you omit (to expound) a portion of what was revealed to you. And do not be distressed that they will say: 'Why was a treasure not bestowed upon him?' or 'Why did no angel accompany him?' For you are merely a warner, whereas Allah has control over everything.

1486.arabic: أَم يَقولونَ افتَرىٰهُ قُل فَأتوا بِعَشرِ سُوَرٍ مِثلِهِ مُفتَرَيـٰتٍ وَادعوا مَنِ استَطَعتُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم صـٰدِقينَ
1486.en: Do they say: 'He has invented this Book himself?' Say: 'If that is so, bring ten surahs the like of it of your composition, and call upon all (the deities) you can other than Allah to your help. Do so if you are truthful.'

1487.arabic: فَإِلَّم يَستَجيبوا لَكُم فَاعلَموا أَنَّما أُنزِلَ بِعِلمِ اللَّهِ وَأَن لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ فَهَل أَنتُم مُسلِمونَ
1487.en: Then if (your deities) do not respond to your call for help then feel assured that this Book was revealed with the knowledge of Allah, and that there is no true god but Him. Will you, then, surrender (to this truth)?

1488.arabic: مَن كانَ يُريدُ الحَيوٰةَ الدُّنيا وَزينَتَها نُوَفِّ إِلَيهِم أَعمـٰلَهُم فيها وَهُم فيها لا يُبخَسونَ
1488.en: Those who seek merely the present world and its adornment. We fully recompense them for their work in this world, and they are made to suffer no diminution in it concerning what is their due.

1489.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ لَيسَ لَهُم فِى الـٔاخِرَةِ إِلَّا النّارُ وَحَبِطَ ما صَنَعوا فيها وَبـٰطِلٌ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
1489.en: They are the ones who shall have nothing in the Hereafter except Fire. (There they shall come to know) that their deeds in the world have come to naught; and that whatever they have done is absolutely useless.

1490.arabic: أَفَمَن كانَ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبِّهِ وَيَتلوهُ شاهِدٌ مِنهُ وَمِن قَبلِهِ كِتـٰبُ موسىٰ إِمامًا وَرَحمَةً أُولـٰئِكَ يُؤمِنونَ بِهِ وَمَن يَكفُر بِهِ مِنَ الأَحزابِ فَالنّارُ مَوعِدُهُ فَلا تَكُ فى مِريَةٍ مِنهُ إِنَّهُ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يُؤمِنونَ
1490.en: Can it happen that he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his Lord, subsequently followed by a witness from Him (in his support), and prior to that the Book of Moses was revealed as a guide and a mercy, (would even he deny the truth in the manner of those who adore the life of this world)? Rather, such men are bound to believe in it. The Fire shall be the promised resort of the groups that disbelieve. So be in no doubt about it for this indeed is the truth from your Lord although most people do not believe.

1491.arabic: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أُولـٰئِكَ يُعرَضونَ عَلىٰ رَبِّهِم وَيَقولُ الأَشهـٰدُ هـٰؤُلاءِ الَّذينَ كَذَبوا عَلىٰ رَبِّهِم أَلا لَعنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الظّـٰلِمينَ
1491.en: And who is a greater wrong#doer than he who invents a lie against Allah? Such men will be set forth before their Lord and witnesses will say: 'These are the ones who lied against their Lord. Lo! Allah's curse be upon the wrong#doers;

1492.arabic: الَّذينَ يَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبغونَها عِوَجًا وَهُم بِالـٔاخِرَةِ هُم كـٰفِرونَ
1492.en: upon those who bar people from the way of Allah, and seek in it crookedness, and disbelieve in the Hereafter.

1493.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ لَم يَكونوا مُعجِزينَ فِى الأَرضِ وَما كانَ لَهُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن أَولِياءَ يُضـٰعَفُ لَهُمُ العَذابُ ما كانوا يَستَطيعونَ السَّمعَ وَما كانوا يُبصِرونَ
1493.en: They had no power to frustrate Allah's design in the earth, nor did they have any protectors against Allah. Their chastisement will be doubled. They were unable to hear, nor could they see.

1494.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
1494.en: They caused utter loss to themselves, and all that they had invented failed them.

1495.arabic: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُم فِى الـٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ الأَخسَرونَ
1495.en: Doubtlessly, they shall be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.

1496.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ وَأَخبَتوا إِلىٰ رَبِّهِم أُولـٰئِكَ أَصحـٰبُ الجَنَّةِ هُم فيها خـٰلِدونَ
1496.en: As for those who believed and acted righteously and dedicated themselves totally to their Lord #they are the people of Paradise, and there they shall abide forever.

1497.arabic: مَثَلُ الفَريقَينِ كَالأَعمىٰ وَالأَصَمِّ وَالبَصيرِ وَالسَّميعِ هَل يَستَوِيانِ مَثَلًا أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
1497.en: The example of the two parties is that one is blind and deaf, and the other capable of seeing and hearing. Can the two be equals? Will you, then, not heed?'

1498.arabic: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا نوحًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِ إِنّى لَكُم نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
1498.en: (Such were the circumstances) when We sent forth Noah to his people. (He said): 'I have been sent to you to warn you plainly

1499.arabic: أَن لا تَعبُدوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ إِنّى أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ أَليمٍ
1499.en: that you may worship none but Allah or else I fear for you the chastisement of a Grievous Day.

1500.arabic: فَقالَ المَلَأُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن قَومِهِ ما نَرىٰكَ إِلّا بَشَرًا مِثلَنا وَما نَرىٰكَ اتَّبَعَكَ إِلَّا الَّذينَ هُم أَراذِلُنا بادِىَ الرَّأىِ وَما نَرىٰ لَكُم عَلَينا مِن فَضلٍ بَل نَظُنُّكُم كـٰذِبينَ
1500.en: The notables among Noah's own people, who had refused to follow him, responded: 'We merely consider you a human being like ourselves. Nor do we find among those who follow you except the lowliest of our folk, the men who follow you without any proper reason. We see nothing in you to suggest that you are any better than us. Rather, we believe you to be liars.'

1501.arabic: قالَ يـٰقَومِ أَرَءَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّى وَءاتىٰنى رَحمَةً مِن عِندِهِ فَعُمِّيَت عَلَيكُم أَنُلزِمُكُموها وَأَنتُم لَها كـٰرِهونَ
1501.en: Noah said: 'My people! If I base myself on a clear evidence from my Lord, and I have also been blessed by His mercy to which you have been blind, how can we force it upon you despite your aversion to it?

1502.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ لا أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ مالًا إِن أَجرِىَ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ وَما أَنا۠ بِطارِدِ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا إِنَّهُم مُلـٰقوا رَبِّهِم وَلـٰكِنّى أَرىٰكُم قَومًا تَجهَلونَ
1502.en: My people! I seek no recompense from you. My recompense is only with Allah. Nor will I drive away those who believe. They are destined to meet their Lord. But I find you to be an ignorant people.

1503.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ مَن يَنصُرُنى مِنَ اللَّهِ إِن طَرَدتُهُم أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
1503.en: My people! Were I to drive the men of faith away, who will protect me from (the chastisement of) Allah? Do you not understand even this much?

1504.arabic: وَلا أَقولُ لَكُم عِندى خَزائِنُ اللَّهِ وَلا أَعلَمُ الغَيبَ وَلا أَقولُ إِنّى مَلَكٌ وَلا أَقولُ لِلَّذينَ تَزدَرى أَعيُنُكُم لَن يُؤتِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ خَيرًا اللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما فى أَنفُسِهِم إِنّى إِذًا لَمِنَ الظّـٰلِمينَ
1504.en: I do not say to you that I possess Allah's treasures, nor that I have access to the realm beyond the ken of sense#perception, nor do I claim to be an angel. Nor do I say regarding those whom you look upon with disdain that Allah will not bestow any good upon them. Allah knows best what is in their hearts. Were I to say so I would be one of the wrongdoers.'

1505.arabic: قالوا يـٰنوحُ قَد جـٰدَلتَنا فَأَكثَرتَ جِدٰلَنا فَأتِنا بِما تَعِدُنا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّـٰدِقينَ
1505.en: They said: 'O Noah! Surely you have disputed with us and have prolonged your dispute. Now bring upon us the chastisement that you threaten us with; do so, if you are truthful.'

1506.arabic: قالَ إِنَّما يَأتيكُم بِهِ اللَّهُ إِن شاءَ وَما أَنتُم بِمُعجِزينَ
1506.en: Noah said: 'Only Allah will bring it upon you if He so wills, and you will be utterly unable to frustrate that.

1507.arabic: وَلا يَنفَعُكُم نُصحى إِن أَرَدتُ أَن أَنصَحَ لَكُم إِن كانَ اللَّهُ يُريدُ أَن يُغوِيَكُم هُوَ رَبُّكُم وَإِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
1507.en: If I want to give you good advice that will not profit you if Allah Himself has decided to let you go astray. He is your Lord, and to Him will you be returned.'

1508.arabic: أَم يَقولونَ افتَرىٰهُ قُل إِنِ افتَرَيتُهُ فَعَلَىَّ إِجرامى وَأَنا۠ بَرىءٌ مِمّا تُجرِمونَ
1508.en: (O Muhammad!) Do they say that he himself has forged this message? Tell them: 'If I have forged this, the guilt of it will fall upon me, but I am not responsible for the crimes you are committing.

1509.arabic: وَأوحِىَ إِلىٰ نوحٍ أَنَّهُ لَن يُؤمِنَ مِن قَومِكَ إِلّا مَن قَد ءامَنَ فَلا تَبتَئِس بِما كانوا يَفعَلونَ
1509.en: It was revealed to Noah that no more of your people, other than those who already believe, will ever come to believe. So do not grieve over their deeds,

1510.arabic: وَاصنَعِ الفُلكَ بِأَعيُنِنا وَوَحيِنا وَلا تُخـٰطِبنى فِى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا إِنَّهُم مُغرَقونَ
1510.en: and build the Ark under Our eyes and Our direction. And do not supplicate Me concerning those who have engaged in wrong#doing. They are doomed to be drowned.

1511.arabic: وَيَصنَعُ الفُلكَ وَكُلَّما مَرَّ عَلَيهِ مَلَأٌ مِن قَومِهِ سَخِروا مِنهُ قالَ إِن تَسخَروا مِنّا فَإِنّا نَسخَرُ مِنكُم كَما تَسخَرونَ
1511.en: As Noah was building the Ark, whenever the leading men of his nation passed by him, they would scoff at him. He said: 'If you scoff at us, we too scoff at you in like manner.

1512.arabic: فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ مَن يَأتيهِ عَذابٌ يُخزيهِ وَيَحِلُّ عَلَيهِ عَذابٌ مُقيمٌ
1512.en: You will come to know who will be struck by a humiliating chastisement, and who will be subjected to an unceasing torment.

1513.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَ أَمرُنا وَفارَ التَّنّورُ قُلنَا احمِل فيها مِن كُلٍّ زَوجَينِ اثنَينِ وَأَهلَكَ إِلّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيهِ القَولُ وَمَن ءامَنَ وَما ءامَنَ مَعَهُ إِلّا قَليلٌ
1513.en: Thus it was until Our command came to pass and the oven boiled over. We said: 'Take into the Ark a pair of every species; and take your own family except those who have already been declared (as unworthy); and also take everyone who believes. But those who, along with him, had believed were indeed just a few.

1514.arabic: وَقالَ اركَبوا فيها بِسمِ اللَّهِ مَجر۪ىٰها وَمُرسىٰها إِنَّ رَبّى لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
1514.en: Noah said: ' Embark in it. In the name of Allah is its sailing and its anchorage. My Lord is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.

1515.arabic: وَهِىَ تَجرى بِهِم فى مَوجٍ كَالجِبالِ وَنادىٰ نوحٌ ابنَهُ وَكانَ فى مَعزِلٍ يـٰبُنَىَّ اركَب مَعَنا وَلا تَكُن مَعَ الكـٰفِرينَ
1515.en: The Ark sailed along with them amid mountain#like waves. Noah, spotting his son at a distance, called out to him: 'My son. embark with us. and do not be with the unbelievers.'

1516.arabic: قالَ سَـٔاوى إِلىٰ جَبَلٍ يَعصِمُنى مِنَ الماءِ قالَ لا عاصِمَ اليَومَ مِن أَمرِ اللَّهِ إِلّا مَن رَحِمَ وَحالَ بَينَهُمَا المَوجُ فَكانَ مِنَ المُغرَقينَ
1516.en: The son replied: 'I will go to a mountain for refuge and it will save me from the water.' Noah said: 'None can save anyone today from the command of Allah except those on whom He may have mercy.' Thereupon a wave swept in between the two and he was drowned.

1517.arabic: وَقيلَ يـٰأَرضُ ابلَعى ماءَكِ وَيـٰسَماءُ أَقلِعى وَغيضَ الماءُ وَقُضِىَ الأَمرُ وَاستَوَت عَلَى الجودِىِّ وَقيلَ بُعدًا لِلقَومِ الظّـٰلِمينَ
1517.en: And the command was given: 'Earth! Swallow up your water'; and: 'Heaven! Abate!' So the water subsided, the command was fulfilled, and the Ark settled on Mount Judi, and it was said: 'Away with the wrong#doing folk!'

1518.arabic: وَنادىٰ نوحٌ رَبَّهُ فَقالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ ابنى مِن أَهلى وَإِنَّ وَعدَكَ الحَقُّ وَأَنتَ أَحكَمُ الحـٰكِمينَ
1518.en: And Noah called out to his Lord, saying: 'My Lord! My son is of my family. Surely Your promise is true, and You are the greatest of those who judge.

1519.arabic: قالَ يـٰنوحُ إِنَّهُ لَيسَ مِن أَهلِكَ إِنَّهُ عَمَلٌ غَيرُ صـٰلِحٍ فَلا تَسـَٔلنِ ما لَيسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلمٌ إِنّى أَعِظُكَ أَن تَكونَ مِنَ الجـٰهِلينَ
1519.en: In response Noah was told: 'Most certainly he is not of your family; verily he is of unrighteous conduct. So do not ask of Me for that concerning which you have no knowledge. I admonish you never to act like the ignorant ones.

1520.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّى أَعوذُ بِكَ أَن أَسـَٔلَكَ ما لَيسَ لى بِهِ عِلمٌ وَإِلّا تَغفِر لى وَتَرحَمنى أَكُن مِنَ الخـٰسِرينَ
1520.en: Noah said: 'My Lord! I take refuge with You that I should ask you for that concerning which I have no knowledge. And if You do not forgive me and do not show mercy to me, I shall be among the losers.

1521.arabic: قيلَ يـٰنوحُ اهبِط بِسَلـٰمٍ مِنّا وَبَرَكـٰتٍ عَلَيكَ وَعَلىٰ أُمَمٍ مِمَّن مَعَكَ وَأُمَمٌ سَنُمَتِّعُهُم ثُمَّ يَمَسُّهُم مِنّا عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
1521.en: It was said: 'Noah! Disembark, with Our peace, and with blessings upon you and upon those who are with you. There are also people whom We shall allow to enjoy themselves for a while, and then a painful chastisement from Us shall afflict them.'

1522.arabic: تِلكَ مِن أَنباءِ الغَيبِ نوحيها إِلَيكَ ما كُنتَ تَعلَمُها أَنتَ وَلا قَومُكَ مِن قَبلِ هـٰذا فَاصبِر إِنَّ العـٰقِبَةَ لِلمُتَّقينَ
1522.en: We reveal to you these accounts of matters that are beyond the reach of human perception. Neither you nor your people knew about them before this. Be, then, patient. Surely, the good end is for the God#fearing.

1523.arabic: وَإِلىٰ عادٍ أَخاهُم هودًا قالَ يـٰقَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلـٰهٍ غَيرُهُ إِن أَنتُم إِلّا مُفتَرونَ
1523.en: And to 'Ad We sent their brother Hud. He said: 'My people! Serve Allah: you have no god save Him. (In attributing partners to Allah) you have merely been fabricating lies.

1524.arabic: يـٰقَومِ لا أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ أَجرًا إِن أَجرِىَ إِلّا عَلَى الَّذى فَطَرَنى أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
1524.en: My people! I seek no reward from you for my work. My reward lies only with Him Who created me. Do you not understand anything?

1525.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ استَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ يُرسِلِ السَّماءَ عَلَيكُم مِدرارًا وَيَزِدكُم قُوَّةً إِلىٰ قُوَّتِكُم وَلا تَتَوَلَّوا مُجرِمينَ
1525.en: My people! Ask your Lord for forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. He will shower abundant rains upon you from the heaven, and will add strength to your strength. Do not turn away as those given to guilt.'

1526.arabic: قالوا يـٰهودُ ما جِئتَنا بِبَيِّنَةٍ وَما نَحنُ بِتارِكى ءالِهَتِنا عَن قَولِكَ وَما نَحنُ لَكَ بِمُؤمِنينَ
1526.en: They said: 'O Hud! You have not brought to us any clear evidence, and we are not going to forsake our gods merely because you say so. We are not going to believe you.

1527.arabic: إِن نَقولُ إِلَّا اعتَرىٰكَ بَعضُ ءالِهَتِنا بِسوءٍ قالَ إِنّى أُشهِدُ اللَّهَ وَاشهَدوا أَنّى بَرىءٌ مِمّا تُشرِكونَ
1527.en: All we can say is that some god of ours has afflicted you with evil.. Hud said: 'Indeed I take Allah as my witness, and you too to be my witnesses that I have nothing to do with your associating with Allah

1528.arabic: مِن دونِهِ فَكيدونى جَميعًا ثُمَّ لا تُنظِرونِ
1528.en: others than Him in His divinity. So conspire against me, all of you, and give me no respite.

1529.arabic: إِنّى تَوَكَّلتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ رَبّى وَرَبِّكُم ما مِن دابَّةٍ إِلّا هُوَ ءاخِذٌ بِناصِيَتِها إِنَّ رَبّى عَلىٰ صِرٰطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
1529.en: I have put my trust in Allah, Who is my Lord and your Lord. There is no moving creature which He does not hold by its forelock. Surely, My Lord is on the straight path.

1530.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَقَد أَبلَغتُكُم ما أُرسِلتُ بِهِ إِلَيكُم وَيَستَخلِفُ رَبّى قَومًا غَيرَكُم وَلا تَضُرّونَهُ شَيـًٔا إِنَّ رَبّى عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ حَفيظٌ
1530.en: If you, then, turn away (from the truth), know that I have delivered the message with which I was sent to you. Now my Lord will set up another people in place of you and you shall in no way be able to harm Him. Surely my Lord keeps a watch over everything.'

1531.arabic: وَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا هودًا وَالَّذينَ ءامَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَنَجَّينـٰهُم مِن عَذابٍ غَليظٍ
1531.en: And when Our com#mand came to pass, We delivered Hud, together with those who shared his faith, out of special mercy from Us. We delivered them from a woeful chastisement.

1532.arabic: وَتِلكَ عادٌ جَحَدوا بِـٔايـٰتِ رَبِّهِم وَعَصَوا رُسُلَهُ وَاتَّبَعوا أَمرَ كُلِّ جَبّارٍ عَنيدٍ
1532.en: Such were 'Ad. They repudiated the signs of their Lord, disobeyed His Messengers, and followed the bidding of every tyrannical enemy of the truth.

1533.arabic: وَأُتبِعوا فى هـٰذِهِ الدُّنيا لَعنَةً وَيَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ أَلا إِنَّ عادًا كَفَروا رَبَّهُم أَلا بُعدًا لِعادٍ قَومِ هودٍ
1533.en: They were pursued by a curse in this world, and so will they be on the Day of Judgement. Lo! 'Ad disbelieved in the Lord. Lo! ruined are 'Ad, the people of Hud.

1534.arabic: وَإِلىٰ ثَمودَ أَخاهُم صـٰلِحًا قالَ يـٰقَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلـٰهٍ غَيرُهُ هُوَ أَنشَأَكُم مِنَ الأَرضِ وَاستَعمَرَكُم فيها فَاستَغفِروهُ ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ إِنَّ رَبّى قَريبٌ مُجيبٌ
1534.en: And to Thamud We sent their brother Sali'h. He said: 'My people! Serve Allah; you have no god other than Him. He brought you into being out of the earth, and has made you dwell in it. So ask Him to forgive you, and do turn towards Him in repentance. Indeed My Lord is near, responsive to prayers.

1535.arabic: قالوا يـٰصـٰلِحُ قَد كُنتَ فينا مَرجُوًّا قَبلَ هـٰذا أَتَنهىٰنا أَن نَعبُدَ ما يَعبُدُ ءاباؤُنا وَإِنَّنا لَفى شَكٍّ مِمّا تَدعونا إِلَيهِ مُريبٍ
1535.en: They said: 'O Salih! Until now you were one of those among us on whom we placed great hopes. Now, would you forbid us to worship what our forefathers were wont to worship? Indeed we are in disquieting doubt about what you are calling us to.

1536.arabic: قالَ يـٰقَومِ أَرَءَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّى وَءاتىٰنى مِنهُ رَحمَةً فَمَن يَنصُرُنى مِنَ اللَّهِ إِن عَصَيتُهُ فَما تَزيدونَنى غَيرَ تَخسيرٍ
1536.en: Salih said: 'My people! What do you think? If I had a clear evidence from my Lord, and then He also bestowed His mercy upon me, who will rescue me from the punishment of Allah if I still disobey Him? You can only make me lose even more.

1537.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ هـٰذِهِ ناقَةُ اللَّهِ لَكُم ءايَةً فَذَروها تَأكُل فى أَرضِ اللَّهِ وَلا تَمَسّوها بِسوءٍ فَيَأخُذَكُم عَذابٌ قَريبٌ
1537.en: My people! This she#camel of Allah is a sign for you. So let her pasture on Allah's earth, and do not hurt her or else some chastisement # which is near at hand #should overtake you.'

1538.arabic: فَعَقَروها فَقالَ تَمَتَّعوا فى دارِكُم ثَلـٰثَةَ أَيّامٍ ذٰلِكَ وَعدٌ غَيرُ مَكذوبٍ
1538.en: But they slaughtered her. Thereupon Salih warned them: 'Enjoy yourselves in your homes for a maximum of three days. This is a promise which shall not be belied.'

1539.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا صـٰلِحًا وَالَّذينَ ءامَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَمِن خِزىِ يَومِئِذٍ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ القَوِىُّ العَزيزُ
1539.en: Then, when Our command came to pass, We saved Salih and those who shared his faith through Our special mercy, from the disgrace of that day. Truly Your Lord is All#Strong, All#Mighty.

1540.arabic: وَأَخَذَ الَّذينَ ظَلَمُوا الصَّيحَةُ فَأَصبَحوا فى دِيـٰرِهِم جـٰثِمينَ
1540.en: And the Blast overtook those who were wont to do wrong, and then they lay lifeless in their homes

1541.arabic: كَأَن لَم يَغنَوا فيها أَلا إِنَّ ثَمودَا۟ كَفَروا رَبَّهُم أَلا بُعدًا لِثَمودَ
1541.en: as though they had never lived there before. Oh, verily the Thamud denied their Lord! Oh, the Thamud were destroyed.

1542.arabic: وَلَقَد جاءَت رُسُلُنا إِبرٰهيمَ بِالبُشرىٰ قالوا سَلـٰمًا قالَ سَلـٰمٌ فَما لَبِثَ أَن جاءَ بِعِجلٍ حَنيذٍ
1542.en: Indeed Our messengers came to Abraham, bearing glad tidings. They greeted him with 'peace', and Abraham answered back to them 'peace', and hurriedly brought to them a roasted calf.

1543.arabic: فَلَمّا رَءا أَيدِيَهُم لا تَصِلُ إِلَيهِ نَكِرَهُم وَأَوجَسَ مِنهُم خيفَةً قالوا لا تَخَف إِنّا أُرسِلنا إِلىٰ قَومِ لوطٍ
1543.en: When he perceived that their hands could not reach it, he mistrusted them, and felt afraid of them. They said: 'Do not be afraid. We have been sent to the people of Lot.

1544.arabic: وَامرَأَتُهُ قائِمَةٌ فَضَحِكَت فَبَشَّرنـٰها بِإِسحـٰقَ وَمِن وَراءِ إِسحـٰقَ يَعقوبَ
1544.en: And Abraham's wife was standing by and on hearing this she laughed. And We gave her the good news of (the birth of) Isaac, and after Isaac, of Jacob.

1545.arabic: قالَت يـٰوَيلَتىٰ ءَأَلِدُ وَأَنا۠ عَجوزٌ وَهـٰذا بَعلى شَيخًا إِنَّ هـٰذا لَشَىءٌ عَجيبٌ
1545.en: She said: 'Woe is me! Shall I bear a child now that I am an old woman and my husband is well advanced in years. This is indeed strange!'

1546.arabic: قالوا أَتَعجَبينَ مِن أَمرِ اللَّهِ رَحمَتُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكـٰتُهُ عَلَيكُم أَهلَ البَيتِ إِنَّهُ حَميدٌ مَجيدٌ
1546.en: They said: 'Do you wonder at Allah's decree? Allah's mercy and His blessings be upon you, O people of the house. Surely, He is Praiseworthy, Glorious.'

1547.arabic: فَلَمّا ذَهَبَ عَن إِبرٰهيمَ الرَّوعُ وَجاءَتهُ البُشرىٰ يُجـٰدِلُنا فى قَومِ لوطٍ
1547.en: Thus when fear had left Abraham and the good news had been conveyed to him, he began to dispute with Us concerning the people of Lot.

1548.en: Surely Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and oft#turning to Allah.

1549.arabic: يـٰإِبرٰهيمُ أَعرِض عَن هـٰذا إِنَّهُ قَد جاءَ أَمرُ رَبِّكَ وَإِنَّهُم ءاتيهِم عَذابٌ غَيرُ مَردودٍ
1549.en: Thereupon (Our angels) said to him: 'O Abraham! Desist from this, for indeed your Lord's command has come; and a chastisement which cannot be averted is about to befall them.' words literally suggest; the purpose is merely to express a sense of wonder.

1550.arabic: وَلَمّا جاءَت رُسُلُنا لوطًا سىءَ بِهِم وَضاقَ بِهِم ذَرعًا وَقالَ هـٰذا يَومٌ عَصيبٌ
1550.en: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was perturbed by their coming and felt troubled on their account, and said: 'This is a distressing day.

1551.arabic: وَجاءَهُ قَومُهُ يُهرَعونَ إِلَيهِ وَمِن قَبلُ كانوا يَعمَلونَ السَّيِّـٔاتِ قالَ يـٰقَومِ هـٰؤُلاءِ بَناتى هُنَّ أَطهَرُ لَكُم فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلا تُخزونِ فى ضَيفى أَلَيسَ مِنكُم رَجُلٌ رَشيدٌ
1551.en: And his people came to him rushing. Before this they were wont to commit evil deeds. Lot said: 'My people! Here are my daughters; they are purer for you. Have fear of Allah and do not disgrace me concerning my guests. Is there not even one right#minded person in your midst?'

1552.arabic: قالوا لَقَد عَلِمتَ ما لَنا فى بَناتِكَ مِن حَقٍّ وَإِنَّكَ لَتَعلَمُ ما نُريدُ
1552.en: They said: 'Surely you already know that we have nothing to do with your daughters. You also know well what we want.'

1553.arabic: قالَ لَو أَنَّ لى بِكُم قُوَّةً أَو ءاوى إِلىٰ رُكنٍ شَديدٍ
1553.en: He said: 'Would that I had the strength to set you straight, or could seek refuge in some powerful support.'

1554.arabic: قالوا يـٰلوطُ إِنّا رُسُلُ رَبِّكَ لَن يَصِلوا إِلَيكَ فَأَسرِ بِأَهلِكَ بِقِطعٍ مِنَ الَّيلِ وَلا يَلتَفِت مِنكُم أَحَدٌ إِلَّا امرَأَتَكَ إِنَّهُ مُصيبُها ما أَصابَهُم إِنَّ مَوعِدَهُمُ الصُّبحُ أَلَيسَ الصُّبحُ بِقَريبٍ
1554.en: Thereupon the angels said: 'O Lot! We indeed are messengers of your Lord. And your people will in no way be able to hurt you. So depart with your family in a part of the night and let no one of you turn around excepting your wife (who shall not go); for what will befall them shall also befall her. In the morning their promised hour will come. Is not the morning near?'

1555.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا جَعَلنا عـٰلِيَها سافِلَها وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيها حِجارَةً مِن سِجّيلٍ مَنضودٍ
1555.en: And when Our command came to pass, We turned the town upside down, and rained on it stones of baked clay, one on another,

1556.arabic: مُسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ وَما هِىَ مِنَ الظّـٰلِمينَ بِبَعيدٍ
1556.en: marked from your Lord. Nor is the punishment far off from the wrong#doers.

1557.arabic: وَإِلىٰ مَديَنَ أَخاهُم شُعَيبًا قالَ يـٰقَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلـٰهٍ غَيرُهُ وَلا تَنقُصُوا المِكيالَ وَالميزانَ إِنّى أَرىٰكُم بِخَيرٍ وَإِنّى أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ مُحيطٍ
1557.en: And to (the people of) Midian We sent their brother Shu'ayb. He said: 'My people! Serve Allah; you have no god other than Him. And do not diminish the measure and weight. Indeed I see that you are prospering now, but I fear for you the chastisement of an encompassing day in the future.

1558.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ أَوفُوا المِكيالَ وَالميزانَ بِالقِسطِ وَلا تَبخَسُوا النّاسَ أَشياءَهُم وَلا تَعثَوا فِى الأَرضِ مُفسِدينَ
1558.en: My people! Give full measure and weight with justice, do not diminish the goods of others, and do not go about creating corruption in the land.

1559.arabic: بَقِيَّتُ اللَّهِ خَيرٌ لَكُم إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ وَما أَنا۠ عَلَيكُم بِحَفيظٍ
1559.en: The gains that Allah lets you retain are better for you, if you indeed believe. In any case, I have not been appointed a keeper over you.

1560.arabic: قالوا يـٰشُعَيبُ أَصَلوٰتُكَ تَأمُرُكَ أَن نَترُكَ ما يَعبُدُ ءاباؤُنا أَو أَن نَفعَلَ فى أَموٰلِنا ما نَشـٰؤُا۟ إِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ الحَليمُ الرَّشيدُ
1560.en: They replied: 'O Shu'ayb! Does your Prayer enjoin upon you that we should forsake the deities whom our forefathers worshipped, or that we should give up using our wealth as we please? Do you fancy that you, and only you, are forbearing and right#directed?'

1561.arabic: قالَ يـٰقَومِ أَرَءَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّى وَرَزَقَنى مِنهُ رِزقًا حَسَنًا وَما أُريدُ أَن أُخالِفَكُم إِلىٰ ما أَنهىٰكُم عَنهُ إِن أُريدُ إِلَّا الإِصلـٰحَ مَا استَطَعتُ وَما تَوفيقى إِلّا بِاللَّهِ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ وَإِلَيهِ أُنيبُ
1561.en: Shu'ayb said: 'My people! What do you think? If I stand on clear evidence from my Lord, and He has also provided me a handsome provision from Himself #(should I be ungrateful to Him and share your error and iniquity?) Nor do I desire to act contrary to what I admonish you. I desire nothing but to set things right as far as I can. My succour is only with Allah. In Him have I put my trust, and to Him do I always turn.

1562.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ لا يَجرِمَنَّكُم شِقاقى أَن يُصيبَكُم مِثلُ ما أَصابَ قَومَ نوحٍ أَو قَومَ هودٍ أَو قَومَ صـٰلِحٍ وَما قَومُ لوطٍ مِنكُم بِبَعيدٍ
1562.en: My people! Let not your opposition to me lead you to guilt that would bring upon you the chastisement that struck earlier the people of Noah, and the people of Hud, and the people of Salih. And the land of the people of Lot is not far from you!

1563.arabic: وَاستَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ إِنَّ رَبّى رَحيمٌ وَدودٌ
1563.en: Seek the forgiveness of your Lord and turn to Him in repentance. Surely my Lord is Ever Merciful, Most Loving.

1564.arabic: قالوا يـٰشُعَيبُ ما نَفقَهُ كَثيرًا مِمّا تَقولُ وَإِنّا لَنَرىٰكَ فينا ضَعيفًا وَلَولا رَهطُكَ لَرَجَمنـٰكَ وَما أَنتَ عَلَينا بِعَزيزٍ
1564.en: They said: 'O Shu'ayb! We do not understand much of what you say. Indeed we see you weak in our midst. Were it not for your kinsmen, we would surely have stoned you for you have no strength to overpower us.

1565.arabic: قالَ يـٰقَومِ أَرَهطى أَعَزُّ عَلَيكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ وَاتَّخَذتُموهُ وَراءَكُم ظِهرِيًّا إِنَّ رَبّى بِما تَعمَلونَ مُحيطٌ
1565.en: Shu'ayb said: 'My people! Are my kinsmen mightier with you than Allah that you (hold the kinsmen in awe while) you cast Allah behind your back? Surely my Lord encompasses all what you do.

1566.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّى عـٰمِلٌ سَوفَ تَعلَمونَ مَن يَأتيهِ عَذابٌ يُخزيهِ وَمَن هُوَ كـٰذِبٌ وَارتَقِبوا إِنّى مَعَكُم رَقيبٌ
1566.en: My people! Go on working according to your way and I will keep working (according to mine). Soon you will come to know who will be afflicted by a humiliating chastisement, and who is proved a liar. And watch, I shall also watch with you.'

1567.arabic: وَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا شُعَيبًا وَالَّذينَ ءامَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَأَخَذَتِ الَّذينَ ظَلَمُوا الصَّيحَةُ فَأَصبَحوا فى دِيـٰرِهِم جـٰثِمينَ
1567.en: And when Our command came to pass, We delivered Shu'ayb and those who shared his faith, through Our mercy, and the Blast seized those who were engaged in wrong#doing, so they lay lifeless in their homes

1568.arabic: كَأَن لَم يَغنَوا فيها أَلا بُعدًا لِمَديَنَ كَما بَعِدَت ثَمودُ
1568.en: as though they had never dwelt in them before. Lo! Away with (the people of) Midian, even as the Thamud were done away with!

1569.arabic: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا موسىٰ بِـٔايـٰتِنا وَسُلطـٰنٍ مُبينٍ
1569.en: And indeed We sent Moses with Our signs and with a clear authority

1570.arabic: إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِ فَاتَّبَعوا أَمرَ فِرعَونَ وَما أَمرُ فِرعَونَ بِرَشيدٍ
1570.en: to Pharaoh and his nobles. But they obeyed the command of Pharaoh even though Pharaoh's command was not rightly#directed.

1571.arabic: يَقدُمُ قَومَهُ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ فَأَورَدَهُمُ النّارَ وَبِئسَ الوِردُ المَورودُ
1571.en: He shall stand at the head of his people on the Day of Resurrection, and will bring them down to the Fire. What a wretched destination to be led to!

1572.arabic: وَأُتبِعوا فى هـٰذِهِ لَعنَةً وَيَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ بِئسَ الرِّفدُ المَرفودُ
1572.en: They were pursued by a curse in this world and so will they be on the Day of Resurrection. What an evil reward will they receive!

1573.arabic: ذٰلِكَ مِن أَنباءِ القُرىٰ نَقُصُّهُ عَلَيكَ مِنها قائِمٌ وَحَصيدٌ
1573.en: That is an account of some towns which We recount to you. Of them some are still standing and some have been mown down.

1574.arabic: وَما ظَلَمنـٰهُم وَلـٰكِن ظَلَموا أَنفُسَهُم فَما أَغنَت عَنهُم ءالِهَتُهُمُ الَّتى يَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن شَىءٍ لَمّا جاءَ أَمرُ رَبِّكَ وَما زادوهُم غَيرَ تَتبيبٍ
1574.en: We did not wrong them; it is rather they who wronged themselves. And when the command of your Lord came to pass, the gods besides Allah whom they had called upon, did not avail them in the least. They added nothing to them except ruin.

1575.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَخذُ رَبِّكَ إِذا أَخَذَ القُرىٰ وَهِىَ ظـٰلِمَةٌ إِنَّ أَخذَهُ أَليمٌ شَديدٌ
1575.en: Such is the seizing of your Lord that when He does seize the towns immersed in wrong#doing, His seizing is painful, terrible.

1576.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً لِمَن خافَ عَذابَ الـٔاخِرَةِ ذٰلِكَ يَومٌ مَجموعٌ لَهُ النّاسُ وَذٰلِكَ يَومٌ مَشهودٌ
1576.en: Surely in that is a sign for him who fears the chastisement of the Hereafter. That will be a Day when all men shall be mustered together; that will be a Day when whatever happens shall be witnessed by all.

1577.en: Nor shall We withhold it except till an appointed term.

1578.arabic: يَومَ يَأتِ لا تَكَلَّمُ نَفسٌ إِلّا بِإِذنِهِ فَمِنهُم شَقِىٌّ وَسَعيدٌ
1578.en: And when the appointed Day comes, no one shall even dare to speak except by the leave of Allah. Then some will be declared wretched, others blessed.

1579.arabic: فَأَمَّا الَّذينَ شَقوا فَفِى النّارِ لَهُم فيها زَفيرٌ وَشَهيقٌ
1579.en: As for the wretched, they shall be in the Fire, and in it they shall sigh and groan.

1580.arabic: خـٰلِدينَ فيها ما دامَتِ السَّمـٰوٰتُ وَالأَرضُ إِلّا ما شاءَ رَبُّكَ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ فَعّالٌ لِما يُريدُ
1580.en: They shall abide in it as long as the heavens and the earth endure, unless your Lord may will otherwise. Surely your Lord does whatsoever He wills.

1581.arabic: وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ سُعِدوا فَفِى الجَنَّةِ خـٰلِدينَ فيها ما دامَتِ السَّمـٰوٰتُ وَالأَرضُ إِلّا ما شاءَ رَبُّكَ عَطاءً غَيرَ مَجذوذٍ
1581.en: And as for those who are blessed, they shall abide in the Garden as long as the heavens and the earth endure, unless your Lord may will otherwise. They shall enjoy an unceasing gift.

1582.arabic: فَلا تَكُ فى مِريَةٍ مِمّا يَعبُدُ هـٰؤُلاءِ ما يَعبُدونَ إِلّا كَما يَعبُدُ ءاباؤُهُم مِن قَبلُ وَإِنّا لَمُوَفّوهُم نَصيبَهُم غَيرَ مَنقوصٍ
1582.en: \[O Prophet!\] Have no doubt about what they worship. For they worship what their fathers worshipped before. And (yet) We shall grant them their due portion in full, diminishing of it nothing.

1583.arabic: وَلَقَد ءاتَينا موسَى الكِتـٰبَ فَاختُلِفَ فيهِ وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ لَقُضِىَ بَينَهُم وَإِنَّهُم لَفى شَكٍّ مِنهُ مُريبٍ
1583.en: And We certainly gave Moses the Book before, and there arose disagreements about it (even as there are disagreements now about the Book revealed to you). Had it not been for a decree that had already gone forth from your Lord, the matter would have long been decided between them. Indeed they are in a disquieting doubt about it.

1584.arabic: وَإِنَّ كُلًّا لَمّا لَيُوَفِّيَنَّهُم رَبُّكَ أَعمـٰلَهُم إِنَّهُ بِما يَعمَلونَ خَبيرٌ
1584.en: Surely your Lord will recompense all to the full for their deeds. For indeed He is well aware of all what they do.

1585.arabic: فَاستَقِم كَما أُمِرتَ وَمَن تابَ مَعَكَ وَلا تَطغَوا إِنَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
1585.en: So remain, (O Muhammad), you and those who have returned with you (to the fold of faith and obedience from unbelief and rebellion) steadfast (in adhering to the straight way) as you were commanded. And do not exceed the limits of (service to Allah). For certainly He is aware of all what you do.

1586.arabic: وَلا تَركَنوا إِلَى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا فَتَمَسَّكُمُ النّارُ وَما لَكُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن أَولِياءَ ثُمَّ لا تُنصَرونَ
1586.en: And do not incline towards the wrong#doers lest the Fire might seize you and you will have none as your protector against Allah; and then you will not be helped from anywhere.

1587.arabic: وَأَقِمِ الصَّلوٰةَ طَرَفَىِ النَّهارِ وَزُلَفًا مِنَ الَّيلِ إِنَّ الحَسَنـٰتِ يُذهِبنَ السَّيِّـٔاتِ ذٰلِكَ ذِكرىٰ لِلذّٰكِرينَ
1587.en: And establish the Prayer at the two ends of the day and in the first hours of the night. Indeed the good deeds drive away the evil deeds. This is a Reminder to those who are mindful of Allah.

1588.arabic: وَاصبِر فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُضيعُ أَجرَ المُحسِنينَ
1588.en: And be patient; for indeed Allah never lets the reward of those who do good go to waste.

1589.arabic: فَلَولا كانَ مِنَ القُرونِ مِن قَبلِكُم أُولوا بَقِيَّةٍ يَنهَونَ عَنِ الفَسادِ فِى الأَرضِ إِلّا قَليلًا مِمَّن أَنجَينا مِنهُم وَاتَّبَعَ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا ما أُترِفوا فيهِ وَكانوا مُجرِمينَ
1589.en: Why were there not, out of the generations that passed away before you, righteous men who would forbid others from causing corruption on the earth? And if such were there, they were only a few whom We had saved from those generations, or else the wrong#doers kept pursuing the ease and comfort which had been conferred upon them, thus losing themselves in sinfulness.

1590.arabic: وَما كانَ رَبُّكَ لِيُهلِكَ القُرىٰ بِظُلمٍ وَأَهلُها مُصلِحونَ
1590.en: And your Lord is not such as would wrongfully destroy human habitations while their inhabitants are righteous.

1591.arabic: وَلَو شاءَ رَبُّكَ لَجَعَلَ النّاسَ أُمَّةً وٰحِدَةً وَلا يَزالونَ مُختَلِفينَ
1591.en: Had your Lord so willed, He would surely have made mankind one community. But as things stand, now they will not cease to differ among themselves and to follow erroneous ways

1592.arabic: إِلّا مَن رَحِمَ رَبُّكَ وَلِذٰلِكَ خَلَقَهُم وَتَمَّت كَلِمَةُ رَبِّكَ لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ الجِنَّةِ وَالنّاسِ أَجمَعينَ
1592.en: except for those on whom your Lord has mercy. And it is for this (exercise of freedom of choice) that He has created them. And the word of your Lord was fulfilled: 'Indeed I will fill the Hell, with men and jinn, altogether.'

1593.arabic: وَكُلًّا نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ مِن أَنباءِ الرُّسُلِ ما نُثَبِّتُ بِهِ فُؤادَكَ وَجاءَكَ فى هـٰذِهِ الحَقُّ وَمَوعِظَةٌ وَذِكرىٰ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
1593.en: (O Muhammad!) We narrate these anecdotes of Messengers to you that We may strengthen through them your heart. In these anecdotes come to you the truth, and an exhortation, and a reminder for the believers.

1594.arabic: وَقُل لِلَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّا عـٰمِلونَ
1594.en: As for those who are bent on not believing, tell them: 'Work according to your way and we are working according to our way.

1595.en: And do wait for the end of things; we too are waiting.

1596.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ غَيبُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَإِلَيهِ يُرجَعُ الأَمرُ كُلُّهُ فَاعبُدهُ وَتَوَكَّل عَلَيهِ وَما رَبُّكَ بِغـٰفِلٍ عَمّا تَعمَلونَ
1596.en: All that is hidden in the heavens and the earth lies within the power of Allah. To Him are all matters referred for judgement. So do serve Him, and place in Him all your trust. Your Lord is not heedless of what you do.

1597.en: Alif. Lam. Ra'. These are the verses of a Book that clearly expounds the truth.

1598.arabic: إِنّا أَنزَلنـٰهُ قُرءٰنًا عَرَبِيًّا لَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
1598.en: We have revealed it as a Recitation in Arabic that you may fully understand.

1599.arabic: نَحنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ أَحسَنَ القَصَصِ بِما أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ هـٰذَا القُرءانَ وَإِن كُنتَ مِن قَبلِهِ لَمِنَ الغـٰفِلينَ
1599.en: (O Muhammad), by revealing the Qur'an to you We narrate to you in the best manner the stories of the past although before this narration you were utterly unaware of them.

1600.arabic: إِذ قالَ يوسُفُ لِأَبيهِ يـٰأَبَتِ إِنّى رَأَيتُ أَحَدَ عَشَرَ كَوكَبًا وَالشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ رَأَيتُهُم لى سـٰجِدينَ
1600.en: Call to mind when Joseph said to his father: "My father! I saw (in a dream) eleven stars and the sun and the moon: I saw them prostrating themselves before me."

1601.arabic: قالَ يـٰبُنَىَّ لا تَقصُص رُءياكَ عَلىٰ إِخوَتِكَ فَيَكيدوا لَكَ كَيدًا إِنَّ الشَّيطـٰنَ لِلإِنسـٰنِ عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
1601.en: His father said: "My son! Do not relate your dream to your brothers lest they hatch a plot to harm you. Indeed Satan is man's open enemy.

1602.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ يَجتَبيكَ رَبُّكَ وَيُعَلِّمُكَ مِن تَأويلِ الأَحاديثِ وَيُتِمُّ نِعمَتَهُ عَلَيكَ وَعَلىٰ ءالِ يَعقوبَ كَما أَتَمَّها عَلىٰ أَبَوَيكَ مِن قَبلُ إِبرٰهيمَ وَإِسحـٰقَ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
1602.en: (As you have seen in the dream), so will your Lord choose you (for His task) and will impart to you the comprehension of the deeper meaning of things and will bestow the full measure of His favour upon you and upon the house of Jacob even as He earlier bestowed it in full measure upon your forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Surely your Lord is All# Knowing, All#Wise."

1603.arabic: لَقَد كانَ فى يوسُفَ وَإِخوَتِهِ ءايـٰتٌ لِلسّائِلينَ
1603.en: Verily in the story of Joseph and his brothers there are many signs for those who inquire (about the truth).

1604.arabic: إِذ قالوا لَيوسُفُ وَأَخوهُ أَحَبُّ إِلىٰ أَبينا مِنّا وَنَحنُ عُصبَةٌ إِنَّ أَبانا لَفى ضَلـٰلٍ مُبينٍ
1604.en: And call to mind when the brothers of Joseph conferred together and said: "Surely Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, although we are a group of so many. Our father is clearly mistaken.

1605.arabic: اقتُلوا يوسُفَ أَوِ اطرَحوهُ أَرضًا يَخلُ لَكُم وَجهُ أَبيكُم وَتَكونوا مِن بَعدِهِ قَومًا صـٰلِحينَ
1605.en: So either kill Joseph or cast him into some distant land so that your father's attention may become exclusively yours. And after so doing become righteous."

1606.arabic: قالَ قائِلٌ مِنهُم لا تَقتُلوا يوسُفَ وَأَلقوهُ فى غَيـٰبَتِ الجُبِّ يَلتَقِطهُ بَعضُ السَّيّارَةِ إِن كُنتُم فـٰعِلينَ
1606.en: Thereupon one of them said: "Do not kill Joseph, but if you are bent upon doing something, cast him down to the bottom of some dark pit, perhaps some caravan passing by will take him out of it."

1607.arabic: قالوا يـٰأَبانا ما لَكَ لا تَأمَ۫نّا عَلىٰ يوسُفَ وَإِنّا لَهُ لَنـٰصِحونَ
1607.en: After so deciding they said to their father: "Why is it that you do not trust us regarding Joseph although we are his true well#wishers?"

1608.arabic: أَرسِلهُ مَعَنا غَدًا يَرتَع وَيَلعَب وَإِنّا لَهُ لَحـٰفِظونَ
1608.en: Send him out with us tomorrow that he may enjoy himself and play while we will be there, standing guard over him."

1609.arabic: قالَ إِنّى لَيَحزُنُنى أَن تَذهَبوا بِهِ وَأَخافُ أَن يَأكُلَهُ الذِّئبُ وَأَنتُم عَنهُ غـٰفِلونَ
1609.en: Their father answered: "It grieves me indeed that you should take him with you for I fear that some wolf might eat him up while you are negligent of him."

1610.arabic: قالوا لَئِن أَكَلَهُ الذِّئبُ وَنَحنُ عُصبَةٌ إِنّا إِذًا لَخـٰسِرونَ
1610.en: They said: "Should a wolf eat him, despite the presence of our strong group, we would indeed be a worthless lot!"

1611.arabic: فَلَمّا ذَهَبوا بِهِ وَأَجمَعوا أَن يَجعَلوهُ فى غَيـٰبَتِ الجُبِّ وَأَوحَينا إِلَيهِ لَتُنَبِّئَنَّهُم بِأَمرِهِم هـٰذا وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
1611.en: So when they went away with Joseph and decided to cast him in the bottom of the dark pit, We revealed to Joseph: "Surely a time will come when you will remind them of their deed. They know nothing about the consequence of what they are doing."

1612.en: At nightfall they came to their father weeping

1613.arabic: قالوا يـٰأَبانا إِنّا ذَهَبنا نَستَبِقُ وَتَرَكنا يوسُفَ عِندَ مَتـٰعِنا فَأَكَلَهُ الذِّئبُ وَما أَنتَ بِمُؤمِنٍ لَنا وَلَو كُنّا صـٰدِقينَ
1613.en: and said: "Father! We went racing with one another and left Joseph behind with our things, and then a wolf came and ate him up. We know that you will not believe us howsoever truthful we might be."

1614.arabic: وَجاءو عَلىٰ قَميصِهِ بِدَمٍ كَذِبٍ قالَ بَل سَوَّلَت لَكُم أَنفُسُكُم أَمرًا فَصَبرٌ جَميلٌ وَاللَّهُ المُستَعانُ عَلىٰ ما تَصِفونَ
1614.en: And they brought Joseph's shirt, stained with false blood. Seeing this their father exclaimed: "Nay (this is not true); rather your evil souls have made it easy for you to commit a heinous act. So I will bear this patiently, and in good grace. It is Allah's help alone that I seek against your fabrication."

1615.arabic: وَجاءَت سَيّارَةٌ فَأَرسَلوا وارِدَهُم فَأَدلىٰ دَلوَهُ قالَ يـٰبُشرىٰ هـٰذا غُلـٰمٌ وَأَسَرّوهُ بِضـٰعَةً وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ بِما يَعمَلونَ
1615.en: And a caravan came, and they sent their water drawer to draw water. As he let down his bucket in the well he (observed Joseph) and cried out: "This is good news. There is a boy." They concealed him, considering him as part of their merchandise, while Allah was well aware of what they did.

1616.arabic: وَشَرَوهُ بِثَمَنٍ بَخسٍ دَرٰهِمَ مَعدودَةٍ وَكانوا فيهِ مِنَ الزّٰهِدينَ
1616.en: Later they sold him for a paltry sum # just a few dirhams; they did not care to obtain a higher price.

1617.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذِى اشتَرىٰهُ مِن مِصرَ لِامرَأَتِهِ أَكرِمى مَثوىٰهُ عَسىٰ أَن يَنفَعَنا أَو نَتَّخِذَهُ وَلَدًا وَكَذٰلِكَ مَكَّنّا لِيوسُفَ فِى الأَرضِ وَلِنُعَلِّمَهُ مِن تَأويلِ الأَحاديثِ وَاللَّهُ غالِبٌ عَلىٰ أَمرِهِ وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
1617.en: The man from Egypt who bought him said to his wife: "Take good care of him, possibly he might be of benefit to us or we might adopt him as a son." Thus We found a way for Joseph to become established in that land and in order that We might teach him to comprehend the deeper meaning of things. Allah has full power to implement His design although most people do not know that.

1618.arabic: وَلَمّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ ءاتَينـٰهُ حُكمًا وَعِلمًا وَكَذٰلِكَ نَجزِى المُحسِنينَ
1618.en: And when Joseph reached the age of maturity, We granted him judgement and knowledge. Thus do We reward those who do good.

1619.arabic: وَرٰوَدَتهُ الَّتى هُوَ فى بَيتِها عَن نَفسِهِ وَغَلَّقَتِ الأَبوٰبَ وَقالَت هَيتَ لَكَ قالَ مَعاذَ اللَّهِ إِنَّهُ رَبّى أَحسَنَ مَثواىَ إِنَّهُ لا يُفلِحُ الظّـٰلِمونَ
1619.en: And it so happened that the lady in whose house Joseph was living, sought to tempt him to herself, and one day bolting the doors she said: "Come on now!" Joseph answered: "May Allah grant me refuge! My Lord has provided an honourable abode for me (so how can I do something so evil)? Such wrong#doers never prosper."

1620.arabic: وَلَقَد هَمَّت بِهِ وَهَمَّ بِها لَولا أَن رَءا بُرهـٰنَ رَبِّهِ كَذٰلِكَ لِنَصرِفَ عَنهُ السّوءَ وَالفَحشاءَ إِنَّهُ مِن عِبادِنَا المُخلَصينَ
1620.en: And she advanced towards him, and had Joseph not perceived a sign from his Lord he too would have advanced towards her. Thus was Joseph shown a sign from his Lord that We might avert from him all evil and indecency, for indeed he was one of Our chosen servants.

1621.arabic: وَاستَبَقَا البابَ وَقَدَّت قَميصَهُ مِن دُبُرٍ وَأَلفَيا سَيِّدَها لَدَا البابِ قالَت ما جَزاءُ مَن أَرادَ بِأَهلِكَ سوءًا إِلّا أَن يُسجَنَ أَو عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
1621.en: Then both of them rushed to the door, each seeking to get ahead of the other, and she tore Joseph's shirt from behind. Then both of them found the husband of the lady at the door. Seeing him she said: "What should be the punishment of him who has foul designs on your wife except that he should be imprisoned or subjected to painful chastisement?"

1622.arabic: قالَ هِىَ رٰوَدَتنى عَن نَفسى وَشَهِدَ شاهِدٌ مِن أَهلِها إِن كانَ قَميصُهُ قُدَّ مِن قُبُلٍ فَصَدَقَت وَهُوَ مِنَ الكـٰذِبينَ
1622.en: Joseph said: "It is she who was trying to tempt me to herself." And a witness belonging to her own household testified (on grounds of circumstantial evidence): "If his shirt is torn from the front, then she is telling the truth and he is a liar.

1623.arabic: وَإِن كانَ قَميصُهُ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ فَكَذَبَت وَهُوَ مِنَ الصّـٰدِقينَ
1623.en: But if his shirt is torn from behind, then she has lied, and he is truthful."

1624.arabic: فَلَمّا رَءا قَميصَهُ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ قالَ إِنَّهُ مِن كَيدِكُنَّ إِنَّ كَيدَكُنَّ عَظيمٌ
1624.en: So when the husband saw Joseph's shirt torn from behind he exclaimed: "Surely, this is one of the tricks of you women; your tricks are indeed great.

1625.arabic: يوسُفُ أَعرِض عَن هـٰذا وَاستَغفِرى لِذَنبِكِ إِنَّكِ كُنتِ مِنَ الخاطِـٔينَ
1625.en: Joseph, disregard this. And you # woman # ask forgiveness for your sin, for indeed it is you who has been at fault."

1626.arabic: وَقالَ نِسوَةٌ فِى المَدينَةِ امرَأَتُ العَزيزِ تُرٰوِدُ فَتىٰها عَن نَفسِهِ قَد شَغَفَها حُبًّا إِنّا لَنَرىٰها فى ضَلـٰلٍ مُبينٍ
1626.en: And some ladies in the city began to say: "The chief's wife, violently in love with her houseboy, is out to tempt him. We think she is clearly mistaken."

1627.arabic: فَلَمّا سَمِعَت بِمَكرِهِنَّ أَرسَلَت إِلَيهِنَّ وَأَعتَدَت لَهُنَّ مُتَّكَـًٔا وَءاتَت كُلَّ وٰحِدَةٍ مِنهُنَّ سِكّينًا وَقالَتِ اخرُج عَلَيهِنَّ فَلَمّا رَأَينَهُ أَكبَرنَهُ وَقَطَّعنَ أَيدِيَهُنَّ وَقُلنَ حـٰشَ لِلَّهِ ما هـٰذا بَشَرًا إِن هـٰذا إِلّا مَلَكٌ كَريمٌ
1627.en: Hearing of their sly talk the chief's wife sent for those ladies, and arranged for them a banquet, and got ready couches, and gave each guest a knife. Then, while they were cutting and eating the fruit, she signalled Joseph: "Come out to them." When the ladies saw him they were so struck with admiration that they cut their hands, exclaiming: "Allah preserve us. This is no mortal human. This is nothing but a noble angel!"

1628.arabic: قالَت فَذٰلِكُنَّ الَّذى لُمتُنَّنى فيهِ وَلَقَد رٰوَدتُهُ عَن نَفسِهِ فَاستَعصَمَ وَلَئِن لَم يَفعَل ما ءامُرُهُ لَيُسجَنَنَّ وَلَيَكونًا مِنَ الصّـٰغِرينَ
1628.en: She said: "So now you see! This is the one regarding whom you reproached me. Indeed I tried to tempt him to myself but he held back, although if he were not to follow my order, he would certainly be imprisoned and humiliated."

1629.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ السِّجنُ أَحَبُّ إِلَىَّ مِمّا يَدعونَنى إِلَيهِ وَإِلّا تَصرِف عَنّى كَيدَهُنَّ أَصبُ إِلَيهِنَّ وَأَكُن مِنَ الجـٰهِلينَ
1629.en: Joseph said: "My Lord! I prefer imprisonment to what they ask me to do. And if You do not avert from me the guile of these women, I will succumb to their attraction and lapse into ignorance."

1630.arabic: فَاستَجابَ لَهُ رَبُّهُ فَصَرَفَ عَنهُ كَيدَهُنَّ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
1630.en: Thereupon his Lord granted his prayer, and averted their guile from him. Surely He alone is All#Hearing, All#Knowing.

1631.arabic: ثُمَّ بَدا لَهُم مِن بَعدِ ما رَأَوُا الـٔايـٰتِ لَيَسجُنُنَّهُ حَتّىٰ حينٍ
1631.en: Then it occurred to them to cast Joseph into prison for a while even though they had seen clear signs (of Joseph's innocence and of the evil ways of their ladies).

1632.arabic: وَدَخَلَ مَعَهُ السِّجنَ فَتَيانِ قالَ أَحَدُهُما إِنّى أَرىٰنى أَعصِرُ خَمرًا وَقالَ الـٔاخَرُ إِنّى أَرىٰنى أَحمِلُ فَوقَ رَأسى خُبزًا تَأكُلُ الطَّيرُ مِنهُ نَبِّئنا بِتَأويلِهِ إِنّا نَرىٰكَ مِنَ المُحسِنينَ
1632.en: And with Joseph two other slaves entered the prison. One of them said: "I saw myself pressing wine in a dream"; and the other said: "I saw myself carrying bread on my head of which the birds were eating."
