1918.en: Is then the One Who creates like the one who does not create? Will you not, then, take heed?

1919.arabic: وَإِن تَعُدّوا نِعمَةَ اللَّهِ لا تُحصوها إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
1919.en: For, were you to count the favours of Allah, you will not be able to count them. Surely Allah is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.

1920.arabic: وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ ما تُسِرّونَ وَما تُعلِنونَ
1920.en: Allah knows all that you conceal and all that you disclose.

1921.arabic: وَالَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ لا يَخلُقونَ شَيـًٔا وَهُم يُخلَقونَ
1921.en: Those whom they call upon beside Allah have created nothing; rather, they themselves were created;

1922.arabic: أَموٰتٌ غَيرُ أَحياءٍ وَما يَشعُرونَ أَيّانَ يُبعَثونَ
1922.en: they are dead, not living. They do not even know when they will be resurrected.

1923.arabic: إِلـٰهُكُم إِلـٰهٌ وٰحِدٌ فَالَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالـٔاخِرَةِ قُلوبُهُم مُنكِرَةٌ وَهُم مُستَكبِرونَ
1923.en: Your God is the One God. But the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter are steeped in rejection of the Truth, and they are given to arrogance.

1924.arabic: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ ما يُسِرّونَ وَما يُعلِنونَ إِنَّهُ لا يُحِبُّ المُستَكبِرينَ
1924.en: Surely Allah knows all that they conceal and all that they disclose. He certainly does not love those who are steeped in arrogance.

1925.arabic: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُم ماذا أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُم قالوا أَسـٰطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
1925.en: When they are asked: "What is it that your Lord has revealed?" They answer: "They are merely tales of olden times!"

1926.arabic: لِيَحمِلوا أَوزارَهُم كامِلَةً يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ وَمِن أَوزارِ الَّذينَ يُضِلّونَهُم بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ أَلا ساءَ ما يَزِرونَ
1926.en: (They say so) that they may bear the full weight of their burdens on the Day of Resurrection and also of the burdens of those whom they misled on account of their ignorance. What a heavy burden are they undertaking to bear!

1927.arabic: قَد مَكَرَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَأَتَى اللَّهُ بُنيـٰنَهُم مِنَ القَواعِدِ فَخَرَّ عَلَيهِمُ السَّقفُ مِن فَوقِهِم وَأَتىٰهُمُ العَذابُ مِن حَيثُ لا يَشعُرونَ
1927.en: Surely many people before them had plotted in a similar manner to (vanquish the Truth), but Allah uprooted the whole structure of their plot from its foundations so that the roof fell in upon them, and the chastisement (of Allah) visited them from unknown directions.

1928.arabic: ثُمَّ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ يُخزيهِم وَيَقولُ أَينَ شُرَكاءِىَ الَّذينَ كُنتُم تُشـٰقّونَ فيهِم قالَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ إِنَّ الخِزىَ اليَومَ وَالسّوءَ عَلَى الكـٰفِرينَ
1928.en: And again, on the Day of Resurrection, He will bring them to disgrace, and say: "Tell Me, now, where are those to whom you ascribed a share in My Divinity, and for whose sake you disputed (with the upholders of the Truth)?" Those who were endowed with knowledge (in the world) will say: "Surely today humiliation and misery shall be the lot of the unbelievers";

1929.arabic: الَّذينَ تَتَوَفّىٰهُمُ المَلـٰئِكَةُ ظالِمى أَنفُسِهِم فَأَلقَوُا السَّلَمَ ما كُنّا نَعمَلُ مِن سوءٍ بَلىٰ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
1929.en: the same unbelievers who, when the angels seize them and cause them to die while they are engaged in wrong#doing, they will proffer their submission saying: "We were engaged in no evil." (The angels will answer them): "Surely Allah knows well all that you did.

1930.arabic: فَادخُلوا أَبوٰبَ جَهَنَّمَ خـٰلِدينَ فيها فَلَبِئسَ مَثوَى المُتَكَبِّرينَ
1930.en: Go now, and enter the gate of Hell, and abide in it for ever. " Evil indeed is the abode of the arrogant.

1931.arabic: وَقيلَ لِلَّذينَ اتَّقَوا ماذا أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُم قالوا خَيرًا لِلَّذينَ أَحسَنوا فى هـٰذِهِ الدُّنيا حَسَنَةٌ وَلَدارُ الـٔاخِرَةِ خَيرٌ وَلَنِعمَ دارُ المُتَّقينَ
1931.en: And when the God#fearing are asked: "What has your Lord revealed?" they answer: "Something excellent!" Good fortune in this world awaits those who do good; and certainly the abode of the Hereafter is even better for them. How excellent is the abode of the God#fearing:

1932.arabic: جَنّـٰتُ عَدنٍ يَدخُلونَها تَجرى مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهـٰرُ لَهُم فيها ما يَشاءونَ كَذٰلِكَ يَجزِى اللَّهُ المُتَّقينَ
1932.en: everlasting gardens that they shall enter; the gardens beneath which rivers shall flow, and where they shall have whatever they desire! Thus does Allah reward the God#fearing,

1933.arabic: الَّذينَ تَتَوَفّىٰهُمُ المَلـٰئِكَةُ طَيِّبينَ يَقولونَ سَلـٰمٌ عَلَيكُمُ ادخُلُوا الجَنَّةَ بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
1933.en: those whose souls the angels seize while they are in a state of purity, saying: "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise as a reward for your deeds."

1934.arabic: هَل يَنظُرونَ إِلّا أَن تَأتِيَهُمُ المَلـٰئِكَةُ أَو يَأتِىَ أَمرُ رَبِّكَ كَذٰلِكَ فَعَلَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم وَما ظَلَمَهُمُ اللَّهُ وَلـٰكِن كانوا أَنفُسَهُم يَظلِمونَ
1934.en: (O Muhammad), are they waiting for anything else than that the angels should appear before them, or that your Lord's judgement should come? Many before them acted with similar temerity. And then what happened with them was not Allah's wrong#doing; they rather wronged themselves.

1935.arabic: فَأَصابَهُم سَيِّـٔاتُ ما عَمِلوا وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِءونَ
1935.en: The evil consequences of their misdeeds overtook them and what they mocked at overwhelmed them.

1936.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذينَ أَشرَكوا لَو شاءَ اللَّهُ ما عَبَدنا مِن دونِهِ مِن شَىءٍ نَحنُ وَلا ءاباؤُنا وَلا حَرَّمنا مِن دونِهِ مِن شَىءٍ كَذٰلِكَ فَعَلَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَهَل عَلَى الرُّسُلِ إِلَّا البَلـٰغُ المُبينُ
1936.en: Those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity say: "Were Allah to will so, neither we nor our forefathers would have worshipped any other than Him, nor would we have prohibited anything without His command." Their predecessors proffered similar excuses. Do the Messengers have any other duty but to plainly convey the Message?

1937.arabic: وَلَقَد بَعَثنا فى كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ رَسولًا أَنِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاجتَنِبُوا الطّـٰغوتَ فَمِنهُم مَن هَدَى اللَّهُ وَمِنهُم مَن حَقَّت عَلَيهِ الضَّلـٰلَةُ فَسيروا فِى الأَرضِ فَانظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عـٰقِبَةُ المُكَذِّبينَ
1937.en: We raised a Messenger in every community (to tell them): "Serve Allah and shun the Evil One." Thereafter Allah guided some of them while others were overtaken by error. Go about the earth, then, and observe what was the end of those who rejected the Messengers, calling them liars.

1938.arabic: إِن تَحرِص عَلىٰ هُدىٰهُم فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدى مَن يُضِلُّ وَما لَهُم مِن نـٰصِرينَ
1938.en: (O Muhammad), howsoever eager you may be to show them the Right Way, Allah does not bestow His guidance on those whom He lets go astray; and in fact none will be able to help them.

1939.arabic: وَأَقسَموا بِاللَّهِ جَهدَ أَيمـٰنِهِم لا يَبعَثُ اللَّهُ مَن يَموتُ بَلىٰ وَعدًا عَلَيهِ حَقًّا وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
1939.en: They swear most solemnly in the name of Allah and say: "Allah shall not raise to life any who dies." (Yes, He will do so); that is a promise by which He is bound, even though most people do not know that.

1940.arabic: لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ الَّذى يَختَلِفونَ فيهِ وَلِيَعلَمَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَنَّهُم كانوا كـٰذِبينَ
1940.en: (That is bound to happen in order that) He may make clear to them the reality regarding the matters on which they differ and that the unbelievers may realize that they were liars.

1941.arabic: إِنَّما قَولُنا لِشَىءٍ إِذا أَرَدنـٰهُ أَن نَقولَ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
1941.en: (As for the possibility of resurrection, bear in mind that) whenever We do will something, We have to do no more than say: "Be", and it is.

1942.arabic: وَالَّذينَ هاجَروا فِى اللَّهِ مِن بَعدِ ما ظُلِموا لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُم فِى الدُّنيا حَسَنَةً وَلَأَجرُ الـٔاخِرَةِ أَكبَرُ لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ
1942.en: As for those who have forsaken their homes for the sake of Allah after enduring persecution, We shall certainly grant them a good abode in this world; and surely the reward of the Hereafter is much greater. If they could but know (what an excellent end awaits)

1943.en: those who remain steadfast and put their trust in their Lord.

1944.arabic: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ إِلّا رِجالًا نوحى إِلَيهِم فَسـَٔلوا أَهلَ الذِّكرِ إِن كُنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
1944.en: (O Muhammad), whenever We raised any Messengers before you, they were no other than human beings; (except that) to them We sent revelation. So ask those who possess knowledge if you do not know.

1945.arabic: بِالبَيِّنـٰتِ وَالزُّبُرِ وَأَنزَلنا إِلَيكَ الذِّكرَ لِتُبَيِّنَ لِلنّاسِ ما نُزِّلَ إِلَيهِم وَلَعَلَّهُم يَتَفَكَّرونَ
1945.en: We raised the Messengers earlier with Clear Signs and Divine Books, and We have now sent down this Reminder upon you that you may elucidate to people the teaching that has been sent down for them, and that the people may themselves reflect.

1946.arabic: أَفَأَمِنَ الَّذينَ مَكَرُوا السَّيِّـٔاتِ أَن يَخسِفَ اللَّهُ بِهِمُ الأَرضَ أَو يَأتِيَهُمُ العَذابُ مِن حَيثُ لا يَشعُرونَ
1946.en: Do those who have been devising evil plans (against the mission of the Messenger) feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them up or that chastisement will not come upon them from a direction that they will not even be able to imagine;

1947.arabic: أَو يَأخُذَهُم فى تَقَلُّبِهِم فَما هُم بِمُعجِزينَ
1947.en: or that He will not suddenly seize them while they are going about to and fro and they will be unable to frustrate His design,

1948.arabic: أَو يَأخُذَهُم عَلىٰ تَخَوُّفٍ فَإِنَّ رَبَّكُم لَرَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
1948.en: or that He will not seize them when they are apprehensive of the impending calamity? Surely your Lord is Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

1949.arabic: أَوَلَم يَرَوا إِلىٰ ما خَلَقَ اللَّهُ مِن شَىءٍ يَتَفَيَّؤُا۟ ظِلـٰلُهُ عَنِ اليَمينِ وَالشَّمائِلِ سُجَّدًا لِلَّهِ وَهُم دٰخِرونَ
1949.en: Do the people not see how the objects Allah has created cast their shadows right and left, prostrating themselves in utter submission to Allah?

1950.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ يَسجُدُ ما فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَما فِى الأَرضِ مِن دابَّةٍ وَالمَلـٰئِكَةُ وَهُم لا يَستَكبِرونَ
1950.en: All living creatures and all angels in the heavens and on the earth are in prostration before Allah; and never do they behave in arrogant defiance.

1951.arabic: يَخافونَ رَبَّهُم مِن فَوقِهِم وَيَفعَلونَ ما يُؤمَرونَ
1951.en: They hold their Lord, Who is above them, in fear, and do as they are bidden.

1952.arabic: وَقالَ اللَّهُ لا تَتَّخِذوا إِلـٰهَينِ اثنَينِ إِنَّما هُوَ إِلـٰهٌ وٰحِدٌ فَإِيّـٰىَ فَارهَبونِ
1952.en: Allah has commanded: "Do not take two gods; for He is but One God. So fear Me alone."

1953.arabic: وَلَهُ ما فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلَهُ الدّينُ واصِبًا أَفَغَيرَ اللَّهِ تَتَّقونَ
1953.en: His is whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and obedience to Him inevitably pervades the whole universe. Will you, then, hold in awe any other than Allah?

1954.arabic: وَما بِكُم مِن نِعمَةٍ فَمِنَ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ إِذا مَسَّكُمُ الضُّرُّ فَإِلَيهِ تَجـَٔرونَ
1954.en: Every bounty that you enjoy is from Allah; and whenever any misfortune strikes you, it is to Him that you cry for the removal of your distress.

1955.arabic: ثُمَّ إِذا كَشَفَ الضُّرَّ عَنكُم إِذا فَريقٌ مِنكُم بِرَبِّهِم يُشرِكونَ
1955.en: But as soon as He removes the distress from you, some of you associate others with their Lord in giving thanks,

1956.arabic: لِيَكفُروا بِما ءاتَينـٰهُم فَتَمَتَّعوا فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ
1956.en: that they may show ingratitude for the bounties We bestowed upon them. So enjoy yourselves for a while, soon you will come to know (the truth).

1957.arabic: وَيَجعَلونَ لِما لا يَعلَمونَ نَصيبًا مِمّا رَزَقنـٰهُم تَاللَّهِ لَتُسـَٔلُنَّ عَمّا كُنتُم تَفتَرونَ
1957.en: They set apart for those, whose reality they do not even know, a portion of the sustenance We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be called to account for the lies that you have invented!

1958.arabic: وَيَجعَلونَ لِلَّهِ البَنـٰتِ سُبحـٰنَهُ وَلَهُم ما يَشتَهونَ
1958.en: They assign daughters to Allah # glory be to Him # whereas they assign to themselves what they truly desire!

1959.arabic: وَإِذا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِالأُنثىٰ ظَلَّ وَجهُهُ مُسوَدًّا وَهُوَ كَظيمٌ
1959.en: When any of them is told about the birth of a female his face turns dark, and he is filled with suppressed anger,

1960.arabic: يَتَوٰرىٰ مِنَ القَومِ مِن سوءِ ما بُشِّرَ بِهِ أَيُمسِكُهُ عَلىٰ هونٍ أَم يَدُسُّهُ فِى التُّرابِ أَلا ساءَ ما يَحكُمونَ
1960.en: and he hides himself from people because of the bad news, thinking: should he keep the child despite disgrace, or should he bury it in dust? How evil is their estimate of Allah!

1961.arabic: لِلَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالـٔاخِرَةِ مَثَلُ السَّوءِ وَلِلَّهِ المَثَلُ الأَعلىٰ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
1961.en: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter deserve to be characterized with evil attributes whereas Allah's are the most excellent attributes. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

1962.arabic: وَلَو يُؤاخِذُ اللَّهُ النّاسَ بِظُلمِهِم ما تَرَكَ عَلَيها مِن دابَّةٍ وَلـٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُم إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى فَإِذا جاءَ أَجَلُهُم لا يَستَـٔخِرونَ ساعَةً وَلا يَستَقدِمونَ
1962.en: Were Allah to take people to task for their wrong#doing, He would not have spared even a single living creature on the face of the earth. But He grants them respite until an appointed term. And when that term arrives, they have no power to delay it by a single moment, nor to hasten it.

1963.arabic: وَيَجعَلونَ لِلَّهِ ما يَكرَهونَ وَتَصِفُ أَلسِنَتُهُمُ الكَذِبَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ الحُسنىٰ لا جَرَمَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ النّارَ وَأَنَّهُم مُفرَطونَ
1963.en: They assign to Allah what they dislike for themselves and their tongues utter a sheer lie in stating that a happy state awaits them. Without doubt the Fire awaits them and it is to it that they shall be hastened.

1964.arabic: تَاللَّهِ لَقَد أَرسَلنا إِلىٰ أُمَمٍ مِن قَبلِكَ فَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيطـٰنُ أَعمـٰلَهُم فَهُوَ وَلِيُّهُمُ اليَومَ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
1964.en: By Allah, (O Muhammad), We sent Messengers to other communities before you but Satan made their evil deeds attractive to them (so they paid no heed to the call of the Messengers). The same Satan is their patron today and they are heading towards a painful chastisement.

1965.arabic: وَما أَنزَلنا عَلَيكَ الكِتـٰبَ إِلّا لِتُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ الَّذِى اختَلَفوا فيهِ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةً لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
1965.en: We have sent down the Book that you may explain to them the truth concerning what they are disputing and that the Book may serve as a guidance and mercy for those who believe in it.

1966.arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَحيا بِهِ الأَرضَ بَعدَ مَوتِها إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً لِقَومٍ يَسمَعونَ
1966.en: Allah sends down water from the heaven, and thereby He instantly revives the earth after it lay dead. Verily there is a sign in it for those who have ears.

1967.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكُم فِى الأَنعـٰمِ لَعِبرَةً نُسقيكُم مِمّا فى بُطونِهِ مِن بَينِ فَرثٍ وَدَمٍ لَبَنًا خالِصًا سائِغًا لِلشّـٰرِبينَ
1967.en: Surely there is a lesson for you in the cattle: We provide you to drink out of that which is in their bellies between the faeces and the blood # pure milk # which is a palatable drink for those who take it.

1968.arabic: وَمِن ثَمَرٰتِ النَّخيلِ وَالأَعنـٰبِ تَتَّخِذونَ مِنهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزقًا حَسَنًا إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
1968.en: And out of the fruits of date#palms and grapes you derive intoxicants as well as wholesome sustenance. Surely there is a sign for those who use reason.

1969.arabic: وَأَوحىٰ رَبُّكَ إِلَى النَّحلِ أَنِ اتَّخِذى مِنَ الجِبالِ بُيوتًا وَمِنَ الشَّجَرِ وَمِمّا يَعرِشونَ
1969.en: Your Lord inspired the bee, saying: "Set up hives in the mountains and in the trees and in the trellises that people put up,

1970.arabic: ثُمَّ كُلى مِن كُلِّ الثَّمَرٰتِ فَاسلُكى سُبُلَ رَبِّكِ ذُلُلًا يَخرُجُ مِن بُطونِها شَرابٌ مُختَلِفٌ أَلوٰنُهُ فيهِ شِفاءٌ لِلنّاسِ إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
1970.en: then suck the juice of every kind of fruit and keep treading the ways of your Lord which have been made easy." There comes forth from their bellies a drink varied in colours, wherein there is healing for men. Verily there is a sign in this for those who reflect.

1971.arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُم ثُمَّ يَتَوَفّىٰكُم وَمِنكُم مَن يُرَدُّ إِلىٰ أَرذَلِ العُمُرِ لِكَى لا يَعلَمَ بَعدَ عِلمٍ شَيـًٔا إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ قَديرٌ
1971.en: Allah has created you, and then He causes you to die. Some of you have your lives prolonged to an abject old age, when one loses all knowledge after having acquired it. Allah is All#Knowing, All#Powerful.

1972.arabic: وَاللَّهُ فَضَّلَ بَعضَكُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ فِى الرِّزقِ فَمَا الَّذينَ فُضِّلوا بِرادّى رِزقِهِم عَلىٰ ما مَلَكَت أَيمـٰنُهُم فَهُم فيهِ سَواءٌ أَفَبِنِعمَةِ اللَّهِ يَجحَدونَ
1972.en: Allah has favoured some of you with more worldly provisions than others. Then those who are more favoured do not give away their provisions to their slaves lest they become equal sharers in it. Do they, then, deny the favour of Allah?

1973.arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِن أَنفُسِكُم أَزوٰجًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِن أَزوٰجِكُم بَنينَ وَحَفَدَةً وَرَزَقَكُم مِنَ الطَّيِّبـٰتِ أَفَبِالبـٰطِلِ يُؤمِنونَ وَبِنِعمَتِ اللَّهِ هُم يَكفُرونَ
1973.en: And Allah has given you spouses from your kind, and has granted you through your spouses, sons and grandsons, and has provided you wholesome things as sustenance. (After knowing all this), do they still believe in falsehood and deny Allah's bounty,

1974.arabic: وَيَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَملِكُ لَهُم رِزقًا مِنَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ شَيـًٔا وَلا يَستَطيعونَ
1974.en: and worship instead of Allah, those helpless beings who have no control over providing them any sustenance from the heavens and the earth; do you worship those who have no power to do anything of this sort?

1975.arabic: فَلا تَضرِبوا لِلَّهِ الأَمثالَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ وَأَنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
1975.en: So do not strike any similitudes to Allah. Allah knows whereas you do not know.

1976.arabic: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا عَبدًا مَملوكًا لا يَقدِرُ عَلىٰ شَىءٍ وَمَن رَزَقنـٰهُ مِنّا رِزقًا حَسَنًا فَهُوَ يُنفِقُ مِنهُ سِرًّا وَجَهرًا هَل يَستَوۥنَ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
1976.en: Allah sets forth a parable: There is one who is a slave and is owned by another and has no power over anything; and there is one whom We have granted good provision Ourselves, of which he spends both secretly and openly. Can they be equal? All praise be to Allah. But most of them do not even know (this simple fact).

1977.arabic: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا رَجُلَينِ أَحَدُهُما أَبكَمُ لا يَقدِرُ عَلىٰ شَىءٍ وَهُوَ كَلٌّ عَلىٰ مَولىٰهُ أَينَما يُوَجِّههُ لا يَأتِ بِخَيرٍ هَل يَستَوى هُوَ وَمَن يَأمُرُ بِالعَدلِ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ صِرٰطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
1977.en: Allah sets forth another parable: There are two men, one of whom is dumb and has no power over anything; he is a burden to his master, and wheresoever his master directs him, he fails to bring forth any good. Can such a person be the equal of one who enjoins justice and himself follows the Right Way?

1978.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ غَيبُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما أَمرُ السّاعَةِ إِلّا كَلَمحِ البَصَرِ أَو هُوَ أَقرَبُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ قَديرٌ
1978.en: Allah has full knowledge of the truths beyond the reach of perception both in the heavens and the earth; and the coming of the Hour will take no more than the twinkling of an eye; it may take even less. Indeed Allah has power over everything.

1979.arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَخرَجَكُم مِن بُطونِ أُمَّهـٰتِكُم لا تَعلَمونَ شَيـًٔا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصـٰرَ وَالأَفـِٔدَةَ لَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
1979.en: Allah has brought you forth from your mothers' wombs when you knew nothing, and then gave you hearing, and sight and thinking hearts so that you may give thanks.

1980.arabic: أَلَم يَرَوا إِلَى الطَّيرِ مُسَخَّرٰتٍ فى جَوِّ السَّماءِ ما يُمسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا اللَّهُ إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايـٰتٍ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
1980.en: Have they never noticed the birds how they are held under control in the middle of the sky, where none holds them (from falling) except Allah? Surely there are signs in this for those who believe.

1981.arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِن بُيوتِكُم سَكَنًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِن جُلودِ الأَنعـٰمِ بُيوتًا تَستَخِفّونَها يَومَ ظَعنِكُم وَيَومَ إِقامَتِكُم وَمِن أَصوافِها وَأَوبارِها وَأَشعارِها أَثـٰثًا وَمَتـٰعًا إِلىٰ حينٍ
1981.en: Allah has made your houses a repose, and has provided you with the skins of the cattle for your habitation which are light to handle both when you travel and when you camp; and out of their wool and their fur and their hair He has given you furnishings and goods for use over a period of time.

1982.arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِمّا خَلَقَ ظِلـٰلًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِنَ الجِبالِ أَكنـٰنًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم سَرٰبيلَ تَقيكُمُ الحَرَّ وَسَرٰبيلَ تَقيكُم بَأسَكُم كَذٰلِكَ يُتِمُّ نِعمَتَهُ عَلَيكُم لَعَلَّكُم تُسلِمونَ
1982.en: And Allah has provided shade for you out of some of the things He has created; and He has provided you with shelters in the mountains, and has given you coats that protect you from heat as well as coats that protect you in battle. Thus does He complete His favour upon you that you may submit to Him.

1983.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَإِنَّما عَلَيكَ البَلـٰغُ المُبينُ
1983.en: But if they turn away, your only duty is to clearly deliver the message of the truth.

1984.arabic: يَعرِفونَ نِعمَتَ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُنكِرونَها وَأَكثَرُهُمُ الكـٰفِرونَ
1984.en: They are aware of the favours of Allah, and yet refuse to acknowledge them. Most of them are determined not to accept the Truth.

1985.arabic: وَيَومَ نَبعَثُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهيدًا ثُمَّ لا يُؤذَنُ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا وَلا هُم يُستَعتَبونَ
1985.en: (They are heedless of) the Day when We shall raise a witness from each community and then the unbelievers will neither be allowed to plead nor will they be asked to repent and seek pardon.

1986.arabic: وَإِذا رَءَا الَّذينَ ظَلَمُوا العَذابَ فَلا يُخَفَّفُ عَنهُم وَلا هُم يُنظَرونَ
1986.en: Once the wrong#doers have beheld the chastisement, neither will it be lightened for them nor will they be granted any respite.

1987.arabic: وَإِذا رَءَا الَّذينَ أَشرَكوا شُرَكاءَهُم قالوا رَبَّنا هـٰؤُلاءِ شُرَكاؤُنَا الَّذينَ كُنّا نَدعوا مِن دونِكَ فَأَلقَوا إِلَيهِمُ القَولَ إِنَّكُم لَكـٰذِبونَ
1987.en: And when those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity will see those to whom they ascribed this share, they will say: "Our Lord! These are the beings to whom we ascribed a share in Your Divinity and whom we called upon instead of You," whereupon those beings will fling at them the words: "You are liars."

1988.arabic: وَأَلقَوا إِلَى اللَّهِ يَومَئِذٍ السَّلَمَ وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
1988.en: On that Day they will offer their submission and all that they had fabricated will have vanished.

1989.arabic: الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ زِدنـٰهُم عَذابًا فَوقَ العَذابِ بِما كانوا يُفسِدونَ
1989.en: As for those who disbelieved and barred others from the way of Allah, We shall add further chastisement to their chastisement for all the mischief they did.

1990.arabic: وَيَومَ نَبعَثُ فى كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهيدًا عَلَيهِم مِن أَنفُسِهِم وَجِئنا بِكَ شَهيدًا عَلىٰ هـٰؤُلاءِ وَنَزَّلنا عَلَيكَ الكِتـٰبَ تِبيـٰنًا لِكُلِّ شَىءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةً وَبُشرىٰ لِلمُسلِمينَ
1990.en: (O Muhammad), warn them of the coming of a Day when We shall bring forth a witness against them from each community and We shall bring you forth as a witness against them all; (and it is for that purpose that) We sent down the Book to you which makes everything clear, and serves as a guidance and mercy and glad tidings to those who have submitted to Allah.

1991.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَأمُرُ بِالعَدلِ وَالإِحسـٰنِ وَإيتائِ ذِى القُربىٰ وَيَنهىٰ عَنِ الفَحشاءِ وَالمُنكَرِ وَالبَغىِ يَعِظُكُم لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
1991.en: Surely Allah enjoins justice, kindness and the doing of good to kith and kin, and forbids all that is shameful, evil and oppressive. He exhorts you so that you may be mindful.

1992.arabic: وَأَوفوا بِعَهدِ اللَّهِ إِذا عـٰهَدتُم وَلا تَنقُضُوا الأَيمـٰنَ بَعدَ تَوكيدِها وَقَد جَعَلتُمُ اللَّهَ عَلَيكُم كَفيلًا إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ ما تَفعَلونَ
1992.en: And fulfil the covenant which you have made with Allah and do not break your oaths after having firmly made them, and after having made Allah your witness. Surely Allah knows all that you do.

1993.arabic: وَلا تَكونوا كَالَّتى نَقَضَت غَزلَها مِن بَعدِ قُوَّةٍ أَنكـٰثًا تَتَّخِذونَ أَيمـٰنَكُم دَخَلًا بَينَكُم أَن تَكونَ أُمَّةٌ هِىَ أَربىٰ مِن أُمَّةٍ إِنَّما يَبلوكُمُ اللَّهُ بِهِ وَلَيُبَيِّنَنَّ لَكُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ ما كُنتُم فيهِ تَختَلِفونَ
1993.en: And do not become like the woman who, after having painstakingly spun her yarn, caused it to disintegrate into pieces. You resort to oaths as instruments of mutual deceit so that one people might take greater advantage than another although Allah puts you to the test through this. Surely on the Day of Resurrection He will make clear the Truth concerning the matters over which you differed.

1994.arabic: وَلَو شاءَ اللَّهُ لَجَعَلَكُم أُمَّةً وٰحِدَةً وَلـٰكِن يُضِلُّ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدى مَن يَشاءُ وَلَتُسـَٔلُنَّ عَمّا كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
1994.en: Had Allah so willed, He would have made you all one single community. However, He lets go astray whomsoever He wills and shows the Right Way to whomsoever He wills. Surely you shall be called to account regarding what you did.

1995.arabic: وَلا تَتَّخِذوا أَيمـٰنَكُم دَخَلًا بَينَكُم فَتَزِلَّ قَدَمٌ بَعدَ ثُبوتِها وَتَذوقُوا السّوءَ بِما صَدَدتُم عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَلَكُم عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
1995.en: Do not make your oaths a means of deceiving one another or else your foot may slip after having been firm, and you may suffer evil consequences because of hindering people from the way of Allah. A mighty chastisement awaits you.

1996.arabic: وَلا تَشتَروا بِعَهدِ اللَّهِ ثَمَنًا قَليلًا إِنَّما عِندَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيرٌ لَكُم إِن كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
1996.en: Do not barter away the covenant of Allah for a paltry gain. Verily that which is with Allah is far better for you, if you only knew.

1997.arabic: ما عِندَكُم يَنفَدُ وَما عِندَ اللَّهِ باقٍ وَلَنَجزِيَنَّ الَّذينَ صَبَروا أَجرَهُم بِأَحسَنِ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
1997.en: Whatever you have is bound to pass away and whatever is with Allah will last. And We shall surely grant those who have been patient their reward according to the best of what they did.

1998.arabic: مَن عَمِلَ صـٰلِحًا مِن ذَكَرٍ أَو أُنثىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَلَنُحيِيَنَّهُ حَيوٰةً طَيِّبَةً وَلَنَجزِيَنَّهُم أَجرَهُم بِأَحسَنِ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
1998.en: Whosoever acts righteously # whether a man or a woman # and embraces belief, We will surely grant him a good life; and will surely grant such persons their reward according to the best of their deeds.

1999.arabic: فَإِذا قَرَأتَ القُرءانَ فَاستَعِذ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطـٰنِ الرَّجيمِ
1999.en: Whenever you read the Qur'an seek refuge with Allah from Satan, the accursed.

2000.arabic: إِنَّهُ لَيسَ لَهُ سُلطـٰنٌ عَلَى الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَلىٰ رَبِّهِم يَتَوَكَّلونَ
2000.en: Surely he has no power over those who have faith and who place their trust in their Lord.

2001.arabic: إِنَّما سُلطـٰنُهُ عَلَى الَّذينَ يَتَوَلَّونَهُ وَالَّذينَ هُم بِهِ مُشرِكونَ
2001.en: He has power only over those who take him as their patron and who, under his influence, associate others with Allah in His Divinity.

2002.arabic: وَإِذا بَدَّلنا ءايَةً مَكانَ ءايَةٍ وَاللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما يُنَزِّلُ قالوا إِنَّما أَنتَ مُفتَرٍ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
2002.en: Whenever We replace one verse by another verse # and Allah knows what He should reveal # they are wont to say: "You are nothing but a fabricator (who has invented the Qur'an)." The fact is that most of them are ignorant of the Truth.

2003.arabic: قُل نَزَّلَهُ روحُ القُدُسِ مِن رَبِّكَ بِالحَقِّ لِيُثَبِّتَ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَهُدًى وَبُشرىٰ لِلمُسلِمينَ
2003.en: Tell them: "It is the spirit of holiness that has brought it down, by stages, from your Lord so that it might bring firmness to those who believe, and guidance to the Right Way, and give glad tidings of felicity and success to those who submit to Allah."

2004.arabic: وَلَقَد نَعلَمُ أَنَّهُم يَقولونَ إِنَّما يُعَلِّمُهُ بَشَرٌ لِسانُ الَّذى يُلحِدونَ إِلَيهِ أَعجَمِىٌّ وَهـٰذا لِسانٌ عَرَبِىٌّ مُبينٌ
2004.en: Surely We know well that they say about you: "It is only a human being who teaches him," (notwithstanding) that he whom they maliciously hint at is of foreign tongue, while this (Qur'an) is plain Arabic speech.

2005.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِـٔايـٰتِ اللَّهِ لا يَهديهِمُ اللَّهُ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
2005.en: Surely Allah will not enable those who do not believe in the signs of Allah to be directed to the Right Way, and a painful chastisement awaits them.

2006.arabic: إِنَّما يَفتَرِى الكَذِبَ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِـٔايـٰتِ اللَّهِ وَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ الكـٰذِبونَ
2006.en: (It is not the Prophet who invents lies), it is rather those who do not believe in the signs of Allah who invent lies. They are liars.

2007.arabic: مَن كَفَرَ بِاللَّهِ مِن بَعدِ إيمـٰنِهِ إِلّا مَن أُكرِهَ وَقَلبُهُ مُطمَئِنٌّ بِالإيمـٰنِ وَلـٰكِن مَن شَرَحَ بِالكُفرِ صَدرًا فَعَلَيهِم غَضَبٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
2007.en: Except for those who were forced to engage in infidelity to Allah after believing the while their hearts remained firmly convinced of their belief, the ones whose hearts willingly embraced disbelief shall incur Allah's wrath and a mighty chastisement lies in store for them.

2008.arabic: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ استَحَبُّوا الحَيوٰةَ الدُّنيا عَلَى الـٔاخِرَةِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدِى القَومَ الكـٰفِرينَ
2008.en: That is because they love the life of this world more than the Hereafter; and Allah does not guide those who are ungrateful to Allah for His favours.

2009.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ طَبَعَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم وَسَمعِهِم وَأَبصـٰرِهِم وَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ الغـٰفِلونَ
2009.en: They are the ones upon whose hearts and hearing and eyes Allah has set a seal. They are utterly steeped in heedlessness.

2010.arabic: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُم فِى الـٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ الخـٰسِرونَ
2010.en: No doubt they shall be losers in the Hereafter.

2011.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذينَ هاجَروا مِن بَعدِ ما فُتِنوا ثُمَّ جـٰهَدوا وَصَبَروا إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِن بَعدِها لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
2011.en: And surely your Lord will be Most Forgiving and Most Merciful towards those who left their homes after they were persecuted, and who thereafter struggled hard and remained constant.

2012.arabic: يَومَ تَأتى كُلُّ نَفسٍ تُجـٰدِلُ عَن نَفسِها وَتُوَفّىٰ كُلُّ نَفسٍ ما عَمِلَت وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
2012.en: Allah's judgement will come about them all on the Day when everyone shall come pleading in his defence, and everyone shall be fully requited for his deeds and none shall be wronged in the least.

2013.arabic: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا قَريَةً كانَت ءامِنَةً مُطمَئِنَّةً يَأتيها رِزقُها رَغَدًا مِن كُلِّ مَكانٍ فَكَفَرَت بِأَنعُمِ اللَّهِ فَأَذٰقَهَا اللَّهُ لِباسَ الجوعِ وَالخَوفِ بِما كانوا يَصنَعونَ
2013.en: Allah sets forth the parable of (the people of) a town who were secure and content and whose sustenance came in abundance from every quarter. But then the people of the town showed ingratitude towards Allah for His bounties, so Allah afflicted them with hunger and fear in punishment for their evil deeds.

2014.arabic: وَلَقَد جاءَهُم رَسولٌ مِنهُم فَكَذَّبوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمُ العَذابُ وَهُم ظـٰلِمونَ
2014.en: Most certainly a Messenger came to them from among them; but they rejected him, calling him a liar. Therefore chastisement seized them while they engaged in wrong#doing.

2015.arabic: فَكُلوا مِمّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ حَلـٰلًا طَيِّبًا وَاشكُروا نِعمَتَ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم إِيّاهُ تَعبُدونَ
2015.en: So eat out of the lawful and good sustenance that Allah has bestowed upon you, and thank Allah for His bounty, if it is Him that you serve.

2016.arabic: إِنَّما حَرَّمَ عَلَيكُمُ المَيتَةَ وَالدَّمَ وَلَحمَ الخِنزيرِ وَما أُهِلَّ لِغَيرِ اللَّهِ بِهِ فَمَنِ اضطُرَّ غَيرَ باغٍ وَلا عادٍ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
2016.en: Allah has forbidden you only carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine; also any animal over which the name of any other than Allah has been pronounced. But whoever eats of them under compelling necessity # neither desiring it nor exceeding the limit of absolute necessity # surely for such action Allah is Much Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2017.arabic: وَلا تَقولوا لِما تَصِفُ أَلسِنَتُكُمُ الكَذِبَ هـٰذا حَلـٰلٌ وَهـٰذا حَرامٌ لِتَفتَروا عَلَى اللَّهِ الكَذِبَ إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَفتَرونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الكَذِبَ لا يُفلِحونَ
2017.en: And do not utter falsehoods by letting your tongues declare: "This is lawful" and "That is unlawful," thus fabricating lies against Allah. Surely those who fabricate lies against Allah will never prosper.

2018.en: Brief is their enjoyment of the world, and thereafter they shall suffer a painful chastisement.

2019.arabic: وَعَلَى الَّذينَ هادوا حَرَّمنا ما قَصَصنا عَلَيكَ مِن قَبلُ وَما ظَلَمنـٰهُم وَلـٰكِن كانوا أَنفُسَهُم يَظلِمونَ
2019.en: We have already recounted to you what We prohibited to the Jews. In so doing We did not wrong them; it is they who wronged themselves.

2020.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذينَ عَمِلُوا السّوءَ بِجَهـٰلَةٍ ثُمَّ تابوا مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ وَأَصلَحوا إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِن بَعدِها لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
2020.en: But to those who commit evil out of ignorance and then repent and amend their ways, thereafter your Lord will be Much Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2021.arabic: إِنَّ إِبرٰهيمَ كانَ أُمَّةً قانِتًا لِلَّهِ حَنيفًا وَلَم يَكُ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
2021.en: Indeed Abraham was a whole community by himself, obedient to Allah, exclusively devoted to Him. And he was never one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity.

2022.arabic: شاكِرًا لِأَنعُمِهِ اجتَبىٰهُ وَهَدىٰهُ إِلىٰ صِرٰطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
2022.en: He rendered thanks to Allah for His bounties so that Allah chose him (for His favours) and directed him to the Right Way.

2023.arabic: وَءاتَينـٰهُ فِى الدُّنيا حَسَنَةً وَإِنَّهُ فِى الـٔاخِرَةِ لَمِنَ الصّـٰلِحينَ
2023.en: We bestowed good upon him in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall certainly be among the righteous.

2024.arabic: ثُمَّ أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ أَنِ اتَّبِع مِلَّةَ إِبرٰهيمَ حَنيفًا وَما كانَ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
2024.en: Then We revealed to you: "Follow the way of Abraham with exclusive devotion to Allah. He was not one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity."

2025.arabic: إِنَّما جُعِلَ السَّبتُ عَلَى الَّذينَ اختَلَفوا فيهِ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَحكُمُ بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ فيما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
2025.en: As for the Sabbath, it was made incumbent only on those who differed about its laws. Certainly your Lord will judge on the Day of Resurrection between them regarding the matters they disputed.

2026.arabic: ادعُ إِلىٰ سَبيلِ رَبِّكَ بِالحِكمَةِ وَالمَوعِظَةِ الحَسَنَةِ وَجـٰدِلهُم بِالَّتى هِىَ أَحسَنُ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعلَمُ بِالمُهتَدينَ
2026.en: (O Prophet), call to the way of your Lord with wisdom and goodly exhortation, and reason with them in the best manner possible. Surely your Lord knows best who has strayed away from His path, and He also knows well those who are guided to the Right Way.

2027.arabic: وَإِن عاقَبتُم فَعاقِبوا بِمِثلِ ما عوقِبتُم بِهِ وَلَئِن صَبَرتُم لَهُوَ خَيرٌ لِلصّـٰبِرينَ
2027.en: If you take retribution, then do so in proportion to the wrong done to you. But if you can bear such conduct with patience, indeed that is best for the steadfast.

2028.arabic: وَاصبِر وَما صَبرُكَ إِلّا بِاللَّهِ وَلا تَحزَن عَلَيهِم وَلا تَكُ فى ضَيقٍ مِمّا يَمكُرونَ
2028.en: And bear with patience, (O Muhammad) # and your patience is only because of the help of Allah # and do not grieve over them, nor feel distressed by their evil plans.

2029.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا وَالَّذينَ هُم مُحسِنونَ
2029.en: For surely Allah is with those who hold Him in fear and do good.

2030.arabic: سُبحـٰنَ الَّذى أَسرىٰ بِعَبدِهِ لَيلًا مِنَ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ إِلَى المَسجِدِ الأَقصَا الَّذى بـٰرَكنا حَولَهُ لِنُرِيَهُ مِن ءايـٰتِنا إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ البَصيرُ
2030.en: Holy is He Who carried His servant by night from the Holy Mosque (in Makkah) to the farther Mosque (in Jerusalem) whose surroundings We have blessed that We might show him some of Our Signs. Indeed He alone is All#Hearing, All#Seeing.

2031.arabic: وَءاتَينا موسَى الكِتـٰبَ وَجَعَلنـٰهُ هُدًى لِبَنى إِسرٰءيلَ أَلّا تَتَّخِذوا مِن دونى وَكيلًا
2031.en: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a source of guidance for the Children of Israel, commanding: "Take no other Guardian beside Me."

2032.arabic: ذُرِّيَّةَ مَن حَمَلنا مَعَ نوحٍ إِنَّهُ كانَ عَبدًا شَكورًا
2032.en: You are the descendants of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah. He was truly a thankful servant.

2033.arabic: وَقَضَينا إِلىٰ بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ فِى الكِتـٰبِ لَتُفسِدُنَّ فِى الأَرضِ مَرَّتَينِ وَلَتَعلُنَّ عُلُوًّا كَبيرًا
2033.en: Then We clearly declared to the Children of Israel in the Book: "Twice you will make mischief in the land and will commit transgression."

2034.arabic: فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ أولىٰهُما بَعَثنا عَلَيكُم عِبادًا لَنا أُولى بَأسٍ شَديدٍ فَجاسوا خِلـٰلَ الدِّيارِ وَكانَ وَعدًا مَفعولًا
2034.en: So, when the occasion for the first of the transgressions arrived, We raised against you some of Our creatures who were full of might, and they ran over the whole of your land. This was a promise that was bound to be fulfilled.

2035.arabic: ثُمَّ رَدَدنا لَكُمُ الكَرَّةَ عَلَيهِم وَأَمدَدنـٰكُم بِأَموٰلٍ وَبَنينَ وَجَعَلنـٰكُم أَكثَرَ نَفيرًا
2035.en: Then We granted you an upper hand against them, and strengthened you with wealth and children, and multiplied your numbers.

2036.arabic: إِن أَحسَنتُم أَحسَنتُم لِأَنفُسِكُم وَإِن أَسَأتُم فَلَها فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ الـٔاخِرَةِ لِيَسـۥـٔوا وُجوهَكُم وَلِيَدخُلُوا المَسجِدَ كَما دَخَلوهُ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ وَلِيُتَبِّروا ما عَلَوا تَتبيرًا
2036.en: Whenever you did good, it was to your own advantage; and whenever you committed evil, it was to your own disadvantage. So, when the time of the fulfilment of the second promise arrived, (We raised other enemies that would) disfigure your faces and enter the Temple (of Jerusalem) as they had entered the first time, and destroy whatever they could lay their hands on.

2037.arabic: عَسىٰ رَبُّكُم أَن يَرحَمَكُم وَإِن عُدتُم عُدنا وَجَعَلنا جَهَنَّمَ لِلكـٰفِرينَ حَصيرًا
2037.en: Your Lord may well show Mercy to you, but if you revert to your evil behaviour, We shall revert to chastising you. We have made Hell a prison for those who are thankless of Allah's bounties.

2038.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰذَا القُرءانَ يَهدى لِلَّتى هِىَ أَقوَمُ وَيُبَشِّرُ المُؤمِنينَ الَّذينَ يَعمَلونَ الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُم أَجرًا كَبيرًا
2038.en: Verily this Qur'an guides to the Way that is the Straight most. To those who believe in it, and do righteous works, it gives the good news that a great reward awaits them,

2039.arabic: وَأَنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالـٔاخِرَةِ أَعتَدنا لَهُم عَذابًا أَليمًا
2039.en: and warns those who do not believe in the Hereafter that We have prepared for them a grievous chastisement.

2040.arabic: وَيَدعُ الإِنسـٰنُ بِالشَّرِّ دُعاءَهُ بِالخَيرِ وَكانَ الإِنسـٰنُ عَجولًا
2040.en: Man prays for evil in the manner he ought to pray for good. Man is ever hasty.

2041.arabic: وَجَعَلنَا الَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ ءايَتَينِ فَمَحَونا ءايَةَ الَّيلِ وَجَعَلنا ءايَةَ النَّهارِ مُبصِرَةً لِتَبتَغوا فَضلًا مِن رَبِّكُم وَلِتَعلَموا عَدَدَ السِّنينَ وَالحِسابَ وَكُلَّ شَىءٍ فَصَّلنـٰهُ تَفصيلًا
2041.en: We have made night and day as two signs. We made the sign of the night devoid of light, and made the sign of the day radiant that you may seek the bounty of your Lord and know the computation of years and numbers. Thus We have expounded everything in detail to keep everything distinct from the other.

2042.arabic: وَكُلَّ إِنسـٰنٍ أَلزَمنـٰهُ طـٰئِرَهُ فى عُنُقِهِ وَنُخرِجُ لَهُ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ كِتـٰبًا يَلقىٰهُ مَنشورًا
2042.en: We have fastened every man's omen to his neck. On the Day of Resurrection We shall produce for him his scroll in the shape of a wide open book, (saying):

2043.arabic: اقرَأ كِتـٰبَكَ كَفىٰ بِنَفسِكَ اليَومَ عَلَيكَ حَسيبًا
2043.en: "Read your scroll; this Day you suffice to take account of yourself."

2044.arabic: مَنِ اهتَدىٰ فَإِنَّما يَهتَدى لِنَفسِهِ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّما يَضِلُّ عَلَيها وَلا تَزِرُ وازِرَةٌ وِزرَ أُخرىٰ وَما كُنّا مُعَذِّبينَ حَتّىٰ نَبعَثَ رَسولًا
2044.en: He who follows the Right Way shall do so to his own advantage; and he who strays shall incur his own loss. No one shall bear another's burden. And never do We punish any people until We send a Messenger (to make the Truth distinct from falsehood).

2045.arabic: وَإِذا أَرَدنا أَن نُهلِكَ قَريَةً أَمَرنا مُترَفيها فَفَسَقوا فيها فَحَقَّ عَلَيهَا القَولُ فَدَمَّرنـٰها تَدميرًا
2045.en: When We decide to destroy a town We command the affluent among them, whereupon they commit sins in it, then the decree (of chastisement) becomes due against them and thereafter We destroy that town utterly.

2046.arabic: وَكَم أَهلَكنا مِنَ القُرونِ مِن بَعدِ نوحٍ وَكَفىٰ بِرَبِّكَ بِذُنوبِ عِبادِهِ خَبيرًا بَصيرًا
2046.en: Many a generation has been destroyed by Our command since Noah's time. Your Lord is well aware and fully observant of the sins of His servants.

2047.arabic: مَن كانَ يُريدُ العاجِلَةَ عَجَّلنا لَهُ فيها ما نَشاءُ لِمَن نُريدُ ثُمَّ جَعَلنا لَهُ جَهَنَّمَ يَصلىٰها مَذمومًا مَدحورًا
2047.en: If anyone desires immediate benefits, We hasten to grant whatever benefits We will in the present life to whomsoever We please, but thereafter We decree for him Hell wherein he shall burn, condemned and rejected.

2048.arabic: وَمَن أَرادَ الـٔاخِرَةَ وَسَعىٰ لَها سَعيَها وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَأُولـٰئِكَ كانَ سَعيُهُم مَشكورًا
2048.en: But he who desires the Hereafter and strives for it in the manner he should, and is a true believer, his striving will come to fruition.

2049.arabic: كُلًّا نُمِدُّ هـٰؤُلاءِ وَهـٰؤُلاءِ مِن عَطاءِ رَبِّكَ وَما كانَ عَطاءُ رَبِّكَ مَحظورًا
2049.en: To all of these as well as those We shall provide the wherewithal of this life in the present world by dint of your Lord's Bounty; and from none shall the Bounty of your Lord be withheld.

2050.arabic: انظُر كَيفَ فَضَّلنا بَعضَهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ وَلَلـٔاخِرَةُ أَكبَرُ دَرَجـٰتٍ وَأَكبَرُ تَفضيلًا
2050.en: See, how We have exalted some above others in this world, and in the Life to Come they will have higher ranks and greater degrees of excellence over others.

2051.arabic: لا تَجعَل مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلـٰهًا ءاخَرَ فَتَقعُدَ مَذمومًا مَخذولًا
2051.en: Do not set up any other god with Allah lest you are rendered humiliated and helpless.

2052.arabic: وَقَضىٰ رَبُّكَ أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلّا إِيّاهُ وَبِالوٰلِدَينِ إِحسـٰنًا إِمّا يَبلُغَنَّ عِندَكَ الكِبَرَ أَحَدُهُما أَو كِلاهُما فَلا تَقُل لَهُما أُفٍّ وَلا تَنهَرهُما وَقُل لَهُما قَولًا كَريمًا
2052.en: Your Lord has decreed: (i) Do not worship any but Him; (ii) Be good to your parents; and should both or any one of them attain old age with you, do not say to them even "fie" neither chide them, but speak to them with respect,

2053.arabic: وَاخفِض لَهُما جَناحَ الذُّلِّ مِنَ الرَّحمَةِ وَقُل رَبِّ ارحَمهُما كَما رَبَّيانى صَغيرًا
2053.en: and be humble and tender to them and say: "Lord, show mercy to them as they nurtured me when I was small."

2054.arabic: رَبُّكُم أَعلَمُ بِما فى نُفوسِكُم إِن تَكونوا صـٰلِحينَ فَإِنَّهُ كانَ لِلأَوّٰبينَ غَفورًا
2054.en: Your Lord is best aware of what is in your hearts. If you are righteous, He will indeed forgive those who relent and revert (to serving Allah).

2055.arabic: وَءاتِ ذَا القُربىٰ حَقَّهُ وَالمِسكينَ وَابنَ السَّبيلِ وَلا تُبَذِّر تَبذيرًا
2055.en: (iii) Give to the near of kin his due, and also to the needy and the wayfarer. (iv) Do not squander your wealth wastefully,

2056.arabic: إِنَّ المُبَذِّرينَ كانوا إِخوٰنَ الشَّيـٰطينِ وَكانَ الشَّيطـٰنُ لِرَبِّهِ كَفورًا
2056.en: for those who squander wastefully are Satan's brothers, and Satan is ever ungrateful to his Lord.

2057.arabic: وَإِمّا تُعرِضَنَّ عَنهُمُ ابتِغاءَ رَحمَةٍ مِن رَبِّكَ تَرجوها فَقُل لَهُم قَولًا مَيسورًا
2057.en: (v) And when you must turn away from them # (that is, from the destitute, the near of kin, the needy, and the wayfarer) # in pursuit of God's Mercy which you expect to receive, then speak to them kindly.

2058.arabic: وَلا تَجعَل يَدَكَ مَغلولَةً إِلىٰ عُنُقِكَ وَلا تَبسُطها كُلَّ البَسطِ فَتَقعُدَ مَلومًا مَحسورًا
2058.en: (vi) Do not keep your hand fastened to your neck nor outspread it, altogether outspread, for you will be left sitting rebuked, destitute.

2059.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ إِنَّهُ كانَ بِعِبادِهِ خَبيرًا بَصيرًا
2059.en: Certainly Your Lord makes plentiful the provision of whomsoever He wills and straitens it for whomsoever He wills. He is well#aware and is fully observant of all that relates to His servants.

2060.arabic: وَلا تَقتُلوا أَولـٰدَكُم خَشيَةَ إِملـٰقٍ نَحنُ نَرزُقُهُم وَإِيّاكُم إِنَّ قَتلَهُم كانَ خِطـًٔا كَبيرًا
2060.en: (vii) Do not kill your children for fear of want. We will provide for them and for you. Surely killing them is a great sin.

2061.arabic: وَلا تَقرَبُوا الزِّنىٰ إِنَّهُ كانَ فـٰحِشَةً وَساءَ سَبيلًا
2061.en: (viii) Do not even approach fornication for it is an outrageous act, and an evil way.

2062.arabic: وَلا تَقتُلُوا النَّفسَ الَّتى حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلّا بِالحَقِّ وَمَن قُتِلَ مَظلومًا فَقَد جَعَلنا لِوَلِيِّهِ سُلطـٰنًا فَلا يُسرِف فِى القَتلِ إِنَّهُ كانَ مَنصورًا
2062.en: (ix) Do not kill any person whom Allah has forbidden to kill, except with right. We have granted the heir of him who has been wrongfully killed the authority to (claim retribution); so let him not exceed in slaying. He shall be helped.

2063.arabic: وَلا تَقرَبوا مالَ اليَتيمِ إِلّا بِالَّتى هِىَ أَحسَنُ حَتّىٰ يَبلُغَ أَشُدَّهُ وَأَوفوا بِالعَهدِ إِنَّ العَهدَ كانَ مَسـٔولًا
2063.en: (x) And do not even go near the property of the orphan # except that it be in the best manner # till he attains his maturity. (xi) And fulfil the covenant, for you will be called to account regarding the covenant.

2064.arabic: وَأَوفُوا الكَيلَ إِذا كِلتُم وَزِنوا بِالقِسطاسِ المُستَقيمِ ذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ وَأَحسَنُ تَأويلًا
2064.en: (xii) Give full measure when you measure, and weigh with even scales. That is fair and better in consequence.

2065.arabic: وَلا تَقفُ ما لَيسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلمٌ إِنَّ السَّمعَ وَالبَصَرَ وَالفُؤادَ كُلُّ أُولـٰئِكَ كانَ عَنهُ مَسـٔولًا
2065.en: (xiii) Do not follow that of which you have no knowledge. Surely the hearing, the sight, the heart # each of these shall be called to account.

2066.arabic: وَلا تَمشِ فِى الأَرضِ مَرَحًا إِنَّكَ لَن تَخرِقَ الأَرضَ وَلَن تَبلُغَ الجِبالَ طولًا
2066.en: (xiv) Do not strut about in the land arrogantly. Surely you cannot cleave the earth, nor reach the heights of the mountains in stature.

2067.arabic: كُلُّ ذٰلِكَ كانَ سَيِّئُهُ عِندَ رَبِّكَ مَكروهًا
2067.en: The wickedness of each of that is hateful to your Lord.

2068.arabic: ذٰلِكَ مِمّا أَوحىٰ إِلَيكَ رَبُّكَ مِنَ الحِكمَةِ وَلا تَجعَل مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلـٰهًا ءاخَرَ فَتُلقىٰ فى جَهَنَّمَ مَلومًا مَدحورًا
2068.en: That is part of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. So do not set up any deity beside Allah lest you are cast into Hell, rebuked and deprived of every good.

2069.arabic: أَفَأَصفىٰكُم رَبُّكُم بِالبَنينَ وَاتَّخَذَ مِنَ المَلـٰئِكَةِ إِنـٰثًا إِنَّكُم لَتَقولونَ قَولًا عَظيمًا
2069.en: What, has your Lord favoured you with sons and has taken for Himself daughters from among the angels? You are indeed uttering a monstrous lie.

2070.arabic: وَلَقَد صَرَّفنا فى هـٰذَا القُرءانِ لِيَذَّكَّروا وَما يَزيدُهُم إِلّا نُفورًا
2070.en: We have expounded (the Truth) in diverse ways in this Qur'an that they might take it to heart but all this only aggravates their aversion.

2071.arabic: قُل لَو كانَ مَعَهُ ءالِهَةٌ كَما يَقولونَ إِذًا لَابتَغَوا إِلىٰ ذِى العَرشِ سَبيلًا
2071.en: Say, (O Muhammad): "Had there been other gods with Him, as they claim, they would surely have attempted to find a way to the Lord of the Throne.

2072.arabic: سُبحـٰنَهُ وَتَعـٰلىٰ عَمّا يَقولونَ عُلُوًّا كَبيرًا
2072.en: Holy is He and far above all that they say.

2073.arabic: تُسَبِّحُ لَهُ السَّمـٰوٰتُ السَّبعُ وَالأَرضُ وَمَن فيهِنَّ وَإِن مِن شَىءٍ إِلّا يُسَبِّحُ بِحَمدِهِ وَلـٰكِن لا تَفقَهونَ تَسبيحَهُم إِنَّهُ كانَ حَليمًا غَفورًا
2073.en: The seven heavens, the earth, and all that is within them give glory to Him. There is nothing but gives glory to Him with His praise, though you do not understand their hymns of praise. He is Most Forbearing, Exceedingly Forgiving."

2074.arabic: وَإِذا قَرَأتَ القُرءانَ جَعَلنا بَينَكَ وَبَينَ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالـٔاخِرَةِ حِجابًا مَستورًا
2074.en: When you recite the Qur'an, We place a hidden barrier between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter;

2075.arabic: وَجَعَلنا عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفقَهوهُ وَفى ءاذانِهِم وَقرًا وَإِذا ذَكَرتَ رَبَّكَ فِى القُرءانِ وَحدَهُ وَلَّوا عَلىٰ أَدبـٰرِهِم نُفورًا
2075.en: and We place a covering on their hearts so that they do not comprehend it, and We cause a heaviness in their ears; and when you mention your Lord, the Only True Lord, in the Qur'an, they turn their backs in aversion.

2076.arabic: نَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِما يَستَمِعونَ بِهِ إِذ يَستَمِعونَ إِلَيكَ وَإِذ هُم نَجوىٰ إِذ يَقولُ الظّـٰلِمونَ إِن تَتَّبِعونَ إِلّا رَجُلًا مَسحورًا
2076.en: We are well aware of what they wish to hear when they listen to you and what they say when they confer in whispers, when the wrong#doers say: "You are only following one who is bewitched."

2077.arabic: انظُر كَيفَ ضَرَبوا لَكَ الأَمثالَ فَضَلّوا فَلا يَستَطيعونَ سَبيلًا
2077.en: Just see how strange are the things they invent about you. They have altogether strayed, and are unable to find the right way.

2078.arabic: وَقالوا أَءِذا كُنّا عِظـٰمًا وَرُفـٰتًا أَءِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ خَلقًا جَديدًا
2078.en: They say: "When we are turned to bones and particles (of dust), shall we truly be raised up as a new creation?"

2079.en: Tell them: "(You will be raised afresh even if) you turn to stone or iron,

2080.arabic: أَو خَلقًا مِمّا يَكبُرُ فى صُدورِكُم فَسَيَقولونَ مَن يُعيدُنا قُلِ الَّذى فَطَرَكُم أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ فَسَيُنغِضونَ إِلَيكَ رُءوسَهُم وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هُوَ قُل عَسىٰ أَن يَكونَ قَريبًا
2080.en: or any other form of creation you deem hardest of all (to recreate from)." They will certainly ask: "Who will bring us back (to life)?" Say: "He Who created you in the first instance." They will shake their heads at you and inquire: "When will that be?" Say: "Perhaps that time might have drawn near;

2081.arabic: يَومَ يَدعوكُم فَتَستَجيبونَ بِحَمدِهِ وَتَظُنّونَ إِن لَبِثتُم إِلّا قَليلًا
2081.en: on the Day when He will call you and you will rise praising Him in response to His call, and you will believe that you had lain in this state only for a while."

2082.arabic: وَقُل لِعِبادى يَقولُوا الَّتى هِىَ أَحسَنُ إِنَّ الشَّيطـٰنَ يَنزَغُ بَينَهُم إِنَّ الشَّيطـٰنَ كانَ لِلإِنسـٰنِ عَدُوًّا مُبينًا
2082.en: Tell My servants, (O Muhammad), to say always that which is best. Verily it is Satan who sows discord among people. Satan indeed is an open enemy to mankind.

2083.arabic: رَبُّكُم أَعلَمُ بِكُم إِن يَشَأ يَرحَمكُم أَو إِن يَشَأ يُعَذِّبكُم وَما أَرسَلنـٰكَ عَلَيهِم وَكيلًا
2083.en: Your Lord knows you best. He will have mercy on you if He wills and chastise you if He wills. We have not sent you, (O Muhammad), as an overseer over them.

2084.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ أَعلَمُ بِمَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلَقَد فَضَّلنا بَعضَ النَّبِيّـۧنَ عَلىٰ بَعضٍ وَءاتَينا داوۥدَ زَبورًا
2084.en: Your Lord knows all who dwell in the heavens and the earth. We have exalted some Prophets over others, and We gave the Psalms to David.

2085.arabic: قُلِ ادعُوا الَّذينَ زَعَمتُم مِن دونِهِ فَلا يَملِكونَ كَشفَ الضُّرِّ عَنكُم وَلا تَحويلًا
2085.en: Tell them: "Call upon those whom you fancy to be (your helpers) instead of Him! They have no power to remove any affliction from you, nor can they shift it (to any other)."

2086.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ يَدعونَ يَبتَغونَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِمُ الوَسيلَةَ أَيُّهُم أَقرَبُ وَيَرجونَ رَحمَتَهُ وَيَخافونَ عَذابَهُ إِنَّ عَذابَ رَبِّكَ كانَ مَحذورًا
2086.en: Those whom they call upon are themselves seeking the means of access to their Lord, each trying to be nearer to Him. They crave for His Mercy and dread His chastisement. Surely your Lord's punishment is to be feared.

2087.arabic: وَإِن مِن قَريَةٍ إِلّا نَحنُ مُهلِكوها قَبلَ يَومِ القِيـٰمَةِ أَو مُعَذِّبوها عَذابًا شَديدًا كانَ ذٰلِكَ فِى الكِتـٰبِ مَسطورًا
2087.en: There is not a town but We shall destroy it or upon which We shall inflict severe chastisement before the Day of Resurrection. This is written down in the Eternal Book (of Allah).

2088.arabic: وَما مَنَعَنا أَن نُرسِلَ بِالـٔايـٰتِ إِلّا أَن كَذَّبَ بِهَا الأَوَّلونَ وَءاتَينا ثَمودَ النّاقَةَ مُبصِرَةً فَظَلَموا بِها وَما نُرسِلُ بِالـٔايـٰتِ إِلّا تَخويفًا
2088.en: Nothing hindered Us from sending Our Signs except that the people of olden times rejected them as lies. We publicly sent the she#camel to the Thamud to open their eyes but they wronged her. We never send Our Signs except to cause people to fear.

2089.arabic: وَإِذ قُلنا لَكَ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ أَحاطَ بِالنّاسِ وَما جَعَلنَا الرُّءيَا الَّتى أَرَينـٰكَ إِلّا فِتنَةً لِلنّاسِ وَالشَّجَرَةَ المَلعونَةَ فِى القُرءانِ وَنُخَوِّفُهُم فَما يَزيدُهُم إِلّا طُغيـٰنًا كَبيرًا
2089.en: And recall when We said to you, (O Muhammad), that your Lord encompasses these people; and that We have made that vision that We have shown you, and the tree accursed in the Qur'an, but as a trial for people. We go about warning them, but each warning leads them to greater transgression.

2090.arabic: وَإِذ قُلنا لِلمَلـٰئِكَةِ اسجُدوا لِـٔادَمَ فَسَجَدوا إِلّا إِبليسَ قالَ ءَأَسجُدُ لِمَن خَلَقتَ طينًا
2090.en: And recall when We asked the angels to prostrate themselves before Adam; all prostrated themselves except Iblis, who said: "Shall I prostrate myself before him whom You created of clay?"

2091.arabic: قالَ أَرَءَيتَكَ هـٰذَا الَّذى كَرَّمتَ عَلَىَّ لَئِن أَخَّرتَنِ إِلىٰ يَومِ القِيـٰمَةِ لَأَحتَنِكَنَّ ذُرِّيَّتَهُ إِلّا قَليلًا
2091.en: He then continued: "Look! This is he whom You have exalted above me! If you will grant me respite till the Day of Resurrection I shall uproot the whole of his progeny except only a few."

2092.arabic: قالَ اذهَب فَمَن تَبِعَكَ مِنهُم فَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ جَزاؤُكُم جَزاءً مَوفورًا
2092.en: Thereupon He retorted: "Be gone! Hell shall be the recompense # and a most ample one # of whosoever of them who follows you.

2093.arabic: وَاستَفزِز مَنِ استَطَعتَ مِنهُم بِصَوتِكَ وَأَجلِب عَلَيهِم بِخَيلِكَ وَرَجِلِكَ وَشارِكهُم فِى الأَموٰلِ وَالأَولـٰدِ وَعِدهُم وَما يَعِدُهُمُ الشَّيطـٰنُ إِلّا غُرورًا
2093.en: Tempt with your call all whom you wish. Muster against them all your forces # your cavalry and your foot soldiers; share with them riches and offspring, and seduce them with rosy promises # and Satan's promise is nothing but a deception #

2094.arabic: إِنَّ عِبادى لَيسَ لَكَ عَلَيهِم سُلطـٰنٌ وَكَفىٰ بِرَبِّكَ وَكيلًا
2094.en: but know well that you will have no power against My servants. Your Lord suffices for them to place their trust in."

2095.arabic: رَبُّكُمُ الَّذى يُزجى لَكُمُ الفُلكَ فِى البَحرِ لِتَبتَغوا مِن فَضلِهِ إِنَّهُ كانَ بِكُم رَحيمًا
2095.en: Your Lord is He Who steers your vessels across the seas that you may seek of His Bounty. He is ever Merciful towards you.

2096.arabic: وَإِذا مَسَّكُمُ الضُّرُّ فِى البَحرِ ضَلَّ مَن تَدعونَ إِلّا إِيّاهُ فَلَمّا نَجّىٰكُم إِلَى البَرِّ أَعرَضتُم وَكانَ الإِنسـٰنُ كَفورًا
2096.en: When a calamity befalls you on the sea, all those whom you invoke forsake you except Him. But when He delivers you safely to the shore you turn away from Him, for man is indeed most thankless.

2097.arabic: أَفَأَمِنتُم أَن يَخسِفَ بِكُم جانِبَ البَرِّ أَو يُرسِلَ عَلَيكُم حاصِبًا ثُمَّ لا تَجِدوا لَكُم وَكيلًا
2097.en: Do you, then, feel secure against His causing you to be swallowed up by a tract of the earth, or letting loose a deadly whirlwind charged with stones towards you, and there you will find none to protect you?

2098.arabic: أَم أَمِنتُم أَن يُعيدَكُم فيهِ تارَةً أُخرىٰ فَيُرسِلَ عَلَيكُم قاصِفًا مِنَ الرّيحِ فَيُغرِقَكُم بِما كَفَرتُم ثُمَّ لا تَجِدوا لَكُم عَلَينا بِهِ تَبيعًا
2098.en: Or do you feel secure that He will not cause you to revert to the sea, and let a tempest loose upon you and then drown you for your ingratitude whereupon you will find none even to inquire of Us what happened to you?

2099.arabic: وَلَقَد كَرَّمنا بَنى ءادَمَ وَحَمَلنـٰهُم فِى البَرِّ وَالبَحرِ وَرَزَقنـٰهُم مِنَ الطَّيِّبـٰتِ وَفَضَّلنـٰهُم عَلىٰ كَثيرٍ مِمَّن خَلَقنا تَفضيلًا
2099.en: Indeed, We honoured the progeny of Adam, and bore them across land and sea and provided them with good things for their sustenance, and exalted them above many of Our creatures.

2100.arabic: يَومَ نَدعوا كُلَّ أُناسٍ بِإِمـٰمِهِم فَمَن أوتِىَ كِتـٰبَهُ بِيَمينِهِ فَأُولـٰئِكَ يَقرَءونَ كِتـٰبَهُم وَلا يُظلَمونَ فَتيلًا
2100.en: Then think of the Day We shall summon every community with its leader. Those who are given their Record in their right hand shall read the Record of their deeds and shall not be wronged a whit.

2101.arabic: وَمَن كانَ فى هـٰذِهِ أَعمىٰ فَهُوَ فِى الـٔاخِرَةِ أَعمىٰ وَأَضَلُّ سَبيلًا
2101.en: Whoever lived in this world as blind shall live as blind in the Life to Come; rather, he will be even farther astray than if he were (just) blind.

2102.arabic: وَإِن كادوا لَيَفتِنونَكَ عَنِ الَّذى أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ لِتَفتَرِىَ عَلَينا غَيرَهُ وَإِذًا لَاتَّخَذوكَ خَليلًا
2102.en: (O Muhammad), they had all but tempted you away from what We have revealed to you that you may invent something else in Our Name. Had you done so, they would have taken you as their trusted friend.

2103.arabic: وَلَولا أَن ثَبَّتنـٰكَ لَقَد كِدتَ تَركَنُ إِلَيهِم شَيـًٔا قَليلًا
2103.en: Indeed, had We not strengthened you, you might have inclined to them a little,

2104.arabic: إِذًا لَأَذَقنـٰكَ ضِعفَ الحَيوٰةِ وَضِعفَ المَماتِ ثُمَّ لا تَجِدُ لَكَ عَلَينا نَصيرًا
2104.en: whereupon We would have made you taste double (the chastisement) in the world and double (the chastisement) after death, and then you would have found none to help you against Us.

2105.arabic: وَإِن كادوا لَيَستَفِزّونَكَ مِنَ الأَرضِ لِيُخرِجوكَ مِنها وَإِذًا لا يَلبَثونَ خِلـٰفَكَ إِلّا قَليلًا
2105.en: They were bent upon uprooting you from this land and driving you away from it. But were they to succeed, they would not be able to remain after you more than a little while.

2106.arabic: سُنَّةَ مَن قَد أَرسَلنا قَبلَكَ مِن رُسُلِنا وَلا تَجِدُ لِسُنَّتِنا تَحويلًا
2106.en: This has been Our Way with the Messengers whom We sent before you. You will find no change in Our Way.

2107.arabic: أَقِمِ الصَّلوٰةَ لِدُلوكِ الشَّمسِ إِلىٰ غَسَقِ الَّيلِ وَقُرءانَ الفَجرِ إِنَّ قُرءانَ الفَجرِ كانَ مَشهودًا
2107.en: Establish Prayer from the declining of the sun to the darkness of the night; and hold fast to the recitation of the Qur'an at dawn, for the recitation of the Qur'an at dawn is witnessed.

2108.arabic: وَمِنَ الَّيلِ فَتَهَجَّد بِهِ نافِلَةً لَكَ عَسىٰ أَن يَبعَثَكَ رَبُّكَ مَقامًا مَحمودًا
2108.en: And rise from sleep during the night as well# this is an additional Prayer for you. Possibly your Lord will raise you to an honoured position.

2109.arabic: وَقُل رَبِّ أَدخِلنى مُدخَلَ صِدقٍ وَأَخرِجنى مُخرَجَ صِدقٍ وَاجعَل لى مِن لَدُنكَ سُلطـٰنًا نَصيرًا
2109.en: And pray: "My Lord! Cause me to enter wherever it be, with Truth, and cause me to exit, wherever it be, with Truth, and support me with authority from Yourself."

2110.arabic: وَقُل جاءَ الحَقُّ وَزَهَقَ البـٰطِلُ إِنَّ البـٰطِلَ كانَ زَهوقًا
2110.en: And proclaim: "The Truth has come, and falsehood has vanished. Surely falsehood is ever bound to vanish."

2111.arabic: وَنُنَزِّلُ مِنَ القُرءانِ ما هُوَ شِفاءٌ وَرَحمَةٌ لِلمُؤمِنينَ وَلا يَزيدُ الظّـٰلِمينَ إِلّا خَسارًا
2111.en: What We are sending down in the course of revealing the Qur'an is a healing and a grace for those who have faith; but it adds only to the ruin of the wrong#doers.

2112.arabic: وَإِذا أَنعَمنا عَلَى الإِنسـٰنِ أَعرَضَ وَنَـٔا بِجانِبِهِ وَإِذا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ كانَ يَـٔوسًا
2112.en: Whenever We bestow favours upon man, he arrogantly turns away and draws aside; and whenever evil visits him, he is in utter despair.

2113.arabic: قُل كُلٌّ يَعمَلُ عَلىٰ شاكِلَتِهِ فَرَبُّكُم أَعلَمُ بِمَن هُوَ أَهدىٰ سَبيلًا
2113.en: Say, (O Prophet): "Each one acts according to his own manner. Your Lord knows well who is best#guided to the Right Path."

2114.arabic: وَيَسـَٔلونَكَ عَنِ الرّوحِ قُلِ الرّوحُ مِن أَمرِ رَبّى وَما أوتيتُم مِنَ العِلمِ إِلّا قَليلًا
2114.en: They ask you about "the spirit". Say: "The spirit descends by the command of my Lord, but you have been given only a little knowledge."

2115.arabic: وَلَئِن شِئنا لَنَذهَبَنَّ بِالَّذى أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ ثُمَّ لا تَجِدُ لَكَ بِهِ عَلَينا وَكيلًا
2115.en: Had We willed, We could take away what We have revealed to you, then you would find none to help you in recovering it from Us.

2116.arabic: إِلّا رَحمَةً مِن رَبِّكَ إِنَّ فَضلَهُ كانَ عَلَيكَ كَبيرًا
2116.en: (Whatever you have received) is nothing but grace from your Lord. Indeed His favour to you is great.

2117.arabic: قُل لَئِنِ اجتَمَعَتِ الإِنسُ وَالجِنُّ عَلىٰ أَن يَأتوا بِمِثلِ هـٰذَا القُرءانِ لا يَأتونَ بِمِثلِهِ وَلَو كانَ بَعضُهُم لِبَعضٍ ظَهيرًا
2117.en: Say: "Surely, if mankind and jinn were to get together to produce the like of this Qur'an, they will never be able to produce the like of it, howsoever they might help one another."

2118.arabic: وَلَقَد صَرَّفنا لِلنّاسِ فى هـٰذَا القُرءانِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ فَأَبىٰ أَكثَرُ النّاسِ إِلّا كُفورًا
2118.en: We have explained things for people in this Qur'an in diverse ways to make them understand the Message, yet most people obstinately persist in unbelief.

2119.arabic: وَقالوا لَن نُؤمِنَ لَكَ حَتّىٰ تَفجُرَ لَنا مِنَ الأَرضِ يَنبوعًا
2119.en: They said: "We shall not accept your Message until you cause a spring to gush forth for us from the earth;

2120.arabic: أَو تَكونَ لَكَ جَنَّةٌ مِن نَخيلٍ وَعِنَبٍ فَتُفَجِّرَ الأَنهـٰرَ خِلـٰلَها تَفجيرًا
2120.en: or that there be a garden of palms and vines for you and then you cause rivers to abundantly flow forth through them;

2121.arabic: أَو تُسقِطَ السَّماءَ كَما زَعَمتَ عَلَينا كِسَفًا أَو تَأتِىَ بِاللَّهِ وَالمَلـٰئِكَةِ قَبيلًا
2121.en: or cause the sky to fall on us in pieces as you claimed, or bring Allah and the angels before us, face to face;

2122.arabic: أَو يَكونَ لَكَ بَيتٌ مِن زُخرُفٍ أَو تَرقىٰ فِى السَّماءِ وَلَن نُؤمِنَ لِرُقِيِّكَ حَتّىٰ تُنَزِّلَ عَلَينا كِتـٰبًا نَقرَؤُهُ قُل سُبحانَ رَبّى هَل كُنتُ إِلّا بَشَرًا رَسولًا
2122.en: or that there come to be for you a house of gold, or that you ascend to the sky # though we shall not believe in your ascension (to the sky) # until you bring down a book for us that we can read." Say to them, (O Muhammad): "Holy is my Lord! Am I anything else than a human being, who bears a Message (from Allah)?"

2123.arabic: وَما مَنَعَ النّاسَ أَن يُؤمِنوا إِذ جاءَهُمُ الهُدىٰ إِلّا أَن قالوا أَبَعَثَ اللَّهُ بَشَرًا رَسولًا
2123.en: Whenever Guidance came to people, nothing prevented them from believing except that they said: "Has Allah sent a human being as a Messenger?"

2124.arabic: قُل لَو كانَ فِى الأَرضِ مَلـٰئِكَةٌ يَمشونَ مُطمَئِنّينَ لَنَزَّلنا عَلَيهِم مِنَ السَّماءِ مَلَكًا رَسولًا
2124.en: Say: "Had angels been walking about in peace on the earth, We would surely have sent to them an angel from the heavens as Messenger."

2125.arabic: قُل كَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهيدًا بَينى وَبَينَكُم إِنَّهُ كانَ بِعِبادِهِ خَبيرًا بَصيرًا
2125.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Allah suffices as a witness between me and you. Allah is well aware and fully observes everything pertaining to His servants."

2126.arabic: وَمَن يَهدِ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ المُهتَدِ وَمَن يُضلِل فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُم أَولِياءَ مِن دونِهِ وَنَحشُرُهُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ عَلىٰ وُجوهِهِم عُميًا وَبُكمًا وَصُمًّا مَأوىٰهُم جَهَنَّمُ كُلَّما خَبَت زِدنـٰهُم سَعيرًا
2126.en: Whomsoever Allah guides is rightly guided; and whomsoever Allah lets go astray, you shall find none # apart from Him # who could protect him. We shall muster them all on the Day of Resurrection, on their faces # blind and dumb and deaf. Hell shall be their refuge. Every time its Fire subsides, We will intensify for them its flame.

2127.arabic: ذٰلِكَ جَزاؤُهُم بِأَنَّهُم كَفَروا بِـٔايـٰتِنا وَقالوا أَءِذا كُنّا عِظـٰمًا وَرُفـٰتًا أَءِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ خَلقًا جَديدًا
2127.en: That will be their recompense because they disbelieved in Our Signs and said: "What, when we shall be reduced to bones and particles (of dust), shall we be raised again as a new creation?"

2128.arabic: أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ الَّذى خَلَقَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضَ قادِرٌ عَلىٰ أَن يَخلُقَ مِثلَهُم وَجَعَلَ لَهُم أَجَلًا لا رَيبَ فيهِ فَأَبَى الظّـٰلِمونَ إِلّا كُفورًا
2128.en: Have they not perceived that Allah, Who has created the heavens and the earth, has the power to create the like of them? He has fixed a term for them about which there is no doubt. And yet the wrong#doers obstinately persist in unbelief.

2129.arabic: قُل لَو أَنتُم تَملِكونَ خَزائِنَ رَحمَةِ رَبّى إِذًا لَأَمسَكتُم خَشيَةَ الإِنفاقِ وَكانَ الإِنسـٰنُ قَتورًا
2129.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Even if you owned the treasures of my Lord's Mercy you would have held them back for fear of spending them." Man is indeed ever niggardly.

2130.arabic: وَلَقَد ءاتَينا موسىٰ تِسعَ ءايـٰتٍ بَيِّنـٰتٍ فَسـَٔل بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ إِذ جاءَهُم فَقالَ لَهُ فِرعَونُ إِنّى لَأَظُنُّكَ يـٰموسىٰ مَسحورًا
2130.en: We granted Moses nine clear signs. Ask the Children of Israel about that: when these signs came forth, Pharaoh said to him: "Moses, I think that you are bewitched."

2131.arabic: قالَ لَقَد عَلِمتَ ما أَنزَلَ هـٰؤُلاءِ إِلّا رَبُّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ بَصائِرَ وَإِنّى لَأَظُنُّكَ يـٰفِرعَونُ مَثبورًا
2131.en: Moses replied: "You know well that no one but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these as eye#opening proofs. I truly think, O Pharaoh, that you are indeed doomed."

2132.arabic: فَأَرادَ أَن يَستَفِزَّهُم مِنَ الأَرضِ فَأَغرَقنـٰهُ وَمَن مَعَهُ جَميعًا
2132.en: At last Pharaoh decided to uproot Moses and the Children of Israel from the land, but We drowned him together with all who were with him;

2133.arabic: وَقُلنا مِن بَعدِهِ لِبَنى إِسرٰءيلَ اسكُنُوا الأَرضَ فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ الـٔاخِرَةِ جِئنا بِكُم لَفيفًا
2133.en: and thereafter We said to the Children of Israel: "Now dwell in the land, but when the promised time of the Hereafter comes, We shall bring you all together."

2134.arabic: وَبِالحَقِّ أَنزَلنـٰهُ وَبِالحَقِّ نَزَلَ وَما أَرسَلنـٰكَ إِلّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذيرًا
2134.en: We have sent down the Qur'an with the Truth, and it is with the Truth that it has descended. And We have not sent you but to proclaim good news and to warn.

2135.arabic: وَقُرءانًا فَرَقنـٰهُ لِتَقرَأَهُ عَلَى النّاسِ عَلىٰ مُكثٍ وَنَزَّلنـٰهُ تَنزيلًا
2135.en: We have revealed the Qur'an in parts that you may recite it to people slowly and with deliberation; and (for that reason) We have revealed it gradually (to suit particular occasions).

2136.arabic: قُل ءامِنوا بِهِ أَو لا تُؤمِنوا إِنَّ الَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ مِن قَبلِهِ إِذا يُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم يَخِرّونَ لِلأَذقانِ سُجَّدًا
2136.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Whether you believe in it, or do not believe," but when it is recited to those who were given the knowledge before its revelation, they fall down upon their faces in prostration

2137.arabic: وَيَقولونَ سُبحـٰنَ رَبِّنا إِن كانَ وَعدُ رَبِّنا لَمَفعولًا
2137.en: and say: "Glory be to our Lord. Surely the promise of our Lord was bound to be fulfilled."

2138.en: And they fall down upon their faces, weeping, and their humility increases when (the Qur'an) is recited to them.

2139.arabic: قُلِ ادعُوا اللَّهَ أَوِ ادعُوا الرَّحمـٰنَ أَيًّا ما تَدعوا فَلَهُ الأَسماءُ الحُسنىٰ وَلا تَجهَر بِصَلاتِكَ وَلا تُخافِت بِها وَابتَغِ بَينَ ذٰلِكَ سَبيلًا
2139.en: Say to them (O Prophet!): "Call upon Him as Allah or call upon Him as al#Rahman; call Him by whichever name you will, all His names are beautiful. Neither offer your Prayer in too loud a voice, nor in a voice too low; but follow a middle course."

2140.arabic: وَقُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذى لَم يَتَّخِذ وَلَدًا وَلَم يَكُن لَهُ شَريكٌ فِى المُلكِ وَلَم يَكُن لَهُ وَلِىٌّ مِنَ الذُّلِّ وَكَبِّرهُ تَكبيرًا
2140.en: And say: "All praise be to Allah Who has neither taken to Himself a son, nor has He any partner in His kingdom, nor does He need anyone, out of weakness, to protect Him." So glorify Him in a manner worthy of His glory.

2141.arabic: الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذى أَنزَلَ عَلىٰ عَبدِهِ الكِتـٰبَ وَلَم يَجعَل لَهُ عِوَجا
2141.en: Praise be to Allah Who has revealed to His servant the Book devoid of all crookedness;

2142.arabic: قَيِّمًا لِيُنذِرَ بَأسًا شَديدًا مِن لَدُنهُ وَيُبَشِّرَ المُؤمِنينَ الَّذينَ يَعمَلونَ الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُم أَجرًا حَسَنًا
2142.en: an unerringly Straight Book, meant to warn of a stern punishment from Allah, and to proclaim, to those who believe and work righteous deeds, the tiding that theirs shall be a good reward

2143.en: wherein they shall abide for ever;

2144.arabic: وَيُنذِرَ الَّذينَ قالُوا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ وَلَدًا
2144.en: and also to warn those who say: "Allah has taken to Himself a son,"

2145.arabic: ما لَهُم بِهِ مِن عِلمٍ وَلا لِـٔابائِهِم كَبُرَت كَلِمَةً تَخرُجُ مِن أَفوٰهِهِم إِن يَقولونَ إِلّا كَذِبًا
2145.en: a thing about which they have no knowledge, neither they nor their ancestors. Dreadful is the word that comes out of their mouths. What they utter is merely a lie.

2146.arabic: فَلَعَلَّكَ بـٰخِعٌ نَفسَكَ عَلىٰ ءاثـٰرِهِم إِن لَم يُؤمِنوا بِهـٰذَا الحَديثِ أَسَفًا
2146.en: (O Muhammad), if they do not believe in this Message, you will perhaps torment yourself to death with grief, sorrowing over them.

2147.arabic: إِنّا جَعَلنا ما عَلَى الأَرضِ زينَةً لَها لِنَبلُوَهُم أَيُّهُم أَحسَنُ عَمَلًا
2147.en: Surely We have made all that is on the earth an embellishment for it in order to test people as to who of them is better in conduct.

2148.arabic: وَإِنّا لَجـٰعِلونَ ما عَلَيها صَعيدًا جُرُزًا
2148.en: In the ultimate, We shall reduce all that is on the earth to a barren plain.

2149.arabic: أَم حَسِبتَ أَنَّ أَصحـٰبَ الكَهفِ وَالرَّقيمِ كانوا مِن ءايـٰتِنا عَجَبًا
2149.en: Do you think that the people of the Cave and the Inscription were one of Our wondrous signs?

2150.arabic: إِذ أَوَى الفِتيَةُ إِلَى الكَهفِ فَقالوا رَبَّنا ءاتِنا مِن لَدُنكَ رَحمَةً وَهَيِّئ لَنا مِن أَمرِنا رَشَدًا
2150.en: When those youths sought refuge in the Cave and said: "Our Lord! Grant us mercy from Yourself and provide for us rectitude in our affairs."

2151.arabic: فَضَرَبنا عَلىٰ ءاذانِهِم فِى الكَهفِ سِنينَ عَدَدًا
2151.en: We lulled them to sleep in that cave for a number of years

2152.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثنـٰهُم لِنَعلَمَ أَىُّ الحِزبَينِ أَحصىٰ لِما لَبِثوا أَمَدًا
2152.en: and then roused them so that We might see which of the two parties could best tell the length of their stay.

2153.arabic: نَحنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ نَبَأَهُم بِالحَقِّ إِنَّهُم فِتيَةٌ ءامَنوا بِرَبِّهِم وَزِدنـٰهُم هُدًى
2153.en: We narrate to you their true story. They were a party of young men who had faith in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance

2154.arabic: وَرَبَطنا عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم إِذ قاموا فَقالوا رَبُّنا رَبُّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ لَن نَدعُوَا۟ مِن دونِهِ إِلـٰهًا لَقَد قُلنا إِذًا شَطَطًا
2154.en: and strengthened their hearts when they stood up and proclaimed: "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We shall call upon no other god beside Him; (for if we did so), we shall be uttering a blasphemy."

2155.arabic: هـٰؤُلاءِ قَومُنَا اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ ءالِهَةً لَولا يَأتونَ عَلَيهِم بِسُلطـٰنٍ بَيِّنٍ فَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
2155.en: (Then they conferred among themselves and said): "These men, our own people, have taken others as gods beside Him: why do they not bring any clear evidence that they indeed are gods? Who can be more unjust than he who foists a lie on Allah?

2156.arabic: وَإِذِ اعتَزَلتُموهُم وَما يَعبُدونَ إِلَّا اللَّهَ فَأوۥا إِلَى الكَهفِ يَنشُر لَكُم رَبُّكُم مِن رَحمَتِهِ وَيُهَيِّئ لَكُم مِن أَمرِكُم مِرفَقًا
2156.en: And now that you have dissociated yourselves from them and from whatever they worship beside Allah, go and seek refuge in the Cave. Your Lord will extend His mercy to you and will provide for you the means for the disposal of your affairs."

2157.arabic: وَتَرَى الشَّمسَ إِذا طَلَعَت تَزٰوَرُ عَن كَهفِهِم ذاتَ اليَمينِ وَإِذا غَرَبَت تَقرِضُهُم ذاتَ الشِّمالِ وَهُم فى فَجوَةٍ مِنهُ ذٰلِكَ مِن ءايـٰتِ اللَّهِ مَن يَهدِ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ المُهتَدِ وَمَن يُضلِل فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُ وَلِيًّا مُرشِدًا
2157.en: Had you seen them in the Cave it would have appeared to you that when the sun rose, it moved away from their Cave to the right; and when it set, it turned away from them to the left, while they remained in a spacious hollow in the Cave. This is one of the Signs of Allah. Whomsoever Allah guides, he alone is led aright; and whomsoever Allah lets go astray, you will find for him no guardian to direct him.

2158.arabic: وَتَحسَبُهُم أَيقاظًا وَهُم رُقودٌ وَنُقَلِّبُهُم ذاتَ اليَمينِ وَذاتَ الشِّمالِ وَكَلبُهُم بـٰسِطٌ ذِراعَيهِ بِالوَصيدِ لَوِ اطَّلَعتَ عَلَيهِم لَوَلَّيتَ مِنهُم فِرارًا وَلَمُلِئتَ مِنهُم رُعبًا
2158.en: On seeing them you would fancy them to be awake though they were asleep; and We caused them to turn their sides to their right and to their left, and their dog sat stretching out its forelegs on the threshold of the Cave. Had you looked upon them you would have certainly fled away from them, their sight filling you with terror.

2159.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ بَعَثنـٰهُم لِيَتَساءَلوا بَينَهُم قالَ قائِلٌ مِنهُم كَم لَبِثتُم قالوا لَبِثنا يَومًا أَو بَعضَ يَومٍ قالوا رَبُّكُم أَعلَمُ بِما لَبِثتُم فَابعَثوا أَحَدَكُم بِوَرِقِكُم هـٰذِهِ إِلَى المَدينَةِ فَليَنظُر أَيُّها أَزكىٰ طَعامًا فَليَأتِكُم بِرِزقٍ مِنهُ وَليَتَلَطَّف وَلا يُشعِرَنَّ بِكُم أَحَدًا
2159.en: Likewise, We roused them in a miraculous way that they might question one another. One of them asked: "How long did you remain (in this state)?" The others said: "We remained so for a day or part of a day." Then they said: "Your Lord knows better how long we remained in this state. Now send one of you to the city with this coin of yours and let him see who has the best food, and let him buy some provisions from there. Let him be cautious and not inform anyone of our whereabouts.

2160.arabic: إِنَّهُم إِن يَظهَروا عَلَيكُم يَرجُموكُم أَو يُعيدوكُم فى مِلَّتِهِم وَلَن تُفلِحوا إِذًا أَبَدًا
2160.en: For if they should come upon us, they will stone us to death or force us to revert to their faith whereafter we shall never prosper."

2161.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَعثَرنا عَلَيهِم لِيَعلَموا أَنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَأَنَّ السّاعَةَ لا رَيبَ فيها إِذ يَتَنـٰزَعونَ بَينَهُم أَمرَهُم فَقالُوا ابنوا عَلَيهِم بُنيـٰنًا رَبُّهُم أَعلَمُ بِهِم قالَ الَّذينَ غَلَبوا عَلىٰ أَمرِهِم لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيهِم مَسجِدًا
2161.en: Thus did We make their case known to the people of the city so that they might know that Allah's promise is true, and that there is absolutely no doubt that the Hour will come to pass. But instead of giving thought to this, they disputed with one another concerning the People of the Cave, some saying: "Build a wall over them. Their Lord alone knows best about them." But those who prevailed over their affairs said: "We shall build a place of worship over them."

2162.arabic: سَيَقولونَ ثَلـٰثَةٌ رابِعُهُم كَلبُهُم وَيَقولونَ خَمسَةٌ سادِسُهُم كَلبُهُم رَجمًا بِالغَيبِ وَيَقولونَ سَبعَةٌ وَثامِنُهُم كَلبُهُم قُل رَبّى أَعلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم ما يَعلَمُهُم إِلّا قَليلٌ فَلا تُمارِ فيهِم إِلّا مِراءً ظـٰهِرًا وَلا تَستَفتِ فيهِم مِنهُم أَحَدًا
2162.en: Some will say concerning them: "They were three and their dog, the fourth"; and some will say: "They were five, and their dog, the sixth" ## all this being merely guesswork; and still others will say: "They were seven, and their dog, the eighth." Say: "My Lord knows their number best. Only a few know their correct number. So do not dispute concerning their number, but stick to what is evident, and do not question anyone about them."

2163.arabic: وَلا تَقولَنَّ لِشَا۟ىءٍ إِنّى فاعِلٌ ذٰلِكَ غَدًا
2163.en: And never say about anything: "I shall certainly do this tomorrow"

2164.arabic: إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ وَاذكُر رَبَّكَ إِذا نَسيتَ وَقُل عَسىٰ أَن يَهدِيَنِ رَبّى لِأَقرَبَ مِن هـٰذا رَشَدًا
2164.en: unless Allah should will it. And should you forget (and make such a statement), remember your Lord and say: "I expect my Lord to guide me to what is nearer to rectitude than this."

2165.arabic: وَلَبِثوا فى كَهفِهِم ثَلـٰثَ مِا۟ئَةٍ سِنينَ وَازدادوا تِسعًا
2165.en: They remained in the Cave for three hundred years; and others added nine more years.

2166.arabic: قُلِ اللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما لَبِثوا لَهُ غَيبُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ أَبصِر بِهِ وَأَسمِع ما لَهُم مِن دونِهِ مِن وَلِىٍّ وَلا يُشرِكُ فى حُكمِهِ أَحَدًا
2166.en: Say: "Allah knows best how long they remained in it, for only He knows all that is hidden in the heavens and the earth. How well He sees; how well He hears! The creatures have no other guardian than Him; He allows none to share His authority."

2167.arabic: وَاتلُ ما أوحِىَ إِلَيكَ مِن كِتابِ رَبِّكَ لا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِمـٰتِهِ وَلَن تَجِدَ مِن دونِهِ مُلتَحَدًا
2167.en: (O Prophet), recite to them from the Book of your Lord what has been revealed to you for none may change His words; (and were you to make any change in His words) you will find no refuge from Him.

2168.arabic: وَاصبِر نَفسَكَ مَعَ الَّذينَ يَدعونَ رَبَّهُم بِالغَدوٰةِ وَالعَشِىِّ يُريدونَ وَجهَهُ وَلا تَعدُ عَيناكَ عَنهُم تُريدُ زينَةَ الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا وَلا تُطِع مَن أَغفَلنا قَلبَهُ عَن ذِكرِنا وَاتَّبَعَ هَوىٰهُ وَكانَ أَمرُهُ فُرُطًا
2168.en: Keep yourself content with those who call upon their Lord, morning and evening, seeking His pleasure, and do not let your eyes pass beyond them. Do you seek the pomp and glitter of the world? Do not follow him whose heart We have caused to be heedless of Our remembrance, and who follows his desires, and whose attitude is of excess.

2169.arabic: وَقُلِ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكُم فَمَن شاءَ فَليُؤمِن وَمَن شاءَ فَليَكفُر إِنّا أَعتَدنا لِلظّـٰلِمينَ نارًا أَحاطَ بِهِم سُرادِقُها وَإِن يَستَغيثوا يُغاثوا بِماءٍ كَالمُهلِ يَشوِى الوُجوهَ بِئسَ الشَّرابُ وَساءَت مُرتَفَقًا
2169.en: And proclaim: "This is the Truth from your Lord. Now let him who will, believe; and let him who will, disbelieve. We have prepared a Fire for the wrong#doers whose billowing folds encompass them. If they ask for water, they will be served with a drink like dregs of oil that will scald their faces. How dreadful a drink, and how evil an abode!

2170.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ إِنّا لا نُضيعُ أَجرَ مَن أَحسَنَ عَمَلًا
2170.en: As for those who believe and do good We shall not cause their reward to be lost.

2171.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ لَهُم جَنّـٰتُ عَدنٍ تَجرى مِن تَحتِهِمُ الأَنهـٰرُ يُحَلَّونَ فيها مِن أَساوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَيَلبَسونَ ثِيابًا خُضرًا مِن سُندُسٍ وَإِستَبرَقٍ مُتَّكِـٔينَ فيها عَلَى الأَرائِكِ نِعمَ الثَّوابُ وَحَسُنَت مُرتَفَقًا
2171.en: They shall dwell in the Gardens of Eternity, beneath which streams flow. There they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, will be arrayed in green garments of silk and rich brocade, and will recline on raised couches. How excellent is their reward, and how nice their resting#place!"

2172.arabic: وَاضرِب لَهُم مَثَلًا رَجُلَينِ جَعَلنا لِأَحَدِهِما جَنَّتَينِ مِن أَعنـٰبٍ وَحَفَفنـٰهُما بِنَخلٍ وَجَعَلنا بَينَهُما زَرعًا
