2172.en: (O Muhammad), propound a parable to them. There were two men of whom We bestowed upon one of the two vineyards, surrounding both of them with date#palms and putting a tillage in between.

2173.arabic: كِلتَا الجَنَّتَينِ ءاتَت أُكُلَها وَلَم تَظلِم مِنهُ شَيـًٔا وَفَجَّرنا خِلـٰلَهُما نَهَرًا
2173.en: Both the vineyards yielded abundant produce without failure and We caused a stream to flow in their midst

2174.arabic: وَكانَ لَهُ ثَمَرٌ فَقالَ لِصـٰحِبِهِ وَهُوَ يُحاوِرُهُ أَنا۠ أَكثَرُ مِنكَ مالًا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرًا
2174.en: so the owner had fruit in abundance and he said to his neighbour, while conversing with him: "I have greater wealth than you and I am stronger than you in numbers."

2175.arabic: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُ وَهُوَ ظالِمٌ لِنَفسِهِ قالَ ما أَظُنُّ أَن تَبيدَ هـٰذِهِ أَبَدًا
2175.en: Then he entered his vine#yard and said, wronging himself: "Surely, I do not believe that all this will ever perish.

2176.arabic: وَما أَظُنُّ السّاعَةَ قائِمَةً وَلَئِن رُدِدتُ إِلىٰ رَبّى لَأَجِدَنَّ خَيرًا مِنها مُنقَلَبًا
2176.en: Nor do I believe that the Hour of Resurrection will ever come to pass. And even if I am returned to my Lord, I shall find a better place than this."

2177.arabic: قالَ لَهُ صاحِبُهُ وَهُوَ يُحاوِرُهُ أَكَفَرتَ بِالَّذى خَلَقَكَ مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُطفَةٍ ثُمَّ سَوّىٰكَ رَجُلًا
2177.en: While conversing with him his neighbour exclaimed: "Do you deny Him Who created you out of dust, then out of a drop of sperm, and then fashioned you into a complete man?

2178.arabic: لـٰكِنّا۠ هُوَ اللَّهُ رَبّى وَلا أُشرِكُ بِرَبّى أَحَدًا
2178.en: As for myself, Allah alone is my Lord, and I associate none with my Lord in His Divinity.

2179.arabic: وَلَولا إِذ دَخَلتَ جَنَّتَكَ قُلتَ ما شاءَ اللَّهُ لا قُوَّةَ إِلّا بِاللَّهِ إِن تَرَنِ أَنا۠ أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مالًا وَوَلَدًا
2179.en: When you entered your vineyard, why did you not say: 'Whatever Allah wills shall come to pass, for there is no power save with Allah!' If you find me less than yourself in wealth and children

2180.arabic: فَعَسىٰ رَبّى أَن يُؤتِيَنِ خَيرًا مِن جَنَّتِكَ وَيُرسِلَ عَلَيها حُسبانًا مِنَ السَّماءِ فَتُصبِحَ صَعيدًا زَلَقًا
2180.en: it may well be that my Lord will give me something better than your vineyard, and send a calamity upon your vineyard from the heavens and it will be reduced to a barren waste,

2181.arabic: أَو يُصبِحَ ماؤُها غَورًا فَلَن تَستَطيعَ لَهُ طَلَبًا
2181.en: or the water of your vineyard will be drained deep into the ground so that you will not be able to seek it out."

2182.arabic: وَأُحيطَ بِثَمَرِهِ فَأَصبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيهِ عَلىٰ ما أَنفَقَ فيها وَهِىَ خاوِيَةٌ عَلىٰ عُروشِها وَيَقولُ يـٰلَيتَنى لَم أُشرِك بِرَبّى أَحَدًا
2182.en: Eventually all his produce was destroyed and he began to wring his hands in sorrow at the loss of what he had spent on it, and on seeing it fallen down upon its trellises, saying: "Would I had not associated anyone with my Lord in His Divinity."

2183.arabic: وَلَم تَكُن لَهُ فِئَةٌ يَنصُرونَهُ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَما كانَ مُنتَصِرًا
2183.en: And there was no host, beside Allah, to help him, nor could he be of any help to himself.

2184.arabic: هُنالِكَ الوَلـٰيَةُ لِلَّهِ الحَقِّ هُوَ خَيرٌ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ عُقبًا
2184.en: (Then he knew) that all power of protection rests with Allah, the True One. He is the best to reward, the best to determine the end of things.

2185.arabic: وَاضرِب لَهُم مَثَلَ الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا كَماءٍ أَنزَلنـٰهُ مِنَ السَّماءِ فَاختَلَطَ بِهِ نَباتُ الأَرضِ فَأَصبَحَ هَشيمًا تَذروهُ الرِّيـٰحُ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ مُقتَدِرًا
2185.en: (O Prophet), propound to them the parable of the present life: it is like the vegetation of the earth which flourished luxuriantly when it mingled with the water that We sent down from the sky, but after that the same vegetation turned into stubble which the winds blew about. Allah alone has the power over all things.

2186.arabic: المالُ وَالبَنونَ زينَةُ الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا وَالبـٰقِيـٰتُ الصّـٰلِحـٰتُ خَيرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ أَمَلًا
2186.en: Wealth and children are an adornment of the life of the world. But the deeds of lasting righteousness are the best in the sight of your Lord in reward, and far better a source of hope.

2187.arabic: وَيَومَ نُسَيِّرُ الجِبالَ وَتَرَى الأَرضَ بارِزَةً وَحَشَرنـٰهُم فَلَم نُغادِر مِنهُم أَحَدًا
2187.en: Bear in mind the Day when We shall set the mountains in motion and you will find the earth void and bare. On that Day We shall muster all men together, leaving none of them behind.

2188.arabic: وَعُرِضوا عَلىٰ رَبِّكَ صَفًّا لَقَد جِئتُمونا كَما خَلَقنـٰكُم أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ بَل زَعَمتُم أَلَّن نَجعَلَ لَكُم مَوعِدًا
2188.en: They shall be brought before your Lord, all lined up, and shall be told: "Now, indeed, you have come before Us in the manner We created you in the first instance, although you thought that We shall not appoint a tryst (with Us)."

2189.arabic: وَوُضِعَ الكِتـٰبُ فَتَرَى المُجرِمينَ مُشفِقينَ مِمّا فيهِ وَيَقولونَ يـٰوَيلَتَنا مالِ هـٰذَا الكِتـٰبِ لا يُغادِرُ صَغيرَةً وَلا كَبيرَةً إِلّا أَحصىٰها وَوَجَدوا ما عَمِلوا حاضِرًا وَلا يَظلِمُ رَبُّكَ أَحَدًا
2189.en: And then the Record of their deeds shall be placed before them and you will see the guilty full of fear for what it contains, and will say: "Woe to us! What a Record this is! It leaves nothing, big or small, but encompasses it." They will find their deeds confronting them. Your Lord wrongs no one.

2190.arabic: وَإِذ قُلنا لِلمَلـٰئِكَةِ اسجُدوا لِـٔادَمَ فَسَجَدوا إِلّا إِبليسَ كانَ مِنَ الجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَن أَمرِ رَبِّهِ أَفَتَتَّخِذونَهُ وَذُرِّيَّتَهُ أَولِياءَ مِن دونى وَهُم لَكُم عَدُوٌّ بِئسَ لِلظّـٰلِمينَ بَدَلًا
2190.en: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong#doers taking!

2191.arabic: ما أَشهَدتُهُم خَلقَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلا خَلقَ أَنفُسِهِم وَما كُنتُ مُتَّخِذَ المُضِلّينَ عَضُدًا
2191.en: I did not call them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor in their own creation. I do not seek the aid of those who lead people astray.

2192.arabic: وَيَومَ يَقولُ نادوا شُرَكاءِىَ الَّذينَ زَعَمتُم فَدَعَوهُم فَلَم يَستَجيبوا لَهُم وَجَعَلنا بَينَهُم مَوبِقًا
2192.en: What will such people do on the Day when the Lord will say: "Now call upon all those whom you believed to be My partners?" Thereupon they will call upon them, but they will not respond to their call; and We shall make them a common pit of doom,

2193.arabic: وَرَءَا المُجرِمونَ النّارَ فَظَنّوا أَنَّهُم مُواقِعوها وَلَم يَجِدوا عَنها مَصرِفًا
2193.en: and the guilty shall behold the Fire and know that they are bound to fall into it, and will find no escape from it.

2194.arabic: وَلَقَد صَرَّفنا فى هـٰذَا القُرءانِ لِلنّاسِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ وَكانَ الإِنسـٰنُ أَكثَرَ شَىءٍ جَدَلًا
2194.en: And surely We have explained matters to people in the Qur'an in diverse ways, using all manner of parables. But man is exceedingly contentious.

2195.arabic: وَما مَنَعَ النّاسَ أَن يُؤمِنوا إِذ جاءَهُمُ الهُدىٰ وَيَستَغفِروا رَبَّهُم إِلّا أَن تَأتِيَهُم سُنَّةُ الأَوَّلينَ أَو يَأتِيَهُمُ العَذابُ قُبُلًا
2195.en: What is it that prevented mankind from believing when the guidance came to them, and from asking forgiveness of their Lord, except that they would like to be treated as the nations of yore, or that they would like to see the scourge come upon them face to face?

2196.arabic: وَما نُرسِلُ المُرسَلينَ إِلّا مُبَشِّرينَ وَمُنذِرينَ وَيُجـٰدِلُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِالبـٰطِلِ لِيُدحِضوا بِهِ الحَقَّ وَاتَّخَذوا ءايـٰتى وَما أُنذِروا هُزُوًا
2196.en: We raise Messengers only to give good news and to warn. But the unbelievers resort to falsehood in order to rebut the truth with it, and scoff at My revelations and My warnings.

2197.arabic: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِـٔايـٰتِ رَبِّهِ فَأَعرَضَ عَنها وَنَسِىَ ما قَدَّمَت يَداهُ إِنّا جَعَلنا عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفقَهوهُ وَفى ءاذانِهِم وَقرًا وَإِن تَدعُهُم إِلَى الهُدىٰ فَلَن يَهتَدوا إِذًا أَبَدًا
2197.en: Who is more wicked than the man who, when he is reminded by the revelations of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets (the consequence of) the deeds wrought by his own hands? We have laid veils over their hearts lest they understand the message of the Qur'an, and We have caused heaviness in their ears. Call them as you may to the Right Path, they will not be ever guided aright.

2198.arabic: وَرَبُّكَ الغَفورُ ذُو الرَّحمَةِ لَو يُؤاخِذُهُم بِما كَسَبوا لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ العَذابَ بَل لَهُم مَوعِدٌ لَن يَجِدوا مِن دونِهِ مَوئِلًا
2198.en: Your Lord is All#Forgiving, full of mercy. Had He wished to take them to task for their doings, He would have hastened in sending His scourge upon them. But He has set for them a time#limit which they cannot evade.

2199.arabic: وَتِلكَ القُرىٰ أَهلَكنـٰهُم لَمّا ظَلَموا وَجَعَلنا لِمَهلِكِهِم مَوعِدًا
2199.en: All the townships afflicted with scourge are before your eyes. When they committed wrong, We destroyed them. For the destruction of each We had set a definite term.

2200.arabic: وَإِذ قالَ موسىٰ لِفَتىٰهُ لا أَبرَحُ حَتّىٰ أَبلُغَ مَجمَعَ البَحرَينِ أَو أَمضِىَ حُقُبًا
2200.en: (And recount to them the story of Moses) when Moses said to his servant: "I will journey on until I reach the point where the two rivers meet, though I may march on for ages."

2201.arabic: فَلَمّا بَلَغا مَجمَعَ بَينِهِما نَسِيا حوتَهُما فَاتَّخَذَ سَبيلَهُ فِى البَحرِ سَرَبًا
2201.en: But when they reached the point where the two rivers meet, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, as if through a tunnel.

2202.arabic: فَلَمّا جاوَزا قالَ لِفَتىٰهُ ءاتِنا غَداءَنا لَقَد لَقينا مِن سَفَرِنا هـٰذا نَصَبًا
2202.en: When they had journeyed further on, Moses said to his servant: "Bring us our repast. We are surely fatigued by today's journey."

2203.arabic: قالَ أَرَءَيتَ إِذ أَوَينا إِلَى الصَّخرَةِ فَإِنّى نَسيتُ الحوتَ وَما أَنسىٰنيهُ إِلَّا الشَّيطـٰنُ أَن أَذكُرَهُ وَاتَّخَذَ سَبيلَهُ فِى البَحرِ عَجَبًا
2203.en: The servant said: "Did you see what happened? When we betook ourselves to the rock to take rest, I forgot the fish # and it is only Satan who caused me to forget to mention it to you # so that it made its way into the sea in a strange manner."

2204.arabic: قالَ ذٰلِكَ ما كُنّا نَبغِ فَارتَدّا عَلىٰ ءاثارِهِما قَصَصًا
2204.en: Moses said: "That is what we were looking for." So the two turned back, retracing their footsteps,

2205.arabic: فَوَجَدا عَبدًا مِن عِبادِنا ءاتَينـٰهُ رَحمَةً مِن عِندِنا وَعَلَّمنـٰهُ مِن لَدُنّا عِلمًا
2205.en: and there they found one of Our servants upon whom We had bestowed Our mercy, and to whom We had imparted a special knowledge from Ourselves.

2206.arabic: قالَ لَهُ موسىٰ هَل أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلىٰ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمّا عُلِّمتَ رُشدًا
2206.en: Moses said to him: "May l follow you that you may teach me something of the wisdom which you have been taught?"

2207.arabic: قالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِىَ صَبرًا
2207.en: He answered: "You will surely not be able to bear with me.

2208.arabic: وَكَيفَ تَصبِرُ عَلىٰ ما لَم تُحِط بِهِ خُبرًا
2208.en: For how can you patiently bear with something you cannot encompass in your knowledge?"

2209.arabic: قالَ سَتَجِدُنى إِن شاءَ اللَّهُ صابِرًا وَلا أَعصى لَكَ أَمرًا
2209.en: Moses replied: "You shall find me, if Allah wills, patient; and I shall not disobey you in anything."

2210.arabic: قالَ فَإِنِ اتَّبَعتَنى فَلا تَسـَٔلنى عَن شَىءٍ حَتّىٰ أُحدِثَ لَكَ مِنهُ ذِكرًا
2210.en: He said: "Well, if you follow me, do not ask me concerning anything until I myself mention it to you."

2211.arabic: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا رَكِبا فِى السَّفينَةِ خَرَقَها قالَ أَخَرَقتَها لِتُغرِقَ أَهلَها لَقَد جِئتَ شَيـًٔا إِمرًا
2211.en: Then the two went forth until, when they embarked on the boat, he made a hole in it, whereupon Moses exclaimed: "Have you made a hole in it so as to drown the people in the boat? You have certainly done an awful thing."

2212.arabic: قالَ أَلَم أَقُل إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِىَ صَبرًا
2212.en: He replied: "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to patiently bear with me?"

2213.arabic: قالَ لا تُؤاخِذنى بِما نَسيتُ وَلا تُرهِقنى مِن أَمرى عُسرًا
2213.en: Moses said: "Do not take me to task at my forgetfulness, and do not be hard on me."

2214.arabic: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا لَقِيا غُلـٰمًا فَقَتَلَهُ قالَ أَقَتَلتَ نَفسًا زَكِيَّةً بِغَيرِ نَفسٍ لَقَد جِئتَ شَيـًٔا نُكرًا
2214.en: Then the two went forth until they met a lad whom he slew, whereupon Moses exclaimed: "What! Have you slain an innocent person without his having slain anyone? Surely you have done a horrible thing."

2215.arabic: قالَ أَلَم أَقُل لَكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِىَ صَبرًا
2215.en: He said: "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to patiently bear with me?"

2216.arabic: قالَ إِن سَأَلتُكَ عَن شَىءٍ بَعدَها فَلا تُصـٰحِبنى قَد بَلَغتَ مِن لَدُنّى عُذرًا
2216.en: Moses said: "Keep me no more in your company if I question you concerning anything after this. You will then be fully justified."

2217.arabic: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا أَتَيا أَهلَ قَريَةٍ استَطعَما أَهلَها فَأَبَوا أَن يُضَيِّفوهُما فَوَجَدا فيها جِدارًا يُريدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقامَهُ قالَ لَو شِئتَ لَتَّخَذتَ عَلَيهِ أَجرًا
2217.en: Then the two went forth until when they came to a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to play host to them. They found in that town a wall that was on the verge of tumbling down, and he buttressed it, whereupon Moses said: "If you had wished, you could have received payment for it."

2218.arabic: قالَ هـٰذا فِراقُ بَينى وَبَينِكَ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأويلِ ما لَم تَستَطِع عَلَيهِ صَبرًا
2218.en: He said: "This brings me and you to a parting of ways. Now I shall explain to you the true meaning of things about which you could not remain patient.

2219.arabic: أَمَّا السَّفينَةُ فَكانَت لِمَسـٰكينَ يَعمَلونَ فِى البَحرِ فَأَرَدتُ أَن أَعيبَها وَكانَ وَراءَهُم مَلِكٌ يَأخُذُ كُلَّ سَفينَةٍ غَصبًا
2219.en: As for the boat it belonged to some poor people who worked on the river, and I desired to damage it for beyond them lay the dominion of a king who was wont to seize every boat by force.

2220.arabic: وَأَمَّا الغُلـٰمُ فَكانَ أَبَواهُ مُؤمِنَينِ فَخَشينا أَن يُرهِقَهُما طُغيـٰنًا وَكُفرًا
2220.en: As for the lad, his parents were people of faith, and we feared lest he should plague them with transgression and disbelief,

2221.arabic: فَأَرَدنا أَن يُبدِلَهُما رَبُّهُما خَيرًا مِنهُ زَكوٰةً وَأَقرَبَ رُحمًا
2221.en: and we desired that their Lord should grant them another in his place, a son more upright and more tender hearted.

2222.arabic: وَأَمَّا الجِدارُ فَكانَ لِغُلـٰمَينِ يَتيمَينِ فِى المَدينَةِ وَكانَ تَحتَهُ كَنزٌ لَهُما وَكانَ أَبوهُما صـٰلِحًا فَأَرادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبلُغا أَشُدَّهُما وَيَستَخرِجا كَنزَهُما رَحمَةً مِن رَبِّكَ وَما فَعَلتُهُ عَن أَمرى ذٰلِكَ تَأويلُ ما لَم تَسطِع عَلَيهِ صَبرًا
2222.en: As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and under it there was a treasure that belonged to them. Their father was a righteous man and your Lord intended that they should come of age and then bring forth their treasure as a mercy from your Lord; I did not do this of my own bidding. This is the true meaning of things with which you could not keep your patience."

2223.arabic: وَيَسـَٔلونَكَ عَن ذِى القَرنَينِ قُل سَأَتلوا عَلَيكُم مِنهُ ذِكرًا
2223.en: (O Muhammad), they ask you about Dhu al#Qarnayn. Say: "I will give you an account of him."

2224.arabic: إِنّا مَكَّنّا لَهُ فِى الأَرضِ وَءاتَينـٰهُ مِن كُلِّ شَىءٍ سَبَبًا
2224.en: We granted him power in the land and endowed him with all kinds of resources.

2225.en: He set out (westwards) on an expedition,

2226.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ مَغرِبَ الشَّمسِ وَجَدَها تَغرُبُ فى عَينٍ حَمِئَةٍ وَوَجَدَ عِندَها قَومًا قُلنا يـٰذَا القَرنَينِ إِمّا أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمّا أَن تَتَّخِذَ فيهِم حُسنًا
2226.en: until when he reached the very limits where the sun sets, he saw it setting in dark turbid waters; and nearby he met a people. We said: "O Dhu al#Qarnayn, you have the power to punish or to treat them with kindness."

2227.arabic: قالَ أَمّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوفَ نُعَذِّبُهُ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ فَيُعَذِّبُهُ عَذابًا نُكرًا
2227.en: He said: "We will chastise him who does wrong, whereafter he will be returned to his Lord and He will chastise him grievously.

2228.arabic: وَأَمّا مَن ءامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صـٰلِحًا فَلَهُ جَزاءً الحُسنىٰ وَسَنَقولُ لَهُ مِن أَمرِنا يُسرًا
2228.en: But as for him who believes and acts righteously, his will be a goodly reward and we shall enjoin upon him only mild commands."

2229.en: Then he set out on another expedition

2230.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ مَطلِعَ الشَّمسِ وَجَدَها تَطلُعُ عَلىٰ قَومٍ لَم نَجعَل لَهُم مِن دونِها سِترًا
2230.en: until he reached the limit where the sun rises and he found it rising on a people whom We had provided no shelter from it.

2231.arabic: كَذٰلِكَ وَقَد أَحَطنا بِما لَدَيهِ خُبرًا
2231.en: Thus was the state of those people, and We encompassed in knowledge all concerning Dhu al# Qarnayn.

2232.en: Then he set out on another expedition

2233.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ بَينَ السَّدَّينِ وَجَدَ مِن دونِهِما قَومًا لا يَكادونَ يَفقَهونَ قَولًا
2233.en: until when he reached a place between the two mountains, he found beside the mountains a people who scarcely understood anything.

2234.arabic: قالوا يـٰذَا القَرنَينِ إِنَّ يَأجوجَ وَمَأجوجَ مُفسِدونَ فِى الأَرضِ فَهَل نَجعَلُ لَكَ خَرجًا عَلىٰ أَن تَجعَلَ بَينَنا وَبَينَهُم سَدًّا
2234.en: They said: "O Dhu al#Qarnayn, Gog and Magog are spreading corruption in this land. So shall we pay you taxes on the understanding that you will set up a barrier between us and them?"

2235.arabic: قالَ ما مَكَّنّى فيهِ رَبّى خَيرٌ فَأَعينونى بِقُوَّةٍ أَجعَل بَينَكُم وَبَينَهُم رَدمًا
2235.en: He answered: "Whatever my Lord has granted me is good enough. But help me with your labour and I will erect a rampart between you and them.

2236.arabic: ءاتونى زُبَرَ الحَديدِ حَتّىٰ إِذا ساوىٰ بَينَ الصَّدَفَينِ قالَ انفُخوا حَتّىٰ إِذا جَعَلَهُ نارًا قالَ ءاتونى أُفرِغ عَلَيهِ قِطرًا
2236.en: Bring me ingots of iron." Then after he had filled up the space between the two mountain#sides, he said: "(Light a fire) and ply bellows." When he had made it (red like) fire, he said: "Bring me molten copper which I may pour on it."

2237.arabic: فَمَا اسطـٰعوا أَن يَظهَروهُ وَمَا استَطـٰعوا لَهُ نَقبًا
2237.en: Such was the rampart that Gog and Magog could not scale, nor could they pierce it.

2238.arabic: قالَ هـٰذا رَحمَةٌ مِن رَبّى فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ رَبّى جَعَلَهُ دَكّاءَ وَكانَ وَعدُ رَبّى حَقًّا
2238.en: Dhu al#Qarnayn said: "This is a mercy from my Lord: but when the time of my Lord's promise shall come, He will level the rampart with the ground. My Lord's promise always comes true."

2239.arabic: وَتَرَكنا بَعضَهُم يَومَئِذٍ يَموجُ فى بَعضٍ وَنُفِخَ فِى الصّورِ فَجَمَعنـٰهُم جَمعًا
2239.en: And on that Day We shall let some of them surge like waves against others, and the Trumpet shall be blown. Then We shall gather them all together.

2240.en: That will be the Day We shall place Hell before the unbelievers

2241.arabic: الَّذينَ كانَت أَعيُنُهُم فى غِطاءٍ عَن ذِكرى وَكانوا لا يَستَطيعونَ سَمعًا
2241.en: whose eyes had become blind against My admonition and who were utterly disinclined to hear it.

2242.arabic: أَفَحَسِبَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَن يَتَّخِذوا عِبادى مِن دونى أَولِياءَ إِنّا أَعتَدنا جَهَنَّمَ لِلكـٰفِرينَ نُزُلًا
2242.en: Do the unbelievers, then, believe that they can take any of My creatures as their guardians beside Me? Verily We have prepared Hell to welcome the unbelievers.

2243.en: Say, (O Muhammad): "Shall We tell you who will be the greatest losers in respect of their works?

2244.arabic: الَّذينَ ضَلَّ سَعيُهُم فِى الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا وَهُم يَحسَبونَ أَنَّهُم يُحسِنونَ صُنعًا
2244.en: It will be those whose effort went astray in the life of the world and who believe nevertheless that they are doing good.

2245.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِـٔايـٰتِ رَبِّهِم وَلِقائِهِ فَحَبِطَت أَعمـٰلُهُم فَلا نُقيمُ لَهُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ وَزنًا
2245.en: Those are the ones who refused to believe in the revelations of their Lord and that they are bound to meet Him. Hence, all their deeds have come to naught, and We shall assign no weight to them on the Day of Resurrection.

2246.arabic: ذٰلِكَ جَزاؤُهُم جَهَنَّمُ بِما كَفَروا وَاتَّخَذوا ءايـٰتى وَرُسُلى هُزُوًا
2246.en: Hell is their recompense for disbelieving and their taking My revelations and My Messengers as objects of jest.

2247.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ كانَت لَهُم جَنّـٰتُ الفِردَوسِ نُزُلًا
2247.en: As for those who believe and do good works, the Gardens of Paradise shall be there to welcome them;

2248.arabic: خـٰلِدينَ فيها لا يَبغونَ عَنها حِوَلًا
2248.en: there they will abide for ever, with no desire to be removed from there."

2249.arabic: قُل لَو كانَ البَحرُ مِدادًا لِكَلِمـٰتِ رَبّى لَنَفِدَ البَحرُ قَبلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِمـٰتُ رَبّى وَلَو جِئنا بِمِثلِهِ مَدَدًا
2249.en: Say: "If the sea were to become ink to record the Words of my Lord, indeed the sea would be all used up before the Words of my Lord are exhausted, and it would be the same even if We were to bring an equal amount of ink."

2250.arabic: قُل إِنَّما أَنا۠ بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم يوحىٰ إِلَىَّ أَنَّما إِلـٰهُكُم إِلـٰهٌ وٰحِدٌ فَمَن كانَ يَرجوا لِقاءَ رَبِّهِ فَليَعمَل عَمَلًا صـٰلِحًا وَلا يُشرِك بِعِبادَةِ رَبِّهِ أَحَدًا
2250.en: Say (O Muhammad): "I am no more than a human being like you; one to whom revelation is made: 'Your Lord is the One and Only God.' Hence, whoever looks forward to meet his Lord, let him do righteous works, and let him associate none with the worship of his Lord."

2252.en: This is an account of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

2253.en: when he cried to his Lord in secret.

2254.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّى وَهَنَ العَظمُ مِنّى وَاشتَعَلَ الرَّأسُ شَيبًا وَلَم أَكُن بِدُعائِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيًّا
2254.en: He said: "Lord! My bones have grown feeble and my head is glistening with age; yet, never have my prayers to You, my Lord, been unfruitful.

2255.arabic: وَإِنّى خِفتُ المَوٰلِىَ مِن وَراءى وَكانَتِ امرَأَتى عاقِرًا فَهَب لى مِن لَدُنكَ وَلِيًّا
2255.en: I fear evil from my kinsmen after I am gone; and my wife is barren, so grant me an heir out of Your special grace,

2256.arabic: يَرِثُنى وَيَرِثُ مِن ءالِ يَعقوبَ وَاجعَلهُ رَبِّ رَضِيًّا
2256.en: one that might be my heir and the heir of the house of Jacob; and make him, Lord, one that will be pleasing to You.

2257.arabic: يـٰزَكَرِيّا إِنّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلـٰمٍ اسمُهُ يَحيىٰ لَم نَجعَل لَهُ مِن قَبلُ سَمِيًّا
2257.en: (He was told): "Zechariah, We bring you the good news of the birth of a son whose name shall be Yahya (John), one whose namesake We never created before."

2258.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ أَنّىٰ يَكونُ لى غُلـٰمٌ وَكانَتِ امرَأَتى عاقِرًا وَقَد بَلَغتُ مِنَ الكِبَرِ عِتِيًّا
2258.en: He said: "My Lord! How can I have a boy when my wife is barren and I have reached an extremely old age?"

2259.arabic: قالَ كَذٰلِكَ قالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌ وَقَد خَلَقتُكَ مِن قَبلُ وَلَم تَكُ شَيـًٔا
2259.en: He answered: "So shall it be." Your Lord says: "It is easy for Me," and then added: "For beyond doubt, I created you earlier when you were nothing."

2260.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ اجعَل لى ءايَةً قالَ ءايَتُكَ أَلّا تُكَلِّمَ النّاسَ ثَلـٰثَ لَيالٍ سَوِيًّا
2260.en: Zechariah said: "Lord, grant me a Sign." Said He: "Your Sign is that you shall not be able to speak to people for three nights, though you will be otherwise sound."

2261.arabic: فَخَرَجَ عَلىٰ قَومِهِ مِنَ المِحرابِ فَأَوحىٰ إِلَيهِم أَن سَبِّحوا بُكرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
2261.en: Thereupon Zechariah came out from the sanctuary and directed his people by gestures to extol His glory by day and by night.

2262.arabic: يـٰيَحيىٰ خُذِ الكِتـٰبَ بِقُوَّةٍ وَءاتَينـٰهُ الحُكمَ صَبِيًّا
2262.en: "O John! Hold the Book with all your strength." We had bestowed wisdom upon him while he was still a child;

2263.arabic: وَحَنانًا مِن لَدُنّا وَزَكوٰةً وَكانَ تَقِيًّا
2263.en: and We also endowed him with tenderness and purity, and he was exceedingly pious

2264.arabic: وَبَرًّا بِوٰلِدَيهِ وَلَم يَكُن جَبّارًا عَصِيًّا
2264.en: and cherishing to his parents. Never was he insolent or rebellious.

2265.arabic: وَسَلـٰمٌ عَلَيهِ يَومَ وُلِدَ وَيَومَ يَموتُ وَيَومَ يُبعَثُ حَيًّا
2265.en: Peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day he will die, and the day he will be raised up alive.

2266.arabic: وَاذكُر فِى الكِتـٰبِ مَريَمَ إِذِ انتَبَذَت مِن أَهلِها مَكانًا شَرقِيًّا
2266.en: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Mary, when she withdrew from her people to a place towards the east;

2267.arabic: فَاتَّخَذَت مِن دونِهِم حِجابًا فَأَرسَلنا إِلَيها روحَنا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَها بَشَرًا سَوِيًّا
2267.en: and drew a curtain, screening herself from people whereupon We sent to her Our spirit and he appeared to her as a well#shaped man.

2268.arabic: قالَت إِنّى أَعوذُ بِالرَّحمـٰنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيًّا
2268.en: Mary exclaimed: "I surely take refuge from you with the Most Compassionate Lord, if you are at all God#fearing."

2269.arabic: قالَ إِنَّما أَنا۠ رَسولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلـٰمًا زَكِيًّا
2269.en: He said: "I am just a message#bearer of your Lord, I have come to grant you a most pure boy."

2270.arabic: قالَت أَنّىٰ يَكونُ لى غُلـٰمٌ وَلَم يَمسَسنى بَشَرٌ وَلَم أَكُ بَغِيًّا
2270.en: Mary said: "How can a boy be born to me when no man has even touched me, nor have I ever been unchaste?"

2271.arabic: قالَ كَذٰلِكِ قالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌ وَلِنَجعَلَهُ ءايَةً لِلنّاسِ وَرَحمَةً مِنّا وَكانَ أَمرًا مَقضِيًّا
2271.en: The angel said: "Thus shall it be. Your Lord says: 'It is easy for Me; and We shall do so in order to make him a Sign for mankind and a mercy from Us. This has been decreed.' "

2272.en: Then she conceived him and withdrew with him to a far#off place.

2273.arabic: فَأَجاءَهَا المَخاضُ إِلىٰ جِذعِ النَّخلَةِ قالَت يـٰلَيتَنى مِتُّ قَبلَ هـٰذا وَكُنتُ نَسيًا مَنسِيًّا
2273.en: Then the birth pangs drove her to the trunk of a palm#tree and she said: "Oh, would that I had died before this and had been all forgotten."

2274.arabic: فَنادىٰها مِن تَحتِها أَلّا تَحزَنى قَد جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحتَكِ سَرِيًّا
2274.en: Thereupon the angel below her cried out: "Grieve not, for your Lord has caused a stream of water to flow beneath you.

2275.arabic: وَهُزّى إِلَيكِ بِجِذعِ النَّخلَةِ تُسـٰقِط عَلَيكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا
2275.en: Shake the trunk of the palm#tree towards yourself and fresh and ripe dates shall fall upon you.

2276.arabic: فَكُلى وَاشرَبى وَقَرّى عَينًا فَإِمّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ البَشَرِ أَحَدًا فَقولى إِنّى نَذَرتُ لِلرَّحمـٰنِ صَومًا فَلَن أُكَلِّمَ اليَومَ إِنسِيًّا
2276.en: So eat and drink and cool your eyes; and if you see any person say to him: 'Verily I have vowed a fast to the Most Compassionate Lord, and so I shall not speak to anyone today.' "

2277.arabic: فَأَتَت بِهِ قَومَها تَحمِلُهُ قالوا يـٰمَريَمُ لَقَد جِئتِ شَيـًٔا فَرِيًّا
2277.en: Then she came to her people, carrying her baby. They said: "O Mary! You have committed a monstrous thing.

2278.arabic: يـٰأُختَ هـٰرونَ ما كانَ أَبوكِ امرَأَ سَوءٍ وَما كانَت أُمُّكِ بَغِيًّا
2278.en: O sister of Aaron! Your father was not an evil man, nor was your mother an unchaste woman."

2279.arabic: فَأَشارَت إِلَيهِ قالوا كَيفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كانَ فِى المَهدِ صَبِيًّا
2279.en: Thereupon Mary pointed to the child. They exclaimed: "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle, a mere child?"

2280.arabic: قالَ إِنّى عَبدُ اللَّهِ ءاتىٰنِىَ الكِتـٰبَ وَجَعَلَنى نَبِيًّا
2280.en: The child cried out: "Verily I am Allah's servant. He has granted me the Book and has made me a Prophet

2281.arabic: وَجَعَلَنى مُبارَكًا أَينَ ما كُنتُ وَأَوصـٰنى بِالصَّلوٰةِ وَالزَّكوٰةِ ما دُمتُ حَيًّا
2281.en: and has blessed me wherever I might be and has enjoined upon me Prayer and Zakah (purifying alms) as long as I live;

2282.arabic: وَبَرًّا بِوٰلِدَتى وَلَم يَجعَلنى جَبّارًا شَقِيًّا
2282.en: and has made me dutiful to my mother. He has not made me oppressive, nor bereft of God's blessings.

2283.arabic: وَالسَّلـٰمُ عَلَىَّ يَومَ وُلِدتُ وَيَومَ أَموتُ وَيَومَ أُبعَثُ حَيًّا
2283.en: Peace be upon me the day I was born and the day I will die, and the day I will be raised up alive."

2284.arabic: ذٰلِكَ عيسَى ابنُ مَريَمَ قَولَ الحَقِّ الَّذى فيهِ يَمتَرونَ
2284.en: This is Jesus, the son of Mary; and this is the truth about him concerning which they are in doubt.

2285.arabic: ما كانَ لِلَّهِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ مِن وَلَدٍ سُبحـٰنَهُ إِذا قَضىٰ أَمرًا فَإِنَّما يَقولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
2285.en: It does not befit Allah to take for Himself a son. Glory be to Him! When He decrees a thing He only says: "Be" and it is.

2286.arabic: وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ رَبّى وَرَبُّكُم فَاعبُدوهُ هـٰذا صِرٰطٌ مُستَقيمٌ
2286.en: (Jesus had said): "Indeed Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so serve Him alone. This is the Straight Way."

2287.arabic: فَاختَلَفَ الأَحزابُ مِن بَينِهِم فَوَيلٌ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن مَشهَدِ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
2287.en: But different parties began to dispute with one another. A dreadful woe awaits on that great Day for those that reject the Truth.

2288.arabic: أَسمِع بِهِم وَأَبصِر يَومَ يَأتونَنا لـٰكِنِ الظّـٰلِمونَ اليَومَ فى ضَلـٰلٍ مُبينٍ
2288.en: How well shall they hear and how well shall they see on the Day they come to Us! But today the evil#doers are in manifest error.

2289.arabic: وَأَنذِرهُم يَومَ الحَسرَةِ إِذ قُضِىَ الأَمرُ وَهُم فى غَفلَةٍ وَهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
2289.en: (O Muhammad), warn those who are steeped in heedlessness and are obstinately rejecting the truth that the Day shall come when things will be finally decided and they shall be left with utter remorse.

2290.arabic: إِنّا نَحنُ نَرِثُ الأَرضَ وَمَن عَلَيها وَإِلَينا يُرجَعونَ
2290.en: Ultimately, We shall inherit the earth and whatever is on it; to Us shall they be returned.

2291.arabic: وَاذكُر فِى الكِتـٰبِ إِبرٰهيمَ إِنَّهُ كانَ صِدّيقًا نَبِيًّا
2291.en: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Abraham. Most surely he was a man of truth, a Prophet.

2292.arabic: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ يـٰأَبَتِ لِمَ تَعبُدُ ما لا يَسمَعُ وَلا يُبصِرُ وَلا يُغنى عَنكَ شَيـًٔا
2292.en: (And remind people) when he said to his father: "Father! Why do you worship that which neither sees nor hears, and which can be of no avail to you?

2293.arabic: يـٰأَبَتِ إِنّى قَد جاءَنى مِنَ العِلمِ ما لَم يَأتِكَ فَاتَّبِعنى أَهدِكَ صِرٰطًا سَوِيًّا
2293.en: Father, a knowledge that has not reached you has come to me. So follow me that I may guide you to a Straight Way.

2294.arabic: يـٰأَبَتِ لا تَعبُدِ الشَّيطـٰنَ إِنَّ الشَّيطـٰنَ كانَ لِلرَّحمـٰنِ عَصِيًّا
2294.en: Father, do not serve Satan, for Satan has indeed been a persistent rebel against the Most Compassionate Lord.

2295.arabic: يـٰأَبَتِ إِنّى أَخافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذابٌ مِنَ الرَّحمـٰنِ فَتَكونَ لِلشَّيطـٰنِ وَلِيًّا
2295.en: Father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Compassionate Lord might strike you and you may end up as one of Satan's companions?"

2296.arabic: قالَ أَراغِبٌ أَنتَ عَن ءالِهَتى يـٰإِبرٰهيمُ لَئِن لَم تَنتَهِ لَأَرجُمَنَّكَ وَاهجُرنى مَلِيًّا
2296.en: The father said: "Abraham, have you turned away from my gods? If you do not give this up, I shall stone you to death. Now begone from me forever."

2297.arabic: قالَ سَلـٰمٌ عَلَيكَ سَأَستَغفِرُ لَكَ رَبّى إِنَّهُ كانَ بى حَفِيًّا
2297.en: Abraham answered: "Peace be upon you. I shall seek pardon for you from my Lord. My Lord has always been kind to Me.

2298.arabic: وَأَعتَزِلُكُم وَما تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَأَدعوا رَبّى عَسىٰ أَلّا أَكونَ بِدُعاءِ رَبّى شَقِيًّا
2298.en: I shall withdraw from you and all that you call upon beside Allah. I shall only call upon my Lord. I trust the prayer to my Lord will not go unanswered."

2299.arabic: فَلَمَّا اعتَزَلَهُم وَما يَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَهَبنا لَهُ إِسحـٰقَ وَيَعقوبَ وَكُلًّا جَعَلنا نَبِيًّا
2299.en: Thereupon Abraham dissociated himself from his people and the deities they worshipped instead of Allah, and We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob and made each of them a Prophet;

2300.arabic: وَوَهَبنا لَهُم مِن رَحمَتِنا وَجَعَلنا لَهُم لِسانَ صِدقٍ عَلِيًّا
2300.en: and We bestowed on them Our mercy, and granted them a truly lofty renown.

2301.arabic: وَاذكُر فِى الكِتـٰبِ موسىٰ إِنَّهُ كانَ مُخلَصًا وَكانَ رَسولًا نَبِيًّا
2301.en: And recite in the Book the account of Moses. He was a chosen one, a Messenger, a Prophet.

2302.arabic: وَنـٰدَينـٰهُ مِن جانِبِ الطّورِ الأَيمَنِ وَقَرَّبنـٰهُ نَجِيًّا
2302.en: We called out to him from the right side of the Mount, and We drew him near to Us by communing to him in secret,

2303.arabic: وَوَهَبنا لَهُ مِن رَحمَتِنا أَخاهُ هـٰرونَ نَبِيًّا
2303.en: and out of Our mercy We appointed his brother Aaron, a Prophet (that he may assist him).

2304.arabic: وَاذكُر فِى الكِتـٰبِ إِسمـٰعيلَ إِنَّهُ كانَ صادِقَ الوَعدِ وَكانَ رَسولًا نَبِيًّا
2304.en: And recite in the Book the account of Ishmael. He was ever true to his promise, and was a Messenger, a Prophet.

2305.arabic: وَكانَ يَأمُرُ أَهلَهُ بِالصَّلوٰةِ وَالزَّكوٰةِ وَكانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِ مَرضِيًّا
2305.en: He enjoined his household to observe Prayer and to give Zakah (purifying alms); and his Lord was well pleased with him.

2306.arabic: وَاذكُر فِى الكِتـٰبِ إِدريسَ إِنَّهُ كانَ صِدّيقًا نَبِيًّا
2306.en: And recite in the Book the account of Idris. He was a man of truth, a Prophet;

2307.en: and We exalted him to a lofty position.

2308.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ أَنعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم مِنَ النَّبِيّـۧنَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ ءادَمَ وَمِمَّن حَمَلنا مَعَ نوحٍ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبرٰهيمَ وَإِسرٰءيلَ وَمِمَّن هَدَينا وَاجتَبَينا إِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم ءايـٰتُ الرَّحمـٰنِ خَرّوا سُجَّدًا وَبُكِيًّا
2308.en: These are the Prophets upon whom Allah bestowed His favour from the seed of Adam, and from the seed of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and from the seed of Abraham and Israel. They were those whom We guided and chose (for an exalted position). They were such that when the words of the Most Compassionate Lord were recited to them, they fell down in prostration, weeping.

2309.arabic: فَخَلَفَ مِن بَعدِهِم خَلفٌ أَضاعُوا الصَّلوٰةَ وَاتَّبَعُوا الشَّهَوٰتِ فَسَوفَ يَلقَونَ غَيًّا
2309.en: They were succeeded by a people who neglected the Prayers and pursued their lusts. They shall presently meet with their doom,

2310.arabic: إِلّا مَن تابَ وَءامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صـٰلِحًا فَأُولـٰئِكَ يَدخُلونَ الجَنَّةَ وَلا يُظلَمونَ شَيـًٔا
2310.en: except those who repent and believe and act righteously. Such shall enter Paradise and shall not be wronged at all.

2311.arabic: جَنّـٰتِ عَدنٍ الَّتى وَعَدَ الرَّحمـٰنُ عِبادَهُ بِالغَيبِ إِنَّهُ كانَ وَعدُهُ مَأتِيًّا
2311.en: Theirs shall be everlasting Gardens which the Most Compassionate Lord has promised His servants in a realm which is beyond the ken of perception. Surely His promise shall he fulfilled.

2312.arabic: لا يَسمَعونَ فيها لَغوًا إِلّا سَلـٰمًا وَلَهُم رِزقُهُم فيها بُكرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
2312.en: They shall not hear in it anything vain; they shall hear only what is good; and they shall have their provision in it, morning and evening.

2313.arabic: تِلكَ الجَنَّةُ الَّتى نورِثُ مِن عِبادِنا مَن كانَ تَقِيًّا
2313.en: Such is the Paradise which We shall cause those of Our servants who have been God#fearing to inherit.

2314.arabic: وَما نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلّا بِأَمرِ رَبِّكَ لَهُ ما بَينَ أَيدينا وَما خَلفَنا وَما بَينَ ذٰلِكَ وَما كانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّا
2314.en: (The angels will say): "(O Muhammad!) We descend not except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us and all that is behind us, and all that is in between. Your Lord is not forgetful in the least.

2315.arabic: رَبُّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما فَاعبُدهُ وَاصطَبِر لِعِبـٰدَتِهِ هَل تَعلَمُ لَهُ سَمِيًّا
2315.en: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between. Serve Him, then, and be constant in serving Him. Do you know anyone that might be His compeer?"

2316.arabic: وَيَقولُ الإِنسـٰنُ أَءِذا ما مِتُّ لَسَوفَ أُخرَجُ حَيًّا
2316.en: Man is prone to say: "Shall I be raised to life after I die?"

2317.arabic: أَوَلا يَذكُرُ الإِنسـٰنُ أَنّا خَلَقنـٰهُ مِن قَبلُ وَلَم يَكُ شَيـًٔا
2317.en: Does man not remember that We created him before when he was nothing?

2318.arabic: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحشُرَنَّهُم وَالشَّيـٰطينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحضِرَنَّهُم حَولَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيًّا
2318.en: By your Lord, We will surely muster them and the devils together. Then We will surely bring them all, on their knees, around Hell,

2319.arabic: ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شيعَةٍ أَيُّهُم أَشَدُّ عَلَى الرَّحمـٰنِ عِتِيًّا
2319.en: and then We will draw aside from each party those who were most rebellious against the Most Compassionate Lord,

2320.arabic: ثُمَّ لَنَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِالَّذينَ هُم أَولىٰ بِها صِلِيًّا
2320.en: and then We shall know well all those most worthy to be cast in Hell.

2321.arabic: وَإِن مِنكُم إِلّا وارِدُها كانَ عَلىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتمًا مَقضِيًّا
2321.en: There is not one of you but shall pass by Hell. This is a decree which your Lord will fulfil.

2322.arabic: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّى الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا وَنَذَرُ الظّـٰلِمينَ فيها جِثِيًّا
2322.en: Then We shall deliver those that feared Allah and leave the wrong#doers there on their knees.

2323.arabic: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم ءايـٰتُنا بَيِّنـٰتٍ قالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِلَّذينَ ءامَنوا أَىُّ الفَريقَينِ خَيرٌ مَقامًا وَأَحسَنُ نَدِيًّا
2323.en: When Our clear revelations are recited to those who deny the Truth they are wont to say to those who have faith: "Which of the two groups has a better status and whose assemblies are grander?"

2324.arabic: وَكَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِن قَرنٍ هُم أَحسَنُ أَثـٰثًا وَرِءيًا
2324.en: How numerous are the peoples We destroyed before them # those that were more resourceful and grander in outward appearance!

2325.arabic: قُل مَن كانَ فِى الضَّلـٰلَةِ فَليَمدُد لَهُ الرَّحمـٰنُ مَدًّا حَتّىٰ إِذا رَأَوا ما يوعَدونَ إِمَّا العَذابَ وَإِمَّا السّاعَةَ فَسَيَعلَمونَ مَن هُوَ شَرٌّ مَكانًا وَأَضعَفُ جُندًا
2325.en: Say: "The Most Compassionate Lord grants respite to those who stray into error, until they behold what they had been threatened with, either God's chastisement (in the world) or the Hour (of Resurrection)" # then they fully know whose station is worse, and who is weaker in hosts!

2326.arabic: وَيَزيدُ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ اهتَدَوا هُدًى وَالبـٰقِيـٰتُ الصّـٰلِحـٰتُ خَيرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ مَرَدًّا
2326.en: (On the contrary), Allah increases in guidance those who follow the Right Way. Lasting acts of righteousness are better in the sight of your Lord as reward and conducive to a better end.

2327.arabic: أَفَرَءَيتَ الَّذى كَفَرَ بِـٔايـٰتِنا وَقالَ لَأوتَيَنَّ مالًا وَوَلَدًا
2327.en: Have you seen him who rejected Our signs and said: "Surely I shall continue to be favoured with riches and children."

2328.arabic: أَطَّلَعَ الغَيبَ أَمِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحمـٰنِ عَهدًا
2328.en: Has he obtained knowledge of the Unseen, or has he taken a covenant with the Most Compassionate Lord?

2329.arabic: كَلّا سَنَكتُبُ ما يَقولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُ مِنَ العَذابِ مَدًّا
2329.en: By no means! We shall write down all what he says; and We shall greatly prolong his chastisement,

2330.en: and We shall inherit all the resources and hosts of which he boasts, and he will come to Us all alone.

2331.arabic: وَاتَّخَذوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ءالِهَةً لِيَكونوا لَهُم عِزًّا
2331.en: They have taken other gods instead of Allah that they may be a source of strength for them.

2332.arabic: كَلّا سَيَكفُرونَ بِعِبادَتِهِم وَيَكونونَ عَلَيهِم ضِدًّا
2332.en: By no means! They shall soon deny their worship and shall become their adversaries instead.

2333.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ أَنّا أَرسَلنَا الشَّيـٰطينَ عَلَى الكـٰفِرينَ تَؤُزُّهُم أَزًّا
2333.en: Do you not see that We have sent devils upon the unbelievers who greatly incite them (to oppose the Truth)?

2334.arabic: فَلا تَعجَل عَلَيهِم إِنَّما نَعُدُّ لَهُم عَدًّا
2334.en: Therefore, do not hasten (in seeking a scourge against them). We are counting their days.

2335.arabic: يَومَ نَحشُرُ المُتَّقينَ إِلَى الرَّحمـٰنِ وَفدًا
2335.en: The Day shall soon come when We shall bring together the God#fearing to the Most Compassionate Lord, as honoured guests;

2336.en: and We shall drive the guilty ones to Hell as a thirsty herd.

2337.arabic: لا يَملِكونَ الشَّفـٰعَةَ إِلّا مَنِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحمـٰنِ عَهدًا
2337.en: On that Day none will have the power to intercede for them except those who received a sanction from the Most Compassionate Lord.

2338.en: They claim: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken a son to Himself."

2339.en: Surely you have made a monstrous statement.

2340.arabic: تَكادُ السَّمـٰوٰتُ يَتَفَطَّرنَ مِنهُ وَتَنشَقُّ الأَرضُ وَتَخِرُّ الجِبالُ هَدًّا
2340.en: It is such a monstrosity that heavens might well#nigh burst forth at it, the earth might be cleaved, and the mountains fall

2341.en: at their ascribing a son to the Most Compassionate Lord.

2342.arabic: وَما يَنبَغى لِلرَّحمـٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا
2342.en: It does not befit the Most Compassionate Lord that He should take a son.

2343.arabic: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ إِلّا ءاتِى الرَّحمـٰنِ عَبدًا
2343.en: There is no one in the heavens and the earth but he shall come to the Most Compassionate Lord as His servant.

2344.en: Verily He encompasses them and has counted them all.

2345.en: On the Day of Resurrection each one of these will come to Him singly.

2346.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ سَيَجعَلُ لَهُمُ الرَّحمـٰنُ وُدًّا
2346.en: Indeed, the Most Compassionate Lord will soon create enduring love for those who believe and do righteous works.

2347.arabic: فَإِنَّما يَسَّرنـٰهُ بِلِسانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ المُتَّقينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِ قَومًا لُدًّا
2347.en: Therefore, We have revealed the Qur'an in your tongue and made it easy to understand that you may give glad tidings to the God#fearing and warn a contentious people.

2348.arabic: وَكَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِن قَرنٍ هَل تُحِسُّ مِنهُم مِن أَحَدٍ أَو تَسمَعُ لَهُم رِكزًا
2348.en: How numerous are the peoples that We destroyed before them! Do you now perceive any one of them, or hear even their whisper?

2350.en: We did not reveal the Qur'an to you to cause you distress;

2351.en: it is only a reminder for him who fears Allah;

2352.arabic: تَنزيلًا مِمَّن خَلَقَ الأَرضَ وَالسَّمـٰوٰتِ العُلَى
2352.en: a revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens.

2353.en: The Most Compassionate Lord is settled on the Throne (of the Universe).

2354.arabic: لَهُ ما فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَما فِى الأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما وَما تَحتَ الثَّرىٰ
2354.en: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and all that is in between, and all that is beneath the soil.

2355.arabic: وَإِن تَجهَر بِالقَولِ فَإِنَّهُ يَعلَمُ السِّرَّ وَأَخفَى
2355.en: Whether you speak out aloud (or in a low voice), He knows what is said secretly, and even that which is most hidden.

2356.arabic: اللَّهُ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ لَهُ الأَسماءُ الحُسنىٰ
2356.en: Allah # there is no god but He. His are the most excellent names.

2357.en: Has the story of Moses reached you?

2358.arabic: إِذ رَءا نارًا فَقالَ لِأَهلِهِ امكُثوا إِنّى ءانَستُ نارًا لَعَلّى ءاتيكُم مِنها بِقَبَسٍ أَو أَجِدُ عَلَى النّارِ هُدًى
2358.en: When he saw a fire and said to his family: "Hold on! I have just perceived a fire; perhaps I will bring a brand from it for you, or I will find some guidance at the fire about the way to follow."

2359.en: When he came to it, a voice called out: "Moses!

2360.arabic: إِنّى أَنا۠ رَبُّكَ فَاخلَع نَعلَيكَ إِنَّكَ بِالوادِ المُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
2360.en: Verily I am your Lord! Take off your shoes. You are in the sacred valley, Tuwa!

2361.en: I Myself have chosen you; therefore, give ear to what is revealed.

2362.arabic: إِنَّنى أَنَا اللَّهُ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا أَنا۠ فَاعبُدنى وَأَقِمِ الصَّلوٰةَ لِذِكرى
2362.en: Verily I am Allah. There is no god beside Me. So serve Me and establish Prayers to remember Me.

2363.arabic: إِنَّ السّاعَةَ ءاتِيَةٌ أَكادُ أُخفيها لِتُجزىٰ كُلُّ نَفسٍ بِما تَسعىٰ
2363.en: The Hour of Resurrection is coming. I have willed to keep the time of its coming hidden so that everyone may be recompensed in accordance with his effort.

2364.arabic: فَلا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنها مَن لا يُؤمِنُ بِها وَاتَّبَعَ هَوىٰهُ فَتَردىٰ
2364.en: Let him who does not believe in it and follows his lust not turn your thought away from it, lest you are ruined.

2365.en: And what is in your right hand, O Moses?"

2366.arabic: قالَ هِىَ عَصاىَ أَتَوَكَّؤُا۟ عَلَيها وَأَهُشُّ بِها عَلىٰ غَنَمى وَلِىَ فيها مَـٔارِبُ أُخرىٰ
2366.en: Moses answered: "This is my staff. I lean on it (when I walk), and with it I beat down leaves for my flock, and I have many other uses for it."

2368.en: So he threw it down, and lo! it was a rapidly moving snake.

2369.arabic: قالَ خُذها وَلا تَخَف سَنُعيدُها سيرَتَهَا الأولىٰ
2369.en: Then He said: "Seize it and have no fear. We shall restore it to its former state.

2370.arabic: وَاضمُم يَدَكَ إِلىٰ جَناحِكَ تَخرُج بَيضاءَ مِن غَيرِ سوءٍ ءايَةً أُخرىٰ
2370.en: And place your hand in your armpit, it will come forth shining white, without blemish. This is another Sign of Allah,

2371.en: for We shall show you some of Our greatest Signs.

2372.en: And go to Pharaoh now for he has transgressed all bounds."

2373.en: Moses said: "Lord! Open my breast for me;

2374.en: and ease my task for me,

2375.en: and loosen the knot from my tongue

2376.en: so that they may understand my speech;

2377.en: and appoint for me, from my household, someone who will help me bear my burden #

2380.en: and let him share my task

2381.en: that we may abundantly extol Your glory;

2383.en: Verily, You have always watched over us."

2384.en: He said: "Moses, your petition is granted.

2385.en: We have again bestowed Our favour upon you.

2386.arabic: إِذ أَوحَينا إِلىٰ أُمِّكَ ما يوحىٰ
2386.en: Recall, when We indicated to your mother through inspiration:

2387.arabic: أَنِ اقذِفيهِ فِى التّابوتِ فَاقذِفيهِ فِى اليَمِّ فَليُلقِهِ اليَمُّ بِالسّاحِلِ يَأخُذهُ عَدُوٌّ لى وَعَدُوٌّ لَهُ وَأَلقَيتُ عَلَيكَ مَحَبَّةً مِنّى وَلِتُصنَعَ عَلىٰ عَينى
2387.en: 'Put the baby into a chest and then throw him in the river. The river will throw him up on the shore, and then an enemy of Mine and an enemy of his will take him.' And I spread My love over you in order that you might be reared in My sight.

2388.arabic: إِذ تَمشى أُختُكَ فَتَقولُ هَل أَدُلُّكُم عَلىٰ مَن يَكفُلُهُ فَرَجَعنـٰكَ إِلىٰ أُمِّكَ كَى تَقَرَّ عَينُها وَلا تَحزَنَ وَقَتَلتَ نَفسًا فَنَجَّينـٰكَ مِنَ الغَمِّ وَفَتَنّـٰكَ فُتونًا فَلَبِثتَ سِنينَ فى أَهلِ مَديَنَ ثُمَّ جِئتَ عَلىٰ قَدَرٍ يـٰموسىٰ
2388.en: Recall, when your sister went along, saying: 'Shall I direct you to one who will take charge of him?' Thus We brought you back to your mother so that her heart might be gladdened and she might not grieve. Moses, recall when you slew a person. We delivered you from distress and made you go through several trials. Then you stayed for several years among the people of Midian, and now you have come at the right moment as ordained.

2389.en: I have chosen you for My service.

2390.arabic: اذهَب أَنتَ وَأَخوكَ بِـٔايـٰتى وَلا تَنِيا فى ذِكرِى
2390.en: So go forth, both you and your brother, with My Signs, and do not slacken in remembering Me.

2391.en: Go both of you to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed all bounds,

2392.arabic: فَقولا لَهُ قَولًا لَيِّنًا لَعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَو يَخشىٰ
2392.en: and speak to him gently, perhaps he may take heed or fear (Allah)."

2393.arabic: قالا رَبَّنا إِنَّنا نَخافُ أَن يَفرُطَ عَلَينا أَو أَن يَطغىٰ
2393.en: The two said:" Lord! We fear he may commit excesses against us, or transgress all bounds."

2394.arabic: قالَ لا تَخافا إِنَّنى مَعَكُما أَسمَعُ وَأَرىٰ
2394.en: He said: "Have no fear. I am with you, hearing and seeing all.

2395.arabic: فَأتِياهُ فَقولا إِنّا رَسولا رَبِّكَ فَأَرسِل مَعَنا بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ وَلا تُعَذِّبهُم قَد جِئنـٰكَ بِـٔايَةٍ مِن رَبِّكَ وَالسَّلـٰمُ عَلىٰ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الهُدىٰ
2395.en: So, go to him, and say: 'Behold, both of us are the Messengers of your Lord. Let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not chastise them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord; and peace shall be for him who follows the true guidance.

2396.arabic: إِنّا قَد أوحِىَ إِلَينا أَنَّ العَذابَ عَلىٰ مَن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلّىٰ
2396.en: It has been revealed to us that chastisement awaits those who called the lie to the truth and turned away from it.' "

2397.en: Pharaoh said:" Moses! Who is the Lord of the two of you?"

2398.arabic: قالَ رَبُّنَا الَّذى أَعطىٰ كُلَّ شَىءٍ خَلقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدىٰ
2398.en: He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave everything its form and then guided it."

2399.en: Pharaoh asked: "Then, what is the state of the former generations?"

2400.arabic: قالَ عِلمُها عِندَ رَبّى فى كِتـٰبٍ لا يَضِلُّ رَبّى وَلا يَنسَى
2400.en: Moses said: "Its knowledge is with my Lord, recorded in the Book. My Lord does not err, nor does He forget."

2401.arabic: الَّذى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَرضَ مَهدًا وَسَلَكَ لَكُم فيها سُبُلًا وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَخرَجنا بِهِ أَزوٰجًا مِن نَباتٍ شَتّىٰ
2401.en: He it is Who spread the earth for you; and made in it paths for you, and sent down water from the sky, and then through it We brought forth many species of diverse plants.

2402.arabic: كُلوا وَارعَوا أَنعـٰمَكُم إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايـٰتٍ لِأُولِى النُّهىٰ
2402.en: So eat yourself and pasture your cattle. Surely there are many Signs in this for people of understanding.

2403.arabic: مِنها خَلَقنـٰكُم وَفيها نُعيدُكُم وَمِنها نُخرِجُكُم تارَةً أُخرىٰ
2403.en: From this very earth We created you and to the same earth We shall cause you to return, and from it We shall bring you forth to life again.

2404.arabic: وَلَقَد أَرَينـٰهُ ءايـٰتِنا كُلَّها فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبىٰ
2404.en: Indeed We showed Pharaoh Our Signs, all of them, but he declared them to be false and rejected them.

2405.arabic: قالَ أَجِئتَنا لِتُخرِجَنا مِن أَرضِنا بِسِحرِكَ يـٰموسىٰ
2405.en: He said: "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land by your sorcery?

2406.arabic: فَلَنَأتِيَنَّكَ بِسِحرٍ مِثلِهِ فَاجعَل بَينَنا وَبَينَكَ مَوعِدًا لا نُخلِفُهُ نَحنُ وَلا أَنتَ مَكانًا سُوًى
2406.en: We shall confront you with a sorcery like your own. So appoint a day when both of us might meet face to face in an open space; an appointment which neither we nor you shall fail to keep."

2407.arabic: قالَ مَوعِدُكُم يَومُ الزّينَةِ وَأَن يُحشَرَ النّاسُ ضُحًى
2407.en: Moses said: "The appointment to meet you is on the Day of the Feast and let all people come together before noon."

2408.arabic: فَتَوَلّىٰ فِرعَونُ فَجَمَعَ كَيدَهُ ثُمَّ أَتىٰ
2408.en: Pharaoh went back and concerted all his stratagem and returned for the encounter.

2409.arabic: قالَ لَهُم موسىٰ وَيلَكُم لا تَفتَروا عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا فَيُسحِتَكُم بِعَذابٍ وَقَد خابَ مَنِ افتَرىٰ
2409.en: (At the time of the encounter) Moses said to them: "Woe to you! Do not invent falsehoods against Allah lest He destroy you with a scourge. Surely those who invent lies shall come to grief."

2410.en: Thereupon they wrangled among themselves about the matter and conferred in secret.

2411.arabic: قالوا إِن هـٰذٰنِ لَسـٰحِرٰنِ يُريدانِ أَن يُخرِجاكُم مِن أَرضِكُم بِسِحرِهِما وَيَذهَبا بِطَريقَتِكُمُ المُثلىٰ
2411.en: Some of them said: "These two are magicians, who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and to destroy your excellent way of life.

2412.arabic: فَأَجمِعوا كَيدَكُم ثُمَّ ائتوا صَفًّا وَقَد أَفلَحَ اليَومَ مَنِ استَعلىٰ
2412.en: So muster all your stratagem and come forth in a row. Whoever prevails today shall triumph."

2413.arabic: قالوا يـٰموسىٰ إِمّا أَن تُلقِىَ وَإِمّا أَن نَكونَ أَوَّلَ مَن أَلقىٰ
2413.en: The magicians said: "Moses, will you throw down or shall we be the first to throw?"

2414.arabic: قالَ بَل أَلقوا فَإِذا حِبالُهُم وَعِصِيُّهُم يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيهِ مِن سِحرِهِم أَنَّها تَسعىٰ
2414.en: Moses replied: "No, let it be you to throw first." Then suddenly it appeared to Moses, owing to their magic, as if their ropes and staffs were running.

2415.en: So Moses' heart was filled with fear.

2416.arabic: قُلنا لا تَخَف إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الأَعلىٰ
2416.en: We said to him: "Have no fear; for it is you who will prevail.

2417.arabic: وَأَلقِ ما فى يَمينِكَ تَلقَف ما صَنَعوا إِنَّما صَنَعوا كَيدُ سـٰحِرٍ وَلا يُفلِحُ السّاحِرُ حَيثُ أَتىٰ
2417.en: And throw down what is in your right hand; it will swallow up all that they have wrought. They have wrought only a magician's stratagem. A magician cannot come to any good, come whence he may."

2418.arabic: فَأُلقِىَ السَّحَرَةُ سُجَّدًا قالوا ءامَنّا بِرَبِّ هـٰرونَ وَموسىٰ
2418.en: Eventually the magicians were impelled to fall down prostrate and said: "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

2419.arabic: قالَ ءامَنتُم لَهُ قَبلَ أَن ءاذَنَ لَكُم إِنَّهُ لَكَبيرُكُمُ الَّذى عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحرَ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيدِيَكُم وَأَرجُلَكُم مِن خِلـٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُم فى جُذوعِ النَّخلِ وَلَتَعلَمُنَّ أَيُّنا أَشَدُّ عَذابًا وَأَبقىٰ
2419.en: Pharaoh said: "What! Did you believe in Him even before I permitted you to do so? Surely, he must be your chief who taught you magic. Now I will certainly cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and will crucify you on the trunks of palm#trees, and then you will come to know which of us can inflict sterner and more lasting torment."

2420.arabic: قالوا لَن نُؤثِرَكَ عَلىٰ ما جاءَنا مِنَ البَيِّنـٰتِ وَالَّذى فَطَرَنا فَاقضِ ما أَنتَ قاضٍ إِنَّما تَقضى هـٰذِهِ الحَيوٰةَ الدُّنيا
2420.en: The magicians answered: "By Him Who has created us, we shall never prefer you to the Truth after manifest Signs have come to us. So decree whatever you will. Your decree will pertain, at the most, to the present life of the world.

2421.arabic: إِنّا ءامَنّا بِرَبِّنا لِيَغفِرَ لَنا خَطـٰيـٰنا وَما أَكرَهتَنا عَلَيهِ مِنَ السِّحرِ وَاللَّهُ خَيرٌ وَأَبقىٰ
2421.en: We believe in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and also forgive us the practice of magic to which you had compelled us. Allah is the Best and He alone will abide."

2422.arabic: إِنَّهُ مَن يَأتِ رَبَّهُ مُجرِمًا فَإِنَّ لَهُ جَهَنَّمَ لا يَموتُ فيها وَلا يَحيىٰ
2422.en: The truth is that Hell awaits him who comes to his Lord laden with sin; he shall neither die in it nor live.

2423.arabic: وَمَن يَأتِهِ مُؤمِنًا قَد عَمِلَ الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ فَأُولـٰئِكَ لَهُمُ الدَّرَجـٰتُ العُلىٰ
2423.en: But he who comes to Him with faith and righteous works shall be exalted to high ranks,

2424.arabic: جَنّـٰتُ عَدنٍ تَجرى مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهـٰرُ خـٰلِدينَ فيها وَذٰلِكَ جَزاءُ مَن تَزَكّىٰ
2424.en: and shall live for ever in everlasting Gardens beneath which rivers flow. Such will be the reward of those who purify themselves.

2425.arabic: وَلَقَد أَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ أَن أَسرِ بِعِبادى فَاضرِب لَهُم طَريقًا فِى البَحرِ يَبَسًا لا تَخـٰفُ دَرَكًا وَلا تَخشىٰ
2425.en: Most certainly We revealed to Moses: "Proceed with My servants in the night and strike for them a dry path in the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken, nor be afraid of treading through the sea."

2426.arabic: فَأَتبَعَهُم فِرعَونُ بِجُنودِهِ فَغَشِيَهُم مِنَ اليَمِّ ما غَشِيَهُم
2426.en: Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts, but they were fully overwhelmed by the sea.

2427.en: Pharaoh led his people astray; he did not guide them aright.

2428.arabic: يـٰبَنى إِسرٰءيلَ قَد أَنجَينـٰكُم مِن عَدُوِّكُم وَوٰعَدنـٰكُم جانِبَ الطّورِ الأَيمَنَ وَنَزَّلنا عَلَيكُمُ المَنَّ وَالسَّلوىٰ
2428.en: Children of Israel! We saved you from your enemy and made a covenant with you on the right side of the Mount and sent down on you manna and quails,

2429.arabic: كُلوا مِن طَيِّبـٰتِ ما رَزَقنـٰكُم وَلا تَطغَوا فيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيكُم غَضَبى وَمَن يَحلِل عَلَيهِ غَضَبى فَقَد هَوىٰ
2429.en: saying: "Partake of the good things that We have provided for you, but do not transgress lest My wrath fall upon you; for he upon whom My wrath falls is ruined.

2430.arabic: وَإِنّى لَغَفّارٌ لِمَن تابَ وَءامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صـٰلِحًا ثُمَّ اهتَدىٰ
2430.en: But I am indeed Most Forgiving to him who repents and believes and does righteous works and keeps to the Right Way."

2431.en: "But, O Moses, what has made you come in haste from your people?"

2432.arabic: قالَ هُم أُولاءِ عَلىٰ أَثَرى وَعَجِلتُ إِلَيكَ رَبِّ لِتَرضىٰ
2432.en: He said: "They are close behind me, and I hastened to You, Lord, that You may be pleased with me."

2433.arabic: قالَ فَإِنّا قَد فَتَنّا قَومَكَ مِن بَعدِكَ وَأَضَلَّهُمُ السّامِرِىُّ
2433.en: Said He: "Verily We tested your people in your absence and the Samiri led them astray."

2434.arabic: فَرَجَعَ موسىٰ إِلىٰ قَومِهِ غَضبـٰنَ أَسِفًا قالَ يـٰقَومِ أَلَم يَعِدكُم رَبُّكُم وَعدًا حَسَنًا أَفَطالَ عَلَيكُمُ العَهدُ أَم أَرَدتُم أَن يَحِلَّ عَلَيكُم غَضَبٌ مِن رَبِّكُم فَأَخلَفتُم مَوعِدى
2434.en: Moses returned to his people full of wrath and grief, and said: "My people! Has your Lord not made good an excellent promise He made to you? And has a long time passed since those promises were fulfilled? Or was it to incur the wrath of your Lord that you broke your promise with me?"

2435.arabic: قالوا ما أَخلَفنا مَوعِدَكَ بِمَلكِنا وَلـٰكِنّا حُمِّلنا أَوزارًا مِن زينَةِ القَومِ فَقَذَفنـٰها فَكَذٰلِكَ أَلقَى السّامِرِىُّ
2435.en: They answered: "We did not break our promise with you out of our own volition; but we were laden with the load of people's ornaments, and we simply threw them down(into the fire), and the Samiri also threw down something,

2436.arabic: فَأَخرَجَ لَهُم عِجلًا جَسَدًا لَهُ خُوارٌ فَقالوا هـٰذا إِلـٰهُكُم وَإِلـٰهُ موسىٰ فَنَسِىَ
2436.en: and brought out of there (from the molten gold) the effigy of a calf that lowed." The people cried out: "This is your deity and the deity of Moses, whom Moses has forgotten."

2437.arabic: أَفَلا يَرَونَ أَلّا يَرجِعُ إِلَيهِم قَولًا وَلا يَملِكُ لَهُم ضَرًّا وَلا نَفعًا
2437.en: Did they not see that it did not return a word to them, and had no power either to hurt them or to cause them any benefit?

2438.arabic: وَلَقَد قالَ لَهُم هـٰرونُ مِن قَبلُ يـٰقَومِ إِنَّما فُتِنتُم بِهِ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ الرَّحمـٰنُ فَاتَّبِعونى وَأَطيعوا أَمرى
2438.en: Certainly Aaron had said to them even before (the return of Moses): "My people, you were fallen into error because of the calf. Surely your Lord is Most Compassionate; so follow me and obey my command."

2439.arabic: قالوا لَن نَبرَحَ عَلَيهِ عـٰكِفينَ حَتّىٰ يَرجِعَ إِلَينا موسىٰ
2439.en: But they answered: "By no means shall we cease to worship it until Moses returns to us."

2440.arabic: قالَ يـٰهـٰرونُ ما مَنَعَكَ إِذ رَأَيتَهُم ضَلّوا
2440.en: (After rebuking his people) Moses turned to Aaron and said: "Aaron! What prevented you, when you saw them going astray,

2441.en: from following my way? Have you disobeyed my command?"

2442.arabic: قالَ يَبنَؤُمَّ لا تَأخُذ بِلِحيَتى وَلا بِرَأسى إِنّى خَشيتُ أَن تَقولَ فَرَّقتَ بَينَ بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ وَلَم تَرقُب قَولى
2442.en: Aaron answered: "Son of my mother! Do not seize me with my beard, nor by (the hair of) my head. I feared that on returning you might say: 'You sowed discord among the Children of Israel, and did not pay heed to my words.'"

2443.en: Moses said: "What, then, is your case, O Samiri?"

2444.arabic: قالَ بَصُرتُ بِما لَم يَبصُروا بِهِ فَقَبَضتُ قَبضَةً مِن أَثَرِ الرَّسولِ فَنَبَذتُها وَكَذٰلِكَ سَوَّلَت لى نَفسى
2444.en: He answered: "I saw what the people did not see. So I took a handful of dust from the trail of the Messenger, and I flung it (into the fire). Thus did my mind prompt me."

2445.arabic: قالَ فَاذهَب فَإِنَّ لَكَ فِى الحَيوٰةِ أَن تَقولَ لا مِساسَ وَإِنَّ لَكَ مَوعِدًا لَن تُخلَفَهُ وَانظُر إِلىٰ إِلـٰهِكَ الَّذى ظَلتَ عَلَيهِ عاكِفًا لَنُحَرِّقَنَّهُ ثُمَّ لَنَنسِفَنَّهُ فِى اليَمِّ نَسفًا
2445.en: Moses said: "Be gone, then. All your life you shall cry: 'Untouchable.' There awaits a term for your reckoning that you cannot fail to keep. Now look at your god that you devotedly adored: We shall burn it and scatter its remains in the sea.

2446.arabic: إِنَّما إِلـٰهُكُمُ اللَّهُ الَّذى لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ وَسِعَ كُلَّ شَىءٍ عِلمًا
2446.en: Your God is none else than Allah, beside Whom there is no god. His knowledge embraces everything."

2447.arabic: كَذٰلِكَ نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ مِن أَنباءِ ما قَد سَبَقَ وَقَد ءاتَينـٰكَ مِن لَدُنّا ذِكرًا
2447.en: (O Muhammad), thus do We recount to you the events of the past, and We have bestowed upon you from Ourself an admonition.

2448.arabic: مَن أَعرَضَ عَنهُ فَإِنَّهُ يَحمِلُ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ وِزرًا
2448.en: He who turns away from it will surely bear a heavy burden on the Day of Resurrection,

2449.arabic: خـٰلِدينَ فيهِ وَساءَ لَهُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ حِملًا
2449.en: and will abide under this burden for ever. Grievous shall be the burden on the Day of Resurrection,

2450.arabic: يَومَ يُنفَخُ فِى الصّورِ وَنَحشُرُ المُجرِمينَ يَومَئِذٍ زُرقًا
2450.en: the Day when the Trumpet shall be sounded and We shall muster the sinners, their eyes turned blue with terror.

2451.arabic: يَتَخـٰفَتونَ بَينَهُم إِن لَبِثتُم إِلّا عَشرًا
2451.en: They shall whisper among themselves: "You stayed on the earth barely ten days."

2452.arabic: نَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِما يَقولونَ إِذ يَقولُ أَمثَلُهُم طَريقَةً إِن لَبِثتُم إِلّا يَومًا
2452.en: We know well what they will say to one another: We also know that even the most cautious in his estimate will say: "You lived in the world no more than a day."

2453.arabic: وَيَسـَٔلونَكَ عَنِ الجِبالِ فَقُل يَنسِفُها رَبّى نَسفًا
2453.en: They ask you concerning the mountains: "Where will they go?" Say: "My Lord will scatter them like dust,

2454.en: and leave the earth a levelled plain

2455.arabic: لا تَرىٰ فيها عِوَجًا وَلا أَمتًا
2455.en: in which you shall find no crookedness or curvature.

2456.arabic: يَومَئِذٍ يَتَّبِعونَ الدّاعِىَ لا عِوَجَ لَهُ وَخَشَعَتِ الأَصواتُ لِلرَّحمـٰنِ فَلا تَسمَعُ إِلّا هَمسًا
2456.en: On that Day people shall follow straight on to the call of the summoner, no one daring to show any haughtiness. Their voices shall be hushed before the Most Compassionate Lord, so that you will hear nothing but a whispering murmur.

2457.arabic: يَومَئِذٍ لا تَنفَعُ الشَّفـٰعَةُ إِلّا مَن أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحمـٰنُ وَرَضِىَ لَهُ قَولًا
2457.en: On that Day intercession shall not avail save of him whom the Most Compassionate Lord permits, and whose word of intercession is pleasing to Him.

2458.arabic: يَعلَمُ ما بَينَ أَيديهِم وَما خَلفَهُم وَلا يُحيطونَ بِهِ عِلمًا
2458.en: He knows all that is ahead of them and all that is behind them, while the others do not know.

2459.arabic: وَعَنَتِ الوُجوهُ لِلحَىِّ القَيّومِ وَقَد خابَ مَن حَمَلَ ظُلمًا
2459.en: All faces shall be humbled before the Ever#Living, the Self#Subsisting Lord, and he who bears the burden of iniquity will have failed;

2460.arabic: وَمَن يَعمَل مِنَ الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَلا يَخافُ ظُلمًا وَلا هَضمًا
2460.en: but whosoever does righteous works, being a believer, shall have no fear of suffering wrong or loss."

2461.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَنزَلنـٰهُ قُرءانًا عَرَبِيًّا وَصَرَّفنا فيهِ مِنَ الوَعيدِ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَّقونَ أَو يُحدِثُ لَهُم ذِكرًا
2461.en: (O Muhammad), thus have We revealed this as an Arabic Qur'an and have expounded in it warning in diverse ways so that they may avoid evil or become heedful.

2462.arabic: فَتَعـٰلَى اللَّهُ المَلِكُ الحَقُّ وَلا تَعجَل بِالقُرءانِ مِن قَبلِ أَن يُقضىٰ إِلَيكَ وَحيُهُ وَقُل رَبِّ زِدنى عِلمًا
2462.en: Exalted is Allah, the True King! Hasten not with reciting the Qur'an before its revelation to you is finished, and pray: "Lord! Increase me in knowledge."

2463.arabic: وَلَقَد عَهِدنا إِلىٰ ءادَمَ مِن قَبلُ فَنَسِىَ وَلَم نَجِد لَهُ عَزمًا
2463.en: Most certainly We had given Adam a command before, but he forgot. We found him lacking in firmness of resolution.

2464.arabic: وَإِذ قُلنا لِلمَلـٰئِكَةِ اسجُدوا لِـٔادَمَ فَسَجَدوا إِلّا إِبليسَ أَبىٰ
2464.en: Recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all prostrated themselves save Iblis. He refused.

2465.arabic: فَقُلنا يـٰـٔادَمُ إِنَّ هـٰذا عَدُوٌّ لَكَ وَلِزَوجِكَ فَلا يُخرِجَنَّكُما مِنَ الجَنَّةِ فَتَشقىٰ
2465.en: Then We said: "Adam! He is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not drive both of you out of Paradise and plunge you into affliction,

2466.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ أَلّا تَجوعَ فيها وَلا تَعرىٰ
2466.en: (for in Paradise) neither are you hungry nor naked,

2467.arabic: وَأَنَّكَ لا تَظمَؤُا۟ فيها وَلا تَضحىٰ
2467.en: nor face thirst or scorching heat."

2468.arabic: فَوَسوَسَ إِلَيهِ الشَّيطـٰنُ قالَ يـٰـٔادَمُ هَل أَدُلُّكَ عَلىٰ شَجَرَةِ الخُلدِ وَمُلكٍ لا يَبلىٰ
2468.en: But Satan seduced him, saying: "Adam! Shall I direct you to a tree of eternal life and an abiding kingdom?"

2469.arabic: فَأَكَلا مِنها فَبَدَت لَهُما سَوءٰتُهُما وَطَفِقا يَخصِفانِ عَلَيهِما مِن وَرَقِ الجَنَّةِ وَعَصىٰ ءادَمُ رَبَّهُ فَغَوىٰ
2469.en: Then the two of them ate the fruit of that tree and their shameful parts became revealed to each other, and they began to cover themselves with the leaves from the Garden. Thus Adam disobeyed his Lord and strayed into error.

2470.arabic: ثُمَّ اجتَبـٰهُ رَبُّهُ فَتابَ عَلَيهِ وَهَدىٰ
2470.en: Thereafter his Lord exalted him, accepted his repentance, and bestowed guidance upon him,

2471.arabic: قالَ اهبِطا مِنها جَميعًا بَعضُكُم لِبَعضٍ عَدُوٌّ فَإِمّا يَأتِيَنَّكُم مِنّى هُدًى فَمَنِ اتَّبَعَ هُداىَ فَلا يَضِلُّ وَلا يَشقىٰ
2471.en: and said: "Get down, both of you, (that is, man and Satan), and be out of it; each of you shall be an enemy to the other. Henceforth if there comes to you a guidance from Me, then whosoever follows My guidance shall neither go astray nor suffer misery.

2472.arabic: وَمَن أَعرَضَ عَن ذِكرى فَإِنَّ لَهُ مَعيشَةً ضَنكًا وَنَحشُرُهُ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ أَعمىٰ
2472.en: But whosoever turns away from this Admonition from Me shall have a straitened life; We shall raise him blind on the Day of Resurrection,"

2473.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ لِمَ حَشَرتَنى أَعمىٰ وَقَد كُنتُ بَصيرًا
2473.en: where#upon he will say: "Lord! Why have You raised me blind when I had sight in the world?"

2474.arabic: قالَ كَذٰلِكَ أَتَتكَ ءايـٰتُنا فَنَسيتَها وَكَذٰلِكَ اليَومَ تُنسىٰ
2474.en: He will say: "Even so it is. Our Signs came to you and you ignored them. So shall you be ignored this Day."

2475.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ نَجزى مَن أَسرَفَ وَلَم يُؤمِن بِـٔايـٰتِ رَبِّهِ وَلَعَذابُ الـٔاخِرَةِ أَشَدُّ وَأَبقىٰ
2475.en: Thus do We requite him who transgresses and does not believe in the signs of your Lord (during the life of the world); and surely the punishment of the Hereafter is even more terrible and more enduring.

2476.arabic: أَفَلَم يَهدِ لَهُم كَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِنَ القُرونِ يَمشونَ فى مَسـٰكِنِهِم إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايـٰتٍ لِأُولِى النُّهىٰ
2476.en: Did they not find any guidance in the fact that We destroyed many nations in whose ruined dwelling#places they now walk about? Surely there are many Signs in them for people endowed with wisdom.

2477.arabic: وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ لَكانَ لِزامًا وَأَجَلٌ مُسَمًّى
2477.en: Were it not for a word already gone from your Lord, the decree (of their destruction) would have come to pass.

2478.arabic: فَاصبِر عَلىٰ ما يَقولونَ وَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ قَبلَ طُلوعِ الشَّمسِ وَقَبلَ غُروبِها وَمِن ءانائِ الَّيلِ فَسَبِّح وَأَطرافَ النَّهارِ لَعَلَّكَ تَرضىٰ
2478.en: So bear patiently with what they say. Glorify your Lord, praising Him before sunrise and before sunset, and in the watches of the night, and glorify Him and at the ends of the day that you may attain to happiness.

2479.arabic: وَلا تَمُدَّنَّ عَينَيكَ إِلىٰ ما مَتَّعنا بِهِ أَزوٰجًا مِنهُم زَهرَةَ الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا لِنَفتِنَهُم فيهِ وَرِزقُ رَبِّكَ خَيرٌ وَأَبقىٰ
2479.en: Do not turn your eyes covetously towards the embellishments of worldly life that We have bestowed upon various kinds of people to test them. But the clean provision bestowed upon you by your Lord is better and more enduring.

2480.arabic: وَأمُر أَهلَكَ بِالصَّلوٰةِ وَاصطَبِر عَلَيها لا نَسـَٔلُكَ رِزقًا نَحنُ نَرزُقُكَ وَالعـٰقِبَةُ لِلتَّقوىٰ
2480.en: Enjoin Prayer on your household, and do keep observing it. We do not ask you for any worldly provision; rather, it is We Who provide you, and ultimately the pious will end up the best.

2481.arabic: وَقالوا لَولا يَأتينا بِـٔايَةٍ مِن رَبِّهِ أَوَلَم تَأتِهِم بَيِّنَةُ ما فِى الصُّحُفِ الأولىٰ
2481.en: They ask: "Why does he not bring us a (miraculous) sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them a Book containing the teachings of the previous scriptures?

2482.arabic: وَلَو أَنّا أَهلَكنـٰهُم بِعَذابٍ مِن قَبلِهِ لَقالوا رَبَّنا لَولا أَرسَلتَ إِلَينا رَسولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ ءايـٰتِكَ مِن قَبلِ أَن نَذِلَّ وَنَخزىٰ
2482.en: Had We destroyed them through some calamity before his coming, they would have said: "Our Lord! Why did You not send any Messenger to us that we might have followed Your signs before being humbled and disgraced?"

2483.arabic: قُل كُلٌّ مُتَرَبِّصٌ فَتَرَبَّصوا فَسَتَعلَمونَ مَن أَصحـٰبُ الصِّرٰطِ السَّوِىِّ وَمَنِ اهتَدىٰ
2483.en: Tell them, (O Muhammad): "Everyone is waiting for his end. Wait, then, and you will soon know who are the people of the Right Way, and are rightly#guided."

2484.arabic: اقتَرَبَ لِلنّاسِ حِسابُهُم وَهُم فى غَفلَةٍ مُعرِضونَ
2484.en: The time of people's reckoning has drawn near, and yet they turn aside in heedlessness.

2485.arabic: ما يَأتيهِم مِن ذِكرٍ مِن رَبِّهِم مُحدَثٍ إِلَّا استَمَعوهُ وَهُم يَلعَبونَ
2485.en: Whenever any fresh admonition comes to them from their Lord they barely heed it and remain immersed in play,

2486.arabic: لاهِيَةً قُلوبُهُم وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجوَى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا هَل هـٰذا إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم أَفَتَأتونَ السِّحرَ وَأَنتُم تُبصِرونَ
2486.en: their hearts being set on other concerns. The wrong#doers whisper to one another: "This person is no more than a mortal like yourselves. Will you, then, be enchanted by sorcery while you see?"

2487.arabic: قالَ رَبّى يَعلَمُ القَولَ فِى السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ وَهُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
2487.en: He said: "My Lord knows well all that is spoken in the heavens and the earth. He is All#Hearing, All# Knowing."

2488.arabic: بَل قالوا أَضغـٰثُ أَحلـٰمٍ بَلِ افتَرىٰهُ بَل هُوَ شاعِرٌ فَليَأتِنا بِـٔايَةٍ كَما أُرسِلَ الأَوَّلونَ
2488.en: They say: "Nay, these are confused dreams; nay, he has forged it; nay, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign, even as the Messengers of the past were sent with signs."

2489.arabic: ما ءامَنَت قَبلَهُم مِن قَريَةٍ أَهلَكنـٰها أَفَهُم يُؤمِنونَ
2489.en: Not one township that We destroyed before them believed. Would they, then, believe?

2490.arabic: وَما أَرسَلنا قَبلَكَ إِلّا رِجالًا نوحى إِلَيهِم فَسـَٔلوا أَهلَ الذِّكرِ إِن كُنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
2490.en: (O Muhammad), even before you We never sent any other than human beings as Messengers, and to them We sent revelation. Ask the People of the Book if you do not know.

2491.arabic: وَما جَعَلنـٰهُم جَسَدًا لا يَأكُلونَ الطَّعامَ وَما كانوا خـٰلِدينَ
2491.en: We did not endow the Messengers with bodies that would need no food; nor were they immortals.

2492.arabic: ثُمَّ صَدَقنـٰهُمُ الوَعدَ فَأَنجَينـٰهُم وَمَن نَشاءُ وَأَهلَكنَا المُسرِفينَ
2492.en: Then We fulfilled the promise We had made to them: We rescued them and those whom We wished, and We destroyed those who exceeded all bounds.

2493.arabic: لَقَد أَنزَلنا إِلَيكُم كِتـٰبًا فيهِ ذِكرُكُم أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
2493.en: We have bestowed upon you a Book that mentions you. Do you not understand?

2494.arabic: وَكَم قَصَمنا مِن قَريَةٍ كانَت ظالِمَةً وَأَنشَأنا بَعدَها قَومًا ءاخَرينَ
2494.en: How many a wrong#doing town did We shatter and then raise up another people.

2495.arabic: فَلَمّا أَحَسّوا بَأسَنا إِذا هُم مِنها يَركُضونَ
2495.en: Then, when they perceived Our chastisement they took to their heels and fled.

2496.arabic: لا تَركُضوا وَارجِعوا إِلىٰ ما أُترِفتُم فيهِ وَمَسـٰكِنِكُم لَعَلَّكُم تُسـَٔلونَ
2496.en: (They were told): "Flee not, but return to your comforts and to your dwellings. You are likely to be questioned."

2497.en: They said: "Woe to us; surely we were wrong#doers."

2498.arabic: فَما زالَت تِلكَ دَعوىٰهُم حَتّىٰ جَعَلنـٰهُم حَصيدًا خـٰمِدينَ
2498.en: They did not cease to cry this until We reduced them to stubble, still and silent.

2499.arabic: وَما خَلَقنَا السَّماءَ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما لـٰعِبينَ
2499.en: We did not create in sport the heavens and the earth and all that lies between the two.

2500.arabic: لَو أَرَدنا أَن نَتَّخِذَ لَهوًا لَاتَّخَذنـٰهُ مِن لَدُنّا إِن كُنّا فـٰعِلينَ
2500.en: Had it been Our will to find a pastime, We would have found one near at hand; if at all We were inclined to do so.

2501.arabic: بَل نَقذِفُ بِالحَقِّ عَلَى البـٰطِلِ فَيَدمَغُهُ فَإِذا هُوَ زاهِقٌ وَلَكُمُ الوَيلُ مِمّا تَصِفونَ
2501.en: Nay, We hurl the Truth at falsehood so that the Truth crushes falsehood, and lo! it vanishes. Woe to you for what you utter!

2502.arabic: وَلَهُ مَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَمَن عِندَهُ لا يَستَكبِرونَ عَن عِبادَتِهِ وَلا يَستَحسِرونَ
2502.en: To Him belongs whosoever dwells in the heavens and on earth. Those (angels) that are with Him neither disdain to serve Him out of pride, nor do they weary of it.

2503.en: They glorify Him night and day, without flagging.

2504.arabic: أَمِ اتَّخَذوا ءالِهَةً مِنَ الأَرضِ هُم يُنشِرونَ
2504.en: Have they taken earthly gods who are such that they raise up the dead to life?

2505.arabic: لَو كانَ فيهِما ءالِهَةٌ إِلَّا اللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتا فَسُبحـٰنَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ العَرشِ عَمّا يَصِفونَ
2505.en: Had there been any gods in the heavens and the earth apart from Allah, the order of both the heavens and the earth would have gone to ruins. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the Throne, Who is far above their false descriptions of Him.

2506.arabic: لا يُسـَٔلُ عَمّا يَفعَلُ وَهُم يُسـَٔلونَ
2506.en: None shall question Him about what He does, but they shall be questioned.

2507.arabic: أَمِ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ ءالِهَةً قُل هاتوا بُرهـٰنَكُم هـٰذا ذِكرُ مَن مَعِىَ وَذِكرُ مَن قَبلى بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ الحَقَّ فَهُم مُعرِضونَ
2507.en: Have they taken gods other than Him? Say, (O Muhammad): "Bring forth your proof! Here is the Book with admonition for those of my time and there are also scriptures with admonition for people before me." But most people do not know the Truth, and have, therefore, turned away from it.

2508.arabic: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ مِن رَسولٍ إِلّا نوحى إِلَيهِ أَنَّهُ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا أَنا۠ فَاعبُدونِ
2508.en: Never did We send any Messenger before you to whom We did not reveal: "There is no god but Me. So serve Me alone."

2509.arabic: وَقالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحمـٰنُ وَلَدًا سُبحـٰنَهُ بَل عِبادٌ مُكرَمونَ
2509.en: They say: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken to Himself a son." Glory be to Him! Those whom they so designate are only His honoured servants.

2510.arabic: لا يَسبِقونَهُ بِالقَولِ وَهُم بِأَمرِهِ يَعمَلونَ
2510.en: They do not outstrip Him in speech and only act as He commands.

2511.arabic: يَعلَمُ ما بَينَ أَيديهِم وَما خَلفَهُم وَلا يَشفَعونَ إِلّا لِمَنِ ارتَضىٰ وَهُم مِن خَشيَتِهِ مُشفِقونَ
2511.en: He knows whatever is before them and whatsoever is remote from them and they do not intercede except for him, intercession on whose behalf pleases Him, and they stand constantly in awe of Him.

2512.arabic: وَمَن يَقُل مِنهُم إِنّى إِلـٰهٌ مِن دونِهِ فَذٰلِكَ نَجزيهِ جَهَنَّمَ كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِى الظّـٰلِمينَ
2512.en: And if anyone of them were to claim: "Indeed I am a god apart from Him," We shall recompense both with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrong#doers.

2513.arabic: أَوَلَم يَرَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَنَّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضَ كانَتا رَتقًا فَفَتَقنـٰهُما وَجَعَلنا مِنَ الماءِ كُلَّ شَىءٍ حَىٍّ أَفَلا يُؤمِنونَ
2513.en: Did the unbelievers (who do not accept the teaching of the Prophet) not realize that the heavens and the earth were one solid mass, then We tore them apart, and We made every living being out of water? Will they, then, not believe (that We created all this)?

2514.arabic: وَجَعَلنا فِى الأَرضِ رَوٰسِىَ أَن تَميدَ بِهِم وَجَعَلنا فيها فِجاجًا سُبُلًا لَعَلَّهُم يَهتَدونَ
2514.en: And We placed firm mountains on earth lest it should sway with them, and We made wide paths in them that they may find their way;

2515.arabic: وَجَعَلنَا السَّماءَ سَقفًا مَحفوظًا وَهُم عَن ءايـٰتِها مُعرِضونَ
2515.en: and We made the sky a secure canopy; and yet they turn away from these Signs.

2516.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى خَلَقَ الَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ وَالشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ كُلٌّ فى فَلَكٍ يَسبَحونَ
2516.en: It is He Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Each of them is floating in its orbit.

2517.arabic: وَما جَعَلنا لِبَشَرٍ مِن قَبلِكَ الخُلدَ أَفَإِي۟ن مِتَّ فَهُمُ الخـٰلِدونَ
2517.en: (O Muhammad), We did not grant everlasting life to any human being even before you. If you were to die, will they live for ever?

2518.arabic: كُلُّ نَفسٍ ذائِقَةُ المَوتِ وَنَبلوكُم بِالشَّرِّ وَالخَيرِ فِتنَةً وَإِلَينا تُرجَعونَ
2518.en: Every living being shall taste death and We shall subject you to ill and good by way of trial, and to Us shall all of you be eventually sent back.

2519.arabic: وَإِذا رَءاكَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن يَتَّخِذونَكَ إِلّا هُزُوًا أَهـٰذَا الَّذى يَذكُرُ ءالِهَتَكُم وَهُم بِذِكرِ الرَّحمـٰنِ هُم كـٰفِرونَ
2519.en: When the unbelievers see you they make you an object of fun, saying: "Is he the one who mentions your gods?" They say so, and yet they reject with disdain the very mention of the Most Compassionate Lord.

2520.arabic: خُلِقَ الإِنسـٰنُ مِن عَجَلٍ سَأُو۟ريكُم ءايـٰتى فَلا تَستَعجِلونِ
2520.en: Man is hasty by nature. I shall certainly show you My Signs. Do not ask Me to be hasty.

2521.arabic: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هـٰذَا الوَعدُ إِن كُنتُم صـٰدِقينَ
2521.en: They say: "(Tell us) when will the threat of punishment come to pass if you are truthful?"

2522.arabic: لَو يَعلَمُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا حينَ لا يَكُفّونَ عَن وُجوهِهِمُ النّارَ وَلا عَن ظُهورِهِم وَلا هُم يُنصَرونَ
2522.en: If only the unbelievers knew of the Hour when they shall not be able to keep off the Fire from their faces, nor from their backs; nor shall they be helped.

2523.arabic: بَل تَأتيهِم بَغتَةً فَتَبهَتُهُم فَلا يَستَطيعونَ رَدَّها وَلا هُم يُنظَرونَ
2523.en: That will suddenly come upon them and stupefy them. They shall not be able to ward it off, nor shall they be granted any respite.

2524.arabic: وَلَقَدِ استُهزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِن قَبلِكَ فَحاقَ بِالَّذينَ سَخِروا مِنهُم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِءونَ
2524.en: Other Messengers before you were also mocked, but those who scoffed at the Messengers were overtaken by the same scourge that they had scoffed at.

2525.arabic: قُل مَن يَكلَؤُكُم بِالَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ مِنَ الرَّحمـٰنِ بَل هُم عَن ذِكرِ رَبِّهِم مُعرِضونَ
2525.en: Tell them, (O Muhammad): "Who protects you, during the night or the day from the Most Compassionate Lord?" And yet they turn away from the Admonition of their Lord.

2526.arabic: أَم لَهُم ءالِهَةٌ تَمنَعُهُم مِن دونِنا لا يَستَطيعونَ نَصرَ أَنفُسِهِم وَلا هُم مِنّا يُصحَبونَ
2526.en: Do they have any gods who would protect them against Us? They have no power even to help themselves; nor do they enjoy Our support.

2527.arabic: بَل مَتَّعنا هـٰؤُلاءِ وَءاباءَهُم حَتّىٰ طالَ عَلَيهِمُ العُمُرُ أَفَلا يَرَونَ أَنّا نَأتِى الأَرضَ نَنقُصُها مِن أَطرافِها أَفَهُمُ الغـٰلِبونَ
2527.en: Nay, We generously provided them and their fathers, and they enjoyed Our provision for long. Do they not see that We are now advancing into their territory, diminishing it from different sides? Is it they, then, who will triumph?"

2528.arabic: قُل إِنَّما أُنذِرُكُم بِالوَحىِ وَلا يَسمَعُ الصُّمُّ الدُّعاءَ إِذا ما يُنذَرونَ
