2528.en: Tell them: "I only warn you by the Revelation." But the deaf do not hear the cry when they are warned.

2529.arabic: وَلَئِن مَسَّتهُم نَفحَةٌ مِن عَذابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقولُنَّ يـٰوَيلَنا إِنّا كُنّا ظـٰلِمينَ
2529.en: Were only the slightest whiff from your Lord's punishment to touch them, they would cry out: "Woe to us; we were indeed wrong#doers."

2530.arabic: وَنَضَعُ المَوٰزينَ القِسطَ لِيَومِ القِيـٰمَةِ فَلا تُظلَمُ نَفسٌ شَيـًٔا وَإِن كانَ مِثقالَ حَبَّةٍ مِن خَردَلٍ أَتَينا بِها وَكَفىٰ بِنا حـٰسِبينَ
2530.en: We shall set up just scales on the Day of Resurrection so that none will be wronged in the least. (We shall bring forth the acts of everyone), even if it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed. We shall suffice as Reckoners.

2531.arabic: وَلَقَد ءاتَينا موسىٰ وَهـٰرونَ الفُرقانَ وَضِياءً وَذِكرًا لِلمُتَّقينَ
2531.en: Surely We had granted to Moses and Aaron the Criterion (between right and wrong), and Light and Admonition for the good of the God#fearing,

2532.arabic: الَّذينَ يَخشَونَ رَبَّهُم بِالغَيبِ وَهُم مِنَ السّاعَةِ مُشفِقونَ
2532.en: for those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and dread the Hour (of Reckoning).

2533.arabic: وَهـٰذا ذِكرٌ مُبارَكٌ أَنزَلنـٰهُ أَفَأَنتُم لَهُ مُنكِرونَ
2533.en: This is a Blessed Admonition that We have revealed. Are you, then, going to reject it?

2534.arabic: وَلَقَد ءاتَينا إِبرٰهيمَ رُشدَهُ مِن قَبلُ وَكُنّا بِهِ عـٰلِمينَ
2534.en: Surely We had bestowed wisdom upon Abraham even earlier, and We knew him well.

2535.arabic: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ وَقَومِهِ ما هـٰذِهِ التَّماثيلُ الَّتى أَنتُم لَها عـٰكِفونَ
2535.en: Recall, when he said to his father and his people: "What are these images to which you are devoutly clinging?"

2536.en: They answered: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

2537.arabic: قالَ لَقَد كُنتُم أَنتُم وَءاباؤُكُم فى ضَلـٰلٍ مُبينٍ
2537.en: He said: "Certainly you and your fathers have all been in manifest error."

2538.arabic: قالوا أَجِئتَنا بِالحَقِّ أَم أَنتَ مِنَ اللّـٰعِبينَ
2538.en: They said: "Are you expressing your true ideas before us or are you jesting?"

2539.arabic: قالَ بَل رَبُّكُم رَبُّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ الَّذى فَطَرَهُنَّ وَأَنا۠ عَلىٰ ذٰلِكُم مِنَ الشّـٰهِدينَ
2539.en: He said: "Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth which He created and to that I bear witness before you.

2540.arabic: وَتَاللَّهِ لَأَكيدَنَّ أَصنـٰمَكُم بَعدَ أَن تُوَلّوا مُدبِرينَ
2540.en: By Allah, I shall certainly carry out my plan against your gods after you are gone."

2541.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُم جُذٰذًا إِلّا كَبيرًا لَهُم لَعَلَّهُم إِلَيهِ يَرجِعونَ
2541.en: Then he broke them all into pieces, sparing only the supreme one among them that they may possibly return to him.

2542.arabic: قالوا مَن فَعَلَ هـٰذا بِـٔالِهَتِنا إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الظّـٰلِمينَ
2542.en: (When they saw the idols in this state) they said: "Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is one of the wrong#doers."

2543.arabic: قالوا سَمِعنا فَتًى يَذكُرُهُم يُقالُ لَهُ إِبرٰهيمُ
2543.en: Some of them said: "We heard a youth called Abraham speak (ill) of them."

2544.arabic: قالوا فَأتوا بِهِ عَلىٰ أَعيُنِ النّاسِ لَعَلَّهُم يَشهَدونَ
2544.en: The others said: "Bring him, then, before the eyes of the people that they may see (what will be done to him)."

2545.arabic: قالوا ءَأَنتَ فَعَلتَ هـٰذا بِـٔالِهَتِنا يـٰإِبرٰهيمُ
2545.en: (On Abraham's arrival) they said: "Abraham, are you he who has done this to our gods?"

2546.arabic: قالَ بَل فَعَلَهُ كَبيرُهُم هـٰذا فَسـَٔلوهُم إِن كانوا يَنطِقونَ
2546.en: He answered: "Rather it was this supreme one who has done it. So ask them, if they can speak."

2547.arabic: فَرَجَعوا إِلىٰ أَنفُسِهِم فَقالوا إِنَّكُم أَنتُمُ الظّـٰلِمونَ
2547.en: Thereupon they turned to their (inner) selves and said (to themselves): "Surely it is you who are the wrong#doers."

2548.arabic: ثُمَّ نُكِسوا عَلىٰ رُءوسِهِم لَقَد عَلِمتَ ما هـٰؤُلاءِ يَنطِقونَ
2548.en: Then their minds were turned upside down, and they said: "You know well that they do not speak."

2549.arabic: قالَ أَفَتَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَنفَعُكُم شَيـًٔا وَلا يَضُرُّكُم
2549.en: Abraham said: "Do you, then, worship beside Allah a thing that can neither benefit you nor hurt you?

2550.arabic: أُفٍّ لَكُم وَلِما تَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
2550.en: Fie upon you and upon all that you worship beside Allah. Do you have no sense?"

2551.arabic: قالوا حَرِّقوهُ وَانصُروا ءالِهَتَكُم إِن كُنتُم فـٰعِلينَ
2551.en: They said: "Burn him, and come to the support of your gods, if you are going to do anything."

2552.arabic: قُلنا يـٰنارُ كونى بَردًا وَسَلـٰمًا عَلىٰ إِبرٰهيمَ
2552.en: We said: "O fire, become coolness and safety for Abraham."

2553.en: They had sought to do evil to him, but We caused them to be the worst losers,

2554.arabic: وَنَجَّينـٰهُ وَلوطًا إِلَى الأَرضِ الَّتى بـٰرَكنا فيها لِلعـٰلَمينَ
2554.en: and We saved him and Lot and brought him to the land upon which We had bestowed Our blessings for all the people of the world.

2555.arabic: وَوَهَبنا لَهُ إِسحـٰقَ وَيَعقوبَ نافِلَةً وَكُلًّا جَعَلنا صـٰلِحينَ
2555.en: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob as an additional gift, making each of them righteous.

2556.arabic: وَجَعَلنـٰهُم أَئِمَّةً يَهدونَ بِأَمرِنا وَأَوحَينا إِلَيهِم فِعلَ الخَيرٰتِ وَإِقامَ الصَّلوٰةِ وَإيتاءَ الزَّكوٰةِ وَكانوا لَنا عـٰبِدينَ
2556.en: And We made them into leaders to guide people in accordance with Our command, and We inspired them to good works, and to establish Prayers and to give Zakah. They worshipped Us alone.

2557.arabic: وَلوطًا ءاتَينـٰهُ حُكمًا وَعِلمًا وَنَجَّينـٰهُ مِنَ القَريَةِ الَّتى كانَت تَعمَلُ الخَبـٰئِثَ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومَ سَوءٍ فـٰسِقينَ
2557.en: We bestowed upon Lot sound judgement and knowledge, and We delivered him from the city that was immersed in foul deeds. They were indeed a wicked people, exceedingly disobedient.

2558.arabic: وَأَدخَلنـٰهُ فى رَحمَتِنا إِنَّهُ مِنَ الصّـٰلِحينَ
2558.en: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Verily he was of the righteous.

2559.arabic: وَنوحًا إِذ نادىٰ مِن قَبلُ فَاستَجَبنا لَهُ فَنَجَّينـٰهُ وَأَهلَهُ مِنَ الكَربِ العَظيمِ
2559.en: We bestowed the same favour upon Noah. Recall, when he cried to Us before; We accepted his prayer and delivered him and his household from the great distress

2560.arabic: وَنَصَرنـٰهُ مِنَ القَومِ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِـٔايـٰتِنا إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومَ سَوءٍ فَأَغرَقنـٰهُم أَجمَعينَ
2560.en: and We helped him against a people who rejected Our signs as false. They were indeed an evil people and so We drowned them all.

2561.arabic: وَداوۥدَ وَسُلَيمـٰنَ إِذ يَحكُمانِ فِى الحَرثِ إِذ نَفَشَت فيهِ غَنَمُ القَومِ وَكُنّا لِحُكمِهِم شـٰهِدينَ
2561.en: We bestowed the same favour upon David and Solomon. Recall, when they gave judgement regarding a tillage into which the sheep of some people had strayed at night, and We were witnesses to their judgement.

2562.arabic: فَفَهَّمنـٰها سُلَيمـٰنَ وَكُلًّا ءاتَينا حُكمًا وَعِلمًا وَسَخَّرنا مَعَ داوۥدَ الجِبالَ يُسَبِّحنَ وَالطَّيرَ وَكُنّا فـٰعِلينَ
2562.en: We guided Solomon to the right verdict, and We had granted each of them judgement and knowledge. We made the mountains and the birds celebrate the praise of Allah with David. It was We Who did all this.

2563.arabic: وَعَلَّمنـٰهُ صَنعَةَ لَبوسٍ لَكُم لِتُحصِنَكُم مِن بَأسِكُم فَهَل أَنتُم شـٰكِرونَ
2563.en: It was We Who taught him the art of making coats of mail for your benefit so that it may protect you from each other's violence. Do you, then, give thanks?

2564.arabic: وَلِسُلَيمـٰنَ الرّيحَ عاصِفَةً تَجرى بِأَمرِهِ إِلَى الأَرضِ الَّتى بـٰرَكنا فيها وَكُنّا بِكُلِّ شَىءٍ عـٰلِمينَ
2564.en: And We subdued the strongly raging wind to Solomon which blew at his bidding towards the land We blessed. We know everything.

2565.arabic: وَمِنَ الشَّيـٰطينِ مَن يَغوصونَ لَهُ وَيَعمَلونَ عَمَلًا دونَ ذٰلِكَ وَكُنّا لَهُم حـٰفِظينَ
2565.en: And We subdued many devils who dived (into the sea) for him and carried out other jobs besides that. We kept watch over all of them.

2566.arabic: وَأَيّوبَ إِذ نادىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنّى مَسَّنِىَ الضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرحَمُ الرّٰحِمينَ
2566.en: We bestowed (the same wisdom, judgement and knowledge) upon Job. Recall, when he cried to his Lord: "Behold, disease has struck me and You are the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."

2567.arabic: فَاستَجَبنا لَهُ فَكَشَفنا ما بِهِ مِن ضُرٍّ وَءاتَينـٰهُ أَهلَهُ وَمِثلَهُم مَعَهُم رَحمَةً مِن عِندِنا وَذِكرىٰ لِلعـٰبِدينَ
2567.en: We accepted his prayer and removed the affliction from him, and We not only restored to him his family but as many more with them as a mercy from Us and as a lesson to the worshippers.

2568.arabic: وَإِسمـٰعيلَ وَإِدريسَ وَذَا الكِفلِ كُلٌّ مِنَ الصّـٰبِرينَ
2568.en: And (We bestowed the same favour) upon Ishmael, Idris and Dhu al#Kifl, for they were all steadfast.

2569.arabic: وَأَدخَلنـٰهُم فى رَحمَتِنا إِنَّهُم مِنَ الصّـٰلِحينَ
2569.en: And We admitted them into Our mercy, for they were of the righteous.

2570.arabic: وَذَا النّونِ إِذ ذَهَبَ مُغـٰضِبًا فَظَنَّ أَن لَن نَقدِرَ عَلَيهِ فَنادىٰ فِى الظُّلُمـٰتِ أَن لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا أَنتَ سُبحـٰنَكَ إِنّى كُنتُ مِنَ الظّـٰلِمينَ
2570.en: And We bestowed Our favour upon Dhu al#Nun. Recall, when he went forth enraged, thinking We have no power to take him to task. Eventually he cried out in the darkness:" There is no god but You. Glory be to You! I have done wrong."

2571.arabic: فَاستَجَبنا لَهُ وَنَجَّينـٰهُ مِنَ الغَمِّ وَكَذٰلِكَ نُـۨجِى المُؤمِنينَ
2571.en: Thereupon We accepted his prayer, and rescued him from grief. Thus do We rescue the believers.

2572.arabic: وَزَكَرِيّا إِذ نادىٰ رَبَّهُ رَبِّ لا تَذَرنى فَردًا وَأَنتَ خَيرُ الوٰرِثينَ
2572.en: And We bestowed favour upon Zechariah, when he cried to his Lord: "Lord! Leave me not solitary (without any issue). You are the Best Inheritor."

2573.arabic: فَاستَجَبنا لَهُ وَوَهَبنا لَهُ يَحيىٰ وَأَصلَحنا لَهُ زَوجَهُ إِنَّهُم كانوا يُسـٰرِعونَ فِى الخَيرٰتِ وَيَدعونَنا رَغَبًا وَرَهَبًا وَكانوا لَنا خـٰشِعينَ
2573.en: So We accepted his prayer and bestowed upon him John, and We made his wife fit (to bear a child). Verily they hastened in doing good works and called upon Us with longing and fear, and humbled themselves to Us.

2574.arabic: وَالَّتى أَحصَنَت فَرجَها فَنَفَخنا فيها مِن روحِنا وَجَعَلنـٰها وَابنَها ءايَةً لِلعـٰلَمينَ
2574.en: And also recall the woman who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her of Our spirit, and made her and her son a Sign to the whole world.

2575.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُم أُمَّةً وٰحِدَةً وَأَنا۠ رَبُّكُم فَاعبُدونِ
2575.en: Verily this community of yours is a single community, and I am your Lord; so worship Me.

2576.arabic: وَتَقَطَّعوا أَمرَهُم بَينَهُم كُلٌّ إِلَينا رٰجِعونَ
2576.en: But they tore asunder their faith into many parts. But to Us they are bound to return.

2577.arabic: فَمَن يَعمَل مِنَ الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَلا كُفرانَ لِسَعيِهِ وَإِنّا لَهُ كـٰتِبونَ
2577.en: Then whosoever does righteous works, while believing, his striving will not go unappreciated. We record them all for him.

2578.arabic: وَحَرٰمٌ عَلىٰ قَريَةٍ أَهلَكنـٰها أَنَّهُم لا يَرجِعونَ
2578.en: It has been ordained against every town that We ever destroyed that they shall not return (to enjoy a new lease of life)

2579.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا فُتِحَت يَأجوجُ وَمَأجوجُ وَهُم مِن كُلِّ حَدَبٍ يَنسِلونَ
2579.en: until Gog and Magog are let loose, and begin swooping from every mound,

2580.arabic: وَاقتَرَبَ الوَعدُ الحَقُّ فَإِذا هِىَ شـٰخِصَةٌ أَبصـٰرُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا يـٰوَيلَنا قَد كُنّا فى غَفلَةٍ مِن هـٰذا بَل كُنّا ظـٰلِمينَ
2580.en: and the time for the fulfilment of the true promise of Allah draws near, whereupon the eyes of those who disbelieved will stare in fear, and they will say: "Woe to us, we were indeed heedless of this; nay, we were wrongdoers."

2581.arabic: إِنَّكُم وَما تَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنتُم لَها وٰرِدونَ
2581.en: (They will be told): "Verily you and the gods you worshipped beside Allah are the fuel of Hell. All of you are bound to arrive there.

2582.arabic: لَو كانَ هـٰؤُلاءِ ءالِهَةً ما وَرَدوها وَكُلٌّ فيها خـٰلِدونَ
2582.en: Had these indeed been gods they would not have gone there. But (as it is), all of you shall ever abide in it."

2583.arabic: لَهُم فيها زَفيرٌ وَهُم فيها لا يَسمَعونَ
2583.en: There they shall groan with anguish and the din and noise in Hell will not let them hear anything.

2584.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ سَبَقَت لَهُم مِنَّا الحُسنىٰ أُولـٰئِكَ عَنها مُبعَدونَ
2584.en: But for those whom We had decided to favour with good reward, they shall be kept far removed from Hell.

2585.arabic: لا يَسمَعونَ حَسيسَها وَهُم فى مَا اشتَهَت أَنفُسُهُم خـٰلِدونَ
2585.en: They shall not hear even a whisper of it, and they shall live for ever in the delights which they had desired.

2586.arabic: لا يَحزُنُهُمُ الفَزَعُ الأَكبَرُ وَتَتَلَقّىٰهُمُ المَلـٰئِكَةُ هـٰذا يَومُكُمُ الَّذى كُنتُم توعَدونَ
2586.en: The Hour of the Great Terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them saying: "This is your Day which you had been promised."

2587.arabic: يَومَ نَطوِى السَّماءَ كَطَىِّ السِّجِلِّ لِلكُتُبِ كَما بَدَأنا أَوَّلَ خَلقٍ نُعيدُهُ وَعدًا عَلَينا إِنّا كُنّا فـٰعِلينَ
2587.en: On that Day We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll for writing. Even as We originated the creation first so We shall repeat it. This is a promise binding on Us; and so We shall do.

2588.arabic: وَلَقَد كَتَبنا فِى الزَّبورِ مِن بَعدِ الذِّكرِ أَنَّ الأَرضَ يَرِثُها عِبادِىَ الصّـٰلِحونَ
2588.en: Surely We wrote in the Psalms, after the exhortation, that the earth shall be inherited by My righteous servants.

2589.arabic: إِنَّ فى هـٰذا لَبَلـٰغًا لِقَومٍ عـٰبِدينَ
2589.en: Herein, surely, is a message for those devoted to worship.

2590.en: We have sent you forth as nothing but mercy to people of the whole world.

2591.arabic: قُل إِنَّما يوحىٰ إِلَىَّ أَنَّما إِلـٰهُكُم إِلـٰهٌ وٰحِدٌ فَهَل أَنتُم مُسلِمونَ
2591.en: Say: "It is revealed to me that your God is only One God. Will you, then, submit to Him?"

2592.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَقُل ءاذَنتُكُم عَلىٰ سَواءٍ وَإِن أَدرى أَقَريبٌ أَم بَعيدٌ ما توعَدونَ
2592.en: If they turn away, say to them: "I have warned you all alike; and I cannot say whether what you have been promised is near or distant.

2593.arabic: إِنَّهُ يَعلَمُ الجَهرَ مِنَ القَولِ وَيَعلَمُ ما تَكتُمونَ
2593.en: Indeed He knows what you say loudly and what you hide.

2594.arabic: وَإِن أَدرى لَعَلَّهُ فِتنَةٌ لَكُم وَمَتـٰعٌ إِلىٰ حينٍ
2594.en: I think that this \[reprieve\] is possibly a trial for you, an opportunity to enjoy yourselves until an appointed time."

2595.arabic: قـٰلَ رَبِّ احكُم بِالحَقِّ وَرَبُّنَا الرَّحمـٰنُ المُستَعانُ عَلىٰ ما تَصِفونَ
2595.en: The Messenger said: "My Lord! Judge with truth. Our Compassionate Lord alone is our support against your (blasphemous) utterances."

2596.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا النّاسُ اتَّقوا رَبَّكُم إِنَّ زَلزَلَةَ السّاعَةِ شَىءٌ عَظيمٌ
2596.en: O mankind, fear the (wrath of) your Lord! Indeed, the earthquake of the Hour (of Judgement) will be an awesome thing.

2597.arabic: يَومَ تَرَونَها تَذهَلُ كُلُّ مُرضِعَةٍ عَمّا أَرضَعَت وَتَضَعُ كُلُّ ذاتِ حَملٍ حَملَها وَتَرَى النّاسَ سُكـٰرىٰ وَما هُم بِسُكـٰرىٰ وَلـٰكِنَّ عَذابَ اللَّهِ شَديدٌ
2597.en: On the Day when you witness it, the suckling woman shall utterly neglect the infant she suckles, and every pregnant woman shall cast her burden, and you will see people as though they are drunk, when they are not drunk; but dreadful shall be Allah's chastisement.

2598.arabic: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يُجـٰدِلُ فِى اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ وَيَتَّبِعُ كُلَّ شَيطـٰنٍ مَريدٍ
2598.en: Among people there are some who wrangle about Allah without knowledge and follow every rebellious devil,

2599.arabic: كُتِبَ عَلَيهِ أَنَّهُ مَن تَوَلّاهُ فَأَنَّهُ يُضِلُّهُ وَيَهديهِ إِلىٰ عَذابِ السَّعيرِ
2599.en: although it is decreed about him that he shall lead into error whosoever takes him for a friend, and will direct him to the torment of the Fire.

2600.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِن كُنتُم فى رَيبٍ مِنَ البَعثِ فَإِنّا خَلَقنـٰكُم مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُطفَةٍ ثُمَّ مِن عَلَقَةٍ ثُمَّ مِن مُضغَةٍ مُخَلَّقَةٍ وَغَيرِ مُخَلَّقَةٍ لِنُبَيِّنَ لَكُم وَنُقِرُّ فِى الأَرحامِ ما نَشاءُ إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ثُمَّ نُخرِجُكُم طِفلًا ثُمَّ لِتَبلُغوا أَشُدَّكُم وَمِنكُم مَن يُتَوَفّىٰ وَمِنكُم مَن يُرَدُّ إِلىٰ أَرذَلِ العُمُرِ لِكَيلا يَعلَمَ مِن بَعدِ عِلمٍ شَيـًٔا وَتَرَى الأَرضَ هامِدَةً فَإِذا أَنزَلنا عَلَيهَا الماءَ اهتَزَّت وَرَبَت وَأَنبَتَت مِن كُلِّ زَوجٍ بَهيجٍ
2600.en: O mankind! If you have any doubt concerning Resurrection, then know that it is surely We Who created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm, then from a clot of blood, then from a little lump of flesh, some of it shapely and other shapeless. (We are rehearsing this) that We may make the reality clear to you. We cause (the drop of sperm) that We please to remain in the wombs till an appointed time. We bring you forth as infants (and nurture you) that you may come of age. Among you is he that dies (at a young age) and he who is kept back to the most abject age so that after once having known, he reaches a stage when he knows nothing. You see the earth dry and barren and then no sooner than We send down water upon it, it begins to quiver and swell and brings forth every kind of beauteous vegetation.

2601.arabic: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الحَقُّ وَأَنَّهُ يُحىِ المَوتىٰ وَأَنَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ قَديرٌ
2601.en: All this is because Allah, He is the Truth, and because He resurrects the dead, and because He has power over everything,

2602.arabic: وَأَنَّ السّاعَةَ ءاتِيَةٌ لا رَيبَ فيها وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبعَثُ مَن فِى القُبورِ
2602.en: (all of which shows that) the Hour shall surely come to pass # in this there is no doubt # and Allah shall surely resurrect those that are in graves.

2603.arabic: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يُجـٰدِلُ فِى اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ وَلا هُدًى وَلا كِتـٰبٍ مُنيرٍ
2603.en: And among people are those that wrangle about Allah without knowledge, without any true guidance, and without any scripture to enlighten them.

2604.arabic: ثانِىَ عِطفِهِ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُ فِى الدُّنيا خِزىٌ وَنُذيقُهُ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ عَذابَ الحَريقِ
2604.en: They wrangle arrogantly, intent on leading people astray from the Way of Allah. Such shall suffer disgrace in this world and We shall cause them to taste the chastisement of burning (in the Next).

2605.arabic: ذٰلِكَ بِما قَدَّمَت يَداكَ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لَيسَ بِظَلّـٰمٍ لِلعَبيدِ
2605.en: That is the outcome of what your own hands have wrought, for Allah never wrongs His creatures.

2606.arabic: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يَعبُدُ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ حَرفٍ فَإِن أَصابَهُ خَيرٌ اطمَأَنَّ بِهِ وَإِن أَصابَتهُ فِتنَةٌ انقَلَبَ عَلىٰ وَجهِهِ خَسِرَ الدُّنيا وَالـٔاخِرَةَ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الخُسرانُ المُبينُ
2606.en: And among people is he who worships Allah on the borderline; if any good befalls him, he is satisfied; but if a trial afflicts him, he utterly turns away. He will incur the loss of this world and the Hereafter. That indeed is a clear loss.

2607.arabic: يَدعوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَضُرُّهُ وَما لا يَنفَعُهُ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الضَّلـٰلُ البَعيدُ
2607.en: He invokes, instead of Allah, those who can neither harm nor benefit him. That indeed is straying far away.

2608.arabic: يَدعوا لَمَن ضَرُّهُ أَقرَبُ مِن نَفعِهِ لَبِئسَ المَولىٰ وَلَبِئسَ العَشيرُ
2608.en: He invokes those that are more likely to cause him harm than benefit. Such is surely an evil patron, and an evil associate.

2609.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدخِلُ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ جَنّـٰتٍ تَجرى مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهـٰرُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفعَلُ ما يُريدُ
2609.en: (In contrast) Allah will assuredly cause those who believe and act righteously to enter Gardens beneath which rivers flow. For, most certainly, Allah does whatever He pleases.

2610.arabic: مَن كانَ يَظُنُّ أَن لَن يَنصُرَهُ اللَّهُ فِى الدُّنيا وَالـٔاخِرَةِ فَليَمدُد بِسَبَبٍ إِلَى السَّماءِ ثُمَّ ليَقطَع فَليَنظُر هَل يُذهِبَنَّ كَيدُهُ ما يَغيظُ
2610.en: Anyone who fancies that Allah will not support him in this world and in the Hereafter, let him reach out to heaven through a rope, and then make a hole in the sky and see whether his device can avert that which enrages him.

2611.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَنزَلنـٰهُ ءايـٰتٍ بَيِّنـٰتٍ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَهدى مَن يُريدُ
2611.en: Even so We have revealed the Qur'an with Clear Signs. Verily Allah guides whomsoever He wills.

2612.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَالَّذينَ هادوا وَالصّـٰبِـٔينَ وَالنَّصـٰرىٰ وَالمَجوسَ وَالَّذينَ أَشرَكوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفصِلُ بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ شَهيدٌ
2612.en: On the Day of Resurrection Allah will most certainly judge among those who believe, and those who became Jews, and Sabaeans, and Christians, and Magians, and those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity. Surely Allah watches over everything.

2613.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَسجُدُ لَهُ مَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَمَن فِى الأَرضِ وَالشَّمسُ وَالقَمَرُ وَالنُّجومُ وَالجِبالُ وَالشَّجَرُ وَالدَّوابُّ وَكَثيرٌ مِنَ النّاسِ وَكَثيرٌ حَقَّ عَلَيهِ العَذابُ وَمَن يُهِنِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن مُكرِمٍ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفعَلُ ما يَشاءُ
2613.en: Have you not seen that all those who are in the heavens and all those who are in the earth prostrate themselves before Allah; and so do the sun and the moon, and the stars and the mountains, and the trees, and the beasts, and so do many human beings, and even many of those who are condemned to chastisement? And he whom Allah humiliates, none can give him honour. Allah does whatever He wills.

2614.arabic: هـٰذانِ خَصمانِ اختَصَموا فى رَبِّهِم فَالَّذينَ كَفَروا قُطِّعَت لَهُم ثِيابٌ مِن نارٍ يُصَبُّ مِن فَوقِ رُءوسِهِمُ الحَميمُ
2614.en: These two groups (the believers and unbelievers) are in dispute about their Lord. As for those that disbelieve, garments of fire have been cut out for them; boiling water shall be poured down over their heads,

2615.arabic: يُصهَرُ بِهِ ما فى بُطونِهِم وَالجُلودُ
2615.en: causing (not only) their skins but all that is in their bellies as well to melt away.

2616.en: There shall be maces of iron to lash them.

2617.arabic: كُلَّما أَرادوا أَن يَخرُجوا مِنها مِن غَمٍّ أُعيدوا فيها وَذوقوا عَذابَ الحَريقِ
2617.en: Whenever they try, in their anguish, to escape from Hell, they will be driven back into it, (and shall be told): "Now taste the torment of burning."

2618.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدخِلُ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ جَنّـٰتٍ تَجرى مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهـٰرُ يُحَلَّونَ فيها مِن أَساوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَلُؤلُؤًا وَلِباسُهُم فيها حَريرٌ
2618.en: (On the other hand), Allah will cause those who believed and acted righteously to enter the Gardens beneath which rivers flow. They shall be decked in them with bracelets of gold and pearls and their raiment shall be of silk.

2619.arabic: وَهُدوا إِلَى الطَّيِّبِ مِنَ القَولِ وَهُدوا إِلىٰ صِرٰطِ الحَميدِ
2619.en: They were guided (to accept) the pure word; they were guided to the Way of the Praiseworthy (Lord).

2620.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَيَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَالمَسجِدِ الحَرامِ الَّذى جَعَلنـٰهُ لِلنّاسِ سَواءً العـٰكِفُ فيهِ وَالبادِ وَمَن يُرِد فيهِ بِإِلحادٍ بِظُلمٍ نُذِقهُ مِن عَذابٍ أَليمٍ
2620.en: Indeed those who disbelieve and who (now) hinder people from the Way of Allah and hinder them from the Holy Mosque which We have set up (as a place of worship) for all people, equally for those who dwell therein and for those who come from outside, (they surely deserve punishment). Whosoever deviates therein from the Right Way and acts with iniquity, We shall cause him to taste a painful chastisement.

2621.arabic: وَإِذ بَوَّأنا لِإِبرٰهيمَ مَكانَ البَيتِ أَن لا تُشرِك بى شَيـًٔا وَطَهِّر بَيتِىَ لِلطّائِفينَ وَالقائِمينَ وَالرُّكَّعِ السُّجودِ
2621.en: Call to mind when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House (Kabah), directing him: "Do not associate aught with Me" and "Keep My House pure for those who walk around it, and for those who stand and who bow down and who prostrate themselves (in worship),

2622.arabic: وَأَذِّن فِى النّاسِ بِالحَجِّ يَأتوكَ رِجالًا وَعَلىٰ كُلِّ ضامِرٍ يَأتينَ مِن كُلِّ فَجٍّ عَميقٍ
2622.en: and publicly proclaim Pilgrimage for all mankind so that they come to you on foot and mounted on lean camels from every distant point

2623.arabic: لِيَشهَدوا مَنـٰفِعَ لَهُم وَيَذكُرُوا اسمَ اللَّهِ فى أَيّامٍ مَعلومـٰتٍ عَلىٰ ما رَزَقَهُم مِن بَهيمَةِ الأَنعـٰمِ فَكُلوا مِنها وَأَطعِمُوا البائِسَ الفَقيرَ
2623.en: to witness the benefits in store for them, and pronounce the name of Allah during the appointed days over the cattle that He has provided them. So eat of it and feed the distressed and the needy.

2624.arabic: ثُمَّ ليَقضوا تَفَثَهُم وَليوفوا نُذورَهُم وَليَطَّوَّفوا بِالبَيتِ العَتيقِ
2624.en: Thereafter, let them tidy up and fulfil their vows and circumambulate the Ancient House."

2625.arabic: ذٰلِكَ وَمَن يُعَظِّم حُرُمـٰتِ اللَّهِ فَهُوَ خَيرٌ لَهُ عِندَ رَبِّهِ وَأُحِلَّت لَكُمُ الأَنعـٰمُ إِلّا ما يُتلىٰ عَلَيكُم فَاجتَنِبُوا الرِّجسَ مِنَ الأَوثـٰنِ وَاجتَنِبوا قَولَ الزّورِ
2625.en: Such (was the purpose of building the Kabah). Whosoever, then, venerates Allah's sanctities will find it to be good for him in the sight of his Lord. Cattle have been made lawful for you except those mentioned to you (as unlawful). So shun the abomination of idols and shun all words of falsehood.

2626.arabic: حُنَفاءَ لِلَّهِ غَيرَ مُشرِكينَ بِهِ وَمَن يُشرِك بِاللَّهِ فَكَأَنَّما خَرَّ مِنَ السَّماءِ فَتَخطَفُهُ الطَّيرُ أَو تَهوى بِهِ الرّيحُ فى مَكانٍ سَحيقٍ
2626.en: Become exclusively devoted to Allah, ascribing Divinity to none other than Him. Whoso ascribes Divinity to aught beside Allah, it is as though he fell down from the sky whereafter either the birds will snatch him away, or the wind will sweep him to a distant place (causing him to be shattered to pieces).

2627.arabic: ذٰلِكَ وَمَن يُعَظِّم شَعـٰئِرَ اللَّهِ فَإِنَّها مِن تَقوَى القُلوبِ
2627.en: Such is the fact. And whoso venerates the sanctity of all that have been ordained as symbols of Allah surely does so because it is part of the true piety of the hearts.

2628.arabic: لَكُم فيها مَنـٰفِعُ إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ثُمَّ مَحِلُّها إِلَى البَيتِ العَتيقِ
2628.en: You may derive benefit (from sacrificial animals) until an appointed time. Thereafter their place (of sacrifice) is near the Ancient House.

2629.arabic: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ جَعَلنا مَنسَكًا لِيَذكُرُوا اسمَ اللَّهِ عَلىٰ ما رَزَقَهُم مِن بَهيمَةِ الأَنعـٰمِ فَإِلـٰهُكُم إِلـٰهٌ وٰحِدٌ فَلَهُ أَسلِموا وَبَشِّرِ المُخبِتينَ
2629.en: For every people We have laid down a ritual of sacrifice(# although the purpose of the ritual is the same #)that they pronounce the name of Allah over the cattle He has provided them. Your Lord is One God; so submit yourselves to Him alone. And give, (O Prophet), glad tidings to those that humble themselves (before Allah),

2630.arabic: الَّذينَ إِذا ذُكِرَ اللَّهُ وَجِلَت قُلوبُهُم وَالصّـٰبِرينَ عَلىٰ ما أَصابَهُم وَالمُقيمِى الصَّلوٰةِ وَمِمّا رَزَقنـٰهُم يُنفِقونَ
2630.en: whose hearts shiver whenever Allah is mentioned, who patiently bear whatever affliction comes to them, who establish Prayer, and who spend (for good purposes) out of what We have provided them.

2631.arabic: وَالبُدنَ جَعَلنـٰها لَكُم مِن شَعـٰئِرِ اللَّهِ لَكُم فيها خَيرٌ فَاذكُرُوا اسمَ اللَّهِ عَلَيها صَوافَّ فَإِذا وَجَبَت جُنوبُها فَكُلوا مِنها وَأَطعِمُوا القانِعَ وَالمُعتَرَّ كَذٰلِكَ سَخَّرنـٰها لَكُم لَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
2631.en: We have appointed sacrificial camels among the symbols of (devotion to) Allah. There is much good in them for you. So make them stand (at the time of sacrifice) and pronounce the name of Allah over them, and when they fall down on their sides (after they are slaughtered), eat and also feed them who do not ask and those who ask. Thus have We subjected these animals that you may give thanks.

2632.arabic: لَن يَنالَ اللَّهَ لُحومُها وَلا دِماؤُها وَلـٰكِن يَنالُهُ التَّقوىٰ مِنكُم كَذٰلِكَ سَخَّرَها لَكُم لِتُكَبِّرُوا اللَّهَ عَلىٰ ما هَدىٰكُم وَبَشِّرِ المُحسِنينَ
2632.en: Neither their flesh reaches Allah nor their blood; it is your piety that reaches Him. He has subjected these animals (to you) that you may magnify Allah for the guidance He has bestowed upon you. Give glad tidings, (O Prophet), to those who do good.

2633.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدٰفِعُ عَنِ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ خَوّانٍ كَفورٍ
2633.en: Surely Allah defends those who believe. Certainly Allah has no love for the perfidious, the thankless.

2634.arabic: أُذِنَ لِلَّذينَ يُقـٰتَلونَ بِأَنَّهُم ظُلِموا وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ نَصرِهِم لَقَديرٌ
2634.en: Permission (to fight) has been granted to those for they have been wronged. Verily Allah has the power to help them:

2635.arabic: الَّذينَ أُخرِجوا مِن دِيـٰرِهِم بِغَيرِ حَقٍّ إِلّا أَن يَقولوا رَبُّنَا اللَّهُ وَلَولا دَفعُ اللَّهِ النّاسَ بَعضَهُم بِبَعضٍ لَهُدِّمَت صَوٰمِعُ وَبِيَعٌ وَصَلَوٰتٌ وَمَسـٰجِدُ يُذكَرُ فيهَا اسمُ اللَّهِ كَثيرًا وَلَيَنصُرَنَّ اللَّهُ مَن يَنصُرُهُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَقَوِىٌّ عَزيزٌ
2635.en: those who were unjustly expelled from their homes for no other reason than their saying: "Allah is Our Lord." If Allah were not to repel some through others, monasteries and churches and synagogues and mosques wherein the name of Allah is much mentioned, would certainly have been pulled down. Allah will most certainly help those who will help Him. Verily Allah is Immensely Strong, Overwhelmingly Mighty.

2636.arabic: الَّذينَ إِن مَكَّنّـٰهُم فِى الأَرضِ أَقامُوا الصَّلوٰةَ وَءاتَوُا الزَّكوٰةَ وَأَمَروا بِالمَعروفِ وَنَهَوا عَنِ المُنكَرِ وَلِلَّهِ عـٰقِبَةُ الأُمورِ
2636.en: (Allah will certainly help) those who, were We to bestow authority on them in the land, will establish Prayers, render Zakah, enjoin good, and forbid evil. The end of all matters rests with Allah.

2637.arabic: وَإِن يُكَذِّبوكَ فَقَد كَذَّبَت قَبلَهُم قَومُ نوحٍ وَعادٌ وَثَمودُ
2637.en: (O Prophet), if they give the lie to you, then before them the people of 'Ad and Thamud, also gave the lie (to the Prophets),

2638.en: and so too did the people of Abraham and the people of Lot;

2639.arabic: وَأَصحـٰبُ مَديَنَ وَكُذِّبَ موسىٰ فَأَملَيتُ لِلكـٰفِرينَ ثُمَّ أَخَذتُهُم فَكَيفَ كانَ نَكيرِ
2639.en: and so did the dwellers of Midian, and Moses too was branded a liar. Initially I granted respite to the unbelievers for a while and then seized them. How dreadful was My punishment!

2640.arabic: فَكَأَيِّن مِن قَريَةٍ أَهلَكنـٰها وَهِىَ ظالِمَةٌ فَهِىَ خاوِيَةٌ عَلىٰ عُروشِها وَبِئرٍ مُعَطَّلَةٍ وَقَصرٍ مَشيدٍ
2640.en: How many towns have We destroyed because their people were steeped in iniquity: so they lie fallen down upon their turrets! How many wells lie deserted; and how many towering palaces lie in ruins!

2641.arabic: أَفَلَم يَسيروا فِى الأَرضِ فَتَكونَ لَهُم قُلوبٌ يَعقِلونَ بِها أَو ءاذانٌ يَسمَعونَ بِها فَإِنَّها لا تَعمَى الأَبصـٰرُ وَلـٰكِن تَعمَى القُلوبُ الَّتى فِى الصُّدورِ
2641.en: Have they not journeyed in the land that their hearts might understand and their ears might listen? For indeed it is not the eyes that are blinded; it is rather the hearts in the breasts that are rendered blind.

2642.arabic: وَيَستَعجِلونَكَ بِالعَذابِ وَلَن يُخلِفَ اللَّهُ وَعدَهُ وَإِنَّ يَومًا عِندَ رَبِّكَ كَأَلفِ سَنَةٍ مِمّا تَعُدّونَ
2642.en: They ask you to hasten the punishment. Allah shall most certainly not fail His promise; but a Day with your Lord is as a thousand years of your reckoning.

2643.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِن قَريَةٍ أَملَيتُ لَها وَهِىَ ظالِمَةٌ ثُمَّ أَخَذتُها وَإِلَىَّ المَصيرُ
2643.en: How many towns did I respite at first though they were steeped in iniquity, and then I seized them! To Me are all destined to return.

2644.arabic: قُل يـٰأَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِنَّما أَنا۠ لَكُم نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
2644.en: Say (O Muhammad): "O people! I have been sent to you only as a plain warner (before the Doom strikes you)."

2645.arabic: فَالَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَرِزقٌ كَريمٌ
2645.en: So those who believe and act righteously shall be granted forgiveness and an honourable sustenance,

2646.arabic: وَالَّذينَ سَعَوا فى ءايـٰتِنا مُعـٰجِزينَ أُولـٰئِكَ أَصحـٰبُ الجَحيمِ
2646.en: whereas those who strive against Our Signs, seeking to profane them, they are the friends of the Fire!

2647.arabic: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ مِن رَسولٍ وَلا نَبِىٍّ إِلّا إِذا تَمَنّىٰ أَلقَى الشَّيطـٰنُ فى أُمنِيَّتِهِ فَيَنسَخُ اللَّهُ ما يُلقِى الشَّيطـٰنُ ثُمَّ يُحكِمُ اللَّهُ ءايـٰتِهِ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
2647.en: Never did We send a Messenger or a Prophet before you (O Muhammad), but that whenever he had a desire, Satan interfered with that desire. Allah eradicates the interference of Satan and strengthens His Signs. Allah is All#Knowing, All#Wise.

2648.arabic: لِيَجعَلَ ما يُلقِى الشَّيطـٰنُ فِتنَةً لِلَّذينَ فى قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ وَالقاسِيَةِ قُلوبُهُم وَإِنَّ الظّـٰلِمينَ لَفى شِقاقٍ بَعيدٍ
2648.en: (He does this) in order that He may make the evil caused by Satan a trial for those in whose hearts there is sickness (of hypocrisy), whose hearts are hard (and vitiated). Surely these wrong#doers have gone too far in their dissension.

2649.arabic: وَلِيَعلَمَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ أَنَّهُ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ فَيُؤمِنوا بِهِ فَتُخبِتَ لَهُ قُلوبُهُم وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهادِ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا إِلىٰ صِرٰطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
2649.en: (He also does this) in order that those endowed with knowledge may know that it is the Truth from your Lord and that they may have faith in it and their hearts may humble themselves before Him. Verily Allah always directs those that believe to the Right Way.

2650.arabic: وَلا يَزالُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا فى مِريَةٍ مِنهُ حَتّىٰ تَأتِيَهُمُ السّاعَةُ بَغتَةً أَو يَأتِيَهُم عَذابُ يَومٍ عَقيمٍ
2650.en: The unbelievers will not cease to be in doubt about it until the Hour suddenly comes upon them, or the chastisement of an ominous day overtakes them.

2651.arabic: المُلكُ يَومَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ يَحكُمُ بَينَهُم فَالَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ فى جَنّـٰتِ النَّعيمِ
2651.en: On that Day all sovereignty shall be Allah's and He will judge among them. Then those who believed and acted righteously shall be in Gardens of Bliss.

2652.arabic: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا وَكَذَّبوا بِـٔايـٰتِنا فَأُولـٰئِكَ لَهُم عَذابٌ مُهينٌ
2652.en: A humiliating chastisement awaits those who disbelieved and denied Our Signs.

2653.arabic: وَالَّذينَ هاجَروا فى سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ قُتِلوا أَو ماتوا لَيَرزُقَنَّهُمُ اللَّهُ رِزقًا حَسَنًا وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُوَ خَيرُ الرّٰزِقينَ
2653.en: As for those who migrated in the way of Allah, whereafter they were slain, or died, Allah will certainly grant them a goodly provision. Indeed, Allah is the Best of all those who provide.

2654.arabic: لَيُدخِلَنَّهُم مُدخَلًا يَرضَونَهُ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَعَليمٌ حَليمٌ
2654.en: He will surely admit them to a resort which will please them. Most certainly Allah is All#Knowing, Most Forbearing.

2655.arabic: ذٰلِكَ وَمَن عاقَبَ بِمِثلِ ما عوقِبَ بِهِ ثُمَّ بُغِىَ عَلَيهِ لَيَنصُرَنَّهُ اللَّهُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفورٌ
2655.en: That indeed is so, as for him who retaliates in proportion to the excess committed against him, and is thereafter again subjected to transgression, Allah will surely aid him. Verily Allah is All#Pardoning, All#Forgiving.

2656.arabic: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يولِجُ الَّيلَ فِى النَّهارِ وَيولِجُ النَّهارَ فِى الَّيلِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ بَصيرٌ
2656.en: So shall it be because it is Allah Who causes the night to emerge out of the day and causes the day to emerge out of the night and Allah is All#Hearing, All#Seeing.

2657.arabic: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الحَقُّ وَأَنَّ ما يَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ هُوَ البـٰطِلُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ العَلِىُّ الكَبيرُ
2657.en: So shall it be because Allah, He is the Truth, and all whom they invoke instead of Him are false. Allah is Most High, All#Great.

2658.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَتُصبِحُ الأَرضُ مُخضَرَّةً إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَطيفٌ خَبيرٌ
2658.en: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky whereby the earth turns green? Verily Allah is Subtle, All#Aware.

2659.arabic: لَهُ ما فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَما فِى الأَرضِ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُوَ الغَنِىُّ الحَميدُ
2659.en: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Surely Allah # He alone is Self# Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

2660.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم ما فِى الأَرضِ وَالفُلكَ تَجرى فِى البَحرِ بِأَمرِهِ وَيُمسِكُ السَّماءَ أَن تَقَعَ عَلَى الأَرضِ إِلّا بِإِذنِهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِالنّاسِ لَرَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
2660.en: Have you not seen how Allah has subjected to you all that is in the earth, and the vessels that sail in the sea by His command, and it is He Who holds back the sky that it may not fall on earth except by His leave? Surely Allah is Most Gentle, Ever Compassionate to people.

2661.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى أَحياكُم ثُمَّ يُميتُكُم ثُمَّ يُحييكُم إِنَّ الإِنسـٰنَ لَكَفورٌ
2661.en: And it is He Who has endowed you with life and it is He who causes you to die, and it is He Who will then resurrect you. Man is indeed extremely prone to denying the Truth.

2662.arabic: لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ جَعَلنا مَنسَكًا هُم ناسِكوهُ فَلا يُنـٰزِعُنَّكَ فِى الأَمرِ وَادعُ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ إِنَّكَ لَعَلىٰ هُدًى مُستَقيمٍ
2662.en: For every people We have prescribed a way of worship which they follow. So, (O Muhammad), let them not dispute with you concerning this, and call them to Your Lord. You are certainly on the Straight Way.

2663.arabic: وَإِن جـٰدَلوكَ فَقُلِ اللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما تَعمَلونَ
2663.en: And if they dispute with you, say: "Allah knows well what you do.

2664.arabic: اللَّهُ يَحكُمُ بَينَكُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ فيما كُنتُم فيهِ تَختَلِفونَ
2664.en: Allah will judge among you on the Day of Resurrection concerning matters about which you disagreed."

2665.arabic: أَلَم تَعلَم أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ ما فِى السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ فى كِتـٰبٍ إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسيرٌ
2665.en: Are you not aware that Allah knows all that is in the heaven and the earth? Surely it is all preserved in a Book. Indeed that is easy with Allah.

2666.arabic: وَيَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لَم يُنَزِّل بِهِ سُلطـٰنًا وَما لَيسَ لَهُم بِهِ عِلمٌ وَما لِلظّـٰلِمينَ مِن نَصيرٍ
2666.en: Instead of Allah they worship those concerning whom He has revealed no sanction and concerning whom they have no true knowledge. None shall be able to help such evil#doers.

2667.arabic: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم ءايـٰتُنا بَيِّنـٰتٍ تَعرِفُ فى وُجوهِ الَّذينَ كَفَرُوا المُنكَرَ يَكادونَ يَسطونَ بِالَّذينَ يَتلونَ عَلَيهِم ءايـٰتِنا قُل أَفَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِشَرٍّ مِن ذٰلِكُمُ النّارُ وَعَدَهَا اللَّهُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
2667.en: When Our Signs are plainly recited to them, you will perceive utter repugnance on their faces and it all but seems as if they will soon pounce upon those who recite Our Signs to them. Say: "Shall I tell you what is worse than that? The Fire with which Allah has threatened those who disbelieve. That is truly an evil end."

2668.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا النّاسُ ضُرِبَ مَثَلٌ فَاستَمِعوا لَهُ إِنَّ الَّذينَ تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ لَن يَخلُقوا ذُبابًا وَلَوِ اجتَمَعوا لَهُ وَإِن يَسلُبهُمُ الذُّبابُ شَيـًٔا لا يَستَنقِذوهُ مِنهُ ضَعُفَ الطّالِبُ وَالمَطلوبُ
2668.en: O people, a parable is set forth: pay heed to it. Those who call upon aught other than Allah shall never be able to create even a fly, even if all of them were to come together to do that. And if the fly were to snatch away anything from them, they would not be able to recover that from it. Powerless is the supplicant; and powerless is he to whom he supplicates.

2669.arabic: ما قَدَرُوا اللَّهَ حَقَّ قَدرِهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَقَوِىٌّ عَزيزٌ
2669.en: They have not formed a true estimate of Allah. Indeed, Allah is All#Powerful, All#Mighty.

2670.arabic: اللَّهُ يَصطَفى مِنَ المَلـٰئِكَةِ رُسُلًا وَمِنَ النّاسِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ بَصيرٌ
2670.en: Allah chooses Messengers from among angels and from among human beings (to convey His command). Allah is All#Hearing, All#Seeing.

2671.arabic: يَعلَمُ ما بَينَ أَيديهِم وَما خَلفَهُم وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرجَعُ الأُمورُ
2671.en: He knows all that is before them and that which is hidden from them. And it is to Allah that all affairs are returned.

2672.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا الَّذينَ ءامَنُوا اركَعوا وَاسجُدوا وَاعبُدوا رَبَّكُم وَافعَلُوا الخَيرَ لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ
2672.en: Believers, bow down and prostrate yourselves before Your Lord and serve Your Lord and do good that you may prosper.

2673.arabic: وَجـٰهِدوا فِى اللَّهِ حَقَّ جِهادِهِ هُوَ اجتَبىٰكُم وَما جَعَلَ عَلَيكُم فِى الدّينِ مِن حَرَجٍ مِلَّةَ أَبيكُم إِبرٰهيمَ هُوَ سَمّىٰكُمُ المُسلِمينَ مِن قَبلُ وَفى هـٰذا لِيَكونَ الرَّسولُ شَهيدًا عَلَيكُم وَتَكونوا شُهَداءَ عَلَى النّاسِ فَأَقيمُوا الصَّلوٰةَ وَءاتُوا الزَّكوٰةَ وَاعتَصِموا بِاللَّهِ هُوَ مَولىٰكُم فَنِعمَ المَولىٰ وَنِعمَ النَّصيرُ
2673.en: Strive in the cause of Allah in a manner worthy of that striving. He has chosen you (for His task), and He has not laid upon you any hardship in religion. Keep to the faith of your father Abraham. Allah named you Muslims earlier and even in this (Book), that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over all mankind. So establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector; what an excellent Helper!

2674.en: The believers have indeed attained true success:

2675.en: those who, in their Prayers, humble themselves;

2676.en: who avoid whatever is vain and frivolous;

2678.en: who strictly guard their private parts

2679.arabic: إِلّا عَلىٰ أَزوٰجِهِم أَو ما مَلَكَت أَيمـٰنُهُم فَإِنَّهُم غَيرُ مَلومينَ
2679.en: save from their wives, or those whom their right hands possess; for with regard to them they are free from blame "

2680.arabic: فَمَنِ ابتَغىٰ وَراءَ ذٰلِكَ فَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ العادونَ
2680.en: As for those who seek beyond that, they are transgressors"

2681.en: who are true to their trusts and their covenants,

2684.arabic: الَّذينَ يَرِثونَ الفِردَوسَ هُم فيها خـٰلِدونَ
2684.en: that shall inherit Paradise; and in it they shall abide for ever.

2685.arabic: وَلَقَد خَلَقنَا الإِنسـٰنَ مِن سُلـٰلَةٍ مِن طينٍ
2685.en: We created man out of the extract of clay,

2686.arabic: ثُمَّ جَعَلنـٰهُ نُطفَةً فى قَرارٍ مَكينٍ
2686.en: then We made him into a drop of life#germ, then We placed it in a safe depository,

2687.arabic: ثُمَّ خَلَقنَا النُّطفَةَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقنَا العَلَقَةَ مُضغَةً فَخَلَقنَا المُضغَةَ عِظـٰمًا فَكَسَونَا العِظـٰمَ لَحمًا ثُمَّ أَنشَأنـٰهُ خَلقًا ءاخَرَ فَتَبارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحسَنُ الخـٰلِقينَ
2687.en: then We made this drop into a clot, then We made the clot into a lump, then We made the lump into bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh, and then We caused it to grow into another creation. Thus Most Blessed is Allah, the Best of all those that create.

2688.en: Thereafter you are destined to die,

2689.en: and then on the Day of Resurrection you shall certainly be raised up.

2690.arabic: وَلَقَد خَلَقنا فَوقَكُم سَبعَ طَرائِقَ وَما كُنّا عَنِ الخَلقِ غـٰفِلينَ
2690.en: We have indeed fashioned above you seven paths. Never were We unaware of the task of creation.

2691.arabic: وَأَنزَلنا مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً بِقَدَرٍ فَأَسكَنّـٰهُ فِى الأَرضِ وَإِنّا عَلىٰ ذَهابٍ بِهِ لَقـٰدِرونَ
2691.en: We sent down water from the sky in right measure, and caused it to stay in the earth, and We have the power to cause it to vanish (in the manner We please).

2692.arabic: فَأَنشَأنا لَكُم بِهِ جَنّـٰتٍ مِن نَخيلٍ وَأَعنـٰبٍ لَكُم فيها فَوٰكِهُ كَثيرَةٌ وَمِنها تَأكُلونَ
2692.en: Then through water We caused gardens of date#palms and vines to grow for you wherein you have an abundance of delicious fruits and from them you derive your livelihood.

2693.arabic: وَشَجَرَةً تَخرُجُ مِن طورِ سَيناءَ تَنبُتُ بِالدُّهنِ وَصِبغٍ لِلـٔاكِلينَ
2693.en: And We also produced the tree which springs forth from Mount Sinai, containing oil and sauce for those that eat.

2694.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكُم فِى الأَنعـٰمِ لَعِبرَةً نُسقيكُم مِمّا فى بُطونِها وَلَكُم فيها مَنـٰفِعُ كَثيرَةٌ وَمِنها تَأكُلونَ
2694.en: And indeed there is also a lesson for you in cattle. We provide you with drink out of what they have in their bellies; and you have many other benefits in them: you eat of them,

2695.en: and are carried on them and also on ships.

2696.arabic: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا نوحًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِ فَقالَ يـٰقَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلـٰهٍ غَيرُهُ أَفَلا تَتَّقونَ
2696.en: We sent Noah to his people, and he said: "My people! Serve Allah; you have no deity other than He. Do you have no fear?"

2697.arabic: فَقالَ المَلَؤُا۟ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن قَومِهِ ما هـٰذا إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم يُريدُ أَن يَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَيكُم وَلَو شاءَ اللَّهُ لَأَنزَلَ مَلـٰئِكَةً ما سَمِعنا بِهـٰذا فى ءابائِنَا الأَوَّلينَ
2697.en: But the notables among his people had refused to believe, and said: "This is none other than a mortal like yourselves who desires to attain superiority over you. Had Allah wanted (to send any Messengers) He would have sent down angels. We have heard nothing like this in the time of our forebears of old (that humans were sent as Messengers).

2698.arabic: إِن هُوَ إِلّا رَجُلٌ بِهِ جِنَّةٌ فَتَرَبَّصوا بِهِ حَتّىٰ حينٍ
2698.en: He is a person who has been seized with a little madness; so wait for a while (perhaps he will improve)."

2699.en: Noah said: "My Lord! Come to my help at their accusation that I am lying."

2700.arabic: فَأَوحَينا إِلَيهِ أَنِ اصنَعِ الفُلكَ بِأَعيُنِنا وَوَحيِنا فَإِذا جاءَ أَمرُنا وَفارَ التَّنّورُ فَاسلُك فيها مِن كُلٍّ زَوجَينِ اثنَينِ وَأَهلَكَ إِلّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيهِ القَولُ مِنهُم وَلا تُخـٰطِبنى فِى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا إِنَّهُم مُغرَقونَ
2700.en: Thereupon We revealed to him, saying: "Build the Ark under Our eyes and according to Our revelation. And when Our command comes to pass and the oven boils over, take on board a pair each from every species, and also take your household except those of them against whom sentence has already been passed and do not plead to Me on behalf of the wrong#doers. They are doomed to be drowned.

2701.arabic: فَإِذَا استَوَيتَ أَنتَ وَمَن مَعَكَ عَلَى الفُلكِ فَقُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذى نَجّىٰنا مِنَ القَومِ الظّـٰلِمينَ
2701.en: And then when you and those accompanying you are firmly seated in the Ark, say: "Thanks be to Allah Who has delivered us from the wrong#doing people."

2702.arabic: وَقُل رَبِّ أَنزِلنى مُنزَلًا مُبارَكًا وَأَنتَ خَيرُ المُنزِلينَ
2702.en: And say: "My Lord! Make my landing a blessed landing, for You are the Best of those Who can cause people to land in safety."

2703.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايـٰتٍ وَإِن كُنّا لَمُبتَلينَ
2703.en: There are great Signs in this story; and surely We do put people to test.

2704.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنشَأنا مِن بَعدِهِم قَرنًا ءاخَرينَ
2704.en: Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;

2705.arabic: فَأَرسَلنا فيهِم رَسولًا مِنهُم أَنِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلـٰهٍ غَيرُهُ أَفَلا تَتَّقونَ
2705.en: and We sent among them a Messenger from among themselves, saying: "Serve Allah; you have no god other than He. Do you have no fear?"

2706.arabic: وَقالَ المَلَأُ مِن قَومِهِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَكَذَّبوا بِلِقاءِ الـٔاخِرَةِ وَأَترَفنـٰهُم فِى الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا ما هـٰذا إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم يَأكُلُ مِمّا تَأكُلونَ مِنهُ وَيَشرَبُ مِمّا تَشرَبونَ
2706.en: The notables among his people who had refused to believe and who denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and those whom We had endowed with ease and comfort in this life, cried out: "This is no other than a mortal like yourselves who eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.

2707.arabic: وَلَئِن أَطَعتُم بَشَرًا مِثلَكُم إِنَّكُم إِذًا لَخـٰسِرونَ
2707.en: If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, you will certainly be losers.

2708.arabic: أَيَعِدُكُم أَنَّكُم إِذا مِتُّم وَكُنتُم تُرابًا وَعِظـٰمًا أَنَّكُم مُخرَجونَ
2708.en: Does he promise you that when you are dead and are reduced to dust and bones, you will be brought forth to life?

2709.en: Far#fetched, utterly far#fetched is what you are being promised.

2710.arabic: إِن هِىَ إِلّا حَياتُنَا الدُّنيا نَموتُ وَنَحيا وَما نَحنُ بِمَبعوثينَ
2710.en: There is no other life than the life of the world. We shall live here and here shall we die; and we are not going to be raised again.

2711.arabic: إِن هُوَ إِلّا رَجُلٌ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا وَما نَحنُ لَهُ بِمُؤمِنينَ
2711.en: This man has forged a mere lie in the name of Allah and we shall never believe what he says."

2712.en: The Messenger said: "My Lord! Come to my help at their accusing me of lying."

2713.en: He answered: "A short while, and they shall be repenting."

2714.arabic: فَأَخَذَتهُمُ الصَّيحَةُ بِالحَقِّ فَجَعَلنـٰهُم غُثاءً فَبُعدًا لِلقَومِ الظّـٰلِمينَ
2714.en: Then a mighty blast quite justly overtook them, and We reduced them to a rubble. So away with the wrong#doing folk!

2715.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنشَأنا مِن بَعدِهِم قُرونًا ءاخَرينَ
2715.en: Then, after them, We brought forth other generations.

2716.arabic: ما تَسبِقُ مِن أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَها وَما يَستَـٔخِرونَ
2716.en: No nation can outstrip its term, nor can it put it back.

2717.arabic: ثُمَّ أَرسَلنا رُسُلَنا تَترا كُلَّ ما جاءَ أُمَّةً رَسولُها كَذَّبوهُ فَأَتبَعنا بَعضَهُم بَعضًا وَجَعَلنـٰهُم أَحاديثَ فَبُعدًا لِقَومٍ لا يُؤمِنونَ
2717.en: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Whenever a Messenger came to his people they rejected him, calling him a liar. Thereupon, We made each people to follow the other (to its doom), reducing them to mere tales (of the past). Scourged be the people who do not believe!

2718.arabic: ثُمَّ أَرسَلنا موسىٰ وَأَخاهُ هـٰرونَ بِـٔايـٰتِنا وَسُلطـٰنٍ مُبينٍ
2718.en: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our Signs and a clear authority

2719.arabic: إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِ فَاستَكبَروا وَكانوا قَومًا عالينَ
2719.en: to Pharaoh and to his chiefs, but they behaved superciliously and they were haughty.

2720.arabic: فَقالوا أَنُؤمِنُ لِبَشَرَينِ مِثلِنا وَقَومُهُما لَنا عـٰبِدونَ
2720.en: They said: "Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves when their people are slaves to us?"

2721.en: So they rejected them, calling them liars, and they too eventually became of those that were destroyed.

2722.arabic: وَلَقَد ءاتَينا موسَى الكِتـٰبَ لَعَلَّهُم يَهتَدونَ
2722.en: And We gave Moses the Book that people might be guided by it.

2723.arabic: وَجَعَلنَا ابنَ مَريَمَ وَأُمَّهُ ءايَةً وَءاوَينـٰهُما إِلىٰ رَبوَةٍ ذاتِ قَرارٍ وَمَعينٍ
2723.en: And We made Mary's son, and his mother, a Sign, and We gave them refuge on a lofty ground, a peaceful site with springs flowing in it.

2724.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا الرُّسُلُ كُلوا مِنَ الطَّيِّبـٰتِ وَاعمَلوا صـٰلِحًا إِنّى بِما تَعمَلونَ عَليمٌ
2724.en: Messengers! Partake of the things that are clean, and act righteously. I know well all that you do.

2725.arabic: وَإِنَّ هـٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُم أُمَّةً وٰحِدَةً وَأَنا۠ رَبُّكُم فَاتَّقونِ
2725.en: This community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord; so hold Me alone in fear.

2726.arabic: فَتَقَطَّعوا أَمرَهُم بَينَهُم زُبُرًا كُلُّ حِزبٍ بِما لَدَيهِم فَرِحونَ
2726.en: But people later cut up their religion into bits, each group rejoicing in what they have.

2727.en: So leave them immersed in their heedlessness till an appointed time.

2728.arabic: أَيَحسَبونَ أَنَّما نُمِدُّهُم بِهِ مِن مالٍ وَبَنينَ
2728.en: Do they fancy that Our continuing to give them wealth and children (means) that

2729.arabic: نُسارِعُ لَهُم فِى الخَيرٰتِ بَل لا يَشعُرونَ
2729.en: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.

2730.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ هُم مِن خَشيَةِ رَبِّهِم مُشفِقونَ
2730.en: Surely those who stand in awe for fear of their Lord,

2731.en: who have full faith in the Signs of their Lord;

2732.en: who associate none with their Lord in His Divinity,

2733.arabic: وَالَّذينَ يُؤتونَ ما ءاتَوا وَقُلوبُهُم وَجِلَةٌ أَنَّهُم إِلىٰ رَبِّهِم رٰجِعونَ
2733.en: who give, whatever they give in charity, with their hearts trembling at the thought that they are destined to return to their Lord;

2734.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ يُسـٰرِعونَ فِى الخَيرٰتِ وَهُم لَها سـٰبِقونَ
2734.en: it is these who hasten to do good works and vie in so doing with one another.

2735.arabic: وَلا نُكَلِّفُ نَفسًا إِلّا وُسعَها وَلَدَينا كِتـٰبٌ يَنطِقُ بِالحَقِّ وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
2735.en: We do not lay a burden on anyone beyond his capacity. We have a Book with Us that speaks the truth (about everyone); and they shall in no wise be wronged.

2736.arabic: بَل قُلوبُهُم فى غَمرَةٍ مِن هـٰذا وَلَهُم أَعمـٰلٌ مِن دونِ ذٰلِكَ هُم لَها عـٰمِلونَ
2736.en: Nay, their hearts are lost in ignorance of all this; and their deeds too vary from the way (mentioned above). They will persist in these deeds

2737.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا أَخَذنا مُترَفيهِم بِالعَذابِ إِذا هُم يَجـَٔرونَ
2737.en: until We seize with Our chastisement those of them that are given to luxuriant ways. They will then begin to groan.

2738.arabic: لا تَجـَٔرُوا اليَومَ إِنَّكُم مِنّا لا تُنصَرونَ
2738.en: "Put a stop to your groaning now! Surely no help shall be provided to you from Us.

2739.arabic: قَد كانَت ءايـٰتى تُتلىٰ عَلَيكُم فَكُنتُم عَلىٰ أَعقـٰبِكُم تَنكِصونَ
2739.en: My Signs were rehearsed to you and you turned back on your heels and took to flight,

2740.en: behaving arrogantly, and making fun, and talking nonsense (about the Book in your nightly chats)."

2741.arabic: أَفَلَم يَدَّبَّرُوا القَولَ أَم جاءَهُم ما لَم يَأتِ ءاباءَهُمُ الأَوَّلينَ
2741.en: Did they never ponder over this Word (of God)? Or has he (to wit, the Messenger) brought something the like of which did not come to their forefathers of yore?

2742.arabic: أَم لَم يَعرِفوا رَسولَهُم فَهُم لَهُ مُنكِرونَ
2742.en: Or is it that they were unaware of their Messenger and were therefore repelled by him for he was a stranger to them?

2743.arabic: أَم يَقولونَ بِهِ جِنَّةٌ بَل جاءَهُم بِالحَقِّ وَأَكثَرُهُم لِلحَقِّ كـٰرِهونَ
2743.en: Or do they say that there is madness in him? Nay, he has brought them the Truth and it is the Truth that most of them disdain.

2744.arabic: وَلَوِ اتَّبَعَ الحَقُّ أَهواءَهُم لَفَسَدَتِ السَّمـٰوٰتُ وَالأَرضُ وَمَن فيهِنَّ بَل أَتَينـٰهُم بِذِكرِهِم فَهُم عَن ذِكرِهِم مُعرِضونَ
2744.en: Were the Truth to follow their desires, the order of the heavens and the earth and those who dwell in them would have been ruined. Nay, the fact is that We have brought to them their own remembrance; and yet it is from their own remembrance that they are turning away.

2745.arabic: أَم تَسـَٔلُهُم خَرجًا فَخَراجُ رَبِّكَ خَيرٌ وَهُوَ خَيرُ الرّٰزِقينَ
2745.en: Are you asking them for something? What Allah has given you is the best. He is the Best of providers.

2746.en: You are calling them to a Straight Way,

2747.arabic: وَإِنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالـٔاخِرَةِ عَنِ الصِّرٰطِ لَنـٰكِبونَ
2747.en: but those who do not believe in the Hereafter are ever prone to deviate from the Right Way.

2748.arabic: وَلَو رَحِمنـٰهُم وَكَشَفنا ما بِهِم مِن ضُرٍّ لَلَجّوا فى طُغيـٰنِهِم يَعمَهونَ
2748.en: Were We to be merciful to them and remove from them their present afflictions, they would persist in their transgression, blindly wandering on.

2749.arabic: وَلَقَد أَخَذنـٰهُم بِالعَذابِ فَمَا استَكانوا لِرَبِّهِم وَما يَتَضَرَّعونَ
2749.en: (They are such) that We seized them with chastisement (and yet) they did not humble themselves before their Lord, nor do they entreat

2750.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا فَتَحنا عَلَيهِم بابًا ذا عَذابٍ شَديدٍ إِذا هُم فيهِ مُبلِسونَ
2750.en: until We opened upon them the door of a severe chastisement. Then lo, in this state they become utterly despaired of any good.

2751.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى أَنشَأَ لَكُمُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصـٰرَ وَالأَفـِٔدَةَ قَليلًا ما تَشكُرونَ
2751.en: It is He Who has endowed you with the faculties of hearing and sight and has given you hearts (to think). Scarcely do you give thanks.

2752.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى ذَرَأَكُم فِى الأَرضِ وَإِلَيهِ تُحشَرونَ
2752.en: It is He Who has dispersed you all around the earth, and it is unto Him that you shall all be mustered.

2753.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى يُحيۦ وَيُميتُ وَلَهُ اختِلـٰفُ الَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
2753.en: It is He Who gives life and causes death, and He holds mastery over the alternation of night and day. Do you not understand this?

2754.arabic: بَل قالوا مِثلَ ما قالَ الأَوَّلونَ
2754.en: Nay, but they say the like of what their predecessors of yore had said.

2755.arabic: قالوا أَءِذا مِتنا وَكُنّا تُرابًا وَعِظـٰمًا أَءِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ
2755.en: They say: "Is it that when we are dead and have been reduced to dust and bones, shall we then be raised up again?

2756.arabic: لَقَد وُعِدنا نَحنُ وَءاباؤُنا هـٰذا مِن قَبلُ إِن هـٰذا إِلّا أَسـٰطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
2756.en: We were promised such things and so were our forefathers before us. All these are no more than tales of the past."

2757.arabic: قُل لِمَنِ الأَرضُ وَمَن فيها إِن كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
2757.en: Ask them: "Whose is the earth and those who are in it? Tell us if you know"

2758.en: They will surely say: "Allah's." Say: "Then why do you not take heed?"

2759.arabic: قُل مَن رَبُّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ السَّبعِ وَرَبُّ العَرشِ العَظيمِ
2759.en: Ask them: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, the Lord of the Great Throne?"

2760.en: They will surely say: "Allah." Say: "Will you not, then, fear (Allah)?"

2761.arabic: قُل مَن بِيَدِهِ مَلَكوتُ كُلِّ شَىءٍ وَهُوَ يُجيرُ وَلا يُجارُ عَلَيهِ إِن كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
2761.en: Ask them: "Say, if you indeed know, to whom belongs the dominion over all things; (Who is it) that grants asylum, but against Whom no asylum is available?"

2762.en: They will surely say: "(The dominion over all things) belongs to Allah." Say: "Whence are you then deluded?"

2763.en: We have brought before them the Truth, and there is no doubt that they are lying.

2764.arabic: مَا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ مِن وَلَدٍ وَما كانَ مَعَهُ مِن إِلـٰهٍ إِذًا لَذَهَبَ كُلُّ إِلـٰهٍ بِما خَلَقَ وَلَعَلا بَعضُهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ سُبحـٰنَ اللَّهِ عَمّا يَصِفونَ
2764.en: Never did Allah take unto Himself any son, nor is there any god other than He. (Had there been any other gods) each god would have taken his creatures away with him, and each would have rushed to overpower the other. Glory be to Allah from all that they characterize Him with!

2765.arabic: عـٰلِمِ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهـٰدَةِ فَتَعـٰلىٰ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
2765.en: He knows both what is visible and what is not visible. Exalted is Allah above all that they associate with Him.

2766.arabic: قُل رَبِّ إِمّا تُرِيَنّى ما يوعَدونَ
2766.en: Pray, (O Muhammad): "My Lord, if You should bring the scourge of which they had been warned in my presence,

2767.arabic: رَبِّ فَلا تَجعَلنى فِى القَومِ الظّـٰلِمينَ
2767.en: then do not include me, my Lord, among these wrong#doing people."

2768.arabic: وَإِنّا عَلىٰ أَن نُرِيَكَ ما نَعِدُهُم لَقـٰدِرونَ
2768.en: Surely We are able to show you what We warn them against.

2769.arabic: ادفَع بِالَّتى هِىَ أَحسَنُ السَّيِّئَةَ نَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِما يَصِفونَ
2769.en: (O Muhammad)! Repel evil in the best manner. We are well aware of all that they say about you.

2770.arabic: وَقُل رَبِّ أَعوذُ بِكَ مِن هَمَزٰتِ الشَّيـٰطينِ
2770.en: And pray: "My Lord! I seek Your refuge from the suggestions of the evil ones;

2771.en: I even seek Your refuge, my Lord, lest they should approach me."

2772.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَ أَحَدَهُمُ المَوتُ قالَ رَبِّ ارجِعونِ
2772.en: (They shall persist in their deeds) until when death comes to anyone of them he will say: "My Lord, send me back to the world

2773.arabic: لَعَلّى أَعمَلُ صـٰلِحًا فيما تَرَكتُ كَلّا إِنَّها كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قائِلُها وَمِن وَرائِهِم بَرزَخٌ إِلىٰ يَومِ يُبعَثونَ
2773.en: that I have left behind. I am likely to do good." Nay, it is merely a word that he is uttering. There is a barrier behind all of them (who are dead) until the Day when they will be raised up.

2774.arabic: فَإِذا نُفِخَ فِى الصّورِ فَلا أَنسابَ بَينَهُم يَومَئِذٍ وَلا يَتَساءَلونَ
2774.en: And then no sooner the Trumpet is blown than there will remain no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask one another.

2775.arabic: فَمَن ثَقُلَت مَوٰزينُهُ فَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
2775.en: It will be an Hour when those whose scales are heavy, they alone will attain success;

2776.arabic: وَمَن خَفَّت مَوٰزينُهُ فَأُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم فى جَهَنَّمَ خـٰلِدونَ
2776.en: and those whose scales are light, those will be the ones who will have courted loss. They will abide in Hell.

2777.arabic: تَلفَحُ وُجوهَهُمُ النّارُ وَهُم فيها كـٰلِحونَ
2777.en: The Fire shall scorch their faces, exposing their jaws.

2778.arabic: أَلَم تَكُن ءايـٰتى تُتلىٰ عَلَيكُم فَكُنتُم بِها تُكَذِّبونَ
2778.en: "Are you not those to whom My revelations were recited, and you dubbed them as lies?"

2779.arabic: قالوا رَبَّنا غَلَبَت عَلَينا شِقوَتُنا وَكُنّا قَومًا ضالّينَ
2779.en: They will say: "Our Lord! Our misfortune prevailed over us. We were indeed an erring people.

2780.arabic: رَبَّنا أَخرِجنا مِنها فَإِن عُدنا فَإِنّا ظـٰلِمونَ
2780.en: Our Lord! Take us out of this. Then if we revert (to evil#doing) we shall indeed be wrongdoers."

2781.en: Allah will say: "Away from Me; stay where you are and do not address Me.

2782.arabic: إِنَّهُ كانَ فَريقٌ مِن عِبادى يَقولونَ رَبَّنا ءامَنّا فَاغفِر لَنا وَارحَمنا وَأَنتَ خَيرُ الرّٰحِمينَ
2782.en: You are those that when a party of My servants said: 'Our Lord, we believe, so forgive us, and have mercy on us, for You are the Best of those that are merciful,'

2783.arabic: فَاتَّخَذتُموهُم سِخرِيًّا حَتّىٰ أَنسَوكُم ذِكرى وَكُنتُم مِنهُم تَضحَكونَ
2783.en: you made a laughingstock of them and your hostility to them caused you to forget Me, and you simply kept laughing.

2784.arabic: إِنّى جَزَيتُهُمُ اليَومَ بِما صَبَروا أَنَّهُم هُمُ الفائِزونَ
2784.en: Lo! I have rewarded them this Day for their steadfastness, so that they, and they alone, are triumphant."

2785.arabic: قـٰلَ كَم لَبِثتُم فِى الأَرضِ عَدَدَ سِنينَ
2785.en: Then Allah will ask them: "For how many years did you stay on earth?"

2786.arabic: قالوا لَبِثنا يَومًا أَو بَعضَ يَومٍ فَسـَٔلِ العادّينَ
2786.en: They will say: "We stayed for a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep count of this."

2787.arabic: قـٰلَ إِن لَبِثتُم إِلّا قَليلًا لَو أَنَّكُم كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
2787.en: He will say: "You stayed only for a while, if you only knew that.

2788.arabic: أَفَحَسِبتُم أَنَّما خَلَقنـٰكُم عَبَثًا وَأَنَّكُم إِلَينا لا تُرجَعونَ
2788.en: Did you imagine that We created you without any purpose, and that you will not be brought back to Us?"

2789.arabic: فَتَعـٰلَى اللَّهُ المَلِكُ الحَقُّ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ رَبُّ العَرشِ الكَريمِ
2789.en: So, exalted be Allah, the True King! There is no god but He, the Lord of the Great Throne.

2790.arabic: وَمَن يَدعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلـٰهًا ءاخَرَ لا بُرهـٰنَ لَهُ بِهِ فَإِنَّما حِسابُهُ عِندَ رَبِّهِ إِنَّهُ لا يُفلِحُ الكـٰفِرونَ
2790.en: He who invokes any other god along with Allah " one for whom he has no evidence" his reckoning is with his Lord alone. Indeed, these unbelievers shall not prosper.

2791.arabic: وَقُل رَبِّ اغفِر وَارحَم وَأَنتَ خَيرُ الرّٰحِمينَ
2791.en: And say, (O Muhammad): "My Lord, forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the Best of those that are merciful."

2792.arabic: سورَةٌ أَنزَلنـٰها وَفَرَضنـٰها وَأَنزَلنا فيها ءايـٰتٍ بَيِّنـٰتٍ لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
2792.en: This is a Surah which We have sent down and We have made it mandatory, and We have sent down clear Commandments in it so that you may learn lessons.

2793.arabic: الزّانِيَةُ وَالزّانى فَاجلِدوا كُلَّ وٰحِدٍ مِنهُما مِا۟ئَةَ جَلدَةٍ وَلا تَأخُذكُم بِهِما رَأفَةٌ فى دينِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم تُؤمِنونَ بِاللَّهِ وَاليَومِ الـٔاخِرِ وَليَشهَد عَذابَهُما طائِفَةٌ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
2793.en: The woman and the man guilty of fornication, flog each one of them with a hundred stripes # and let not any pity for them restrain you in regard to a matter prescribed by Allah, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day, and let, some of the believers witness the punishment inflicted on them.

2794.arabic: الزّانى لا يَنكِحُ إِلّا زانِيَةً أَو مُشرِكَةً وَالزّانِيَةُ لا يَنكِحُها إِلّا زانٍ أَو مُشرِكٌ وَحُرِّمَ ذٰلِكَ عَلَى المُؤمِنينَ
2794.en: A man guilty of adultery (or fornication) shall not marry any but the woman guilty of the same or a mushrik woman, and none shall marry a woman guilty of adultery (or fornication) but the man guilty of the same or a mushrik man: such marriages are forbidden to true believers.

2795.arabic: وَالَّذينَ يَرمونَ المُحصَنـٰتِ ثُمَّ لَم يَأتوا بِأَربَعَةِ شُهَداءَ فَاجلِدوهُم ثَمـٰنينَ جَلدَةً وَلا تَقبَلوا لَهُم شَهـٰدَةً أَبَدًا وَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ الفـٰسِقونَ
2795.en: As for those persons who charge chaste women with false accusations but do not produce four witnesses, flog them with eighty stripes and never accept their evidence afterwards, for they themselves are transgressors,

2796.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذينَ تابوا مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ وَأَصلَحوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
2796.en: except those who repent and reform themselves; Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

2797.arabic: وَالَّذينَ يَرمونَ أَزوٰجَهُم وَلَم يَكُن لَهُم شُهَداءُ إِلّا أَنفُسُهُم فَشَهـٰدَةُ أَحَدِهِم أَربَعُ شَهـٰدٰتٍ بِاللَّهِ إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الصّـٰدِقينَ
2797.en: As for those who accuse their own wives but have no witness except themselves, the evidence of one of them is that he shall swear four times by Allah and declare that he is true (in his charge).

2798.arabic: وَالخـٰمِسَةُ أَنَّ لَعنَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيهِ إِن كانَ مِنَ الكـٰذِبينَ
2798.en: Then the fifth time he shall declare that Allah's curse be upon him if he be false (in his charge).

2799.arabic: وَيَدرَؤُا۟ عَنهَا العَذابَ أَن تَشهَدَ أَربَعَ شَهـٰدٰتٍ بِاللَّهِ إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الكـٰذِبينَ
2799.en: (As for the woman), it shall avert the punishment from her if she swears four times by Allah that the man is false (in his charge)

2800.arabic: وَالخـٰمِسَةَ أَنَّ غَضَبَ اللَّهِ عَلَيها إِن كانَ مِنَ الصّـٰدِقينَ
2800.en: and the fifth time she invokes Allah's wrath upon herself, if he be true (in his charge).

2801.arabic: وَلَولا فَضلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَرَحمَتُهُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ تَوّابٌ حَكيمٌ
2801.en: If Allah had not shown you His grace and mercy and if Allah had not been most Forgiving and All#Wise, (you would have been in a great fix because of accusing your wives).

2802.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ جاءو بِالإِفكِ عُصبَةٌ مِنكُم لا تَحسَبوهُ شَرًّا لَكُم بَل هُوَ خَيرٌ لَكُم لِكُلِّ امرِئٍ مِنهُم مَا اكتَسَبَ مِنَ الإِثمِ وَالَّذى تَوَلّىٰ كِبرَهُ مِنهُم لَهُ عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
2802.en: Those who have invented the slander, are some of your own people. You should not, however, regard this matter as evil for it has good in it for you. Whoso took any part in this, he earned his share of the sin accordingly, and the one, who had the greatest share of responsibility in it, shall have a terrible punishment.

2803.arabic: لَولا إِذ سَمِعتُموهُ ظَنَّ المُؤمِنونَ وَالمُؤمِنـٰتُ بِأَنفُسِهِم خَيرًا وَقالوا هـٰذا إِفكٌ مُبينٌ
2803.en: When you heard of it, why didn't the Believing men and the Believing women have a good opinion of themselves, and why did they not say, "This is a manifest slander?"

2804.arabic: لَولا جاءو عَلَيهِ بِأَربَعَةِ شُهَداءَ فَإِذ لَم يَأتوا بِالشُّهَداءِ فَأُولـٰئِكَ عِندَ اللَّهِ هُمُ الكـٰذِبونَ
2804.en: Why did the slanderers not bring four witnesses (to prove their charge)? Now that they have not brought witnesses, they themselves are liars in the sight of Allah.

2805.arabic: وَلَولا فَضلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَرَحمَتُهُ فِى الدُّنيا وَالـٔاخِرَةِ لَمَسَّكُم فى ما أَفَضتُم فيهِ عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
2805.en: Were it not for Allah's grace and mercy towards you in this world and in the Hereafter, a painful scourge would have visited you because of the things in which you were involved.

2806.arabic: إِذ تَلَقَّونَهُ بِأَلسِنَتِكُم وَتَقولونَ بِأَفواهِكُم ما لَيسَ لَكُم بِهِ عِلمٌ وَتَحسَبونَهُ هَيِّنًا وَهُوَ عِندَ اللَّهِ عَظيمٌ
2806.en: (Just think how erroneous you were,) when you passed this lie on from one tongue to the other and uttered with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge. You took it as a trifling matter whereas it was a grave offence in the sight of Allah.

2807.arabic: وَلَولا إِذ سَمِعتُموهُ قُلتُم ما يَكونُ لَنا أَن نَتَكَلَّمَ بِهـٰذا سُبحـٰنَكَ هـٰذا بُهتـٰنٌ عَظيمٌ
2807.en: Why did you not, as soon as you heard of it, say, "It is not proper for us to utter such a thing? Glory be to Allah! This is a great slander."

2808.arabic: يَعِظُكُمُ اللَّهُ أَن تَعودوا لِمِثلِهِ أَبَدًا إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ
2808.en: Allah admonishes you that in future you should never repeat a thing like this, if you are true Believers.

2809.arabic: وَيُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الـٔايـٰتِ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
2809.en: Allah makes His Revelations clear to you, and He is All#Knowing, All#Wise.

2810.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُحِبّونَ أَن تَشيعَ الفـٰحِشَةُ فِى الَّذينَ ءامَنوا لَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ فِى الدُّنيا وَالـٔاخِرَةِ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ وَأَنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
2810.en: As for those, who like that indecency should spread among the Believers, they deserve a painful punishment in this world and in the Hereafter, for Allah knows and you do not know (its consequences).

2811.arabic: وَلَولا فَضلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَرَحمَتُهُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ رَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
2811.en: If Allah had not shown His grace and mercy to you, (this scandal would have produced very evil results): Allah is indeed very Kind and Merciful.

2812.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا الَّذينَ ءامَنوا لا تَتَّبِعوا خُطُوٰتِ الشَّيطـٰنِ وَمَن يَتَّبِع خُطُوٰتِ الشَّيطـٰنِ فَإِنَّهُ يَأمُرُ بِالفَحشاءِ وَالمُنكَرِ وَلَولا فَضلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَرَحمَتُهُ ما زَكىٰ مِنكُم مِن أَحَدٍ أَبَدًا وَلـٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يُزَكّى مَن يَشاءُ وَاللَّهُ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
2812.en: O Believers, do not follow in Satan's footsteps, for he will incite to indecency and wickedness any who will follow him. If Allah had not shown His Brace and mercy to you, none of you would have been able to cleanse yourself, for it is Allah alone Who cleanses whom He wills, and Allah is All#Hearing, All#Knowing.

2813.arabic: وَلا يَأتَلِ أُولُوا الفَضلِ مِنكُم وَالسَّعَةِ أَن يُؤتوا أُولِى القُربىٰ وَالمَسـٰكينَ وَالمُهـٰجِرينَ فى سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَليَعفوا وَليَصفَحوا أَلا تُحِبّونَ أَن يَغفِرَ اللَّهُ لَكُم وَاللَّهُ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
2813.en: Those among you, who are bountiful and persons of means, should not swear on oath that they would withhold their help from their relatives, the indigent and those who have left their homes for the cause of Allah: they should forgive and forbear. Do you not wish that Allah should forgive you? and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

2814.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَرمونَ المُحصَنـٰتِ الغـٰفِلـٰتِ المُؤمِنـٰتِ لُعِنوا فِى الدُّنيا وَالـٔاخِرَةِ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
2814.en: Those who charge with slander those Believing women, who are chaste but simple souls, are accursed in this world and in the Hereafter: there is a great punishment for them.

2815.arabic: يَومَ تَشهَدُ عَلَيهِم أَلسِنَتُهُم وَأَيديهِم وَأَرجُلُهُم بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
2815.en: They should not forget the Day when their own tongues and their own hands and test will bear testimony in regard to their misdeeds.

2816.arabic: يَومَئِذٍ يُوَفّيهِمُ اللَّهُ دينَهُمُ الحَقَّ وَيَعلَمونَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الحَقُّ المُبينُ
2816.en: On that Day Allah will give them the full recompense they deserve, and they will realize that Allah is the very Truth, Who makes the Truth manifest.

2817.arabic: الخَبيثـٰتُ لِلخَبيثينَ وَالخَبيثونَ لِلخَبيثـٰتِ وَالطَّيِّبـٰتُ لِلطَّيِّبينَ وَالطَّيِّبونَ لِلطَّيِّبـٰتِ أُولـٰئِكَ مُبَرَّءونَ مِمّا يَقولونَ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَرِزقٌ كَريمٌ
2817.en: Impure women are for impure men and impure men for impure women, and pure women are for pure men and pure men for pure women. They are free from those scandals which the slanderers utter. There is forgiveness for them and honourable provision.

2818.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا الَّذينَ ءامَنوا لا تَدخُلوا بُيوتًا غَيرَ بُيوتِكُم حَتّىٰ تَستَأنِسوا وَتُسَلِّموا عَلىٰ أَهلِها ذٰلِكُم خَيرٌ لَكُم لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
2818.en: O Believers, do not enter other houses than your own until you have the approval of the inmates and have wished them peace; this is the best way for you: it is expected that you will observe it.

2819.arabic: فَإِن لَم تَجِدوا فيها أَحَدًا فَلا تَدخُلوها حَتّىٰ يُؤذَنَ لَكُم وَإِن قيلَ لَكُمُ ارجِعوا فَارجِعوا هُوَ أَزكىٰ لَكُم وَاللَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ عَليمٌ
2819.en: Then, if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter until you have been given permission, and if you are told to go back, you should go back. This is a purer way for you; and Allah has full knowledge of what you do.

2820.arabic: لَيسَ عَلَيكُم جُناحٌ أَن تَدخُلوا بُيوتًا غَيرَ مَسكونَةٍ فيها مَتـٰعٌ لَكُم وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ ما تُبدونَ وَما تَكتُمونَ
2820.en: There is, however, no harm if you enter houses which are not dwelling places, but contain something useful for you; Allah knows what you disclose and what you conceal.

2821.arabic: قُل لِلمُؤمِنينَ يَغُضّوا مِن أَبصـٰرِهِم وَيَحفَظوا فُروجَهُم ذٰلِكَ أَزكىٰ لَهُم إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبيرٌ بِما يَصنَعونَ
2821.en: And O Prophet, enjoin the Believing men to restrain their gaze and guard their private parts. This is a more righteous way for them: Allah has knowledge of what they do.

2822.arabic: وَقُل لِلمُؤمِنـٰتِ يَغضُضنَ مِن أَبصـٰرِهِنَّ وَيَحفَظنَ فُروجَهُنَّ وَلا يُبدينَ زينَتَهُنَّ إِلّا ما ظَهَرَ مِنها وَليَضرِبنَ بِخُمُرِهِنَّ عَلىٰ جُيوبِهِنَّ وَلا يُبدينَ زينَتَهُنَّ إِلّا لِبُعولَتِهِنَّ أَو ءابائِهِنَّ أَو ءاباءِ بُعولَتِهِنَّ أَو أَبنائِهِنَّ أَو أَبناءِ بُعولَتِهِنَّ أَو إِخوٰنِهِنَّ أَو بَنى إِخوٰنِهِنَّ أَو بَنى أَخَوٰتِهِنَّ أَو نِسائِهِنَّ أَو ما مَلَكَت أَيمـٰنُهُنَّ أَوِ التّـٰبِعينَ غَيرِ أُولِى الإِربَةِ مِنَ الرِّجالِ أَوِ الطِّفلِ الَّذينَ لَم يَظهَروا عَلىٰ عَورٰتِ النِّساءِ وَلا يَضرِبنَ بِأَرجُلِهِنَّ لِيُعلَمَ ما يُخفينَ مِن زينَتِهِنَّ وَتوبوا إِلَى اللَّهِ جَميعًا أَيُّهَ المُؤمِنونَ لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ
2822.en: O Prophet, enjoin the Believing women to restrain their gaze and guard their private parts. and not to display their adornment except that which is displayed of itself, and to draw their veils over their bosoms and not to display their adornment except before their husbands, their fathers, the fathers of their husbands, their sons and the sons of their husbands (from other wives), their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their female associates and those in their possession and male attendants incapable of sex desire and those boys who have not yet attained knowledge of sex matters concerning women; also forbid them to stamp their feet on the ground lest their hidden ornaments should be displayed. O Believers, turn all together towards Allah: it is expected that you will attain true success.

2823.arabic: وَأَنكِحُوا الأَيـٰمىٰ مِنكُم وَالصّـٰلِحينَ مِن عِبادِكُم وَإِمائِكُم إِن يَكونوا فُقَراءَ يُغنِهِمُ اللَّهُ مِن فَضلِهِ وَاللَّهُ وٰسِعٌ عَليمٌ
2823.en: Arrange marriages between the single men and women among your and between your slave men and slave women, who are righteous,, if they be indigent, Allah will provide means for them out of His bounty: Allah has boundless resources and He is AllKnowing.

2824.arabic: وَليَستَعفِفِ الَّذينَ لا يَجِدونَ نِكاحًا حَتّىٰ يُغنِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ مِن فَضلِهِ وَالَّذينَ يَبتَغونَ الكِتـٰبَ مِمّا مَلَكَت أَيمـٰنُكُم فَكاتِبوهُم إِن عَلِمتُم فيهِم خَيرًا وَءاتوهُم مِن مالِ اللَّهِ الَّذى ءاتىٰكُم وَلا تُكرِهوا فَتَيـٰتِكُم عَلَى البِغاءِ إِن أَرَدنَ تَحَصُّنًا لِتَبتَغوا عَرَضَ الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا وَمَن يُكرِههُنَّ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ مِن بَعدِ إِكرٰهِهِنَّ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
2824.en: And those, who cannot find a match, should observe continence till Allah provides them with means out of His bounty And if those who are in your possession, ask for a deed of emancipation, execute the deed of emancipation with them, provided that you find some good in them; and give them something out of the means Allah has given you. And do not force your slave#girls into prostitution for your own worldly gains when they themselves want to keep chaste; and if anyone forces them into it, after such a compulsion Allah will be forgiving and merciful for them.

2825.arabic: وَلَقَد أَنزَلنا إِلَيكُم ءايـٰتٍ مُبَيِّنـٰتٍ وَمَثَلًا مِنَ الَّذينَ خَلَوا مِن قَبلِكُم وَمَوعِظَةً لِلمُتَّقينَ
2825.en: We have sent down to you Revelations giving clear guidance and cited examples of the peoples who went before you to serve as warning and We have imparted admonitions for the God#fearing.

2826.arabic: اللَّهُ نورُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ مَثَلُ نورِهِ كَمِشكوٰةٍ فيها مِصباحٌ المِصباحُ فى زُجاجَةٍ الزُّجاجَةُ كَأَنَّها كَوكَبٌ دُرِّىٌّ يوقَدُ مِن شَجَرَةٍ مُبـٰرَكَةٍ زَيتونَةٍ لا شَرقِيَّةٍ وَلا غَربِيَّةٍ يَكادُ زَيتُها يُضىءُ وَلَو لَم تَمسَسهُ نارٌ نورٌ عَلىٰ نورٍ يَهدِى اللَّهُ لِنورِهِ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَضرِبُ اللَّهُ الأَمثـٰلَ لِلنّاسِ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىءٍ عَليمٌ
2826.en: Allah is the light of the heavens and the earth: His light (in the universe) may be likened (to the light of) a lamp in a niche: the lamp is in a glass shade: the glass shade is like a glittering star and lamp is lit with the olive oil of a blessed tree which is neither eastern nor western: its oil is (so fine) as if it were going to shine forth by itself though no fire touched it (as though all the means of increasing) light upon light (were provided); Allah guides to His light whomever He wills. He cites parables to make the Message clear to the people; He has perfect knowledge of everything.

2827.arabic: فى بُيوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّهُ أَن تُرفَعَ وَيُذكَرَ فيهَا اسمُهُ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ فيها بِالغُدُوِّ وَالـٔاصالِ
2827.en: (Those who obtain guidance to His light are found) in the houses which He has enjoined to raise up and to mention His name therein. In them such people glorify Him morning and evening

2828.arabic: رِجالٌ لا تُلهيهِم تِجـٰرَةٌ وَلا بَيعٌ عَن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ وَإِقامِ الصَّلوٰةِ وَإيتاءِ الزَّكوٰةِ يَخافونَ يَومًا تَتَقَلَّبُ فيهِ القُلوبُ وَالأَبصـٰرُ
2828.en: as are not diverted by trade and merchandise from remembering Him and from establishing Salat and paying Zakat, for they fear the Day when the hearts will be overturned and the eyes will become petrified.

2829.arabic: لِيَجزِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ أَحسَنَ ما عَمِلوا وَيَزيدَهُم مِن فَضلِهِ وَاللَّهُ يَرزُقُ مَن يَشاءُ بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
2829.en: (And they behave like this) so that Allah may reward them for their excellent deeds and, in addition to it, show His favour to them out of His bounty: Allah provides without stint for anyone He pleases.

2830.arabic: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا أَعمـٰلُهُم كَسَرابٍ بِقيعَةٍ يَحسَبُهُ الظَّمـٔانُ ماءً حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَهُ لَم يَجِدهُ شَيـًٔا وَوَجَدَ اللَّهَ عِندَهُ فَوَفّىٰهُ حِسابَهُ وَاللَّهُ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
2830.en: (On the other hand,) the deeds of those who disbelieved, maybe likened to a mirage in a waterless desert, which the thirsty one took for water; but when he reached there he found nothing to drink; nay, he found there Allah Who settled his full account, and Allah is very swift at reckoning.

2831.arabic: أَو كَظُلُمـٰتٍ فى بَحرٍ لُجِّىٍّ يَغشىٰهُ مَوجٌ مِن فَوقِهِ مَوجٌ مِن فَوقِهِ سَحابٌ ظُلُمـٰتٌ بَعضُها فَوقَ بَعضٍ إِذا أَخرَجَ يَدَهُ لَم يَكَد يَرىٰها وَمَن لَم يَجعَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ نورًا فَما لَهُ مِن نورٍ
2831.en: Or (their efforts may be likened to those of a man trying to swim in) a deep dark ocean, covered with billows, one over the other, and above it a cloud: darkness upon darkness: so much so that if he stretches out his hand, he cannot see it. There is no light for the one whom Allah does not give light.

2832.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ مَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَالطَّيرُ صـٰفّـٰتٍ كُلٌّ قَد عَلِمَ صَلاتَهُ وَتَسبيحَهُ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ بِما يَفعَلونَ
