2832.en: Do you not observe that all those who are in the heavens and the earth, and the birds with outspread wings, glorify Allah? Each one knows the mode of its prayer and glorification, and Allah has full knowledge of all they do.

2833.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مُلكُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ المَصيرُ
2833.en: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone, and all shall have to return to Him.

2834.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُزجى سَحابًا ثُمَّ يُؤَلِّفُ بَينَهُ ثُمَّ يَجعَلُهُ رُكامًا فَتَرَى الوَدقَ يَخرُجُ مِن خِلـٰلِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ السَّماءِ مِن جِبالٍ فيها مِن بَرَدٍ فَيُصيبُ بِهِ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَصرِفُهُ عَن مَن يَشاءُ يَكادُ سَنا بَرقِهِ يَذهَبُ بِالأَبصـٰرِ
2834.en: Do you not observe that Allah makes the cloud move gently then joins its pieces together: then gathers it into a mass of thick cloud: then you see that rain#drops fall down from its midst: and He sends down hail out of the high up mountains in the heaven: then He smites with it whom He wills and turns it away from whom He pleases: then a flash of lightning from it dazzles the eyes.

2835.arabic: يُقَلِّبُ اللَّهُ الَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَعِبرَةً لِأُولِى الأَبصـٰرِ
2835.en: He alternates the day and the night: there is indeed a lesson in it for those who have observing eyes.

2836.arabic: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَ كُلَّ دابَّةٍ مِن ماءٍ فَمِنهُم مَن يَمشى عَلىٰ بَطنِهِ وَمِنهُم مَن يَمشى عَلىٰ رِجلَينِ وَمِنهُم مَن يَمشى عَلىٰ أَربَعٍ يَخلُقُ اللَّهُ ما يَشاءُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ قَديرٌ
2836.en: And Allah created every creature from a sort of water: of them some one crawls upon its belly: another walks on two legs and still another on four; Allah creates whatever He wills for He has power over everything

2837.arabic: لَقَد أَنزَلنا ءايـٰتٍ مُبَيِّنـٰتٍ وَاللَّهُ يَهدى مَن يَشاءُ إِلىٰ صِرٰطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
2837.en: We have sent down Revelations that make the reality quite plain; however, Allah guides to the straight path whomsoever He pleases.

2838.arabic: وَيَقولونَ ءامَنّا بِاللَّهِ وَبِالرَّسولِ وَأَطَعنا ثُمَّ يَتَوَلّىٰ فَريقٌ مِنهُم مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ وَما أُولـٰئِكَ بِالمُؤمِنينَ
2838.en: These people say "We have believed in Allah and the Messenger and we have submitted"; but soon after this, some of them turn away (from obedience): such people are not true Believers.

2839.arabic: وَإِذا دُعوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ لِيَحكُمَ بَينَهُم إِذا فَريقٌ مِنهُم مُعرِضونَ
2839.en: When they are called to Allah and His Messenger so that the Messenger may judge between them, a party of them turns away.

2840.arabic: وَإِن يَكُن لَهُمُ الحَقُّ يَأتوا إِلَيهِ مُذعِنينَ
2840.en: However, if the truth be on their side, they come towards the Messenger in all obedience.

2841.arabic: أَفى قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ أَمِ ارتابوا أَم يَخافونَ أَن يَحيفَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم وَرَسولُهُ بَل أُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ الظّـٰلِمونَ
2841.en: Are their hearts afflicted with the disease (of hypocrisy)? Or, are they in doubt? Or, do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust to them? In fact, they themselves are unjust.

2842.arabic: إِنَّما كانَ قَولَ المُؤمِنينَ إِذا دُعوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ لِيَحكُمَ بَينَهُم أَن يَقولوا سَمِعنا وَأَطَعنا وَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
2842.en: As regards the Believers, when they are called towards Allah and His Messenger so that the Messenger may judge between them, they say, "We have heard and obeyed"; such are the people who attain true success,

2843.arabic: وَمَن يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ وَيَخشَ اللَّهَ وَيَتَّقهِ فَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ الفائِزونَ
2843.en: and only those attain true success who obey Allah and His Messenger and fear Allah and refrain from His disobedience.

2844.arabic: وَأَقسَموا بِاللَّهِ جَهدَ أَيمـٰنِهِم لَئِن أَمَرتَهُم لَيَخرُجُنَّ قُل لا تُقسِموا طاعَةٌ مَعروفَةٌ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبيرٌ بِما تَعمَلونَ
2844.en: They (the hypocrites) solemnly swear by Allah and say, "If you order us, we will leave our homes." Say to them, "Do not swear oaths for your \`obedience' is well known; Allah is fully aware of what you are doing. "

2845.arabic: قُل أَطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطيعُوا الرَّسولَ فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَإِنَّما عَلَيهِ ما حُمِّلَ وَعَلَيكُم ما حُمِّلتُم وَإِن تُطيعوهُ تَهتَدوا وَما عَلَى الرَّسولِ إِلَّا البَلـٰغُ المُبينُ
2845.en: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, you should note it well that the Messenger is responsible for the duty entrusted to him and you are responsible for the duty entrusted to you. If you obey him, you will be rightly guided, for the responsibility of the Messenger is only to convey the Message clearly to you.

2846.arabic: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا مِنكُم وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ لَيَستَخلِفَنَّهُم فِى الأَرضِ كَمَا استَخلَفَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم وَلَيُمَكِّنَنَّ لَهُم دينَهُمُ الَّذِى ارتَضىٰ لَهُم وَلَيُبَدِّلَنَّهُم مِن بَعدِ خَوفِهِم أَمنًا يَعبُدونَنى لا يُشرِكونَ بى شَيـًٔا وَمَن كَفَرَ بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ فَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ الفـٰسِقونَ
2846.en: Allah has promised to those among you who believe and do righteous deeds, that He will make them successors in the land just as He made those who passed away before them, and that He will establish their religion, which He has approved for them, on strong foundations and will change their (present) state of fear into peace and security. Let them worship Me and associate none with Me; and the one who disbelieves after this," shall be of those who are perverse transgressors.

2847.arabic: وَأَقيمُوا الصَّلوٰةَ وَءاتُوا الزَّكوٰةَ وَأَطيعُوا الرَّسولَ لَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
2847.en: Therefore, establish Salat, pay the Zakat dues and obey the Messenger; it is expected that you will be shown mercy.

2848.arabic: لا تَحسَبَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مُعجِزينَ فِى الأَرضِ وَمَأوىٰهُمُ النّارُ وَلَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
2848.en: Do not think about those who have disbelieved that they will be able to frustrate Allah in the land; their abode is Hell and it is a very evil abode.

2849.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا الَّذينَ ءامَنوا لِيَستَـٔذِنكُمُ الَّذينَ مَلَكَت أَيمـٰنُكُم وَالَّذينَ لَم يَبلُغُوا الحُلُمَ مِنكُم ثَلـٰثَ مَرّٰتٍ مِن قَبلِ صَلوٰةِ الفَجرِ وَحينَ تَضَعونَ ثِيابَكُم مِنَ الظَّهيرَةِ وَمِن بَعدِ صَلوٰةِ العِشاءِ ثَلـٰثُ عَورٰتٍ لَكُم لَيسَ عَلَيكُم وَلا عَلَيهِم جُناحٌ بَعدَهُنَّ طَوّٰفونَ عَلَيكُم بَعضُكُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ كَذٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الـٔايـٰتِ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
2849.en: O Believers, your slaves and those of your children, who have not yet become sex conscious, must ask your permission before coming in to see you on three occasions: before the Fajr Prayer and at noon when you put off your clothes and after the \`Isha' Prayer. These are your three times of privacy. There is no sin for you or for them if they come without permission at other times than these, for you have to visit: ne another over and over again. In this way Allah makes His Comm andments clear to you for He is All#Knowing, All#Wise.

2850.arabic: وَإِذا بَلَغَ الأَطفـٰلُ مِنكُمُ الحُلُمَ فَليَستَـٔذِنوا كَمَا استَـٔذَنَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم كَذٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُم ءايـٰتِهِ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
2850.en: And when your children have grown sex conscious, they should receive your permission for this just as their elders get permission. In this way Allah makes His Revelations plain to you for He is All#Knowing, AllWise.

2851.arabic: وَالقَوٰعِدُ مِنَ النِّساءِ الّـٰتى لا يَرجونَ نِكاحًا فَلَيسَ عَلَيهِنَّ جُناحٌ أَن يَضَعنَ ثِيابَهُنَّ غَيرَ مُتَبَرِّجـٰتٍ بِزينَةٍ وَأَن يَستَعفِفنَ خَيرٌ لَهُنَّ وَاللَّهُ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
2851.en: There is no sin for such elderly women as are past the age of marriage, if they lay aside their outer graments provided that they do not mean to display their adornment. Nevertheless, if they behave modestly, it would be better for them: for Allah hears everything and knows everything.

2852.arabic: لَيسَ عَلَى الأَعمىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلا عَلَى الأَعرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلا عَلَى المَريضِ حَرَجٌ وَلا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِكُم أَن تَأكُلوا مِن بُيوتِكُم أَو بُيوتِ ءابائِكُم أَو بُيوتِ أُمَّهـٰتِكُم أَو بُيوتِ إِخوٰنِكُم أَو بُيوتِ أَخَوٰتِكُم أَو بُيوتِ أَعمـٰمِكُم أَو بُيوتِ عَمّـٰتِكُم أَو بُيوتِ أَخوٰلِكُم أَو بُيوتِ خـٰلـٰتِكُم أَو ما مَلَكتُم مَفاتِحَهُ أَو صَديقِكُم لَيسَ عَلَيكُم جُناحٌ أَن تَأكُلوا جَميعًا أَو أَشتاتًا فَإِذا دَخَلتُم بُيوتًا فَسَلِّموا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِكُم تَحِيَّةً مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ مُبـٰرَكَةً طَيِّبَةً كَذٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الـٔايـٰتِ لَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
2852.en: There is no harm if a blind or a lame or a sick person (takes a meal at another's house): nor is there any harm for yourselves if you take meals at your own houses or at the houses of your fathers and grandfathers or at the houses of your mothers and grandmothers or at your brothers' houses or at your sisters' houses or at the houses of your paternal uncles or at the houses of your paternal aunts or at the houses of your maternal uncles or at the houses of your maternal aunts or from the houses whose keys are in your possession or at the houses of your friends. There is no harm if you take your meals together or separately; however, when you enter the houses, you should send greetings of peace on your people, for the prayer of greetings prescribed by Allah is blessed and pure. Thus Allah makes His Revelation's clear to you. It is expected that you will use your common sense to grasp these.

2853.arabic: إِنَّمَا المُؤمِنونَ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ وَإِذا كانوا مَعَهُ عَلىٰ أَمرٍ جامِعٍ لَم يَذهَبوا حَتّىٰ يَستَـٔذِنوهُ إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَستَـٔذِنونَكَ أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ يُؤمِنونَ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ فَإِذَا استَـٔذَنوكَ لِبَعضِ شَأنِهِم فَأذَن لِمَن شِئتَ مِنهُم وَاستَغفِر لَهُمُ اللَّهَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
2853.en: True Believers are those who sincerely believe in Allah and His Messenger and who do not leave him without permission when they are with the Messenger for some common good; only those who ask your permission sincerely believe in Allah and His Messenger. Therefore, when they ask your permission for a private business, you may give permission to whomever you like, and ask Allah's forgiveness for such people: Allah is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.

2854.arabic: لا تَجعَلوا دُعاءَ الرَّسولِ بَينَكُم كَدُعاءِ بَعضِكُم بَعضًا قَد يَعلَمُ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ يَتَسَلَّلونَ مِنكُم لِواذًا فَليَحذَرِ الَّذينَ يُخالِفونَ عَن أَمرِهِ أَن تُصيبَهُم فِتنَةٌ أَو يُصيبَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
2854.en: O Believers, do not consider the summoning by the Messenger like the summoning among you by one another. Allah knows well those of you who steal away, concealing themselves behind others. Let those who disobey the order of the Messenger beware lest they should be involved in some affliction, or are visited by a woeful scourge.

2855.arabic: أَلا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ ما فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ قَد يَعلَمُ ما أَنتُم عَلَيهِ وَيَومَ يُرجَعونَ إِلَيهِ فَيُنَبِّئُهُم بِما عَمِلوا وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىءٍ عَليمٌ
2855.en: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.

2856.arabic: تَبارَكَ الَّذى نَزَّلَ الفُرقانَ عَلىٰ عَبدِهِ لِيَكونَ لِلعـٰلَمينَ نَذيرًا
2856.en: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al#Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:

2857.arabic: الَّذى لَهُ مُلكُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلَم يَتَّخِذ وَلَدًا وَلَم يَكُن لَهُ شَريكٌ فِى المُلكِ وَخَلَقَ كُلَّ شَىءٍ فَقَدَّرَهُ تَقديرًا
2857.en: He to Whom belongs the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth: Who has begotten no son: Who has no partner in His Sovereignty: Who created each and every thing and then ordained its destiny.

2858.arabic: وَاتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ ءالِهَةً لا يَخلُقونَ شَيـًٔا وَهُم يُخلَقونَ وَلا يَملِكونَ لِأَنفُسِهِم ضَرًّا وَلا نَفعًا وَلا يَملِكونَ مَوتًا وَلا حَيوٰةً وَلا نُشورًا
2858.en: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.

2859.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن هـٰذا إِلّا إِفكٌ افتَرىٰهُ وَأَعانَهُ عَلَيهِ قَومٌ ءاخَرونَ فَقَد جاءو ظُلمًا وَزورًا
2859.en: Those who have rejected the Message of the Prophet, say, "This (Al#Furgan) is a forgery which this man himself has devised, and some others have helped him at it. " What a cruel injustice and an impudent lie!

2860.arabic: وَقالوا أَسـٰطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ اكتَتَبَها فَهِىَ تُملىٰ عَلَيهِ بُكرَةً وَأَصيلًا
2860.en: They say, "These things are the writings of the ancients which he has got copied down for himself, and then these are recited to him in the morning and evening.''

2861.arabic: قُل أَنزَلَهُ الَّذى يَعلَمُ السِّرَّ فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ إِنَّهُ كانَ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
2861.en: O Muhammad, say to them, "This has been sent down by Him, Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth." The fact is that He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

2862.arabic: وَقالوا مالِ هـٰذَا الرَّسولِ يَأكُلُ الطَّعامَ وَيَمشى فِى الأَسواقِ لَولا أُنزِلَ إِلَيهِ مَلَكٌ فَيَكونَ مَعَهُ نَذيرًا
2862.en: They say, "What sort of a Messenger is he that he eats food and moves about in the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to accompany him and threaten (the disbelievers)?

2863.arabic: أَو يُلقىٰ إِلَيهِ كَنزٌ أَو تَكونُ لَهُ جَنَّةٌ يَأكُلُ مِنها وَقالَ الظّـٰلِمونَ إِن تَتَّبِعونَ إِلّا رَجُلًا مَسحورًا
2863.en: Or why has not at least a treasure been sent down for him or a garden given to him for (easy) sustenance?" And the wicked people say, "You are following a man bewitched."

2864.arabic: انظُر كَيفَ ضَرَبوا لَكَ الأَمثـٰلَ فَضَلّوا فَلا يَستَطيعونَ سَبيلًا
2864.en: Just see what strange arguments they bring forward with regard to you! They have gone so far astray that they cannot charge any thing against you.

2865.arabic: تَبارَكَ الَّذى إِن شاءَ جَعَلَ لَكَ خَيرًا مِن ذٰلِكَ جَنّـٰتٍ تَجرى مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهـٰرُ وَيَجعَل لَكَ قُصورًا
2865.en: Highly blessed is He, Who, if He wills, could give you much more and better things than what they propose for you: (Not one but) many gardens, beneath which rivers flow; and big castles:

2866.arabic: بَل كَذَّبوا بِالسّاعَةِ وَأَعتَدنا لِمَن كَذَّبَ بِالسّاعَةِ سَعيرًا
2866.en: The fact of the matter is that these people have denied "the Hour", ##And for the one who denies the coming of the Hour, We have prepared a blazing Fire.

2867.arabic: إِذا رَأَتهُم مِن مَكانٍ بَعيدٍ سَمِعوا لَها تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفيرًا
2867.en: When it will see them from afar, they will hear the sounds of its raging and roaring.

2868.arabic: وَإِذا أُلقوا مِنها مَكانًا ضَيِّقًا مُقَرَّنينَ دَعَوا هُنالِكَ ثُبورًا
2868.en: And when they are chained together and flung into a narrow space therein, they will begin to call for death.

2869.arabic: لا تَدعُوا اليَومَ ثُبورًا وٰحِدًا وَادعوا ثُبورًا كَثيرًا
2869.en: (Then it will be said to them:) "Do not call for one death today, but call for many deaths."

2870.arabic: قُل أَذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ أَم جَنَّةُ الخُلدِ الَّتى وُعِدَ المُتَّقونَ كانَت لَهُم جَزاءً وَمَصيرًا
2870.en: Ask them "Is this (Fire) better or the everlasting Garden which has been promised to the God#fearing righteous people?" which will be the recompense of their good deeds and the final destination of their journey

2871.arabic: لَهُم فيها ما يَشاءونَ خـٰلِدينَ كانَ عَلىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعدًا مَسـٔولًا
2871.en: wherein they will get everything they desire and wherein they will dwell for ever. This is a promise which your Lord has taken upon Himself to fulfil.

2872.arabic: وَيَومَ يَحشُرُهُم وَما يَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ فَيَقولُ ءَأَنتُم أَضلَلتُم عِبادى هـٰؤُلاءِ أَم هُم ضَلُّوا السَّبيلَ
2872.en: And on that Day (your Lord will gather these people together as well as their deities, whom they worship besides AIlah. Then He will ask them, "Did you mislead these servants of Mine, or did they themselves go astray?"

2873.arabic: قالوا سُبحـٰنَكَ ما كانَ يَنبَغى لَنا أَن نَتَّخِذَ مِن دونِكَ مِن أَولِياءَ وَلـٰكِن مَتَّعتَهُم وَءاباءَهُم حَتّىٰ نَسُوا الذِّكرَ وَكانوا قَومًا بورًا
2873.en: They will answer, "Glory be to Thee! We dared not take anyguardian besides Thee: (they were misled because) Thou didst give them and their forefathers all the good things of life till they forgot the Admonition, and incurred the punishment. "

2874.arabic: فَقَد كَذَّبوكُم بِما تَقولونَ فَما تَستَطيعونَ صَرفًا وَلا نَصرًا وَمَن يَظلِم مِنكُم نُذِقهُ عَذابًا كَبيرًا
2874.en: Thus will your gods deny alI that you are professing today. Then you shall neither be able to repel your punishment nor shall get any help from anywhere; and whoso is guilty. of iniquity'' among you, We shall make him taste a severe torment.

2875.arabic: وَما أَرسَلنا قَبلَكَ مِنَ المُرسَلينَ إِلّا إِنَّهُم لَيَأكُلونَ الطَّعامَ وَيَمشونَ فِى الأَسواقِ وَجَعَلنا بَعضَكُم لِبَعضٍ فِتنَةً أَتَصبِرونَ وَكانَ رَبُّكَ بَصيرًا
2875.en: O Muhammad,, all the Messengers whom We sent before you also ate food and moved about in the streets. In fact, We have made you all a means of test for one another. Will you show patience? for your Lord sees everything.

2876.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذينَ لا يَرجونَ لِقاءَنا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَينَا المَلـٰئِكَةُ أَو نَرىٰ رَبَّنا لَقَدِ استَكبَروا فى أَنفُسِهِم وَعَتَو عُتُوًّا كَبيرًا
2876.en: Those people, who have no fear of coming before Us, say, "Why should not the angels be sent down to us? Or else we should see our Lord. " Great arrogance have they assumed in regard to themselves, and have transgressed all limits in their rebellion.

2877.arabic: يَومَ يَرَونَ المَلـٰئِكَةَ لا بُشرىٰ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُجرِمينَ وَيَقولونَ حِجرًا مَحجورًا
2877.en: The Day, when they will see the angels, will not be a day of rejoicing for the criminals; they will cry out, "May Allah save us!"

2878.arabic: وَقَدِمنا إِلىٰ ما عَمِلوا مِن عَمَلٍ فَجَعَلنـٰهُ هَباءً مَنثورًا
2878.en: Then We shall turn to what they had done and render it vain like scattered dust.

2879.arabic: أَصحـٰبُ الجَنَّةِ يَومَئِذٍ خَيرٌ مُستَقَرًّا وَأَحسَنُ مَقيلًا
2879.en: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.

2880.arabic: وَيَومَ تَشَقَّقُ السَّماءُ بِالغَمـٰمِ وَنُزِّلَ المَلـٰئِكَةُ تَنزيلًا
2880.en: On that Day, a cloud will appear rending the sky and the angels will be senthi down rank after rank.

2881.arabic: المُلكُ يَومَئِذٍ الحَقُّ لِلرَّحمـٰنِ وَكانَ يَومًا عَلَى الكـٰفِرينَ عَسيرًا
2881.en: The real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the Merciful, and it will be a very hard Day for the disbelievers.

2882.arabic: وَيَومَ يَعَضُّ الظّالِمُ عَلىٰ يَدَيهِ يَقولُ يـٰلَيتَنِى اتَّخَذتُ مَعَ الرَّسولِ سَبيلًا
2882.en: The unjust man will bite at his hand and say, "Would that I had stood by the Messenger!

2883.arabic: يـٰوَيلَتىٰ لَيتَنى لَم أَتَّخِذ فُلانًا خَليلًا
2883.en: O, woe to me! Would that I had not chosen so and so for a friend!

2884.arabic: لَقَد أَضَلَّنى عَنِ الذِّكرِ بَعدَ إِذ جاءَنى وَكانَ الشَّيطـٰنُ لِلإِنسـٰنِ خَذولًا
2884.en: For it was he, who had deluded me to reject the Admonition which had come to me. Satan has proved very treacherous to man. "

2885.arabic: وَقالَ الرَّسولُ يـٰرَبِّ إِنَّ قَومِى اتَّخَذوا هـٰذَا القُرءانَ مَهجورًا
2885.en: And the Messenger will say, "O my Lord, my people had made this Qur'an the object of their ridicule."

2886.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ جَعَلنا لِكُلِّ نَبِىٍّ عَدُوًّا مِنَ المُجرِمينَ وَكَفىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هادِيًا وَنَصيرًا
2886.en: O Muhammad, in this very way We have made the criminals the enemies of every Prophet, but your Lord suffices for you as your Guide and Helper.

2887.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَولا نُزِّلَ عَلَيهِ القُرءانُ جُملَةً وٰحِدَةً كَذٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِ فُؤادَكَ وَرَتَّلنـٰهُ تَرتيلًا
2887.en: The disbelievers say, "Why has not the entire Qur'an been sent down to this man all at nce?" #Well, this has been done to impress it deeply on your mind, and (for the same object) We have sent it down piecemeal by degrees.

2888.arabic: وَلا يَأتونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلّا جِئنـٰكَ بِالحَقِّ وَأَحسَنَ تَفسيرًا
2888.en: And (there is another wisdom in this: whenever they brought to you an odd thing (or a strange question), We sent its right answer to you in time and explained it all in the best manner,

2889.arabic: الَّذينَ يُحشَرونَ عَلىٰ وُجوهِهِم إِلىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُولـٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبيلًا
2889.en: those who are going to be driven to Hell upon their faces, have taken an utterly wrong stand and their way is most erroneous!

2890.arabic: وَلَقَد ءاتَينا موسَى الكِتـٰبَ وَجَعَلنا مَعَهُ أَخاهُ هـٰرونَ وَزيرًا
2890.en: We gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron as his counsellor:

2891.arabic: فَقُلنَا اذهَبا إِلَى القَومِ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِـٔايـٰتِنا فَدَمَّرنـٰهُم تَدميرًا
2891.en: then We said to them, "Go to the people who have treated Our Revelations as false. " So We annihilated those people utterly.

2892.arabic: وَقَومَ نوحٍ لَمّا كَذَّبُوا الرُّسُلَ أَغرَقنـٰهُم وَجَعَلنـٰهُم لِلنّاسِ ءايَةً وَأَعتَدنا لِلظّـٰلِمينَ عَذابًا أَليمًا
2892.en: The same was the case with the people of Noah when they charged the Messenger with imposture: We drowned them and made them a sign of warning for entire mankind, and We have prepared a painful chastisement for the unjust.

2893.arabic: وَعادًا وَثَمودَا۟ وَأَصحـٰبَ الرَّسِّ وَقُرونًا بَينَ ذٰلِكَ كَثيرًا
2893.en: Likewise were destroyed the \`Ad and the Thamud and the people of the Rass, and many a generation in between.

2894.arabic: وَكُلًّا ضَرَبنا لَهُ الأَمثـٰلَ وَكُلًّا تَبَّرنا تَتبيرًا
2894.en: We admonished each one of them by citing the examples (of those who were destroyed before them) and ultimately annihilated all of them.

2895.arabic: وَلَقَد أَتَوا عَلَى القَريَةِ الَّتى أُمطِرَت مَطَرَ السَّوءِ أَفَلَم يَكونوا يَرَونَها بَل كانوا لا يَرجونَ نُشورًا
2895.en: Surely, these people have passed by that habitation on which was rained an evil rain: have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect another life in the Hereafter.

2896.arabic: وَإِذا رَأَوكَ إِن يَتَّخِذونَكَ إِلّا هُزُوًا أَهـٰذَا الَّذى بَعَثَ اللَّهُ رَسولًا
2896.en: When these people see you, they scoff at you, (saying), "Is this the man whom Allah has sent as His Messenger?

2897.arabic: إِن كادَ لَيُضِلُّنا عَن ءالِهَتِنا لَولا أَن صَبَرنا عَلَيها وَسَوفَ يَعلَمونَ حينَ يَرَونَ العَذابَ مَن أَضَلُّ سَبيلًا
2897.en: He had almost led us astray from our gods, had we not remained firm in our faith with regard to them. " The time is not far when they will see the torment and realize who had strayed far from the truth.

2898.arabic: أَرَءَيتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلـٰهَهُ هَوىٰهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكونُ عَلَيهِ وَكيلًا
2898.en: Have you ever considered the case of the person who has made his lust his god? Can you take the responsibility of guiding such a one aright?

2899.arabic: أَم تَحسَبُ أَنَّ أَكثَرَهُم يَسمَعونَ أَو يَعقِلونَ إِن هُم إِلّا كَالأَنعـٰمِ بَل هُم أَضَلُّ سَبيلًا
2899.en: Do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are only like the cattle; nay, even worse than the cattle.

2900.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيفَ مَدَّ الظِّلَّ وَلَو شاءَ لَجَعَلَهُ ساكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلنَا الشَّمسَ عَلَيهِ دَليلًا
2900.en: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? Had He willed, He would have made it constant, but We have made the sun its pilot;

2901.en: then (as the sun climbs up), We roll it up little by little towards Ourselves.

2902.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الَّيلَ لِباسًا وَالنَّومَ سُباتًا وَجَعَلَ النَّهارَ نُشورًا
2902.en: And it is Allah Who has ordained the night as a garment for you, and the sleep as a repose of death, and the day as the time of return to life.

2903.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى أَرسَلَ الرِّيـٰحَ بُشرًا بَينَ يَدَى رَحمَتِهِ وَأَنزَلنا مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً طَهورًا
2903.en: And it is He, Who drives the winds to be the harbingers of His mercy: then He sends down pure water from the sky

2904.arabic: لِنُحـِۧىَ بِهِ بَلدَةً مَيتًا وَنُسقِيَهُ مِمّا خَلَقنا أَنعـٰمًا وَأَناسِىَّ كَثيرًا
2904.en: so that He may revive the dead land, and quench the thirst of many of His creatures from among beasts and men.

2905.arabic: وَلَقَد صَرَّفنـٰهُ بَينَهُم لِيَذَّكَّروا فَأَبىٰ أَكثَرُ النّاسِ إِلّا كُفورًا
2905.en: We present the same phenomenon over and over again before them so that they may learn a lesson from it; but most people decline to adopt any other attitude than of disbelief and ingratitude.

2906.arabic: وَلَو شِئنا لَبَعَثنا فى كُلِّ قَريَةٍ نَذيرًا
2906.en: Had We willed, We would have raised up a separate Warner in each habitation.

2907.arabic: فَلا تُطِعِ الكـٰفِرينَ وَجـٰهِدهُم بِهِ جِهادًا كَبيرًا
2907.en: So, O Prophet, do not yield to the disbelievers, but wage a Jihad against them with this Qur'an.

2908.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى مَرَجَ البَحرَينِ هـٰذا عَذبٌ فُراتٌ وَهـٰذا مِلحٌ أُجاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَينَهُما بَرزَخًا وَحِجرًا مَحجورًا
2908.en: And it is He, Who has let loose the two seas, one palatable and sweet, the other bitter and saltish, and there is a partition between them, which is an insurmountable barrier.

2909.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى خَلَقَ مِنَ الماءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُ نَسَبًا وَصِهرًا وَكانَ رَبُّكَ قَديرًا
2909.en: And it is He, Who created man from water: then from him He caused two kinds of kindred, by blood and by marriage: your Lord is AI I#Powerful.

2910.arabic: وَيَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَنفَعُهُم وَلا يَضُرُّهُم وَكانَ الكافِرُ عَلىٰ رَبِّهِ ظَهيرًا
2910.en: Yet they worship, instead of Allah, those who can neither benefit them nor harm them: more than this, the disbeliever has become a helper of every rebel against his Lord.

2911.en: O Muhammad, We have sent you only to proclaim good tidings and to give warning.

2912.arabic: قُل ما أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ إِلّا مَن شاءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبيلًا
2912.en: Tell them, "I do not ask of you any recompense for this work: I only ask of the one, who will, to adopt the way of his Lord.

2913.arabic: وَتَوَكَّل عَلَى الحَىِّ الَّذى لا يَموتُ وَسَبِّح بِحَمدِهِ وَكَفىٰ بِهِ بِذُنوبِ عِبادِهِ خَبيرًا
2913.en: O Muhammad trust in that Allah Who is Ever#Living and will never die' Glorify Him with His praise, for He alone is sufficient to be aware of the sins of His servants.

2914.arabic: الَّذى خَلَقَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما فى سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ ثُمَّ استَوىٰ عَلَى العَرشِ الرَّحمـٰنُ فَسـَٔل بِهِ خَبيرًا
2914.en: In six days He created the earth and the heavens and all that is between them; then He established Himself on the "Throne" (of the Kingdom of the uriverse). (He is) the Merciful: as to His Glory, ask the one who knows.

2915.arabic: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُمُ اسجُدوا لِلرَّحمـٰنِ قالوا وَمَا الرَّحمـٰنُ أَنَسجُدُ لِما تَأمُرُنا وَزادَهُم نُفورًا
2915.en: When it is said to them. "Prostrate yourselves before the Merciful," they retort, "What is the Merciful? Would you have us prostrate ourselves before whomsoever you will?" And this invitation only helps to increase their hatred all the more.

2916.arabic: تَبارَكَ الَّذى جَعَلَ فِى السَّماءِ بُروجًا وَجَعَلَ فيها سِرٰجًا وَقَمَرًا مُنيرًا
2916.en: Highly blessed is He, Who has made fortified spheres in the heavens and has set in it a "lamp" and a shining moon.

2917.arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذى جَعَلَ الَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ خِلفَةً لِمَن أَرادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَو أَرادَ شُكورًا
2917.en: He it is Who caused the night and the day to succeed each other so that everyone who desires may learn a lesson or become grateful.

2918.arabic: وَعِبادُ الرَّحمـٰنِ الَّذينَ يَمشونَ عَلَى الأَرضِ هَونًا وَإِذا خاطَبَهُمُ الجـٰهِلونَ قالوا سَلـٰمًا
2918.en: The (true) servants of the Merciful are those who walk humbly on the earth who, when the ignorant people behave insolently towards them, say, "Peace to you"

2919.en: who pass their nights in prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord:

2920.arabic: وَالَّذينَ يَقولونَ رَبَّنَا اصرِف عَنّا عَذابَ جَهَنَّمَ إِنَّ عَذابَها كانَ غَرامًا
2920.en: who pray, "Our Lord, save us from the torment of Hell, for its torment is killing:

2921.en: it is an evil abode and an evil resting place":

2922.arabic: وَالَّذينَ إِذا أَنفَقوا لَم يُسرِفوا وَلَم يَقتُروا وَكانَ بَينَ ذٰلِكَ قَوامًا
2922.en: who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor miserly but keep the golden mean between the two (extremes):

2923.arabic: وَالَّذينَ لا يَدعونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلـٰهًا ءاخَرَ وَلا يَقتُلونَ النَّفسَ الَّتى حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلّا بِالحَقِّ وَلا يَزنونَ وَمَن يَفعَل ذٰلِكَ يَلقَ أَثامًا
2923.en: who do not invoke any god but Allah nor kill a soul, which Allah has forbidden, unjustly, nor commit adultery. #He who does this shall be punished for his sin,

2924.arabic: يُضـٰعَف لَهُ العَذابُ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ وَيَخلُد فيهِ مُهانًا
2924.en: and his torment shall be doubled on the Day of Resurrection, and he shall abide in a state of ignominy,

2925.arabic: إِلّا مَن تابَ وَءامَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صـٰلِحًا فَأُولـٰئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ اللَّهُ سَيِّـٔاتِهِم حَسَنـٰتٍ وَكانَ اللَّهُ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
2925.en: except the one who may have repented (after those sins) and have believed and done righteous works, for then Allah will change his evil deeds into good deeds, and He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

2926.arabic: وَمَن تابَ وَعَمِلَ صـٰلِحًا فَإِنَّهُ يَتوبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَتابًا
2926.en: In fact, the one who repents and does righteous deeds, returns to Allah as one ightly should. #

2927.arabic: وَالَّذينَ لا يَشهَدونَ الزّورَ وَإِذا مَرّوا بِاللَّغوِ مَرّوا كِرامًا
2927.en: (And the servants of the Merciful are those:) who do not bear witness to falsehood and who; if they have ever to pass by what is vain, pass by like dignified people:

2928.arabic: وَالَّذينَ إِذا ذُكِّروا بِـٔايـٰتِ رَبِّهِم لَم يَخِرّوا عَلَيها صُمًّا وَعُميانًا
2928.en: who do not behave like the blind and the deaf, when the Revelations of their Lord are recited to them for admonition;

2929.arabic: وَالَّذينَ يَقولونَ رَبَّنا هَب لَنا مِن أَزوٰجِنا وَذُرِّيّـٰتِنا قُرَّةَ أَعيُنٍ وَاجعَلنا لِلمُتَّقينَ إِمامًا
2929.en: who pray, "Our Lord, bless us with wives and children, who may be the comfort of our eyes, and make us leaders of the righteous. " #

2930.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ يُجزَونَ الغُرفَةَ بِما صَبَروا وَيُلَقَّونَ فيها تَحِيَّةً وَسَلـٰمًا
2930.en: Such are the people who will be rewarded with high palaces for their fortitude,, wherein they will be welcomed with due respect, honour and salutations

2931.en: and wherein they will live for ever: what an excellent abode and what an excellent resting place!

2932.arabic: قُل ما يَعبَؤُا۟ بِكُم رَبّى لَولا دُعاؤُكُم فَقَد كَذَّبتُم فَسَوفَ يَكونُ لِزامًا
2932.en: O Muhammad, tell the people, "MyLord does not care at all if you do not invoke Him. Now that you have denied (His Revelation), you will soon be awarded such a punishment which you will never be able to avoid."

2934.en: These are the verses of the Clear Book.

2935.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بـٰخِعٌ نَفسَكَ أَلّا يَكونوا مُؤمِنينَ
2935.en: (O Muhammad), you will perhaps grieve yourself to death because these people do not believe.

2936.arabic: إِن نَشَأ نُنَزِّل عَلَيهِم مِنَ السَّماءِ ءايَةً فَظَلَّت أَعنـٰقُهُم لَها خـٰضِعينَ
2936.en: If We will, We can send down a Sign to them from heaven, so their necks will be humbled to it.

2937.arabic: وَما يَأتيهِم مِن ذِكرٍ مِنَ الرَّحمـٰنِ مُحدَثٍ إِلّا كانوا عَنهُ مُعرِضينَ
2937.en: Never does there come to them an admonition from the Merciful Lord but they turn away from it.

2938.arabic: فَقَد كَذَّبوا فَسَيَأتيهِم أَنبـٰؤُا۟ ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِءونَ
2938.en: They will soon come to know the truth of that which they have been scoffing at.

2939.arabic: أَوَلَم يَرَوا إِلَى الأَرضِ كَم أَنبَتنا فيها مِن كُلِّ زَوجٍ كَريمٍ
2939.en: Do they not look at the earth, how We caused a variety of fine vegetation to grow from it (in abundance)?

2940.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
2940.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

2941.en: Verily Your Lord is Infinitely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

2942.arabic: وَإِذ نادىٰ رَبُّكَ موسىٰ أَنِ ائتِ القَومَ الظّـٰلِمينَ
2942.en: (Recount to them about the time) when Your Lord called Moses: "Go to the wrong#doing people,

2943.en: the people of Pharaoh: do they have no fear?"

2944.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّى أَخافُ أَن يُكَذِّبونِ
2944.en: He said: "My Lord! I fear that they will brand me a liar.

2945.arabic: وَيَضيقُ صَدرى وَلا يَنطَلِقُ لِسانى فَأَرسِل إِلىٰ هـٰرونَ
2945.en: My breast is constricted and my tongue is not fluent, so endow Messengership on Aaron.

2946.arabic: وَلَهُم عَلَىَّ ذَنبٌ فَأَخافُ أَن يَقتُلونِ
2946.en: As for me, they hold the charge of a crime against me. I fear they will put me to death."

2947.arabic: قالَ كَلّا فَاذهَبا بِـٔايـٰتِنا إِنّا مَعَكُم مُستَمِعونَ
2947.en: He said: "Certainly not! So go both of you with Our Signs. We shall be with you listening to everything.

2948.arabic: فَأتِيا فِرعَونَ فَقولا إِنّا رَسولُ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
2948.en: Go, then, to Pharaoh and say to him: 'The Lord of the Universe has sent us

2949.en: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.'"

2950.arabic: قالَ أَلَم نُرَبِّكَ فينا وَليدًا وَلَبِثتَ فينا مِن عُمُرِكَ سِنينَ
2950.en: Pharaoh said: "Did we not bring you up among us when you were a child?

2951.arabic: وَفَعَلتَ فَعلَتَكَ الَّتى فَعَلتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ الكـٰفِرينَ
2951.en: You spent many years of your life among us and then you committed that deed of yours. You are very ungrateful indeed."

2952.arabic: قالَ فَعَلتُها إِذًا وَأَنا۠ مِنَ الضّالّينَ
2952.en: Moses replied: "I committed that act erringly.

2953.arabic: فَفَرَرتُ مِنكُم لَمّا خِفتُكُم فَوَهَبَ لى رَبّى حُكمًا وَجَعَلَنى مِنَ المُرسَلينَ
2953.en: Then I fled for fear of you. Then my Lord bestowed wisdom and authority on me and made me one of the Messengers.

2954.arabic: وَتِلكَ نِعمَةٌ تَمُنُّها عَلَىَّ أَن عَبَّدتَ بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ
2954.en: Now this is the favour that you tauntingly remind me of: that you enslaved the Children of Israel!"

2955.en: Pharaoh said: "And who is this Lord of the Universe?"

2956.arabic: قالَ رَبُّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما إِن كُنتُم موقِنينَ
2956.en: Moses answered: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, if you were only to believe."

2957.en: Pharaoh said to those around him: "Do you hear (what he says)?"

2958.en: Moses said: "(He is) Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of yore."

2959.arabic: قالَ إِنَّ رَسولَكُمُ الَّذى أُرسِلَ إِلَيكُم لَمَجنونٌ
2959.en: Pharaoh said to the audience: "This Messenger of yours who has been sent to you is simply mad."

2960.arabic: قالَ رَبُّ المَشرِقِ وَالمَغرِبِ وَما بَينَهُما إِن كُنتُم تَعقِلونَ
2960.en: Moses continued: "(He is) the Lord of the east and the west, and all between them. If you only had any understanding!"

2961.arabic: قالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذتَ إِلـٰهًا غَيرى لَأَجعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ المَسجونينَ
2961.en: Pharaoh said: "If you take any god other than me, I will certainly make you one of those (who are rotting) in prison."

2962.en: Moses said: "Even if I were to bring a Clear Sign to you?"

2963.arabic: قالَ فَأتِ بِهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّـٰدِقينَ
2963.en: Pharaoh said: "Then bring it if you are truthful at all."

2964.arabic: فَأَلقىٰ عَصاهُ فَإِذا هِىَ ثُعبانٌ مُبينٌ
2964.en: (No sooner had he said this than) Moses threw down his rod and behold, it was a veritable serpent,

2965.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذا هِىَ بَيضاءُ لِلنّـٰظِرينَ
2965.en: and he drew his hand (out of his armpit) and lo! it had become a shining object to the beholders.

2966.arabic: قالَ لِلمَلَإِ حَولَهُ إِنَّ هـٰذا لَسـٰحِرٌ عَليمٌ
2966.en: Pharaoh said to the nobles around him: "Surely this man is a skilled magician

2967.arabic: يُريدُ أَن يُخرِجَكُم مِن أَرضِكُم بِسِحرِهِ فَماذا تَأمُرونَ
2967.en: who wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. Tell us, what do you advise us?"

2968.arabic: قالوا أَرجِه وَأَخاهُ وَابعَث فِى المَدائِنِ حـٰشِرينَ
2968.en: They said: "Detain him and his brother for a while and send forth heralds to the cities

2970.en: So the magicians were brought together on a particular day at a set time

2971.en: and the people were told: "Will you join the assembly?

2972.arabic: لَعَلَّنا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِن كانوا هُمُ الغـٰلِبينَ
2972.en: We may perhaps follow the religion of the magicians if they triumph."

2973.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قالوا لِفِرعَونَ أَئِنَّ لَنا لَأَجرًا إِن كُنّا نَحنُ الغـٰلِبينَ
2973.en: When the magicians came forth (for the encounter) they said to Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we triumph?"

2974.arabic: قالَ نَعَم وَإِنَّكُم إِذًا لَمِنَ المُقَرَّبينَ
2974.en: He said: "Yes, you will then become those near#stationed to me."

2975.arabic: قالَ لَهُم موسىٰ أَلقوا ما أَنتُم مُلقونَ
2975.en: Moses said to them: "Throw down whatever you wish to throw."

2976.arabic: فَأَلقَوا حِبالَهُم وَعِصِيَّهُم وَقالوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرعَونَ إِنّا لَنَحنُ الغـٰلِبونَ
2976.en: Thereupon they threw down their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall prevail."

2977.arabic: فَأَلقىٰ موسىٰ عَصاهُ فَإِذا هِىَ تَلقَفُ ما يَأفِكونَ
2977.en: Thereafter, Moses threw down his rod and behold, it went about swallowing up all the false devices they had contrived.

2978.en: Thereupon the magicians fell down in prostration,

2979.en: saying: "We (now) believe in the Lord of the Universe,

2980.en: the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

2981.arabic: قالَ ءامَنتُم لَهُ قَبلَ أَن ءاذَنَ لَكُم إِنَّهُ لَكَبيرُكُمُ الَّذى عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحرَ فَلَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيدِيَكُم وَأَرجُلَكُم مِن خِلـٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُم أَجمَعينَ
2981.en: Pharaoh said: "You accepted the word of Moses even before I granted you the leave to do so. Surely he is your chief who has taught you magic. Soon shall you come to know. I shall cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and shall crucify all of you."

2982.arabic: قالوا لا ضَيرَ إِنّا إِلىٰ رَبِّنا مُنقَلِبونَ
2982.en: They said: "We do not care, for we are bound to return to our Lord,

2983.arabic: إِنّا نَطمَعُ أَن يَغفِرَ لَنا رَبُّنا خَطـٰيـٰنا أَن كُنّا أَوَّلَ المُؤمِنينَ
2983.en: and we surely expect that Our Lord will forgive us our sins for we are the first ones to believe."

2984.arabic: وَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ أَن أَسرِ بِعِبادى إِنَّكُم مُتَّبَعونَ
2984.en: We revealed to Moses: "Set forth with My servants by night for you will be pursued."

2985.en: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities (to mobilise troops)

2986.en: saying: "These (Israelites) are only a small band of people

2987.en: who have certainly provoked our wrath.

2988.en: But we are a numerous host, ever on guard."

2989.en: Thus did We drive them out of their gardens and springs

2990.en: and their treasures and excellent dwellings.

2991.en: This happened with them; (but on the other hand), We enabled the Children of Israel to inherit those bounties.

2992.en: At sunrise they set off in pursuit of them

2993.arabic: فَلَمّا تَرٰءَا الجَمعانِ قالَ أَصحـٰبُ موسىٰ إِنّا لَمُدرَكونَ
2993.en: and when the groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out: "We are overtaken!"

2994.arabic: قالَ كَلّا إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبّى سَيَهدينِ
2994.en: Moses said: "Certainly not. My Lord is with me; He will direct me."

2995.arabic: فَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ أَنِ اضرِب بِعَصاكَ البَحرَ فَانفَلَقَ فَكانَ كُلُّ فِرقٍ كَالطَّودِ العَظيمِ
2995.en: Then We revealed to Moses, (commanding him): "Strike the sea with your rod." Thereupon the sea split up, and then each became like the mass of a huge mount.

2996.en: We also brought the other party close to the same spot,

2997.en: and We delivered Moses and his companions, all of them,

2999.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
2999.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3000.en: Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

3001.en: And recount to them the story of Abraham:

3002.arabic: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ وَقَومِهِ ما تَعبُدونَ
3002.en: when he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

3003.arabic: قالوا نَعبُدُ أَصنامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَها عـٰكِفينَ
3003.en: They answered: "There are some idols that we worship and are devoted to them with constancy."

3004.en: He asked: "Do they hear you when you call them

3005.en: or do they cause you any benefit or harm?"

3006.arabic: قالوا بَل وَجَدنا ءاباءَنا كَذٰلِكَ يَفعَلونَ
3006.en: They answered: "No; but we found our forefathers doing so."

3007.en: Thereupon, Abraham said: "Have you seen (with your eyes) those whom you have been worshipping,

3008.en: you and your forefathers of yore?

3009.arabic: فَإِنَّهُم عَدُوٌّ لى إِلّا رَبَّ العـٰلَمينَ
3009.en: They are all enemies to me; all, except the Lord of the Universe

3010.en: Who created me and Who guides me;

3011.en: Who gives me food and drink,

3012.en: and Who, when I am ill, heals me;

3013.en: Who will cause me to die and then will again restore me to life;

3014.arabic: وَالَّذى أَطمَعُ أَن يَغفِرَ لى خَطيـَٔتى يَومَ الدّينِ
3014.en: Who, I hope, will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgement."

3015.arabic: رَبِّ هَب لى حُكمًا وَأَلحِقنى بِالصّـٰلِحينَ
3015.en: (And then Abraham prayed): "My Lord, endow me with knowledge and wisdom and join me with the righteous,

3016.arabic: وَاجعَل لى لِسانَ صِدقٍ فِى الـٔاخِرينَ
3016.en: and grant me an honourable reputation among posterity,

3017.en: and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss,

3018.arabic: وَاغفِر لِأَبى إِنَّهُ كانَ مِنَ الضّالّينَ
3018.en: and forgive my father for he is among those who strayed,

3019.en: and disgrace me not on the Day when people will be raised to life,

3020.arabic: يَومَ لا يَنفَعُ مالٌ وَلا بَنونَ
3020.en: the Day when nothing will avail, neither wealth nor offspring,

3021.arabic: إِلّا مَن أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلبٍ سَليمٍ
3021.en: but only he that brings to Allah a sound heart will (attain to success)."

3022.en: (On that Day) the Garden will be brought near to the God#fearing,

3023.en: and the Fire will be uncovered for those who strayed,

3024.arabic: وَقيلَ لَهُم أَينَ ما كُنتُم تَعبُدونَ
3024.en: and they will be asked: "Where are the gods that you worshipped

3025.arabic: مِن دونِ اللَّهِ هَل يَنصُرونَكُم أَو يَنتَصِرونَ
3025.en: beside Allah? Can they be of any help to you, or even be of any help to themselves?"

3026.en: Then the idols and those who strayed will be hurled into the Fire headlong, one upon another,

3027.en: and so too the hosts of Iblis, all of them.

3028.en: There they will quarrel with one another and the erring ones will say (to their deities):

3029.arabic: تَاللَّهِ إِن كُنّا لَفى ضَلـٰلٍ مُبينٍ
3029.en: "By Allah, we were surely in clear error

3030.en: when we assigned to you a position equal to that of the Lord of the Universe.

3031.en: It is none but those steeped in guilt who led us into this error,

3032.en: and now we have none to intercede on our behalf,

3033.en: nor do we have a truly sincere friend.

3034.arabic: فَلَو أَنَّ لَنا كَرَّةً فَنَكونَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
3034.en: If only we could return we would be among the believers."

3035.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
3035.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3036.en: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

3037.en: The people of Noah gave the lie to the Messengers.

3038.arabic: إِذ قالَ لَهُم أَخوهُم نوحٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
3038.en: Recall when their brother Noah said to them: "Do you have no fear?

3039.en: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you;

3040.en: so fear Allah and obey me.

3041.arabic: وَما أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ إِن أَجرِىَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
3041.en: I seek of you no reward for this: my reward is with none except the Lord of the Universe.

3042.en: So fear Allah and obey me."

3043.en: They answered: "Shall we accept you even though it is the meanest of people who follow you?"

3044.arabic: قالَ وَما عِلمى بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
3044.en: Noah said: "What knowledge do I have about their deeds?

3045.arabic: إِن حِسابُهُم إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبّى لَو تَشعُرونَ
3045.en: It is only for my Lord to take account of them. Would that you made use of your understanding!

3046.en: It is not for me to repel those who choose to believe.

3047.en: I am none but a plain warner."

3048.arabic: قالوا لَئِن لَم تَنتَهِ يـٰنوحُ لَتَكونَنَّ مِنَ المَرجومينَ
3048.en: They said: "O Noah! If you do not desist, you will certainly become one of the accursed."

3049.en: He said: "My Lord! My people have branded me a liar.

3050.arabic: فَافتَح بَينى وَبَينَهُم فَتحًا وَنَجِّنى وَمَن مَعِىَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
3050.en: So pass a clear judgement between me and them and rescue me and the believers with me."

3051.arabic: فَأَنجَينـٰهُ وَمَن مَعَهُ فِى الفُلكِ المَشحونِ
3051.en: Thereafter We rescued him and those who were with him in the laden Ark

3053.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
3053.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3054.en: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

3055.en: The Ad gave the lie to the Messengers.

3056.arabic: إِذ قالَ لَهُم أَخوهُم هودٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
3056.en: Recall, when their brother Hud said to them: "Have you no fear?

3057.en: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

3058.en: So fear Allah and obey me.

3059.arabic: وَما أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ إِن أَجرِىَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
3059.en: I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

3060.en: What, you build a monument on every hill merely for fun

3061.en: and erect huge palaces as though you will live for ever,

3062.en: and when you strike you strike like tyrants?

3063.en: So fear Allah and obey me.

3064.en: Have fear of Him Who has provided you with all the (good) things you know;

3065.en: Who has provided you with flocks and children

3067.arabic: إِنّى أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
3067.en: I fear for you the chastisement of an Awesome Day."

3068.arabic: قالوا سَواءٌ عَلَينا أَوَعَظتَ أَم لَم تَكُن مِنَ الوٰعِظينَ
3068.en: They replied: "It is all the same for us whether you admonish us or not.

3069.en: This has been happening all along.

3070.en: We will not be subjected to any chastisement."

3071.arabic: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَأَهلَكنـٰهُم إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
3071.en: Eventually they gave the lie to him and We destroyed them. Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3072.en: Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

3073.en: The Thamud gave the lie to the Messengers.

3074.arabic: إِذ قالَ لَهُم أَخوهُم صـٰلِحٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
3074.en: Recall when their brother Salih said to them: "Have you no fear?"

3075.en: "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

3076.en: So fear Allah and obey me.

3077.arabic: وَما أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ إِن أَجرِىَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
3077.en: I ask of you no reward. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

3078.en: Do you believe that you will be left here to live securely in the present state

3080.en: and cornfields and date#palms laden with juicy fruits?

3081.en: You hew dwellings in mountains and exult in that.

3083.en: and do not follow the biddings of those that go to excesses

3084.arabic: الَّذينَ يُفسِدونَ فِى الأَرضِ وَلا يُصلِحونَ
3084.en: and spread mischief in the land rather than set things right."

3085.en: They replied: "You are nothing but one of those who are bewitched;

3086.arabic: ما أَنتَ إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُنا فَأتِ بِـٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّـٰدِقينَ
3086.en: you are no different from a mortal like us. So produce a sign if you are truthful."

3087.arabic: قالَ هـٰذِهِ ناقَةٌ لَها شِربٌ وَلَكُم شِربُ يَومٍ مَعلومٍ
3087.en: Salih said: "This is a she#camel. There is a day set for her to drink and there is a day set for you to drink.

3088.arabic: وَلا تَمَسّوها بِسوءٍ فَيَأخُذَكُم عَذابُ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
3088.en: Do not molest her lest the chastisement of an Awesome Day should seize you."

3089.en: But they hamstrung her and then regretted it.

3090.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ العَذابُ إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
3090.en: So the chastisement seized them. Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3091.en: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

3092.en: The people of Lot rejected the Messengers, branding them liars.

3093.arabic: إِذ قالَ لَهُم أَخوهُم لوطٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
3093.en: Recall, when their brother Lot said to them: "Have you no fear?

3094.en: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

3095.en: So fear Allah and obey me.

3096.arabic: وَما أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ إِن أَجرِىَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
3096.en: I seek of you no reward. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

3097.en: What, of all creation will you go to (fornicate with) the males,

3098.arabic: وَتَذَرونَ ما خَلَقَ لَكُم رَبُّكُم مِن أَزوٰجِكُم بَل أَنتُم قَومٌ عادونَ
3098.en: leaving aside those whom Allah has created for you as your mates. Nay, you are a people that has transgressed all limits."

3099.arabic: قالوا لَئِن لَم تَنتَهِ يـٰلوطُ لَتَكونَنَّ مِنَ المُخرَجينَ
3099.en: They said: "O Lot! If you do not desist, you will be one of those expelled (from our towns)."

3100.en: He said: "I am one of those who abhor your practice.

3101.en: My Lord, deliver me and my family from their wicked deeds."

3102.en: Then We delivered him and all his family

3103.en: except an old woman who was among those that stayed behind.

3104.en: Thereafter, We utterly destroyed the rest,

3105.arabic: وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيهِم مَطَرًا فَساءَ مَطَرُ المُنذَرينَ
3105.en: and We sent upon them a rain, an evil rain that fell on those who had been warned.

3106.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
3106.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3107.en: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

3108.en: The people of Aykah also gave the lie to the Messengers.

3109.arabic: إِذ قالَ لَهُم شُعَيبٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
3109.en: Recall, when Shuayb said to them: "Have you no fear?

3110.en: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

3111.en: So fear Allah and obey me.

3112.arabic: وَما أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ إِن أَجرِىَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
3112.en: I ask of you no reward for this. My reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

3113.arabic: أَوفُوا الكَيلَ وَلا تَكونوا مِنَ المُخسِرينَ
3113.en: Fill up the measure and do not diminish the goods of people,

3115.arabic: وَلا تَبخَسُوا النّاسَ أَشياءَهُم وَلا تَعثَوا فِى الأَرضِ مُفسِدينَ
3115.en: and do not deliver short, and do not go about creating mischief in the land,

3116.en: and have fear of Him Who created you and the earlier generations."

3117.en: They said: "You are no more than one of those who have been bewitched,

3118.arabic: وَما أَنتَ إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُنا وَإِن نَظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الكـٰذِبينَ
3118.en: you are only a mortal like us. Indeed we believe that you are an utter liar.

3119.arabic: فَأَسقِط عَلَينا كِسَفًا مِنَ السَّماءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّـٰدِقينَ
3119.en: So cause a piece of the sky to fall upon us if you are truthful."

3120.en: Shuayb said: "My Lord knows well all what you do."

3121.arabic: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَأَخَذَهُم عَذابُ يَومِ الظُّلَّةِ إِنَّهُ كانَ عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
3121.en: Then they branded him a liar, whereupon the chastisement of the Day of Canopy overtook them. It was the chastisement of a very awesome day.

3122.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
3122.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3123.en: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

3124.en: Indeed this is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe;

3125.en: which the truthful spirit has carried down

3126.en: to your heart that you might become one of those who warn (others on behalf of Allah),

3128.en: (a revelation embodied) in the scriptures of the ancients.

3129.arabic: أَوَلَم يَكُن لَهُم ءايَةً أَن يَعلَمَهُ عُلَمـٰؤُا۟ بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ
3129.en: Is it not a Sign to them # (to wit, the Makkans) # that the learned men of the Children of Israel know that?

3130.en: (But such is their adamance) that had We revealed it to one of the non#Arabs and even if he had recited (this clear Arabic discourse) to them

3131.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيهِم ما كانوا بِهِ مُؤمِنينَ
3131.en: they would still not have believed in it.

3132.en: Thus have We caused this (Admonition) to penetrate the hearts of the culprits (like a hot rod).

3133.arabic: لا يُؤمِنونَ بِهِ حَتّىٰ يَرَوُا العَذابَ الأَليمَ
3133.en: They will not believe in it until they clearly see the grievous chastisement.

3134.en: But when it comes upon them suddenly, taking them unawares,

3135.en: they say: "Can we be granted some respite?"

3136.en: Do they really want Our chastisement to be expedited?

3137.en: Did you consider that if We were to let them enjoy life for many years

3138.en: and then the chastisement of which they were being warned were to come upon them,

3139.arabic: ما أَغنىٰ عَنهُم ما كانوا يُمَتَّعونَ
3139.en: of what avail will be the provisions of life which they have been granted to enjoy?

3140.arabic: وَما أَهلَكنا مِن قَريَةٍ إِلّا لَها مُنذِرونَ
3140.en: We never destroyed any habitation but that it had warners

3141.en: to admonish them. We have never been unjust.

3142.en: The satans did not bring down this (Clear Book),

3143.en: nor does it behove them, nor does it lie in their power.

3144.en: Indeed they are debarred from even hearing it.

3145.arabic: فَلا تَدعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلـٰهًا ءاخَرَ فَتَكونَ مِنَ المُعَذَّبينَ
3145.en: So do not call any other god beside Allah lest you become of those who will be punished,

3147.arabic: وَاخفِض جَناحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
3147.en: and be meek to the believers who follow you.

3148.arabic: فَإِن عَصَوكَ فَقُل إِنّى بَرىءٌ مِمّا تَعمَلونَ
3148.en: Then if they disobey you say to them: "I am quit of what you do."

3149.en: And put your trust in Him Who is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate,

3150.en: Who observes you when you rise (to pray)

3151.en: and observes your movements among those who prostrate themselves.

3153.arabic: هَل أُنَبِّئُكُم عَلىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيـٰطينُ
3153.en: O people, shall I tell you on whom it is that satans descend?

3154.en: They descend on every forgerer steeped in sin,

3155.en: on those who whisper hearsay in the ears of people; and most of them are liars.

3156.en: As for poets, only the wayward follow them.

3157.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّهُم فى كُلِّ وادٍ يَهيمونَ
3157.en: Do you not see that they wander about in every valley

3158.en: and say things which they do not act upon,

3159.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثيرًا وَانتَصَروا مِن بَعدِ ما ظُلِموا وَسَيَعلَمُ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبونَ
3159.en: except those who believed and acted righteously and remembered Allah much, and when they themselves were subjected to wrong, they exacted retribution no more than to the extent of the wrong? Soon will the wrong#doers know the end that they shall reach.

3160.arabic: طس تِلكَ ءايـٰتُ القُرءانِ وَكِتابٍ مُبينٍ
3160.en: Ta'. Sin. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a Clear Book;

3161.en: a guidance and good tidings for the believers

3162.arabic: الَّذينَ يُقيمونَ الصَّلوٰةَ وَيُؤتونَ الزَّكوٰةَ وَهُم بِالـٔاخِرَةِ هُم يوقِنونَ
3162.en: who establish Prayer and give Zakah, and have firm faith in the Hereafter.

3163.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالـٔاخِرَةِ زَيَّنّا لَهُم أَعمـٰلَهُم فَهُم يَعمَهونَ
3163.en: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem attractive to them so they stumble around in perplexity.

3164.arabic: أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ لَهُم سوءُ العَذابِ وَهُم فِى الـٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ الأَخسَرونَ
3164.en: It is they for whom a grievous chastisement lies in store; it is they who shall be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.

3165.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى القُرءانَ مِن لَدُن حَكيمٍ عَليمٍ
3165.en: As for you, (O Muhammad), you are receiving the Qur'an from the Most Wise, the All#Knowing.

3166.arabic: إِذ قالَ موسىٰ لِأَهلِهِ إِنّى ءانَستُ نارًا سَـٔاتيكُم مِنها بِخَبَرٍ أَو ءاتيكُم بِشِهابٍ قَبَسٍ لَعَلَّكُم تَصطَلونَ
3166.en: (Recount to them) when Moses said to his family: "I perceive something like fire: soon will I bring to you some information from there, or I will bring you a burning brand that you may warm yourselves."

3167.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَها نودِىَ أَن بورِكَ مَن فِى النّارِ وَمَن حَولَها وَسُبحـٰنَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
3167.en: But when Moses came to the fire, a call was sounded: "Blessed is He Who is in the fire and whatever is around it. Glory be to Allah, the Sustainer of all in the Universe.

3168.arabic: يـٰموسىٰ إِنَّهُ أَنَا اللَّهُ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
3168.en: O Moses, verily this is Me, Allah, the All#Mighty, the All#Wise!

3169.arabic: وَأَلقِ عَصاكَ فَلَمّا رَءاها تَهتَزُّ كَأَنَّها جانٌّ وَلّىٰ مُدبِرًا وَلَم يُعَقِّب يـٰموسىٰ لا تَخَف إِنّى لا يَخافُ لَدَىَّ المُرسَلونَ
3169.en: Now cast your rod!" But when he saw the rod writhing as though it were a serpent, he turned his back in retreat and did not even look behind. "O Moses, have no fear. Messengers have no fear in My presence,

3170.arabic: إِلّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسنًا بَعدَ سوءٍ فَإِنّى غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
3170.en: except he who has committed some wrong. But if he substitutes good in place of evil, I am Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

3171.arabic: وَأَدخِل يَدَكَ فى جَيبِكَ تَخرُج بَيضاءَ مِن غَيرِ سوءٍ فى تِسعِ ءايـٰتٍ إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَقَومِهِ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومًا فـٰسِقينَ
3171.en: Now put your hand into your bosom, and it will come forth shining without any blemish. (These are two of the) nine Signs to be carried to Pharaoh and his people. They are surely a wicked people."

3172.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَتهُم ءايـٰتُنا مُبصِرَةً قالوا هـٰذا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
3172.en: But when Our Clear Signs came to them, they said: "This is plain magic."

3173.arabic: وَجَحَدوا بِها وَاستَيقَنَتها أَنفُسُهُم ظُلمًا وَعُلُوًّا فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عـٰقِبَةُ المُفسِدينَ
3173.en: They denied those Signs out of iniquity and arrogance although their hearts were convinced of their truth. So see how evil was the end of those mischief#makers!

3174.arabic: وَلَقَد ءاتَينا داوۥدَ وَسُلَيمـٰنَ عِلمًا وَقالَا الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذى فَضَّلَنا عَلىٰ كَثيرٍ مِن عِبادِهِ المُؤمِنينَ
3174.en: (On the other hand), We granted knowledge to David and Solomon and they said: "All praise be to Allah Who has exalted us above many of His believing servants!"

3175.arabic: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيمـٰنُ داوۥدَ وَقالَ يـٰأَيُّهَا النّاسُ عُلِّمنا مَنطِقَ الطَّيرِ وَأوتينا مِن كُلِّ شَىءٍ إِنَّ هـٰذا لَهُوَ الفَضلُ المُبينُ
3175.en: And Solomon succeeded David and said: "O people, we have been taught the speech of birds and we have been endowed with all kinds of things. Surely this is a conspicuous favour (from Allah)."

3176.arabic: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيمـٰنَ جُنودُهُ مِنَ الجِنِّ وَالإِنسِ وَالطَّيرِ فَهُم يوزَعونَ
3176.en: Hosts of jinn and humans and birds were marshalled for Solomon and were kept under full control.

3177.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا أَتَوا عَلىٰ وادِ النَّملِ قالَت نَملَةٌ يـٰأَيُّهَا النَّملُ ادخُلوا مَسـٰكِنَكُم لا يَحطِمَنَّكُم سُلَيمـٰنُ وَجُنودُهُ وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
3177.en: (Solomon was once on the move with them) until when they reached a valley of ants one of the ants said: "O ants, get into your holes, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you (under their feet) without even knowing."

3178.arabic: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضاحِكًا مِن قَولِها وَقالَ رَبِّ أَوزِعنى أَن أَشكُرَ نِعمَتَكَ الَّتى أَنعَمتَ عَلَىَّ وَعَلىٰ وٰلِدَىَّ وَأَن أَعمَلَ صـٰلِحًا تَرضىٰهُ وَأَدخِلنى بِرَحمَتِكَ فى عِبادِكَ الصّـٰلِحينَ
3178.en: Smiling at the ant's utterance, Solomon burst into laughter and said: "My Lord! Hold me under (Your) control that I may render thanks for the favour which You have bestowed on me and on my parents, and that I may act righteously in a manner that would please You. Include me, out of Your Mercy, among Your righteous servants."

3179.arabic: وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيرَ فَقالَ ما لِىَ لا أَرَى الهُدهُدَ أَم كانَ مِنَ الغائِبينَ
3179.en: (On another occasion) Solomon inspected the birds and said: "Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Is he among the absentees?

3180.arabic: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذابًا شَديدًا أَو لَأَا۟ذبَحَنَّهُ أَو لَيَأتِيَنّى بِسُلطـٰنٍ مُبينٍ
3180.en: I will inflict a severe punishment on him or maybe even slaughter him unless he comes forth with a convincing reason (for his absence)."

3181.arabic: فَمَكَثَ غَيرَ بَعيدٍ فَقالَ أَحَطتُ بِما لَم تُحِط بِهِ وَجِئتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقينٍ
3181.en: Not before long the hoopoe came up and said: "I have obtained a knowledge which you could not. I have brought for you sure news about Sheba.

3182.arabic: إِنّى وَجَدتُ امرَأَةً تَملِكُهُم وَأوتِيَت مِن كُلِّ شَىءٍ وَلَها عَرشٌ عَظيمٌ
3182.en: I found there a woman ruling over them, one who has been endowed with all things and has a mighty throne.

3183.arabic: وَجَدتُها وَقَومَها يَسجُدونَ لِلشَّمسِ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيطـٰنُ أَعمـٰلَهُم فَصَدَّهُم عَنِ السَّبيلِ فَهُم لا يَهتَدونَ
3183.en: I found that she and her people prostrate themselves before the sun rather than Allah. " Satan has made their deeds appear attractive to them and has, thus, debarred them from the Right Path so they do not find true guidance

3184.arabic: أَلّا يَسجُدوا لِلَّهِ الَّذى يُخرِجُ الخَبءَ فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَيَعلَمُ ما تُخفونَ وَما تُعلِنونَ
3184.en: that they would prostrate themselves before Allah Who brings to light all that is hidden in the heavens and the earth and knows all that you conceal and all that you reveal.

3185.arabic: اللَّهُ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ رَبُّ العَرشِ العَظيمِ
3185.en: Allah # none is worthy of worship save He; He is the Lord of the Mighty Throne.

3186.arabic: قالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقتَ أَم كُنتَ مِنَ الكـٰذِبينَ
3186.en: Solomon said: "Soon shall we see whether you have spoken the truth or are one of those that lie.

3187.arabic: اذهَب بِكِتـٰبى هـٰذا فَأَلقِه إِلَيهِم ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنهُم فَانظُر ماذا يَرجِعونَ
3187.en: Take this letter of mine, deliver it to them, and then draw back from them, and observe what they do."

3188.arabic: قالَت يـٰأَيُّهَا المَلَؤُا۟ إِنّى أُلقِىَ إِلَىَّ كِتـٰبٌ كَريمٌ
3188.en: The Queen said:" Know my nobles that a gracious letter has been delivered to me.

3189.arabic: إِنَّهُ مِن سُلَيمـٰنَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحمـٰنِ الرَّحيمِ
3189.en: It is from Solomon, and it is: "In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate."

3190.en: (It says): "Do not act towards me with defiance, but come to me in submission."

3191.arabic: قالَت يـٰأَيُّهَا المَلَؤُا۟ أَفتونى فى أَمرى ما كُنتُ قاطِعَةً أَمرًا حَتّىٰ تَشهَدونِ
3191.en: (After reading the letter) the Queen said: "Nobles, let me have your counsel in this matter for I make no firm decision without you."

3192.arabic: قالوا نَحنُ أُولوا قُوَّةٍ وَأُولوا بَأسٍ شَديدٍ وَالأَمرُ إِلَيكِ فَانظُرى ماذا تَأمُرينَ
3192.en: They said: "We are strong and are given to vehement fighting. But the decision is yours. Therefore, consider what you would like to command."

3193.arabic: قالَت إِنَّ المُلوكَ إِذا دَخَلوا قَريَةً أَفسَدوها وَجَعَلوا أَعِزَّةَ أَهلِها أَذِلَّةً وَكَذٰلِكَ يَفعَلونَ
3193.en: The Queen said: "When the kings enter a country they cause corruption in it and abase those of its people who are held in honour. This is what they are wont to do.

3194.arabic: وَإِنّى مُرسِلَةٌ إِلَيهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَناظِرَةٌ بِمَ يَرجِعُ المُرسَلونَ
3194.en: I will send them a gift and then see with what answer my envoys return."

3195.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَ سُلَيمـٰنَ قالَ أَتُمِدّونَنِ بِمالٍ فَما ءاتىٰنِۦَ اللَّهُ خَيرٌ مِمّا ءاتىٰكُم بَل أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُم تَفرَحونَ
3195.en: Now, when (the envoy of the Queen) came to Solomon, he said: "Do you want to aid me with wealth? Whatever Allah has granted me is much more than what He has given you. (Keep for yourselves) your gift in which you are exulting.

3196.arabic: ارجِع إِلَيهِم فَلَنَأتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنودٍ لا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِها وَلَنُخرِجَنَّهُم مِنها أَذِلَّةً وَهُم صـٰغِرونَ
3196.en: Envoy, go back to those who sent you and we shall certainly come upon them with hosts whom they will be unable to resist. We shall drive them out from there, and they will suffer humiliation and disgrace."

3197.arabic: قالَ يـٰأَيُّهَا المَلَؤُا۟ أَيُّكُم يَأتينى بِعَرشِها قَبلَ أَن يَأتونى مُسلِمينَ
3197.en: Solomon said: "My nobles, which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"

3198.arabic: قالَ عِفريتٌ مِنَ الجِنِّ أَنا۠ ءاتيكَ بِهِ قَبلَ أَن تَقومَ مِن مَقامِكَ وَإِنّى عَلَيهِ لَقَوِىٌّ أَمينٌ
3198.en: A stalwart of the jinn said: "I will bring it to you before you rise from your council. Surely I have the power to do so and I am trustworthy."

3199.arabic: قالَ الَّذى عِندَهُ عِلمٌ مِنَ الكِتـٰبِ أَنا۠ ءاتيكَ بِهِ قَبلَ أَن يَرتَدَّ إِلَيكَ طَرفُكَ فَلَمّا رَءاهُ مُستَقِرًّا عِندَهُ قالَ هـٰذا مِن فَضلِ رَبّى لِيَبلُوَنى ءَأَشكُرُ أَم أَكفُرُ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّما يَشكُرُ لِنَفسِهِ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبّى غَنِىٌّ كَريمٌ
3199.en: And he who had some knowledge of the Book said: "I will bring it before the twinkling of your eye." When Solomon saw the throne placed firmly beside him, he cried out: "This is by the grace of my Lord so that He may test me whether I give thanks for (His Bounty) or act with ingratitude. Whoever is grateful is so to his own good; and whoever is ungrateful, let him know that my Lord is Immensely Resourceful, Most Bountiful."

3200.arabic: قالَ نَكِّروا لَها عَرشَها نَنظُر أَتَهتَدى أَم تَكونُ مِنَ الَّذينَ لا يَهتَدونَ
3200.en: Solomon said: " Set the throne before her casually, and let us see whether she gets to the Truth or is one of those who are not guided to what is right."

3201.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَت قيلَ أَهـٰكَذا عَرشُكِ قالَت كَأَنَّهُ هُوَ وَأوتينَا العِلمَ مِن قَبلِها وَكُنّا مُسلِمينَ
3201.en: When the Queen arrived, she was asked: "Is your throne like this one?" She said: "It seems as if it is the same. We had already come to know this and we had submitted ourselves."

3202.arabic: وَصَدَّها ما كانَت تَعبُدُ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ إِنَّها كانَت مِن قَومٍ كـٰفِرينَ
3202.en: What prevented her (from accepting the True Faith) was her worshipping deities other than Allah, for she belonged to an unbelieving people.

3203.arabic: قيلَ لَهَا ادخُلِى الصَّرحَ فَلَمّا رَأَتهُ حَسِبَتهُ لُجَّةً وَكَشَفَت عَن ساقَيها قالَ إِنَّهُ صَرحٌ مُمَرَّدٌ مِن قَواريرَ قالَت رَبِّ إِنّى ظَلَمتُ نَفسى وَأَسلَمتُ مَعَ سُلَيمـٰنَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
3203.en: She was told: "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a pool of water and she bared both her calves (to enter into it). Solomon said: "This is a slippery floor of crystal." Thereupon she cried out: "My Lord, I have been inflicting much wrong on myself. Now I submit myself with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe."

3204.arabic: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا إِلىٰ ثَمودَ أَخاهُم صـٰلِحًا أَنِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ فَإِذا هُم فَريقانِ يَختَصِمونَ
3204.en: And We sent to Thamud their brother Salih (with the Message): "Serve Allah," but all of a sudden they became split into two quarrelling factions.

3205.arabic: قالَ يـٰقَومِ لِمَ تَستَعجِلونَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ قَبلَ الحَسَنَةِ لَولا تَستَغفِرونَ اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
3205.en: Salih said: "My people, why do you wish to hasten that evil rather than good should come upon you? Why should you not seek pardon from Allah so that mercy be shown to you?"

3206.arabic: قالُوا اطَّيَّرنا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَعَكَ قالَ طـٰئِرُكُم عِندَ اللَّهِ بَل أَنتُم قَومٌ تُفتَنونَ
3206.en: They said: "We augur ill of you and those who are with you." Salih replied: "Your augury is with Allah. The truth is that you are a people who are being tried."

3207.arabic: وَكانَ فِى المَدينَةِ تِسعَةُ رَهطٍ يُفسِدونَ فِى الأَرضِ وَلا يُصلِحونَ
3207.en: Now there were nine ring#leaders in the city who created corruption in the land and never worked to set things right.

3208.arabic: قالوا تَقاسَموا بِاللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُ وَأَهلَهُ ثُمَّ لَنَقولَنَّ لِوَلِيِّهِ ما شَهِدنا مَهلِكَ أَهلِهِ وَإِنّا لَصـٰدِقونَ
3208.en: They said: "Swear to one another in the name of Allah that we shall make a sudden night swoop on Salih and his family and will then tell their heirs that we did not witness the destruction of his family. We are indeed truthful."

3209.arabic: وَمَكَروا مَكرًا وَمَكَرنا مَكرًا وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
3209.en: Thus they planned and We too planned, the while they did not know.

3210.arabic: فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عـٰقِبَةُ مَكرِهِم أَنّا دَمَّرنـٰهُم وَقَومَهُم أَجمَعينَ
3210.en: So see what was the outcome of the plan they made: We utterly destroyed them and their people, all of them.

3211.arabic: فَتِلكَ بُيوتُهُم خاوِيَةً بِما ظَلَموا إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايَةً لِقَومٍ يَعلَمونَ
3211.en: Now behold their houses that lie in utter ruins because of their wrong#doing. Verily there is a Sign in this for the people who know.

3212.en: And We delivered those who believed and were wont to avoid disobeying (Allah).

3213.arabic: وَلوطًا إِذ قالَ لِقَومِهِ أَتَأتونَ الفـٰحِشَةَ وَأَنتُم تُبصِرونَ
3213.en: We also sent Lot, and recall when he told his people: "Do you commit shameless acts with your eyes open?

3214.arabic: أَئِنَّكُم لَتَأتونَ الرِّجالَ شَهوَةً مِن دونِ النِّساءِ بَل أَنتُم قَومٌ تَجهَلونَ
3214.en: Do you lustfully approach men instead of women? Nay, you engage in acts of sheer ignorance."

3215.arabic: فَما كانَ جَوابَ قَومِهِ إِلّا أَن قالوا أَخرِجوا ءالَ لوطٍ مِن قَريَتِكُم إِنَّهُم أُناسٌ يَتَطَهَّرونَ
3215.en: But this had only one answer from his people. They said: "Expel Lot's folk from your city. They pretend to be absolutely clean."

3216.arabic: فَأَنجَينـٰهُ وَأَهلَهُ إِلَّا امرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرنـٰها مِنَ الغـٰبِرينَ
3216.en: Eventually We saved (Lot) and his family, except his wife. We had decreed that she should be among those who would remain behind.

3217.arabic: وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيهِم مَطَرًا فَساءَ مَطَرُ المُنذَرينَ
3217.en: And We rained down upon them a rain. It was an evil rain for those who had already been warned.

3218.arabic: قُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ وَسَلـٰمٌ عَلىٰ عِبادِهِ الَّذينَ اصطَفىٰ ءاللَّهُ خَيرٌ أَمّا يُشرِكونَ
3218.en: Say, (O Muhammad): "All praise be to Allah, and peace be on those of His servants whom He has chosen." (Ask them): "Who is better: Allah or the false gods that they associate with Him as His partners?

3219.arabic: أَمَّن خَلَقَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضَ وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَنبَتنا بِهِ حَدائِقَ ذاتَ بَهجَةٍ ما كانَ لَكُم أَن تُنبِتوا شَجَرَها أَءِلـٰهٌ مَعَ اللَّهِ بَل هُم قَومٌ يَعدِلونَ
3219.en: Who is it that has created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you water from the sky and then We caused to grow therewith orchards full of beauty whose trees you could never grow. Is there any god associated with Allah (in these tasks)?" Nay, they are a people who are veering away from the Right Path.

3220.arabic: أَمَّن جَعَلَ الأَرضَ قَرارًا وَجَعَلَ خِلـٰلَها أَنهـٰرًا وَجَعَلَ لَها رَوٰسِىَ وَجَعَلَ بَينَ البَحرَينِ حاجِزًا أَءِلـٰهٌ مَعَ اللَّهِ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
3220.en: Who is it Who has made the earth a place of resort, and has caused rivers to flow in its midst, and has placed upon it firm mountains, and has placed a barrier between two masses of water? Is there any god associated with Allah (in these tasks)? Nay; but most of them do not know.

3221.arabic: أَمَّن يُجيبُ المُضطَرَّ إِذا دَعاهُ وَيَكشِفُ السّوءَ وَيَجعَلُكُم خُلَفاءَ الأَرضِ أَءِلـٰهٌ مَعَ اللَّهِ قَليلًا ما تَذَكَّرونَ
3221.en: Who is it Who heeds the prayers of the distressed when he calls out to Him and Who removes his affliction? And who is it Who makes you vicegerents of the earth? Is there any god associated with Allah (in this task)? How little do you reflect!

3222.arabic: أَمَّن يَهديكُم فى ظُلُمـٰتِ البَرِّ وَالبَحرِ وَمَن يُرسِلُ الرِّيـٰحَ بُشرًا بَينَ يَدَى رَحمَتِهِ أَءِلـٰهٌ مَعَ اللَّهِ تَعـٰلَى اللَّهُ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
3222.en: Who is it Who guides you through the darkness on land and sea? And Who sends winds as heralds of good tidings ahead of His Mercy? Is there any god associated with Allah (in this task)? Exalted be Allah above whatever they associate with Him in His Divinity!

3223.arabic: أَمَّن يَبدَؤُا۟ الخَلقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ وَمَن يَرزُقُكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ أَءِلـٰهٌ مَعَ اللَّهِ قُل هاتوا بُرهـٰنَكُم إِن كُنتُم صـٰدِقينَ
3223.en: Who is it Who creates in the first instance and then repeats it? Who is it Who provides you with sustenance from the heavens and the earth? Is there any god associated with Allah (in these tasks)? Say: "Bring forth your evidence, if you are truthful."

3224.arabic: قُل لا يَعلَمُ مَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ الغَيبَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَما يَشعُرونَ أَيّانَ يُبعَثونَ
3224.en: Say: "None in the heavens or on the earth has knowledge of the Unseen save Allah. They do not know when they will be raised to life."

3225.arabic: بَلِ ادّٰرَكَ عِلمُهُم فِى الـٔاخِرَةِ بَل هُم فى شَكٍّ مِنها بَل هُم مِنها عَمونَ
3225.en: Nay, but they have lost their knowledge of the Hereafter. They are steeped in doubt and uncertainty about it: rather they are blind to it.

3226.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَءِذا كُنّا تُرٰبًا وَءاباؤُنا أَئِنّا لَمُخرَجونَ
3226.en: The unbelievers say: "When we become dust, we and our forefathers, shall we really be brought out (from our graves)?

3227.arabic: لَقَد وُعِدنا هـٰذا نَحنُ وَءاباؤُنا مِن قَبلُ إِن هـٰذا إِلّا أَسـٰطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
3227.en: We were told about this and so were our forefathers before us. But these are no more than fairy tales that have been recounted from ancient times."

3228.arabic: قُل سيروا فِى الأَرضِ فَانظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عـٰقِبَةُ المُجرِمينَ
3228.en: Say: "Go about through the earth and see what has been the end of the evil#doers."

3229.arabic: وَلا تَحزَن عَلَيهِم وَلا تَكُن فى ضَيقٍ مِمّا يَمكُرونَ
3229.en: (O Prophet), do not grieve over them, nor be distressed at their designs.

3230.arabic: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هـٰذَا الوَعدُ إِن كُنتُم صـٰدِقينَ
3230.en: They also say: "Tell us when this threat will come to pass, if you are truthful."

3231.arabic: قُل عَسىٰ أَن يَكونَ رَدِفَ لَكُم بَعضُ الَّذى تَستَعجِلونَ
3231.en: Say: "The chastisement whose hastening you have been asking for, maybe a part of it has drawn quite near to you."

3232.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذو فَضلٍ عَلَى النّاسِ وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَشكُرونَ
3232.en: Indeed Your Lord is exceedingly bountiful to mankind. Yet most of them do not give thanks.

3233.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَعلَمُ ما تُكِنُّ صُدورُهُم وَما يُعلِنونَ
3233.en: Verily your Lord knows all that their hearts conceal as well as all that they reveal.

3234.arabic: وَما مِن غائِبَةٍ فِى السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ إِلّا فى كِتـٰبٍ مُبينٍ
3234.en: There is nothing that is hidden # be it in the heaven or the earth # but is recorded in a Clear Book.

3235.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰذَا القُرءانَ يَقُصُّ عَلىٰ بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ أَكثَرَ الَّذى هُم فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
3235.en: Surely this Qur'an explains to the Children of Israel most of the matters concerning which they have disagreements

3236.en: and it is a guidance and mercy for the believers.

3237.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقضى بَينَهُم بِحُكمِهِ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ العَليمُ
3237.en: Indeed your Lord will decide between them by His judgement. He is All#Mighty, All#Knowing.

3238.arabic: فَتَوَكَّل عَلَى اللَّهِ إِنَّكَ عَلَى الحَقِّ المُبينِ
3238.en: So put your trust in Allah for you are on the manifest truth.

3239.arabic: إِنَّكَ لا تُسمِعُ المَوتىٰ وَلا تُسمِعُ الصُّمَّ الدُّعاءَ إِذا وَلَّوا مُدبِرينَ
3239.en: Surely you cannot make the dead hear you, nor can you make the deaf hear your call if they turn back in flight,

3240.arabic: وَما أَنتَ بِهـٰدِى العُمىِ عَن ضَلـٰلَتِهِم إِن تُسمِعُ إِلّا مَن يُؤمِنُ بِـٔايـٰتِنا فَهُم مُسلِمونَ
3240.en: nor can you direct the blind to the Right Way, preventing them from falling into error. You can make only those who believe in Our verses to hear the call and then submit.

3241.arabic: وَإِذا وَقَعَ القَولُ عَلَيهِم أَخرَجنا لَهُم دابَّةً مِنَ الأَرضِ تُكَلِّمُهُم أَنَّ النّاسَ كانوا بِـٔايـٰتِنا لا يوقِنونَ
3241.en: And when the time for the fulfilment of Our Word against them will come, We shall bring forth for them a beast from the earth who will speak to them because people did not believe in Our Signs.

3242.arabic: وَيَومَ نَحشُرُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ فَوجًا مِمَّن يُكَذِّبُ بِـٔايـٰتِنا فَهُم يوزَعونَ
3242.en: Just imagine the Day when We shall muster from every nation a large group of those who gave the lie to Our Signs, and they shall be duly arranged in ranks

3243.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءو قالَ أَكَذَّبتُم بِـٔايـٰتى وَلَم تُحيطوا بِها عِلمًا أَمّاذا كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
3243.en: until, when all of them have arrived, Allah will say: "Did you give the lie to My Signs even without encompassing them with your knowledge? If that is not so, what did you do?"

3244.arabic: وَوَقَعَ القَولُ عَلَيهِم بِما ظَلَموا فَهُم لا يَنطِقونَ
3244.en: And the Word will come to pass against them because of their wrong#doing: they will then be able to utter nothing.

3245.arabic: أَلَم يَرَوا أَنّا جَعَلنَا الَّيلَ لِيَسكُنوا فيهِ وَالنَّهارَ مُبصِرًا إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايـٰتٍ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
3245.en: Did they not perceive that We had made the night so that they may repose in it and made the day clear and shining. Surely there are Signs in this for those who believe.

3246.arabic: وَيَومَ يُنفَخُ فِى الصّورِ فَفَزِعَ مَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَمَن فِى الأَرضِ إِلّا مَن شاءَ اللَّهُ وَكُلٌّ أَتَوهُ دٰخِرينَ
3246.en: The Day when the Trumpet will be blown all those who are in the heavens and on the earth shall be terror stricken # all except those whom Allah wills # and everyone shall come to Him utterly abject.

3247.arabic: وَتَرَى الجِبالَ تَحسَبُها جامِدَةً وَهِىَ تَمُرُّ مَرَّ السَّحابِ صُنعَ اللَّهِ الَّذى أَتقَنَ كُلَّ شَىءٍ إِنَّهُ خَبيرٌ بِما تَفعَلونَ
3247.en: You now see the mountains and consider them firmly fixed, but then they shall pass away even as clouds pass away. That will be the handiwork of Allah Who has created everything with perfect wisdom. He is well aware of what you do.

3248.arabic: مَن جاءَ بِالحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُ خَيرٌ مِنها وَهُم مِن فَزَعٍ يَومَئِذٍ ءامِنونَ
3248.en: Whosoever comes with good will receive a reward better than his deed, and they will be made secure from the terror of that Day.

3249.arabic: وَمَن جاءَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ فَكُبَّت وُجوهُهُم فِى النّارِ هَل تُجزَونَ إِلّا ما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
3249.en: And whosoever comes with evil, they will be flung upon their faces into the Fire. Will you be recompensed for aught other than what you do?

3250.arabic: إِنَّما أُمِرتُ أَن أَعبُدَ رَبَّ هـٰذِهِ البَلدَةِ الَّذى حَرَّمَها وَلَهُ كُلُّ شَىءٍ وَأُمِرتُ أَن أَكونَ مِنَ المُسلِمينَ
3250.en: (Tell them, O Muhammad): "I have been commanded only to serve the Lord of this city that He has made inviolable, to serve Him to Whom all things belong. I have been commanded to be of those that submit to Allah,

3251.arabic: وَأَن أَتلُوَا۟ القُرءانَ فَمَنِ اهتَدىٰ فَإِنَّما يَهتَدى لِنَفسِهِ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَقُل إِنَّما أَنا۠ مِنَ المُنذِرينَ
3251.en: and to recite the Qur'an." So, whosoever is guided, his guidance will be to his own good. As for those who stray, tell them: "I am none but a warner."

3252.arabic: وَقُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ سَيُريكُم ءايـٰتِهِ فَتَعرِفونَها وَما رَبُّكَ بِغـٰفِلٍ عَمّا تَعمَلونَ
3252.en: And say: "All praise be to Allah, Who will soon show you His Signs that you will recognize." Your Lord is not unaware of what you do.

3254.en: These are the verses of the Clear Book.

3255.arabic: نَتلوا عَلَيكَ مِن نَبَإِ موسىٰ وَفِرعَونَ بِالحَقِّ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
3255.en: We recount to you with truth some parts of the story of Moses and Pharaoh for the benefit of those who believe.
