3795.en: and have protected it from every rebellious satan.

3796.arabic: لا يَسَّمَّعونَ إِلَى المَلَإِ الأَعلىٰ وَيُقذَفونَ مِن كُلِّ جانِبٍ
3796.en: These satans cannot listen to what transpires in the High Council for they are pelted away from every side

3797.en: and are repelled. Theirs is an unceasing chastisement.

3798.arabic: إِلّا مَن خَطِفَ الخَطفَةَ فَأَتبَعَهُ شِهابٌ ثاقِبٌ
3798.en: And if any is able to snatch a fragment, he is pursued by a piercing flame.

3799.arabic: فَاستَفتِهِم أَهُم أَشَدُّ خَلقًا أَم مَن خَلَقنا إِنّا خَلَقنـٰهُم مِن طينٍ لازِبٍ
3799.en: So ask them (that is, human beings): “Were they harder to create than the objects We created?” We created them from sticky clay.

3800.en: You marvel (at the wondrous creations of Allah) and they scoff at it,

3801.en: and when they are admonished, they pay no heed;

3802.en: and if they see any Sign, they laugh it away

3803.arabic: وَقالوا إِن هـٰذا إِلّا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
3803.en: and say: “This is nothing but plain sorcery.

3804.arabic: أَءِذا مِتنا وَكُنّا تُرابًا وَعِظـٰمًا أَءِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ
3804.en: Is it ever possible that after we die and are reduced to dust and (a skeleton of) bones, we will be raised to life?

3805.en: And so also shall our forefathers of yore be raised to life?”

3806.en: Tell them: “Yes; and you are utterly helpless (against Allah).”

3807.arabic: فَإِنَّما هِىَ زَجرَةٌ وٰحِدَةٌ فَإِذا هُم يَنظُرونَ
3807.en: There will be a single stern rebuff and lo, they will be observing with their own eyes (all that they had been warned against).

3808.en: They will then say: “Woe for us. This is the Day of Judgement.”

3809.arabic: هـٰذا يَومُ الفَصلِ الَّذى كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبونَ
3809.en: “Yes, this is the Day of Final Decision that you used to deny as a lie.”

3810.arabic: احشُرُوا الَّذينَ ظَلَموا وَأَزوٰجَهُم وَما كانوا يَعبُدونَ
3810.en: (Then will the command be given): “Muster all the wrong#doers and their spouses and the deities whom they used to serve

3811.arabic: مِن دونِ اللَّهِ فَاهدوهُم إِلىٰ صِرٰطِ الجَحيمِ
3811.en: apart from Allah, and direct them to the path of Hell,

3812.en: and detain them there; they will be called to account.

3813.en: How is it that you are not helping one another?

3814.en: Indeed, today they are surrendering themselves completely.”

3815.en: They will then turn towards each other (and start wrangling).

3816.arabic: قالوا إِنَّكُم كُنتُم تَأتونَنا عَنِ اليَمينِ
3816.en: (The followers will say to their leaders): “You used to come to us from the right hand.”

3817.en: They will say: “Nay, you yourselves were not the ones who would believe.

3818.arabic: وَما كانَ لَنا عَلَيكُم مِن سُلطـٰنٍ بَل كُنتُم قَومًا طـٰغينَ
3818.en: We had no power over you. You were a rebellious people,

3819.arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَينا قَولُ رَبِّنا إِنّا لَذائِقونَ
3819.en: and so we became deserving of the Word of our Lord that we shall be made to suffer chastisement.

3820.en: So we led you astray; we ourselves were strayed.”

3821.en: On that Day, they will all share the chastisement.

3822.en: Thus do We treat the culprits.

3823.arabic: إِنَّهُم كانوا إِذا قيلَ لَهُم لا إِلـٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ يَستَكبِرونَ
3823.en: Whenever it was said to them: “There is no true deity apart from Allah,” they waxed proud

3824.arabic: وَيَقولونَ أَئِنّا لَتارِكوا ءالِهَتِنا لِشاعِرٍ مَجنونٍ
3824.en: and said: “Shall we forsake our deities for the sake of a distracted poet?”

3825.en: (They say so although) he brought the Truth and confirmed the veracity of the Messengers.

3826.en: (They will be told): “You shall taste the grievous chastisement.

3827.arabic: وَما تُجزَونَ إِلّا ما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
3827.en: You will only be recompensed according to your deeds.”

3828.en: But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).

3829.en: For them awaits a known provision,

3830.en: a variety of delicious fruits; and they shall be honoured

3832.en: They will be seated upon couches set face to face;

3833.en: a cup filled with wine from its springs, will be passed around to them;

3834.en: white, sparkling (wine), a delight to the drinkers.

3835.arabic: لا فيها غَولٌ وَلا هُم عَنها يُنزَفونَ
3835.en: There will neither be any harm in it for their body nor will it intoxicate their mind.

3836.en: Theirs shall be wide#eyed maidens with bashful, restrained glances,

3837.en: so delicate as the hidden peel under an egg's shell.

3838.en: Then some of them will turn to others, and will ask each other.

3839.arabic: قالَ قائِلٌ مِنهُم إِنّى كانَ لى قَرينٌ
3839.en: One of them will say: “I had a companion in the world

3840.en: who used to say: ## Are you also one of those who confirm the Truth (of life after death)?

3841.arabic: أَءِذا مِتنا وَكُنّا تُرابًا وَعِظـٰمًا أَءِنّا لَمَدينونَ
3841.en: After we are dead and have become all dust and bones shall we still be requited?'

3842.en: He will say: ## Do you wish to know where he is now?'

3843.en: Then he will look downwards, and will see him in the depths of Hell.

3844.en: He will say to him: ## By Allah, you almost ruined me.

3845.arabic: وَلَولا نِعمَةُ رَبّى لَكُنتُ مِنَ المُحضَرينَ
3845.en: But for Allah's favour, I should be one of those who have been mustered here.

3846.en: So, are we not going to die,

3847.arabic: إِلّا مَوتَتَنَا الأولىٰ وَما نَحنُ بِمُعَذَّبينَ
3847.en: except for our first death? And shall we suffer no chastisement?'”

3848.en: Surely this is the supreme triumph.

3849.en: For the like of it should the workers work.

3850.arabic: أَذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ نُزُلًا أَم شَجَرَةُ الزَّقّومِ
3850.en: Is this a better hospitality or the tree of al#Zaqqum?

3851.en: We have made this tree a trial for the wrong#doers.

3852.arabic: إِنَّها شَجَرَةٌ تَخرُجُ فى أَصلِ الجَحيمِ
3852.en: It is a tree that grows in the nethermost part of Hell.

3853.en: Its spathes are like the heads of satans.

3854.arabic: فَإِنَّهُم لَـٔاكِلونَ مِنها فَمالِـٔونَ مِنهَا البُطونَ
3854.en: (The people of Hell) will surely eat of it, filling their bellies with it.

3855.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُم عَلَيها لَشَوبًا مِن حَميمٍ
3855.en: Then on top of it they will have a brew of boiling water.

3856.en: Then their return will be to the same blazing Hell.

3857.en: These are the ones who found their fathers steeped in error,

3858.en: and they are running in their footsteps.

3859.en: Before them a multitude of people of olden times had erred,

3860.en: and We had sent among them Messengers to warn them.

3861.en: Observe, then, what was the end of those that had been warned,

3862.en: except for the chosen servants of Allah?

3863.en: Noah had called upon Us (earlier). See, how excellent We were in answering him!

3864.en: We delivered him and his household from the great calamity;

3865.en: and made his offspring the only ones to survive,

3866.en: and We established for him a good name among posterity.

3867.en: Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.

3868.en: Thus do We reward all those who do good.

3869.en: Surely he was one of Our truly believing servants.

3870.en: Thereafter We caused the others to be drowned.

3871.en: Abraham was on the self#same way (as Noah).

3872.en: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart,

3873.arabic: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ وَقَومِهِ ماذا تَعبُدونَ
3873.en: and said to his father and his people: “Whom do you worship?

3874.en: Is it false deities that you want to serve rather than Allah?

3875.en: What do you think of the Lord of the whole Universe?”

3876.en: Then he looked carefully at the stars

3878.en: So turning their backs, they went away from him.

3879.arabic: فَراغَ إِلىٰ ءالِهَتِهِم فَقالَ أَلا تَأكُلونَ
3879.en: Then he went quietly to the (temple of the deities) and said: “What is the matter with you, why do you not eat?

3880.en: What is the matter with you, why do you not speak?”

3881.en: Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand,

3882.en: whereupon people came to him running.

3883.en: Abraham said to them: “Do you worship what you yourselves have carved with your own hands

3884.en: while it is Allah Who has created you and all that you make?”

3885.arabic: قالُوا ابنوا لَهُ بُنيـٰنًا فَأَلقوهُ فِى الجَحيمِ
3885.en: They spoke among themselves: “Build him a pyre and then throw him into the furnace.”

3886.en: They had contrived an evil plan against him, but We abased them all.

3887.arabic: وَقالَ إِنّى ذاهِبٌ إِلىٰ رَبّى سَيَهدينِ
3887.en: Abraham said: “I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.

3888.en: Lord, grant me a righteous son.”

3889.en: (In response to this prayer) We gave him the good news of a prudent boy;

3890.arabic: فَلَمّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ السَّعىَ قالَ يـٰبُنَىَّ إِنّى أَرىٰ فِى المَنامِ أَنّى أَذبَحُكَ فَانظُر ماذا تَرىٰ قالَ يـٰأَبَتِ افعَل ما تُؤمَرُ سَتَجِدُنى إِن شاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصّـٰبِرينَ
3890.en: and when he was old enough to go about and work with him, (one day) Abraham said to him: “My son, I see in my dream that I am slaughtering you. So consider (and tell me) what you think.” He said: “Do as you are bidden. You will find me, if Allah so wills, among the steadfast.”

3891.en: When both surrendered (to Allah's command) and Abraham flung the son down on his forehead,

3893.arabic: قَد صَدَّقتَ الرُّءيا إِنّا كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِى المُحسِنينَ
3893.en: you have indeed fulfilled your dream. Thus do We reward the good#doers.”

3894.en: This was indeed a plain trial.

3895.en: And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,

3896.en: and We preserved for him a good name among posterity.

3898.en: Thus do We reward the good#doers.

3899.en: Surely he was one of Our believing servants.

3900.en: And We gave him the good news of Isaac, a Prophet and among the righteous ones.

3901.arabic: وَبـٰرَكنا عَلَيهِ وَعَلىٰ إِسحـٰقَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِما مُحسِنٌ وَظالِمٌ لِنَفسِهِ مُبينٌ
3901.en: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among the offspring of the two some did good and some plainly wronged themselves.

3902.en: Verily We bestowed Our favours on Moses and Aaron

3903.en: and We delivered both of them and their people from the great calamity.

3904.en: We succoured them, and they gained the upper hand (against their enemies).

3905.en: We granted them a Clear Book,

3906.en: and showed them the Straight Way,

3907.en: and preserved for them a good name among posterity.

3908.en: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.

3909.en: Thus do We reward the good#doers.

3910.en: Surely both of them were among Our believing servants.

3911.en: Surely, Elias too was among the Messengers.

3912.en: (Call to mind) when he said to his people: “Will you not fear Allah?

3913.en: Do you call upon Baal and forsake the Best of the Creators?

3914.en: Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors of yore.”

3915.en: But they denounced him as a liar, so they will surely be arraigned (for punishment),

3917.en: We preserved a good name for him among posterity.

3919.en: Thus do We reward the good#doers.

3920.en: He was one of Our believing servants.

3921.en: And Lot too was one of the Messengers.

3922.en: (Call to mind) when We delivered him and all his kinsfolk,

3923.en: except for an old woman who was among those that stayed behind.

3924.en: Then We utterly destroyed the rest of them.

3925.en: You pass by their desolate habitations in the morning

3926.en: and at night. Do you still not understand?

3927.en: And Jonah too was one of the Messengers.

3928.en: Call to mind when he fled to the laden ship,

3929.en: cast lots, and was among the losers.

3930.en: Then a fish swallowed him, and he was blameworthy.

3931.en: Had he not been one of those who glorify Allah,

3932.arabic: لَلَبِثَ فى بَطنِهِ إِلىٰ يَومِ يُبعَثونَ
3932.en: he would certainly have remained in its belly till the Day of Resurrection.

3933.en: But We threw him on a wide bare tract of land while he was ill;

3934.en: and caused a gourd tree to grow over him,

3935.arabic: وَأَرسَلنـٰهُ إِلىٰ مِا۟ئَةِ أَلفٍ أَو يَزيدونَ
3935.en: and We sent him forth to a nation of a hundred thousand or more,

3936.en: and they believed. So We let them enjoy life for a while.

3937.en: So ask their opinion: “(Are you convinced) that your Lord should have daughters and you should have sons?

3938.arabic: أَم خَلَقنَا المَلـٰئِكَةَ إِنـٰثًا وَهُم شـٰهِدونَ
3938.en: Did We create the angels as females the while they witnessed?”

3939.en: Behold, it is one of their fabrications that they say:

3941.en: Did He choose daughters rather than sons?

3942.en: What is the matter with you that you make such strange judgements?

3943.en: Will you then not take heed?

3944.en: Do you have any clear authority for such claims?

3945.en: Bring your Book, if you are truthful.

3946.arabic: وَجَعَلوا بَينَهُ وَبَينَ الجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا وَلَقَد عَلِمَتِ الجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُم لَمُحضَرونَ
3946.en: They have established a kinship between Allah and the angels; and the angels know well that these people will be arraigned (as culprits).

3947.en: (They say): “Exalted be Allah above what they attribute to Him,

3948.en: all of them except the chosen servants of Allah.

3950.en: shall not be able to tempt anyone away from Allah

3951.en: except him who shall roast in the Blazing Fire.

3952.arabic: وَما مِنّا إِلّا لَهُ مَقامٌ مَعلومٌ
3952.en: As for us, there is none but has an appointed station.

3953.en: Verily we range ourselves in rows (as humble servants)

3954.en: and we are of those who glorify Allah.”

3956.arabic: لَو أَنَّ عِندَنا ذِكرًا مِنَ الأَوَّلينَ
3956.en: “If only we had the Reminder which had been granted to the people of yore

3957.en: we would surely have been Allah's chosen servants.”

3958.en: But when it came to them, they rejected it. They shall soon come to know (the end of such an attitude).

3959.en: We have already given Our promise to Our Messengers

3960.en: that they shall certainly be succoured,

3961.en: and that Our hosts shall triumph.

3962.en: So, (O Prophet), leave them alone for a while,

3963.en: and see, and soon they too shall see.

3964.en: Do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?

3965.arabic: فَإِذا نَزَلَ بِساحَتِهِم فَساءَ صَباحُ المُنذَرينَ
3965.en: When that chastisement will descend upon their courtyard, evil shall that Day be for those who had been warned.

3966.en: Leave them alone for a while,

3967.en: and see; and they too shall soon see.

3968.arabic: سُبحـٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ العِزَّةِ عَمّا يَصِفونَ
3968.en: Exalted be your Lord, the Lord of Glory, above what they attribute to Him,

3969.en: and peace be upon the Messengers,

3970.en: and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Universe.

3971.en: Sad, and by the Qur'an full of exhortation!

3972.arabic: بَلِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا فى عِزَّةٍ وَشِقاقٍ
3972.en: Nay, but the unbelievers are steeped in arrogance and stubborn defiance.

3973.arabic: كَم أَهلَكنا مِن قَبلِهِم مِن قَرنٍ فَنادَوا وَلاتَ حينَ مَناصٍ
3973.en: How many a nation did We destroy before them! (When they approached their doom) they cried out (for deliverance), but the time for deliverance was already past.

3974.arabic: وَعَجِبوا أَن جاءَهُم مُنذِرٌ مِنهُم وَقالَ الكـٰفِرونَ هـٰذا سـٰحِرٌ كَذّابٌ
3974.en: They wondered that a warner had come to them from among themselves, and the deniers of the Truth said: “This is a sorcerer, and a big liar.

3975.arabic: أَجَعَلَ الـٔالِهَةَ إِلـٰهًا وٰحِدًا إِنَّ هـٰذا لَشَىءٌ عُجابٌ
3975.en: Has he made the gods one single God? This is truly astounding.”

3976.arabic: وَانطَلَقَ المَلَأُ مِنهُم أَنِ امشوا وَاصبِروا عَلىٰ ءالِهَتِكُم إِنَّ هـٰذا لَشَىءٌ يُرادُ
3976.en: And the elders among them went forth saying: “Go ahead and be steadfast in adhering to your deities. What is being said is with a design.”

3977.arabic: ما سَمِعنا بِهـٰذا فِى المِلَّةِ الـٔاخِرَةِ إِن هـٰذا إِلَّا اختِلـٰقٌ
3977.en: We have not heard this in the religious community close to our time. This is nothing but a fabrication.

3978.arabic: أَءُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ الذِّكرُ مِن بَينِنا بَل هُم فى شَكٍّ مِن ذِكرى بَل لَمّا يَذوقوا عَذابِ
3978.en: Has this Exhortation been sent down among us only to him, to the exclusion of all others?” Nay, they are in doubt regarding My Exhortation, and are saying all this because they have not yet had any taste of My chastisement.

3979.arabic: أَم عِندَهُم خَزائِنُ رَحمَةِ رَبِّكَ العَزيزِ الوَهّابِ
3979.en: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord, the Most Mighty, the Great Bestower?

3980.arabic: أَم لَهُم مُلكُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما فَليَرتَقوا فِى الأَسبـٰبِ
3980.en: Or do they possess the dominion of the heavens and the earth and of all that is in between them? If so, let them ascend the heights of the realm of causation and see!

3981.arabic: جُندٌ ما هُنالِكَ مَهزومٌ مِنَ الأَحزابِ
3981.en: This is only a small army out of the several armies that will suffer defeat here.

3982.arabic: كَذَّبَت قَبلَهُم قَومُ نوحٍ وَعادٌ وَفِرعَونُ ذُو الأَوتادِ
3982.en: Before them the people of Noah, Ad, and Pharaoh of the tent#pegs gave the lie (to the Messengers)

3983.arabic: وَثَمودُ وَقَومُ لوطٍ وَأَصحـٰبُ لـَٔيكَةِ أُولـٰئِكَ الأَحزابُ
3983.en: and so did Thamud and the people of Lot and the people of Aykah. These were all leagued together.

3984.arabic: إِن كُلٌّ إِلّا كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقابِ
3984.en: Each of them gave the lie to Messengers and My decree of chastisement came upon them.

3985.arabic: وَما يَنظُرُ هـٰؤُلاءِ إِلّا صَيحَةً وٰحِدَةً ما لَها مِن فَواقٍ
3985.en: They are waiting for nothing except a single Cry, after which there will be no second Cry.

3986.arabic: وَقالوا رَبَّنا عَجِّل لَنا قِطَّنا قَبلَ يَومِ الحِسابِ
3986.en: They say: “Our Lord, hasten to us our share (of chastisement) before the Day of Reckoning.”

3987.arabic: اصبِر عَلىٰ ما يَقولونَ وَاذكُر عَبدَنا داوۥدَ ذَا الأَيدِ إِنَّهُ أَوّابٌ
3987.en: (O Prophet), bear with patience what they say, and call to mind Our servant David, who was endowed with great strength and who constantly turned (to Allah).

3988.arabic: إِنّا سَخَّرنَا الجِبالَ مَعَهُ يُسَبِّحنَ بِالعَشِىِّ وَالإِشراقِ
3988.en: With him We had subjected the mountains that they join him in celebrating Allah's glory, evening and morning,

3989.en: and the birds, too, in their flocks, and turn again and again to celebrating Allah's glory.

3990.arabic: وَشَدَدنا مُلكَهُ وَءاتَينـٰهُ الحِكمَةَ وَفَصلَ الخِطابِ
3990.en: And We strengthened his kingdom and endowed him with wisdom and decisive judgement.

3991.arabic: وَهَل أَتىٰكَ نَبَؤُا۟ الخَصمِ إِذ تَسَوَّرُوا المِحرابَ
3991.en: Has the story of the litigants reached you ## of those who entered his private chambers by climbing over the wall?

3992.arabic: إِذ دَخَلوا عَلىٰ داوۥدَ فَفَزِعَ مِنهُم قالوا لا تَخَف خَصمانِ بَغىٰ بَعضُنا عَلىٰ بَعضٍ فَاحكُم بَينَنا بِالحَقِّ وَلا تُشطِط وَاهدِنا إِلىٰ سَواءِ الصِّرٰطِ
3992.en: As they came upon David ## and he was frightened of them ## they said: “Be not afraid. We are just two litigants: one of us has committed excess against the other. So judge rightly between us, and be not unjust; and guide us to the Right Way.

3993.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰذا أَخى لَهُ تِسعٌ وَتِسعونَ نَعجَةً وَلِىَ نَعجَةٌ وٰحِدَةٌ فَقالَ أَكفِلنيها وَعَزَّنى فِى الخِطابِ
3993.en: Behold, this is my brother; he has ninety#nine ewes and I have only one ewe.” And yet he said: “Give her into my charge,” and he got the better of me in argument.

3994.arabic: قالَ لَقَد ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤالِ نَعجَتِكَ إِلىٰ نِعاجِهِ وَإِنَّ كَثيرًا مِنَ الخُلَطاءِ لَيَبغى بَعضُهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ إِلَّا الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ وَقَليلٌ ما هُم وَظَنَّ داوۥدُ أَنَّما فَتَنّـٰهُ فَاستَغفَرَ رَبَّهُ وَخَرَّ راكِعًا وَأَنابَ
3994.en: David said: “He has certainly wronged you in seeking to add your ewe to his ewes; and indeed many who live together commit excesses, one to the other, except those that believe and act righteously; and they are but few.” (While so saying) David realized that it is We Who have put him to test; therefore, he sought the forgiveness of his Lord, and fell down, bowing and penitently turning (to Him).

3995.arabic: فَغَفَرنا لَهُ ذٰلِكَ وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنا لَزُلفىٰ وَحُسنَ مَـٔابٍ
3995.en: Thereupon We forgave him his shortcoming and indeed (an exalted position of) nearness awaits him, and an excellent resort.

3996.arabic: يـٰداوۥدُ إِنّا جَعَلنـٰكَ خَليفَةً فِى الأَرضِ فَاحكُم بَينَ النّاسِ بِالحَقِّ وَلا تَتَّبِعِ الهَوىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَضِلّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُم عَذابٌ شَديدٌ بِما نَسوا يَومَ الحِسابِ
3996.en: (We said to him): “O David, We have appointed you vicegerent on earth. Therefore, rule among people with justice and do not follow (your) desire lest it should lead you astray from Allah's Path. Allah's severe chastisement awaits those who stray away from Allah's Path, for they had forgotten the Day of Reckoning.

3997.arabic: وَما خَلَقنَا السَّماءَ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما بـٰطِلًا ذٰلِكَ ظَنُّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا فَوَيلٌ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا مِنَ النّارِ
3997.en: We did not create this heaven and earth and all that lies between them in vain. That is the fancy of those who denied the Truth. So woe from the Fire to all who deny the Truth.

3998.arabic: أَم نَجعَلُ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ كَالمُفسِدينَ فِى الأَرضِ أَم نَجعَلُ المُتَّقينَ كَالفُجّارِ
3998.en: Shall We then treat alike those that believe and act righteously and those that create mischief on earth? Or treat alike the God#fearing and the wicked?

3999.arabic: كِتـٰبٌ أَنزَلنـٰهُ إِلَيكَ مُبـٰرَكٌ لِيَدَّبَّروا ءايـٰتِهِ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُولُوا الأَلبـٰبِ
3999.en: This is the Blessed Book that We have revealed to you, (O Muhammad), that people with understanding may reflect over its verses and those with understanding derive a lesson.

4000.arabic: وَوَهَبنا لِداوۥدَ سُلَيمـٰنَ نِعمَ العَبدُ إِنَّهُ أَوّابٌ
4000.en: We bestowed upon David (an illustrious son), Solomon. How excellent a servant (of Ours he was)! Indeed he constantly turned to Us in devotion.

4001.arabic: إِذ عُرِضَ عَلَيهِ بِالعَشِىِّ الصّـٰفِنـٰتُ الجِيادُ
4001.en: And when one evening well#trained and running horses of noble breed were brought to him

4002.arabic: فَقالَ إِنّى أَحبَبتُ حُبَّ الخَيرِ عَن ذِكرِ رَبّى حَتّىٰ تَوارَت بِالحِجابِ
4002.en: he said: “Lo! I have come to love this wealth on account of the remembrance of my Lord.” And when the horses disappeared,

4003.arabic: رُدّوها عَلَىَّ فَطَفِقَ مَسحًا بِالسّوقِ وَالأَعناقِ
4003.en: (he ordered): “Bring these horses back to me,” and then he began to gently stroke their shanks and necks.

4004.arabic: وَلَقَد فَتَنّا سُلَيمـٰنَ وَأَلقَينا عَلىٰ كُرسِيِّهِ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنابَ
4004.en: Surely We put Solomon to the test and cast upon his throne a mere body. Thereupon he penitently turned (to Us).

4005.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ اغفِر لى وَهَب لى مُلكًا لا يَنبَغى لِأَحَدٍ مِن بَعدى إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الوَهّابُ
4005.en: He said: “My Lord, forgive me and bestow upon me a kingdom such as none other after me will deserve. Surely You are the Bounteous Giver.”

4006.arabic: فَسَخَّرنا لَهُ الرّيحَ تَجرى بِأَمرِهِ رُخاءً حَيثُ أَصابَ
4006.en: We subjected the wind to him, so that it blew gently at his bidding, wherever he directed it,

4007.en: and We also subjected the devils to him ## all kinds of builders and divers;

4008.en: and others that were bound with chains.

4009.arabic: هـٰذا عَطاؤُنا فَامنُن أَو أَمسِك بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
4009.en: “This is Our bestowal. So give or withhold as you wish without account.”

4010.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنا لَزُلفىٰ وَحُسنَ مَـٔابٍ
4010.en: Indeed an exalted position of nearness awaits him and an excellent resort.

4011.arabic: وَاذكُر عَبدَنا أَيّوبَ إِذ نادىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنّى مَسَّنِىَ الشَّيطـٰنُ بِنُصبٍ وَعَذابٍ
4011.en: And remember Our servant Job: when he cried to his Lord: “Behold, Satan has afflicted me with much hardship and suffering.”

4012.arabic: اركُض بِرِجلِكَ هـٰذا مُغتَسَلٌ بارِدٌ وَشَرابٌ
4012.en: (We commanded him): “Stamp your foot on earth, and here is cool water to wash with and to drink.”

4013.arabic: وَوَهَبنا لَهُ أَهلَهُ وَمِثلَهُم مَعَهُم رَحمَةً مِنّا وَذِكرىٰ لِأُولِى الأَلبـٰبِ
4013.en: And We granted to him his family and also the like of them, as a mercy from Us, and as a reminder to people of understanding,

4014.arabic: وَخُذ بِيَدِكَ ضِغثًا فَاضرِب بِهِ وَلا تَحنَث إِنّا وَجَدنـٰهُ صابِرًا نِعمَ العَبدُ إِنَّهُ أَوّابٌ
4014.en: (and We said to him): “Take in your hand a bundle of rushes and strike with it, and do not break your oath.” Indeed We found him steadfast. How excellent a servant (of Ours) he was. Indeed he constantly turned (to his Lord).

4015.arabic: وَاذكُر عِبـٰدَنا إِبرٰهيمَ وَإِسحـٰقَ وَيَعقوبَ أُولِى الأَيدى وَالأَبصـٰرِ
4015.en: And remember Our servants ## Abraham, Isaac and Jacob ## they were endowed with great strength and vision.

4016.en: Verily We exalted them in consideration of a sterling quality: their remembrance of the Abode of the Hereafter.

4017.en: In Our sight they are among the chosen and excellent ones.

4018.arabic: وَاذكُر إِسمـٰعيلَ وَاليَسَعَ وَذَا الكِفلِ وَكُلٌّ مِنَ الأَخيارِ
4018.en: And remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhu al#Kifl. All were of the best.

4019.arabic: هـٰذا ذِكرٌ وَإِنَّ لِلمُتَّقينَ لَحُسنَ مَـٔابٍ
4019.en: This was a remembrance. An excellent retreat awaits the God#fearing

4020.en: \#\# everlasting Gardens with gates wide open for them

4021.arabic: مُتَّكِـٔينَ فيها يَدعونَ فيها بِفـٰكِهَةٍ كَثيرَةٍ وَشَرابٍ
4021.en: wherein they shall recline, wherein they shall ask for abundant fruit and drinks,

4022.en: and wherein there shall be with them well#matched, bashful mates.

4023.en: All this is what you are promised for the Day of Judgement.

4024.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰذا لَرِزقُنا ما لَهُ مِن نَفادٍ
4024.en: This is Our provision for you, never to end.

4025.en: All this (is for the God#fearing). But for the transgressors, an evil resort awaits them ##

4026.en: Hell, where they will be roasted. An evil place to dwell!

4027.en: All this (is for them); so let them taste boiling water and pus,

4028.en: and other sufferings of the kind.

4029.arabic: هـٰذا فَوجٌ مُقتَحِمٌ مَعَكُم لا مَرحَبًا بِهِم إِنَّهُم صالُوا النّارِ
4029.en: (Observing their followers advancing to Hell they will say, among themselves: “This is a troop rushing in to you. There is no welcome for them. They are destined to roast in the Fire.”

4030.arabic: قالوا بَل أَنتُم لا مَرحَبًا بِكُم أَنتُم قَدَّمتُموهُ لَنا فَبِئسَ القَرارُ
4030.en: They will reply: “Rather, no welcome to you. (You will roast in Hell.) It is you who led us to this end. What an evil resort!”

4031.arabic: قالوا رَبَّنا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنا هـٰذا فَزِدهُ عَذابًا ضِعفًا فِى النّارِ
4031.en: They will say: “Our Lord, give twofold punishment in the Fire to him who has led us to this.”

4032.arabic: وَقالوا ما لَنا لا نَرىٰ رِجالًا كُنّا نَعُدُّهُم مِنَ الأَشرارِ
4032.en: They will say to one another: “But why do we not see those whom we considered him among the wicked?

4033.arabic: أَتَّخَذنـٰهُم سِخرِيًّا أَم زاغَت عَنهُمُ الأَبصـٰرُ
4033.en: Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them; or have they disappeared from our sight?”

4034.arabic: إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ لَحَقٌّ تَخاصُمُ أَهلِ النّارِ
4034.en: Verily all this is true. This is how the inmates of the Fire will dispute among themselves.

4035.arabic: قُل إِنَّما أَنا۠ مُنذِرٌ وَما مِن إِلـٰهٍ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الوٰحِدُ القَهّارُ
4035.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am nothing but a warner. There is no deity but Allah, the One, the Supreme,

4036.arabic: رَبُّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُمَا العَزيزُ الغَفّـٰرُ
4036.en: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them, the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving.”

4037.en: Say: “This is a tiding of tremendous import

4038.en: from which you are turning away.”

4039.arabic: ما كانَ لِىَ مِن عِلمٍ بِالمَلَإِ الأَعلىٰ إِذ يَختَصِمونَ
4039.en: (Tell them): “I had no knowledge of the High Council when they were disputing.

4040.arabic: إِن يوحىٰ إِلَىَّ إِلّا أَنَّما أَنا۠ نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
4040.en: I am told (about matters) by means of revelation only because I am a clear warner.”

4041.arabic: إِذ قالَ رَبُّكَ لِلمَلـٰئِكَةِ إِنّى خـٰلِقٌ بَشَرًا مِن طينٍ
4041.en: When your Lord said to the angels: “Verily I am creating a human being from clay.

4042.arabic: فَإِذا سَوَّيتُهُ وَنَفَختُ فيهِ مِن روحى فَقَعوا لَهُ سـٰجِدينَ
4042.en: After I have created him and breathed into him of My spirit, fall you down, prostrating yourselves to him.”

4043.en: Then the angels, all of them, prostrated themselves before Adam

4044.arabic: إِلّا إِبليسَ استَكبَرَ وَكانَ مِنَ الكـٰفِرينَ
4044.en: except Iblis. He waxed proud and became one of the unbelievers.

4045.arabic: قالَ يـٰإِبليسُ ما مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسجُدَ لِما خَلَقتُ بِيَدَىَّ أَستَكبَرتَ أَم كُنتَ مِنَ العالينَ
4045.en: The Lord said: “O Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating yourself before him whom I created of My Two Hands. Are you waxing proud, or fancy yourself to be too exalted?”

4046.arabic: قالَ أَنا۠ خَيرٌ مِنهُ خَلَقتَنى مِن نارٍ وَخَلَقتَهُ مِن طينٍ
4046.en: He replied: “I am nobler than he. You created me from fire and created him from clay.”

4047.en: He said: “Get out of here; surely you are accursed,

4048.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيكَ لَعنَتى إِلىٰ يَومِ الدّينِ
4048.en: and My curse shall remain upon you till the Day of Resurrection.”

4049.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرنى إِلىٰ يَومِ يُبعَثونَ
4049.en: Satan said: “My Lord, then grant me respite till the Day that they are raised up.”

4050.en: He said: “You are of those who have been granted respite

4051.en: till the Day whose Hour I know.”

4052.en: (Iblis) said: “By Your glory, I shall mislead them all

4053.en: except those of Your servants, the chosen ones from amongst them.”

4054.en: He (i.e. Allah) said: “This is the Truth ## and I only speak the Truth ##

4055.arabic: لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنهُم أَجمَعينَ
4055.en: I will certainly fill the Gehenna with you and with all those among them who follow you.”

4056.arabic: قُل ما أَسـَٔلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ وَما أَنا۠ مِنَ المُتَكَلِّفينَ
4056.en: (O Prophet), tell them: “I do not ask you for any recompense for the performance of this task; nor am I given to affectation.

4057.en: This is nothing but an Admonition for all people the world over.

4058.en: You will know the truth of the matter after a while.”

4059.arabic: تَنزيلُ الكِتـٰبِ مِنَ اللَّهِ العَزيزِ الحَكيمِ
4059.en: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

4060.arabic: إِنّا أَنزَلنا إِلَيكَ الكِتـٰبَ بِالحَقِّ فَاعبُدِ اللَّهَ مُخلِصًا لَهُ الدّينَ
4060.en: (O Prophet), it is We Who have revealed this Book to you with Truth. So serve only Allah, consecrating your devotion to Him.

4061.arabic: أَلا لِلَّهِ الدّينُ الخالِصُ وَالَّذينَ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ أَولِياءَ ما نَعبُدُهُم إِلّا لِيُقَرِّبونا إِلَى اللَّهِ زُلفىٰ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَحكُمُ بَينَهُم فى ما هُم فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدى مَن هُوَ كـٰذِبٌ كَفّارٌ
4061.en: Lo, religion is exclusively devoted to Allah. Your religion is entirely consecrated to Him. As for those who have taken others than Allah for their guardians, (they say): “We worship them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah.” Allah will judge between them concerning what they differ about. Verily Allah does not guide anyone who is given to sheer lying, is an utter unbeliever.

4062.arabic: لَو أَرادَ اللَّهُ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا لَاصطَفىٰ مِمّا يَخلُقُ ما يَشاءُ سُبحـٰنَهُ هُوَ اللَّهُ الوٰحِدُ القَهّارُ
4062.en: If Allah had wanted to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen anyone He wanted out of those whom He creates. Glory be to Him (that He should have a son). He is Allah: the One, the Overpowering.

4063.arabic: خَلَقَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضَ بِالحَقِّ يُكَوِّرُ الَّيلَ عَلَى النَّهارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ النَّهارَ عَلَى الَّيلِ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ كُلٌّ يَجرى لِأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى أَلا هُوَ العَزيزُ الغَفّـٰرُ
4063.en: He created the heavens and the earth with Truth, and He folds up the day over the night and folds up the night over the day. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each is running its course until an appointed time. Lo, He is the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving.

4064.arabic: خَلَقَكُم مِن نَفسٍ وٰحِدَةٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنها زَوجَها وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِنَ الأَنعـٰمِ ثَمـٰنِيَةَ أَزوٰجٍ يَخلُقُكُم فى بُطونِ أُمَّهـٰتِكُم خَلقًا مِن بَعدِ خَلقٍ فى ظُلُمـٰتٍ ثَلـٰثٍ ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُم لَهُ المُلكُ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ فَأَنّىٰ تُصرَفونَ
4064.en: He it is Who created you from a single being, and He it is Who made from it its mate. He it is Who created for you eight heads of cattle in pairs. He creates you in your mothers' wombs, giving you one form after another in threefold depths of darkness. That, then, is Allah, your Lord. His is the kingdom. There is no god but He. So, whence are you being turned astray?

4065.arabic: إِن تَكفُروا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ عَنكُم وَلا يَرضىٰ لِعِبادِهِ الكُفرَ وَإِن تَشكُروا يَرضَهُ لَكُم وَلا تَزِرُ وازِرَةٌ وِزرَ أُخرىٰ ثُمَّ إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم مَرجِعُكُم فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
4065.en: If you disbelieve, know well that Allah has no need of you. Yet He does not like unbelief in His servants. But if you are thankful, your thankfulness will please Him. No one shall bear another's burden. You are destined to return to your Lord and He will tell you what you used to do. He is well aware even of what lies hidden in your breasts.

4066.arabic: وَإِذا مَسَّ الإِنسـٰنَ ضُرٌّ دَعا رَبَّهُ مُنيبًا إِلَيهِ ثُمَّ إِذا خَوَّلَهُ نِعمَةً مِنهُ نَسِىَ ما كانَ يَدعوا إِلَيهِ مِن قَبلُ وَجَعَلَ لِلَّهِ أَندادًا لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبيلِهِ قُل تَمَتَّع بِكُفرِكَ قَليلًا إِنَّكَ مِن أَصحـٰبِ النّارِ
4066.en: When any affliction befalls man, he cries out to his Lord, penitently turning to Him. But when his Lord bestows His favour upon him, he forgets the affliction regarding which he had cried out and sets up compeers to Allah that they may lead others astray from His Path. Say, (O Prophet): “Enjoy your unbelief for a while. Surely you will be among the inmates of the Fire.”

4067.arabic: أَمَّن هُوَ قـٰنِتٌ ءاناءَ الَّيلِ ساجِدًا وَقائِمًا يَحذَرُ الـٔاخِرَةَ وَيَرجوا رَحمَةَ رَبِّهِ قُل هَل يَستَوِى الَّذينَ يَعلَمونَ وَالَّذينَ لا يَعلَمونَ إِنَّما يَتَذَكَّرُ أُولُوا الأَلبـٰبِ
4067.en: Is such a person (preferable or he) who is obedient, and prostrates himself in the watches of the night, stands (in Prayer), is fearful of the Hereafter, and looks forward to the mercy of His Lord? Ask them: “Are those who know equal to those who do not know?” Only those endowed with understanding take heed.

4068.arabic: قُل يـٰعِبادِ الَّذينَ ءامَنُوا اتَّقوا رَبَّكُم لِلَّذينَ أَحسَنوا فى هـٰذِهِ الدُّنيا حَسَنَةٌ وَأَرضُ اللَّهِ وٰسِعَةٌ إِنَّما يُوَفَّى الصّـٰبِرونَ أَجرَهُم بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
4068.en: Tell them (O Prophet): “O you servants of Mine who believe, have fear of your Lord. A good end awaits those who did good in this world. Allah's earth is spacious. Verily those who persevere shall be granted their reward beyond all reckoning.”

4069.arabic: قُل إِنّى أُمِرتُ أَن أَعبُدَ اللَّهَ مُخلِصًا لَهُ الدّينَ
4069.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am bidden to serve Allah, consecrating my devotion to Him,

4070.en: and I am bidden to be the first of those who surrender to Him.”

4071.arabic: قُل إِنّى أَخافُ إِن عَصَيتُ رَبّى عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
4071.en: Say: “If I disobey my Lord, I fear the chastisement of an Awesome Day.”

4072.arabic: قُلِ اللَّهَ أَعبُدُ مُخلِصًا لَهُ دينى
4072.en: Say: “Allah alone shall I serve, consecrating my devotion to Him.

4073.arabic: فَاعبُدوا ما شِئتُم مِن دونِهِ قُل إِنَّ الخـٰسِرينَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم وَأَهليهِم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ أَلا ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الخُسرانُ المُبينُ
4073.en: So serve, apart from Him, whomsoever you please.” Say: “Behold, the real losers shall be those who will have lost their own selves and their kith and kin on the Day of Resurrection. Behold, that is the obvious loss.

4074.arabic: لَهُم مِن فَوقِهِم ظُلَلٌ مِنَ النّارِ وَمِن تَحتِهِم ظُلَلٌ ذٰلِكَ يُخَوِّفُ اللَّهُ بِهِ عِبادَهُ يـٰعِبادِ فَاتَّقونِ
4074.en: There shall be sheets of fire above them and beneath them. This is the end against which Allah warns His servants. So dread My wrath, O you servants of Mine!”

4075.arabic: وَالَّذينَ اجتَنَبُوا الطّـٰغوتَ أَن يَعبُدوها وَأَنابوا إِلَى اللَّهِ لَهُمُ البُشرىٰ فَبَشِّر عِبادِ
4075.en: (On the other hand), good tidings await those who eschew serving false gods and penitently return to Allah. (O Prophet), give good tidings to My servants,

4076.arabic: الَّذينَ يَستَمِعونَ القَولَ فَيَتَّبِعونَ أَحسَنَهُ أُولـٰئِكَ الَّذينَ هَدىٰهُمُ اللَّهُ وَأُولـٰئِكَ هُم أُولُوا الأَلبـٰبِ
4076.en: to those who pay heed to what is said and follow the best of it. They are the ones whom Allah has guided to the Right Way; they are the ones endowed with understanding.

4077.arabic: أَفَمَن حَقَّ عَلَيهِ كَلِمَةُ العَذابِ أَفَأَنتَ تُنقِذُ مَن فِى النّارِ
4077.en: (O Prophet), can you save him (from chastisement) against whom the sentence of chastisement has become due; him who has, (as it were), already fallen into the Fire?”

4078.arabic: لـٰكِنِ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا رَبَّهُم لَهُم غُرَفٌ مِن فَوقِها غُرَفٌ مَبنِيَّةٌ تَجرى مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهـٰرُ وَعدَ اللَّهِ لا يُخلِفُ اللَّهُ الميعادَ
4078.en: But those who fear their Lord shall have lofty mansions built over one another beneath which rivers flow. This is Allah's promise and never does Allah fail to fulfil His promise.

4079.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَسَلَكَهُ يَنـٰبيعَ فِى الأَرضِ ثُمَّ يُخرِجُ بِهِ زَرعًا مُختَلِفًا أَلوٰنُهُ ثُمَّ يَهيجُ فَتَرىٰهُ مُصفَرًّا ثُمَّ يَجعَلُهُ حُطـٰمًا إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَذِكرىٰ لِأُولِى الأَلبـٰبِ
4079.en: Do you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky, then made it flow on earth as springs and streams and rivers and then with it He brings forth vegetation of various hues; then this vegetation ripens and dries up, turning yellow, whereafter He reduces it to broken straw? Surely there is a lesson in this for those endowed with understanding.

4080.arabic: أَفَمَن شَرَحَ اللَّهُ صَدرَهُ لِلإِسلـٰمِ فَهُوَ عَلىٰ نورٍ مِن رَبِّهِ فَوَيلٌ لِلقـٰسِيَةِ قُلوبُهُم مِن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ أُولـٰئِكَ فى ضَلـٰلٍ مُبينٍ
4080.en: Can he whose breast Allah has opened up for Islam and who is thus (moving along a Path) illumined by a light from Allah (be likened to him who derives no lesson from what he observes)? Woe, then, to those whose hearts were further hardened after Allah's admonition. Such are indeed in obvious error.

4081.arabic: اللَّهُ نَزَّلَ أَحسَنَ الحَديثِ كِتـٰبًا مُتَشـٰبِهًا مَثانِىَ تَقشَعِرُّ مِنهُ جُلودُ الَّذينَ يَخشَونَ رَبَّهُم ثُمَّ تَلينُ جُلودُهُم وَقُلوبُهُم إِلىٰ ذِكرِ اللَّهِ ذٰلِكَ هُدَى اللَّهِ يَهدى بِهِ مَن يَشاءُ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن هادٍ
4081.en: Allah has revealed the best teaching, a self#consistent Book which repeats its contents in manifold forms whereat shiver the skins of those that hold their Lord in awe, and then their skins and their hearts soften for Allah's remembrance. That is Allah's Guidance wherewith He guides whosoever He pleases. And he whom Allah does not guide to the Right Path has none to guide him.

4082.arabic: أَفَمَن يَتَّقى بِوَجهِهِ سوءَ العَذابِ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ وَقيلَ لِلظّـٰلِمينَ ذوقوا ما كُنتُم تَكسِبونَ
4082.en: How woeful is the plight of him who has nothing except his face to shield him from severe chastisement on the Day of Resurrection? Such evil#doers shall be told: “Taste now the consequence of your deeds.”

4083.arabic: كَذَّبَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَأَتىٰهُمُ العَذابُ مِن حَيثُ لا يَشعُرونَ
4083.en: Their predecessors gave the lie to the Truth and then chastisement came upon them from whence they could not imagine.

4084.arabic: فَأَذاقَهُمُ اللَّهُ الخِزىَ فِى الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا وَلَعَذابُ الـٔاخِرَةِ أَكبَرُ لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ
4084.en: So Allah made them taste degradation in the life of this world, and certainly the chastisement of the Hereafter will be much more grievous. Would that they knew!

4085.arabic: وَلَقَد ضَرَبنا لِلنّاسِ فى هـٰذَا القُرءانِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَذَكَّرونَ
4085.en: We have indeed propounded for mankind all kinds of parables in this Qur'an that they may take heed.

4086.arabic: قُرءانًا عَرَبِيًّا غَيرَ ذى عِوَجٍ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَّقونَ
4086.en: It is an Arabic Qur'an free of all crookedness that they may guard against their evil end.

4087.arabic: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا رَجُلًا فيهِ شُرَكاءُ مُتَشـٰكِسونَ وَرَجُلًا سَلَمًا لِرَجُلٍ هَل يَستَوِيانِ مَثَلًا الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
4087.en: Allah propounds a parable: there is a man whose ownership is shared by several quarrelsome masters, each pulling him to himself; and there is another who is exclusively owned by one man. Can the two be alike? All praise and thanks be to Allah. But most of them are unaware.

4088.en: (O Prophet), you are destined to die and they too are destined to die.

4089.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُم يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ عِندَ رَبِّكُم تَختَصِمونَ
4089.en: Then eventually all of you will contend before your Lord on the Day of Resurrection.

4090.arabic: فَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن كَذَبَ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَكَذَّبَ بِالصِّدقِ إِذ جاءَهُ أَلَيسَ فى جَهَنَّمَ مَثوًى لِلكـٰفِرينَ
4090.en: Who, then, can be more unjust than he who lied against Allah and denied the Truth when it came to him, calling it a lie? Is there no room for such unbelievers in Hell?

4091.arabic: وَالَّذى جاءَ بِالصِّدقِ وَصَدَّقَ بِهِ أُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ المُتَّقونَ
4091.en: But he who brought the Truth, and those who confirmed it as true, such are the ones who shall be guarded against the chastisement.

4092.arabic: لَهُم ما يَشاءونَ عِندَ رَبِّهِم ذٰلِكَ جَزاءُ المُحسِنينَ
4092.en: They shall have from their Lord all that they wish for. That is the reward of those that do good,

4093.arabic: لِيُكَفِّرَ اللَّهُ عَنهُم أَسوَأَ الَّذى عَمِلوا وَيَجزِيَهُم أَجرَهُم بِأَحسَنِ الَّذى كانوا يَعمَلونَ
4093.en: so that Allah may remit their worst deeds and reward them according to the best of their deeds.

4094.arabic: أَلَيسَ اللَّهُ بِكافٍ عَبدَهُ وَيُخَوِّفونَكَ بِالَّذينَ مِن دونِهِ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن هادٍ
4094.en: (O Prophet), does Allah not suffice for His servant? They frighten you with others apart from Him, although he whom Allah lets go astray, none can guide him to the Right Way.

4095.arabic: وَمَن يَهدِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن مُضِلٍّ أَلَيسَ اللَّهُ بِعَزيزٍ ذِى انتِقامٍ
4095.en: And he whom Allah guides to the Right Way, none can lead him astray. Is not Allah the Most Mighty, the Lord of Retribution?

4096.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلتَهُم مَن خَلَقَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضَ لَيَقولُنَّ اللَّهُ قُل أَفَرَءَيتُم ما تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ إِن أَرادَنِىَ اللَّهُ بِضُرٍّ هَل هُنَّ كـٰشِفـٰتُ ضُرِّهِ أَو أَرادَنى بِرَحمَةٍ هَل هُنَّ مُمسِكـٰتُ رَحمَتِهِ قُل حَسبِىَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِ يَتَوَكَّلُ المُتَوَكِّلونَ
4096.en: If you ask them: “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they will surely answer: “Allah.” Tell them: “What do you think, then, of the deities whom you call upon instead of Allah? If Allah should will that an affliction befall me, will those deities remove the harm inflicted by Him? Or if Allah should will that I receive (His) Mercy, will they be able to withhold His Mercy from me?” Say: “Allah is sufficient for me; those who have to put their trust, let them put their trust in Him.

4097.arabic: قُل يـٰقَومِ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّى عـٰمِلٌ فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ
4097.en: Tell them: “My people, continue to work in your position as you will, I too will continue with my work. Soon you shall know

4098.arabic: مَن يَأتيهِ عَذابٌ يُخزيهِ وَيَحِلُّ عَلَيهِ عَذابٌ مُقيمٌ
4098.en: whom the degrading chastisement will visit and upon whom the everlasting chastisement will alight.

4099.arabic: إِنّا أَنزَلنا عَلَيكَ الكِتـٰبَ لِلنّاسِ بِالحَقِّ فَمَنِ اهتَدىٰ فَلِنَفسِهِ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّما يَضِلُّ عَلَيها وَما أَنتَ عَلَيهِم بِوَكيلٍ
4099.en: (O Prophet), We revealed to you the Book with the Truth for all mankind. So he who follows the Right Way does so to his own benefit, and he who goes astray, shall hurt only himself by straying. You are not accountable on their behalf.

4100.arabic: اللَّهُ يَتَوَفَّى الأَنفُسَ حينَ مَوتِها وَالَّتى لَم تَمُت فى مَنامِها فَيُمسِكُ الَّتى قَضىٰ عَلَيهَا المَوتَ وَيُرسِلُ الأُخرىٰ إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايـٰتٍ لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
4100.en: It is Allah Who takes away the souls of people at the hour of their death, and takes away at the time of sleep the souls of those that have not died. Then He retains the souls of those against whom He had decreed death and returns the souls of others till an appointed time. Surely there are Signs in this for a people who reflect.

4101.arabic: أَمِ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ شُفَعاءَ قُل أَوَلَو كانوا لا يَملِكونَ شَيـًٔا وَلا يَعقِلونَ
4101.en: Or have they taken others instead of Allah as intercessors? Say: “Will they intercede though they may have no power and though they may not even understand?”

4102.arabic: قُل لِلَّهِ الشَّفـٰعَةُ جَميعًا لَهُ مُلكُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ ثُمَّ إِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
4102.en: Say: “All intercession lies with Allah. His is the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And to Him will all of you be sent back.”

4103.arabic: وَإِذا ذُكِرَ اللَّهُ وَحدَهُ اشمَأَزَّت قُلوبُ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالـٔاخِرَةِ وَإِذا ذُكِرَ الَّذينَ مِن دونِهِ إِذا هُم يَستَبشِرونَ
4103.en: When Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter contract with bitterness, but when deities apart from Allah are mentioned, they are filled with joy.

4104.arabic: قُلِ اللَّهُمَّ فاطِرَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ عـٰلِمَ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهـٰدَةِ أَنتَ تَحكُمُ بَينَ عِبادِكَ فى ما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
4104.en: Say: “O Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, the Knower of the unseen and the seen, You it is Who will judge among Your servants concerning what they differed.

4105.arabic: وَلَو أَنَّ لِلَّذينَ ظَلَموا ما فِى الأَرضِ جَميعًا وَمِثلَهُ مَعَهُ لَافتَدَوا بِهِ مِن سوءِ العَذابِ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ وَبَدا لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ ما لَم يَكونوا يَحتَسِبونَ
4105.en: If the wrong#doers possessed the treasures of the earth in their entirety and as much besides, they would gladly offer it on the Day of Resurrection to redeem themselves from the harrowing chastisement. This because there will appear to them from Allah something (exceedingly dismal which) they had never even imagined.

4106.arabic: وَبَدا لَهُم سَيِّـٔاتُ ما كَسَبوا وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِءونَ
4106.en: The evil consequences of their deeds will become fully apparent to them, and what they had scoffed at will encompass them.

4107.arabic: فَإِذا مَسَّ الإِنسـٰنَ ضُرٌّ دَعانا ثُمَّ إِذا خَوَّلنـٰهُ نِعمَةً مِنّا قالَ إِنَّما أوتيتُهُ عَلىٰ عِلمٍ بَل هِىَ فِتنَةٌ وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
4107.en: When an affliction befalls man, he cries out to Us; but when We grant him a favour from Us, he says: “I have been granted this on account of my knowledge.” Nay; this (favour) is a test; but most of them do not know.

4108.arabic: قَد قالَهَا الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَما أَغنىٰ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
4108.en: Their predecessors also said the same, but their earnings proved of no avail to them,

4109.arabic: فَأَصابَهُم سَيِّـٔاتُ ما كَسَبوا وَالَّذينَ ظَلَموا مِن هـٰؤُلاءِ سَيُصيبُهُم سَيِّـٔاتُ ما كَسَبوا وَما هُم بِمُعجِزينَ
4109.en: and the evil consequences of their deeds overtook them. The wrongdoers among these will also be overtaken by the evil consequences of their deeds. They will be utterly unable to frustrate (Us).

4110.arabic: أَوَلَم يَعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَـٔايـٰتٍ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
4110.en: Do they not know that Allah enlarges and straitens the provision of whomsoever He pleases? Therein are Signs for those that believe.

4111.arabic: قُل يـٰعِبادِىَ الَّذينَ أَسرَفوا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِهِم لا تَقنَطوا مِن رَحمَةِ اللَّهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَغفِرُ الذُّنوبَ جَميعًا إِنَّهُ هُوَ الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
4111.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): “My servants who have committed excesses against themselves, do not despair of Allah's Mercy. Surely Allah forgives all sins. He is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

4112.arabic: وَأَنيبوا إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم وَأَسلِموا لَهُ مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَكُمُ العَذابُ ثُمَّ لا تُنصَرونَ
4112.en: Turn to your Lord and surrender yourselves to Him before the chastisement over#takes you; for then you will receive no help.

4113.arabic: وَاتَّبِعوا أَحسَنَ ما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكُم مِن رَبِّكُم مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَكُمُ العَذابُ بَغتَةً وَأَنتُم لا تَشعُرونَ
4113.en: Follow the best of what has been revealed to you from your Lord before the chastisement suddenly comes upon you without you even being aware of it.”

4114.arabic: أَن تَقولَ نَفسٌ يـٰحَسرَتىٰ عَلىٰ ما فَرَّطتُ فى جَنبِ اللَّهِ وَإِن كُنتُ لَمِنَ السّـٰخِرينَ
4114.en: Lest a person should say: “Alas for me for neglecting my duty towards Allah and for being among those that scoffed”;

4115.arabic: أَو تَقولَ لَو أَنَّ اللَّهَ هَدىٰنى لَكُنتُ مِنَ المُتَّقينَ
4115.en: and lest a person should say: “If only Allah had guided me, I should have been one of the God#fearing”;

4116.arabic: أَو تَقولَ حينَ تَرَى العَذابَ لَو أَنَّ لى كَرَّةً فَأَكونَ مِنَ المُحسِنينَ
4116.en: or lest he should say, when he sees the chastisement: “O that I might return again, and be among those who do good.”

4117.arabic: بَلىٰ قَد جاءَتكَ ءايـٰتى فَكَذَّبتَ بِها وَاستَكبَرتَ وَكُنتَ مِنَ الكـٰفِرينَ
4117.en: Yes indeed! But My Signs came to you and you rejected them as lies, and waxed arrogant and were among those who disbelieved.

4118.arabic: وَيَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ تَرَى الَّذينَ كَذَبوا عَلَى اللَّهِ وُجوهُهُم مُسوَدَّةٌ أَلَيسَ فى جَهَنَّمَ مَثوًى لِلمُتَكَبِّرينَ
4118.en: On the Day of Resurrection you shall see that the faces of those who had lied against Allah have turned dark. Is Hell not vast enough to provide a room to the vainglorious?

4119.arabic: وَيُنَجِّى اللَّهُ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا بِمَفازَتِهِم لا يَمَسُّهُمُ السّوءُ وَلا هُم يَحزَنونَ
4119.en: But as for the God#fearing, Allah will deliver them on account of their achievements: no harm shall visit them nor shall they grieve.

4120.arabic: اللَّهُ خـٰلِقُ كُلِّ شَىءٍ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ وَكيلٌ
4120.en: Allah is the Creator of everything; He is the Guardian over everything.

4121.arabic: لَهُ مَقاليدُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا بِـٔايـٰتِ اللَّهِ أُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ الخـٰسِرونَ
4121.en: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. It is those who disbelieve in Allah's Signs who will be the losers.

4122.arabic: قُل أَفَغَيرَ اللَّهِ تَأمُرونّى أَعبُدُ أَيُّهَا الجـٰهِلونَ
4122.en: (O Prophet), say: “Ignorant people! Do you bid me to serve any other beside Allah?”

4123.arabic: وَلَقَد أوحِىَ إِلَيكَ وَإِلَى الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِكَ لَئِن أَشرَكتَ لَيَحبَطَنَّ عَمَلُكَ وَلَتَكونَنَّ مِنَ الخـٰسِرينَ
4123.en: (Tell them clearly that) it was revealed to you and to all Prophets before you: “If you associate any others with Allah in His Divinity, your works will surely come to naught and you will certainly be among the losers.”

4124.arabic: بَلِ اللَّهَ فَاعبُد وَكُن مِنَ الشّـٰكِرينَ
4124.en: Therefore, serve Allah alone and be among those who give thanks.

4125.arabic: وَما قَدَرُوا اللَّهَ حَقَّ قَدرِهِ وَالأَرضُ جَميعًا قَبضَتُهُ يَومَ القِيـٰمَةِ وَالسَّمـٰوٰتُ مَطوِيّـٰتٌ بِيَمينِهِ سُبحـٰنَهُ وَتَعـٰلىٰ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
4125.en: They did not recognise the true worth of Allah. (Such is Allah's power that) on the Day of Resurrection the whole earth will be in His grasp, and the heavens shall be folded up in His Right Hand. Glory be to Him! Exalted be He from all that they associate with Him.

4126.arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِى الصّورِ فَصَعِقَ مَن فِى السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَمَن فِى الأَرضِ إِلّا مَن شاءَ اللَّهُ ثُمَّ نُفِخَ فيهِ أُخرىٰ فَإِذا هُم قِيامٌ يَنظُرونَ
4126.en: And the Trumpet shall be blown and all who are in the heavens and the earth shall fall down dead save those whom Allah wills. Then the Trumpet shall be blown again, and lo! all of them will be standing and looking on.

4127.arabic: وَأَشرَقَتِ الأَرضُ بِنورِ رَبِّها وَوُضِعَ الكِتـٰبُ وَجِا۟ىءَ بِالنَّبِيّـۧنَ وَالشُّهَداءِ وَقُضِىَ بَينَهُم بِالحَقِّ وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
4127.en: The earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Scroll (of deeds) shall be set in place, and the Prophets and all witnesses shall be brought, and judgement shall be justly passed among them, and they shall not be wronged;

4128.arabic: وَوُفِّيَت كُلُّ نَفسٍ ما عَمِلَت وَهُوَ أَعلَمُ بِما يَفعَلونَ
4128.en: and everyone shall be paid in full for all that he did. Allah is best aware of all that they do.

4129.arabic: وَسيقَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِلىٰ جَهَنَّمَ زُمَرًا حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءوها فُتِحَت أَبوٰبُها وَقالَ لَهُم خَزَنَتُها أَلَم يَأتِكُم رُسُلٌ مِنكُم يَتلونَ عَلَيكُم ءايـٰتِ رَبِّكُم وَيُنذِرونَكُم لِقاءَ يَومِكُم هـٰذا قالوا بَلىٰ وَلـٰكِن حَقَّت كَلِمَةُ العَذابِ عَلَى الكـٰفِرينَ
4129.en: (After the judgement has been passed) the unbelievers shall be driven in companies to Hell so that when they arrive there, its gates shall be thrown open and its keepers shall say to them: “Did Messengers from among yourselves not come to you, rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord and warning you against your meeting of this Day?” They will say: “Yes indeed; but the sentence of chastisement was bound to be executed against the unbelievers.”

4130.arabic: قيلَ ادخُلوا أَبوٰبَ جَهَنَّمَ خـٰلِدينَ فيها فَبِئسَ مَثوَى المُتَكَبِّرينَ
4130.en: It will be said: “Enter the gates of Hell. Herein shall you abide.” How evil is the abode of the vainglorious!

4131.arabic: وَسيقَ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا رَبَّهُم إِلَى الجَنَّةِ زُمَرًا حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءوها وَفُتِحَت أَبوٰبُها وَقالَ لَهُم خَزَنَتُها سَلـٰمٌ عَلَيكُم طِبتُم فَادخُلوها خـٰلِدينَ
4131.en: And those who eschewed disobeying their Lord shall be driven in companies to Paradise so that when they arrive there its gates will have already been thrown open and its keepers shall say to them: “Peace be upon you; you have done well. So enter. Herein you shall abide.”

4132.arabic: وَقالُوا الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذى صَدَقَنا وَعدَهُ وَأَورَثَنَا الأَرضَ نَتَبَوَّأُ مِنَ الجَنَّةِ حَيثُ نَشاءُ فَنِعمَ أَجرُ العـٰمِلينَ
4132.en: They will say: “All thanks and praise be to Allah Who has made His promise to us come true, and Who gave us the earth to inherit. We may now dwell in Paradise wherever we please.” How excellent is the reward of those who laboured!

4133.arabic: وَتَرَى المَلـٰئِكَةَ حافّينَ مِن حَولِ العَرشِ يُسَبِّحونَ بِحَمدِ رَبِّهِم وَقُضِىَ بَينَهُم بِالحَقِّ وَقيلَ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
4133.en: You shall see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise, and judgement will have been made among them with fairness, and it will be proclaimed: “All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe.”

4135.arabic: تَنزيلُ الكِتـٰبِ مِنَ اللَّهِ العَزيزِ العَليمِ
4135.en: This Book is a revelation from Allah, the All#Mighty, the All#Knowing;

4136.arabic: غافِرِ الذَّنبِ وَقابِلِ التَّوبِ شَديدِ العِقابِ ذِى الطَّولِ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ إِلَيهِ المَصيرُ
4136.en: the Forgiver of sins, the Accepter of repentance, the Stern in retribution, the Bountiful. There is no god but He. To Him are all destined to return.

4137.arabic: ما يُجـٰدِلُ فى ءايـٰتِ اللَّهِ إِلَّا الَّذينَ كَفَروا فَلا يَغرُركَ تَقَلُّبُهُم فِى البِلـٰدِ
4137.en: None but the unbelievers dispute regarding the Signs of Allah. So let not their strutting about in the land delude you.

4138.arabic: كَذَّبَت قَبلَهُم قَومُ نوحٍ وَالأَحزابُ مِن بَعدِهِم وَهَمَّت كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ بِرَسولِهِم لِيَأخُذوهُ وَجـٰدَلوا بِالبـٰطِلِ لِيُدحِضوا بِهِ الحَقَّ فَأَخَذتُهُم فَكَيفَ كانَ عِقابِ
4138.en: Before them the people of Noah also gave the lie (to Messengers), and so did many parties after them. Each nation sallied forth against its Messenger to seize him, and they disputed with false arguments seeking therewith to repudiate the Truth. Then I seized them; and behold, how woeful was My retribution!

4139.arabic: وَكَذٰلِكَ حَقَّت كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ عَلَى الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَنَّهُم أَصحـٰبُ النّارِ
4139.en: Thus has the decree of your Lord become due against the unbelievers. They are destined for the Fire.

4140.arabic: الَّذينَ يَحمِلونَ العَرشَ وَمَن حَولَهُ يُسَبِّحونَ بِحَمدِ رَبِّهِم وَيُؤمِنونَ بِهِ وَيَستَغفِرونَ لِلَّذينَ ءامَنوا رَبَّنا وَسِعتَ كُلَّ شَىءٍ رَحمَةً وَعِلمًا فَاغفِر لِلَّذينَ تابوا وَاتَّبَعوا سَبيلَكَ وَقِهِم عَذابَ الجَحيمِ
4140.en: The angels that bear the Throne and those that are around to extol your Lord's glory with His praise, they believe in Him, and ask forgiveness for the believers, saying: “Our Lord! You encompass everything with Your Mercy and Knowledge. So forgive those that repent and follow Your Path, and guard them against the chastisement of Hell.

4141.arabic: رَبَّنا وَأَدخِلهُم جَنّـٰتِ عَدنٍ الَّتى وَعَدتَهُم وَمَن صَلَحَ مِن ءابائِهِم وَأَزوٰجِهِم وَذُرِّيّـٰتِهِم إِنَّكَ أَنتَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
4141.en: Our Lord, admit them to the everlasting Gardens You have promised them and those of their fathers and spouses and progeny that were righteous. Surely You alone are Most Mighty, Most Wise;

4142.arabic: وَقِهِمُ السَّيِّـٔاتِ وَمَن تَقِ السَّيِّـٔاتِ يَومَئِذٍ فَقَد رَحِمتَهُ وَذٰلِكَ هُوَ الفَوزُ العَظيمُ
4142.en: and guard them against all ills. He whom You guard against ills on that Day, to him You have surely been Most Merciful. That is the great triumph.”

4143.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا يُنادَونَ لَمَقتُ اللَّهِ أَكبَرُ مِن مَقتِكُم أَنفُسَكُم إِذ تُدعَونَ إِلَى الإيمـٰنِ فَتَكفُرونَ
4143.en: It will be announced to the unbelievers (on the Day of Resurrection): “Surely Allah's abhorrence of you when you were called to believe but you disbelieved was greater than is your abhorrence of yourselves today.”

4144.arabic: قالوا رَبَّنا أَمَتَّنَا اثنَتَينِ وَأَحيَيتَنَا اثنَتَينِ فَاعتَرَفنا بِذُنوبِنا فَهَل إِلىٰ خُروجٍ مِن سَبيلٍ
4144.en: They will say: “Our Lord, twice have You caused us to die and twice have You given us life. We have now confessed our sins. Is there, then, any way out?”

4145.arabic: ذٰلِكُم بِأَنَّهُ إِذا دُعِىَ اللَّهُ وَحدَهُ كَفَرتُم وَإِن يُشرَك بِهِ تُؤمِنوا فَالحُكمُ لِلَّهِ العَلِىِّ الكَبيرِ
4145.en: (They will be told): “(The cause of your present state is that) when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved; and when others instead of Him were invoked, you believed. Today all judgement lies with Allah, the Most High, the All#Great.”

4146.arabic: هُوَ الَّذى يُريكُم ءايـٰتِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ لَكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ رِزقًا وَما يَتَذَكَّرُ إِلّا مَن يُنيبُ
4146.en: He it is Who shows you His Signs and sends down provision for you from the sky. Yet none takes heed except he who constantly turns to Allah.

4147.arabic: فَادعُوا اللَّهَ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ وَلَو كَرِهَ الكـٰفِرونَ
4147.en: So call upon Allah, consecrating all your devotion to Him, howsoever much the unbelievers may dislike it.

4148.arabic: رَفيعُ الدَّرَجـٰتِ ذُو العَرشِ يُلقِى الرّوحَ مِن أَمرِهِ عَلىٰ مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ لِيُنذِرَ يَومَ التَّلاقِ
4148.en: Exalted in Rank, Lord of the Throne: He causes the spirit to descend on whomsoever of His servants He pleases so as to warn them of the Day of Encounter;

4149.arabic: يَومَ هُم بـٰرِزونَ لا يَخفىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ مِنهُم شَىءٌ لِمَنِ المُلكُ اليَومَ لِلَّهِ الوٰحِدِ القَهّارِ
4149.en: the Day when they will emerge and nothing of them shall be hidden from Allah. (On that Day they will be asked): “Whose is the kingdom today?” (The whole world will cry out): “It is Allah's, the One, the Overpowering.”

4150.arabic: اليَومَ تُجزىٰ كُلُّ نَفسٍ بِما كَسَبَت لا ظُلمَ اليَومَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
4150.en: (It will then be said): “Today shall everyone be fully recompensed for his deeds. None shall be wronged today. Surely Allah is Swift in Reckoning.”

4151.arabic: وَأَنذِرهُم يَومَ الـٔازِفَةِ إِذِ القُلوبُ لَدَى الحَناجِرِ كـٰظِمينَ ما لِلظّـٰلِمينَ مِن حَميمٍ وَلا شَفيعٍ يُطاعُ
4151.en: (O Prophet), then warn them of the Day that has drawn near, the Day when hearts full of suppressed grief will leap up to the throats and the wrong#doers shall neither have any sincere friend nor intercessor whose word will be heeded.

4152.arabic: يَعلَمُ خائِنَةَ الأَعيُنِ وَما تُخفِى الصُّدورُ
4152.en: He knows even the most stealthy glance of the eyes and all the secrets that hearts conceal.

4153.arabic: وَاللَّهُ يَقضى بِالحَقِّ وَالَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ لا يَقضونَ بِشَىءٍ إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ السَّميعُ البَصيرُ
4153.en: Allah will judge with justice, whereas those whom they call upon beside Him cannot judge at all. Surely Allah ## and He alone ## is All# Hearing, All#Seeing.

4154.arabic: أَوَلَم يَسيروا فِى الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عـٰقِبَةُ الَّذينَ كانوا مِن قَبلِهِم كانوا هُم أَشَدَّ مِنهُم قُوَّةً وَءاثارًا فِى الأَرضِ فَأَخَذَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِذُنوبِهِم وَما كانَ لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن واقٍ
4154.en: Have they not journeyed in the land that they might observe the end of those who came before them? They were even greater in strength than they and left behind more splendid traces in the land. Then Allah seized them because of their sins and they had none who could protect them from Allah.

4155.arabic: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم كانَت تَأتيهِم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّنـٰتِ فَكَفَروا فَأَخَذَهُمُ اللَّهُ إِنَّهُ قَوِىٌّ شَديدُ العِقابِ
4155.en: They came to this end because their Messengers would come to them with Clear Signs and yet they would refuse to believe. So Allah seized them. He is indeed Strong, Terrible in Retribution.

4156.arabic: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا موسىٰ بِـٔايـٰتِنا وَسُلطـٰنٍ مُبينٍ
4156.en: Verily We sent Moses with Our Signs and a clear authority

4157.arabic: إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَهـٰمـٰنَ وَقـٰرونَ فَقالوا سـٰحِرٌ كَذّابٌ
4157.en: to Pharaoh and Haman and Korah. They said: “(He is) a sorcerer, an utter liar.”

4158.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَهُم بِالحَقِّ مِن عِندِنا قالُوا اقتُلوا أَبناءَ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا مَعَهُ وَاستَحيوا نِساءَهُم وَما كَيدُ الكـٰفِرينَ إِلّا فى ضَلـٰلٍ
4158.en: When Moses brought them the Truth from Us they said: “Kill the sons of all the believers who have joined him, but spare the women.” The guile of the unbelievers always ends in vain.

4159.arabic: وَقالَ فِرعَونُ ذَرونى أَقتُل موسىٰ وَليَدعُ رَبَّهُ إِنّى أَخافُ أَن يُبَدِّلَ دينَكُم أَو أَن يُظهِرَ فِى الأَرضِ الفَسادَ
4159.en: One day Pharaoh said: “Let me go and kill Moses; then let him invoke his Lord. I fear that he will change your religion or cause disruption in the land.”

4160.arabic: وَقالَ موسىٰ إِنّى عُذتُ بِرَبّى وَرَبِّكُم مِن كُلِّ مُتَكَبِّرٍ لا يُؤمِنُ بِيَومِ الحِسابِ
4160.en: Moses said: “I have taken refuge with my Lord and your Lord from everyone who waxes arrogant and does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.”

4161.arabic: وَقالَ رَجُلٌ مُؤمِنٌ مِن ءالِ فِرعَونَ يَكتُمُ إيمـٰنَهُ أَتَقتُلونَ رَجُلًا أَن يَقولَ رَبِّىَ اللَّهُ وَقَد جاءَكُم بِالبَيِّنـٰتِ مِن رَبِّكُم وَإِن يَكُ كـٰذِبًا فَعَلَيهِ كَذِبُهُ وَإِن يَكُ صادِقًا يُصِبكُم بَعضُ الَّذى يَعِدُكُم إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدى مَن هُوَ مُسرِفٌ كَذّابٌ
4161.en: Then a man endowed with faith, from Pharaoh's folk, who had kept his faith hidden, said: “Do you kill a person simply because he says: 'My Lord is Allah' even though he brought to you clear Signs from your Lord? If he is a liar, his lying will recoil upon him; but if he is truthful, you will be smitten with some of the awesome consequences of which he warns you. Allah does not guide to the Right Way any who exceeds the limits and is an utter liar.

4162.arabic: يـٰقَومِ لَكُمُ المُلكُ اليَومَ ظـٰهِرينَ فِى الأَرضِ فَمَن يَنصُرُنا مِن بَأسِ اللَّهِ إِن جاءَنا قالَ فِرعَونُ ما أُريكُم إِلّا ما أَرىٰ وَما أَهديكُم إِلّا سَبيلَ الرَّشادِ
4162.en: My people, today the kingdom is yours, and you are supreme in the land. But if Allah's chastisement were to come upon you, who will come to our help?” Pharaoh said: “I only counsel what I consider right; I only direct you to the Path of Rectitude.”

4163.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذى ءامَنَ يـٰقَومِ إِنّى أَخافُ عَلَيكُم مِثلَ يَومِ الأَحزابِ
4163.en: He who had faith said: “My people, I fear that you will confront a day like that which overtook many parties before you,

4164.arabic: مِثلَ دَأبِ قَومِ نوحٍ وَعادٍ وَثَمودَ وَالَّذينَ مِن بَعدِهِم وَمَا اللَّهُ يُريدُ ظُلمًا لِلعِبادِ
4164.en: like the day that overtook the people of Noah and Ad and Thamud, and those who came after them. Allah does not wish to subject His servants to any injustice.

4165.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ إِنّى أَخافُ عَلَيكُم يَومَ التَّنادِ
4165.en: My people, I fear that you will encounter a day when there will be much wailing and you will cry out to one another for help,

4166.arabic: يَومَ تُوَلّونَ مُدبِرينَ ما لَكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن عاصِمٍ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن هادٍ
4166.en: the day when you will turn around to retreat, there will be none to protect you from Allah. He whom Allah lets go astray, none will be able to show him the Right Way.

4167.arabic: وَلَقَد جاءَكُم يوسُفُ مِن قَبلُ بِالبَيِّنـٰتِ فَما زِلتُم فى شَكٍّ مِمّا جاءَكُم بِهِ حَتّىٰ إِذا هَلَكَ قُلتُم لَن يَبعَثَ اللَّهُ مِن بَعدِهِ رَسولًا كَذٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن هُوَ مُسرِفٌ مُرتابٌ
4167.en: Verily Joseph came to you with Clear Signs before, yet you continued to doubt his Message. Thereafter when he died, you said: 'Allah shall send no Messenger after him.'” Thus Allah leads astray those who transgress the limits and are given to much doubting;

4168.arabic: الَّذينَ يُجـٰدِلونَ فى ءايـٰتِ اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ سُلطـٰنٍ أَتىٰهُم كَبُرَ مَقتًا عِندَ اللَّهِ وَعِندَ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا كَذٰلِكَ يَطبَعُ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ قَلبِ مُتَكَبِّرٍ جَبّارٍ
4168.en: those who contend regarding Allah's Signs without any evidence that might have come to them. That is exceedingly loathsome to Allah and to those that believe. Thus does Allah seal the heart of everyone who is proud and high#handed.

4169.arabic: وَقالَ فِرعَونُ يـٰهـٰمـٰنُ ابنِ لى صَرحًا لَعَلّى أَبلُغُ الأَسبـٰبَ
4169.en: Pharaoh said: “Haman, build for me a lofty tower that I may scale the highways ##

4170.arabic: أَسبـٰبَ السَّمـٰوٰتِ فَأَطَّلِعَ إِلىٰ إِلـٰهِ موسىٰ وَإِنّى لَأَظُنُّهُ كـٰذِبًا وَكَذٰلِكَ زُيِّنَ لِفِرعَونَ سوءُ عَمَلِهِ وَصُدَّ عَنِ السَّبيلِ وَما كَيدُ فِرعَونَ إِلّا فى تَبابٍ
4170.en: the highways to the heavens ## and have a look at the God of Moses, although I am certain that Moses is a liar.” Thus Pharaoh's evil deed was made to seem fair to him, and he was barred from the Right Path. Pharaoh's guile only led him to his own perdition.

4171.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذى ءامَنَ يـٰقَومِ اتَّبِعونِ أَهدِكُم سَبيلَ الرَّشادِ
4171.en: The person endowed with faith said: “My people, follow me; I shall direct you to the Path of Rectitude.

4172.arabic: يـٰقَومِ إِنَّما هـٰذِهِ الحَيوٰةُ الدُّنيا مَتـٰعٌ وَإِنَّ الـٔاخِرَةَ هِىَ دارُ القَرارِ
4172.en: My people, the life of this world is ephemeral, whereas the Hereafter, that is the permanent abode.

4173.arabic: مَن عَمِلَ سَيِّئَةً فَلا يُجزىٰ إِلّا مِثلَها وَمَن عَمِلَ صـٰلِحًا مِن ذَكَرٍ أَو أُنثىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَأُولـٰئِكَ يَدخُلونَ الجَنَّةَ يُرزَقونَ فيها بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
4173.en: Whosoever does an evil deed will be requited only with the like of it; and whosoever acts righteously and has attained to faith ## be he a male or a female ## they shall enter Paradise and be provided sustenance beyond all reckoning.

4174.arabic: وَيـٰقَومِ ما لى أَدعوكُم إِلَى النَّجوٰةِ وَتَدعونَنى إِلَى النّارِ
4174.en: My people, how is it that I call you to salvation while you call me to the Fire;

4175.arabic: تَدعونَنى لِأَكفُرَ بِاللَّهِ وَأُشرِكَ بِهِ ما لَيسَ لى بِهِ عِلمٌ وَأَنا۠ أَدعوكُم إِلَى العَزيزِ الغَفّـٰرِ
4175.en: you call me to deny Allah and to associate with Him as His partners those regarding whom I have no knowledge (that they are Allah's partners in His Divinity), whereas I call you to the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving?

4176.arabic: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّما تَدعونَنى إِلَيهِ لَيسَ لَهُ دَعوَةٌ فِى الدُّنيا وَلا فِى الـٔاخِرَةِ وَأَنَّ مَرَدَّنا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَأَنَّ المُسرِفينَ هُم أَصحـٰبُ النّارِ
4176.en: There is no doubt that those whom you call me to have no claim to be called upon in this world and in the Hereafter. Certainly to Allah shall be our return, and those who exceed the limits are destined to the Fire.

4177.arabic: فَسَتَذكُرونَ ما أَقولُ لَكُم وَأُفَوِّضُ أَمرى إِلَى اللَّهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بَصيرٌ بِالعِبادِ
4177.en: Soon you shall remember what I say to you. I entrust my affairs to Allah. Surely Allah is watchful over His servants.”

4178.arabic: فَوَقىٰهُ اللَّهُ سَيِّـٔاتِ ما مَكَروا وَحاقَ بِـٔالِ فِرعَونَ سوءُ العَذابِ
4178.en: Eventually Allah saved the person endowed with faith from all the evils of their guile, and a woeful chastisement encompassed the Pharaonites.

4179.arabic: النّارُ يُعرَضونَ عَلَيها غُدُوًّا وَعَشِيًّا وَيَومَ تَقومُ السّاعَةُ أَدخِلوا ءالَ فِرعَونَ أَشَدَّ العَذابِ
4179.en: They are exposed to the Fire every morning and evening; and when the Last Hour will come to pass, a command shall be given: “Admit the Pharaonites to an even more severe chastisement.”

4180.arabic: وَإِذ يَتَحاجّونَ فِى النّارِ فَيَقولُ الضُّعَفـٰؤُا۟ لِلَّذينَ استَكبَروا إِنّا كُنّا لَكُم تَبَعًا فَهَل أَنتُم مُغنونَ عَنّا نَصيبًا مِنَ النّارِ
4180.en: Just imagine when they will remonstrate with one another in Hell. The weak ones will say to those who waxed proud: “We were your followers. Will you, then, lighten for us a part of our suffering of the Fire?”

4181.arabic: قالَ الَّذينَ استَكبَروا إِنّا كُلٌّ فيها إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَد حَكَمَ بَينَ العِبادِ
4181.en: Those who had waxed proud will reply: “All of us are in it. Allah has already passed His judgement among His servants.”

4182.arabic: وَقالَ الَّذينَ فِى النّارِ لِخَزَنَةِ جَهَنَّمَ ادعوا رَبَّكُم يُخَفِّف عَنّا يَومًا مِنَ العَذابِ
4182.en: Those suffering in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell: “Call upon your Lord to lighten the chastisement for us just for a day.”

4183.arabic: قالوا أَوَلَم تَكُ تَأتيكُم رُسُلُكُم بِالبَيِّنـٰتِ قالوا بَلىٰ قالوا فَادعوا وَما دُعـٰؤُا۟ الكـٰفِرينَ إِلّا فى ضَلـٰلٍ
4183.en: The keepers of Hell will ask: “Did your Messengers not come to you with Clear Signs?” They will say: “Yes (they did).” The keepers of Hell will say: “Then you yourselves should call (upon the Lord). And the call of the unbelievers will end in vain.”

4184.arabic: إِنّا لَنَنصُرُ رُسُلَنا وَالَّذينَ ءامَنوا فِى الحَيوٰةِ الدُّنيا وَيَومَ يَقومُ الأَشهـٰدُ
4184.en: Surely We shall help Our Messengers and the believers in the life of this world and on the Day when witnesses will rise to testify,

4185.arabic: يَومَ لا يَنفَعُ الظّـٰلِمينَ مَعذِرَتُهُم وَلَهُمُ اللَّعنَةُ وَلَهُم سوءُ الدّارِ
4185.en: the Day when the excuses offered by the wrong#doers shall not avail them. They shall be victims of the curse and a woeful abode.

4186.arabic: وَلَقَد ءاتَينا موسَى الهُدىٰ وَأَورَثنا بَنى إِسرٰءيلَ الكِتـٰبَ
4186.en: We surely guided Moses and made the Children of Israel the heirs of the Book

4187.en: which was a guidance and good counsel to people endowed with understanding and wisdom.

4188.arabic: فَاصبِر إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَاستَغفِر لِذَنبِكَ وَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ بِالعَشِىِّ وَالإِبكـٰرِ
4188.en: Be steadfast, then, (O Prophet), Allah's promise is true. Seek forgiveness for your shortcomings, and celebrate the praise of your Lord, evening and morning.

4189.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُجـٰدِلونَ فى ءايـٰتِ اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ سُلطـٰنٍ أَتىٰهُم إِن فى صُدورِهِم إِلّا كِبرٌ ما هُم بِبـٰلِغيهِ فَاستَعِذ بِاللَّهِ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ البَصيرُ
4189.en: Verily those who dispute regarding the Signs of Allah without any evidence that might have come to them, nothing but vain pride fills their hearts. Yet they shall never be able to satisfy the pride with which they are puffed up. So seek refuge with Allah. Verily He is All#Hearing, All#Seeing.

4190.arabic: لَخَلقُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ أَكبَرُ مِن خَلقِ النّاسِ وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
4190.en: Surely the creation of the heavens and the earth is a greater act than the creation of human beings. But most people do not know.

4191.arabic: وَما يَستَوِى الأَعمىٰ وَالبَصيرُ وَالَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ وَلَا المُسىءُ قَليلًا ما تَتَذَكَّرونَ
4191.en: Never can the blind and the seeing be equal; nor those that believe and act righteously and those that do evil. Little do you understand.

4192.arabic: إِنَّ السّاعَةَ لَـٔاتِيَةٌ لا رَيبَ فيها وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يُؤمِنونَ
4192.en: The Hour will indeed come; there is no doubt about that. Yet most people do not believe.

4193.arabic: وَقالَ رَبُّكُمُ ادعونى أَستَجِب لَكُم إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَستَكبِرونَ عَن عِبادَتى سَيَدخُلونَ جَهَنَّمَ داخِرينَ
4193.en: Your Lord said: “Pray to Me, and I will accept your prayers. Surely those who wax too proud to worship Me shall enter Hell, utterly abased.”

4194.arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الَّيلَ لِتَسكُنوا فيهِ وَالنَّهارَ مُبصِرًا إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَذو فَضلٍ عَلَى النّاسِ وَلـٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَشكُرونَ
4194.en: Allah it is Who made the night so that you may seek repose in it, and made the day radiant. Surely Allah is Most Bounteous to people; but most people do not give thanks.

4195.arabic: ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُم خـٰلِقُ كُلِّ شَىءٍ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ فَأَنّىٰ تُؤفَكونَ
4195.en: Allah (Who bestowed all these favours upon you) is your Lord, the Creator of everything. There is no god but He. Whence are you, then, being led astray?

4196.arabic: كَذٰلِكَ يُؤفَكُ الَّذينَ كانوا بِـٔايـٰتِ اللَّهِ يَجحَدونَ
4196.en: Thus it is only those who had denied Allah's Signs that were led astray.

4197.arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَرضَ قَرارًا وَالسَّماءَ بِناءً وَصَوَّرَكُم فَأَحسَنَ صُوَرَكُم وَرَزَقَكُم مِنَ الطَّيِّبـٰتِ ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُم فَتَبارَكَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ العـٰلَمينَ
4197.en: Allah it is Who made the earth a dwelling place for you and made the sky a canopy, Who shaped you ## and shaped you exceedingly well ## and gave you good things as sustenance. That is Allah, your Lord; blessed be Allah, the Lord of the Universe.

4198.arabic: هُوَ الحَىُّ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ فَادعوهُ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
4198.en: He is the Ever#Living: there is no god but He. So call upon Him, consecrating to Him all your devotion. All praise and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of the whole Universe.

4199.arabic: قُل إِنّى نُهيتُ أَن أَعبُدَ الَّذينَ تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ لَمّا جاءَنِىَ البَيِّنـٰتُ مِن رَبّى وَأُمِرتُ أَن أُسلِمَ لِرَبِّ العـٰلَمينَ
4199.en: Say, (O Prophet): “I have been forbidden to worship those beside Allah whom you call upon. (How can I worship any beside Allah) when clear Signs have come to me from my Lord and I have been commanded to surrender to Allah, the Lord of the Universe?”

4200.arabic: هُوَ الَّذى خَلَقَكُم مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُطفَةٍ ثُمَّ مِن عَلَقَةٍ ثُمَّ يُخرِجُكُم طِفلًا ثُمَّ لِتَبلُغوا أَشُدَّكُم ثُمَّ لِتَكونوا شُيوخًا وَمِنكُم مَن يُتَوَفّىٰ مِن قَبلُ وَلِتَبلُغوا أَجَلًا مُسَمًّى وَلَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
4200.en: He it is Who created you from dust, then from a sperm#drop, then from a clot; then He brings you out as an infant, then causes you to grow into full maturity, and then causes you to grow further so that you may reach old age, while some of you He recalls earlier. All this is in order that you may reach an appointed term and that you may understand (the Truth).

4201.arabic: هُوَ الَّذى يُحيۦ وَيُميتُ فَإِذا قَضىٰ أَمرًا فَإِنَّما يَقولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
4201.en: He it is Who gives life and causes death. Whenever He decrees a thing, He only commands to it “Be”, and it is.

4202.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ إِلَى الَّذينَ يُجـٰدِلونَ فى ءايـٰتِ اللَّهِ أَنّىٰ يُصرَفونَ
4202.en: Did you not see those who dispute concerning Allah's Signs? Whence are they, then, being turned astray?

4203.arabic: الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِالكِتـٰبِ وَبِما أَرسَلنا بِهِ رُسُلَنا فَسَوفَ يَعلَمونَ
4203.en: Those who gave the lie to this Book and all the Books which We had sent with Our Messengers shall soon come to know the Truth

4204.arabic: إِذِ الأَغلـٰلُ فى أَعنـٰقِهِم وَالسَّلـٰسِلُ يُسحَبونَ
4204.en: when fetters and chains shall be on their necks, and they shall be dragged into

4205.arabic: فِى الحَميمِ ثُمَّ فِى النّارِ يُسجَرونَ
4205.en: boiling water, and cast into the Fire.

4206.arabic: ثُمَّ قيلَ لَهُم أَينَ ما كُنتُم تُشرِكونَ
4206.en: It will then be said to them: “Where are those whom you

4207.arabic: مِن دونِ اللَّهِ قالوا ضَلّوا عَنّا بَل لَم نَكُن نَدعوا مِن قَبلُ شَيـًٔا كَذٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ الكـٰفِرينَ
4207.en: associated with Allah in His Divinity?” They will say: “We have lost them; rather, we never used to call upon anyone before.” Thus will Allah cause them to stumble in error.

4208.arabic: ذٰلِكُم بِما كُنتُم تَفرَحونَ فِى الأَرضِ بِغَيرِ الحَقِّ وَبِما كُنتُم تَمرَحونَ
4208.en: (They will be told): “This is because while you were on earth you took delight in untruth and exulted in it.

4209.arabic: ادخُلوا أَبوٰبَ جَهَنَّمَ خـٰلِدينَ فيها فَبِئسَ مَثوَى المُتَكَبِّرينَ
4209.en: Enter Hell now to abide in it. How woeful is the abode of those who wax proud!

4210.arabic: فَاصبِر إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ فَإِمّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعضَ الَّذى نَعِدُهُم أَو نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِلَينا يُرجَعونَ
4210.en: So be patient, (O Prophet). Surely Allah's promise is true. Whether We show them a part of the woeful consequences against which We warn them (while you are still in their midst) or We recall you (from this world) before that, eventually it is to Us that they shall be brought back.

4211.arabic: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا رُسُلًا مِن قَبلِكَ مِنهُم مَن قَصَصنا عَلَيكَ وَمِنهُم مَن لَم نَقصُص عَلَيكَ وَما كانَ لِرَسولٍ أَن يَأتِىَ بِـٔايَةٍ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ فَإِذا جاءَ أَمرُ اللَّهِ قُضِىَ بِالحَقِّ وَخَسِرَ هُنالِكَ المُبطِلونَ
4211.en: Indeed We sent many Messengers before you: of them there are some whose account We have narrated to you and there are others whose account We have not narrated to you. It did not lie in any Messenger's power to bring any Sign except with Allah's leave. So when Allah's decree came, the matter was decided with justice, and those steeped in error courted utter loss, then and there.

4212.arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَنعـٰمَ لِتَركَبوا مِنها وَمِنها تَأكُلونَ
4212.en: Allah it is Who has made cattle for you so that you ride some of them and from some of them you derive food.

4213.arabic: وَلَكُم فيها مَنـٰفِعُ وَلِتَبلُغوا عَلَيها حاجَةً فى صُدورِكُم وَعَلَيها وَعَلَى الفُلكِ تُحمَلونَ
4213.en: In them there are also other benefits for you, and through them you fulfil your heartfelt need (to reach places), and you are borne along upon them as upon the ships.

4214.arabic: وَيُريكُم ءايـٰتِهِ فَأَىَّ ءايـٰتِ اللَّهِ تُنكِرونَ
4214.en: Allah shows His Signs to you; then which of Allah's Signs will you deny?

4215.arabic: أَفَلَم يَسيروا فِى الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عـٰقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم كانوا أَكثَرَ مِنهُم وَأَشَدَّ قُوَّةً وَءاثارًا فِى الأَرضِ فَما أَغنىٰ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
4215.en: Did they not journey in the land that they may behold the end of those who had gone before them? They were more numerous and greater in strength and left behind more splendid traces in the land. Yet their attainments did not avail them.

4216.arabic: فَلَمّا جاءَتهُم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّنـٰتِ فَرِحوا بِما عِندَهُم مِنَ العِلمِ وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِءونَ
4216.en: When their Messengers came to them with Clear Signs, they arrogantly exulted in whatever knowledge they had. They were then encompassed by what they had mocked.

4217.arabic: فَلَمّا رَأَوا بَأسَنا قالوا ءامَنّا بِاللَّهِ وَحدَهُ وَكَفَرنا بِما كُنّا بِهِ مُشرِكينَ
4217.en: When they saw Our chastisement, they said: “We have come to believe in Allah, the Only One, and we reject all what we had associated (with Allah in His Divinity).”

4218.arabic: فَلَم يَكُ يَنفَعُهُم إيمـٰنُهُم لَمّا رَأَوا بَأسَنا سُنَّتَ اللَّهِ الَّتى قَد خَلَت فى عِبادِهِ وَخَسِرَ هُنالِكَ الكـٰفِرونَ
