5310.en: Or have We sworn a covenant with you which We are bound to keep till the Day of Resurrection, (a covenant requiring that whatever you ordain for yourselves shall be yours)?

5311.en: Ask them: “Which of them can guarantee that?

5312.arabic: أَم لَهُم شُرَكاءُ فَليَأتوا بِشُرَكائِهِم إِن كانوا صـٰدِقينَ
5312.en: Or has something been guaranteed by any of those whom they associate with Allah in His Divinity?” If so, let them bring forth their associates, if they are truthful.

5313.arabic: يَومَ يُكشَفُ عَن ساقٍ وَيُدعَونَ إِلَى السُّجودِ فَلا يَستَطيعونَ
5313.en: On the Day when the dreadful calamity will unfold, when people will be summoned to prostrate themselves, and yet they will not be able to prostrate.

5314.arabic: خـٰشِعَةً أَبصـٰرُهُم تَرهَقُهُم ذِلَّةٌ وَقَد كانوا يُدعَونَ إِلَى السُّجودِ وَهُم سـٰلِمونَ
5314.en: Their eyes shall be downcast and ignominy shall overwhelm them. For when they were safe and sound, they were summoned to prostrate themselves, (and they refused).

5315.arabic: فَذَرنى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهـٰذَا الحَديثِ سَنَستَدرِجُهُم مِن حَيثُ لا يَعلَمونَ
5315.en: So leave Me, (O Prophet), to deal with him who gives the lie to this Discourse. We shall draw them little by little (to their undoing) in a way that they will not know.

5316.en: I am giving them a respite. Great is My scheme!

5317.arabic: أَم تَسـَٔلُهُم أَجرًا فَهُم مِن مَغرَمٍ مُثقَلونَ
5317.en: Or are you asking them for some compensation so that they feel burdened with debt?

5318.en: Or do they have any knowledge of the Unseen which they are now writing down?

5319.arabic: فَاصبِر لِحُكمِ رَبِّكَ وَلا تَكُن كَصاحِبِ الحوتِ إِذ نادىٰ وَهُوَ مَكظومٌ
5319.en: So bear with patience until the Judgement of your Lord comes, and do not belike the man in the fish (i.e., Jonah) who called out, choking with grief:

5320.arabic: لَولا أَن تَدٰرَكَهُ نِعمَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِ لَنُبِذَ بِالعَراءِ وَهُوَ مَذمومٌ
5320.en: had his Lord not bestowed His favour upon him, he would have been cast upon that barren shore (and would have remained there) in disgrace.

5321.en: But his Lord exalted him, and included him among His righteous servants.

5322.arabic: وَإِن يَكادُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَيُزلِقونَكَ بِأَبصـٰرِهِم لَمّا سَمِعُوا الذِّكرَ وَيَقولونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجنونٌ
5322.en: When the unbelievers hear this Exhortation, they look at you as though they would knock you off your feet with their (hostile) glances. They say: “Surely he is afflicted with madness”;

5323.en: although this is nothing but an Exhortation (to goodness) for everyone in the world.

5325.en: And what is that indubitable event?

5326.en: And what do you know what that indubitable event is?

5327.en: The Thamud and the Ad denied the (possibility of a) sudden calamity, calling it false.

5328.en: Then the Thamud were destroyed by an awesome upheaval;

5329.arabic: وَأَمّا عادٌ فَأُهلِكوا بِريحٍ صَرصَرٍ عاتِيَةٍ
5329.en: and the Ad were destroyed by a furiously raging wind#storm

5330.arabic: سَخَّرَها عَلَيهِم سَبعَ لَيالٍ وَثَمـٰنِيَةَ أَيّامٍ حُسومًا فَتَرَى القَومَ فيها صَرعىٰ كَأَنَّهُم أَعجازُ نَخلٍ خاوِيَةٍ
5330.en: which He let loose upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession; so that (if you had been there) you might have seen people lying prostrate, as though they were uprooted trunks of hollowed palm trees.

5331.en: Do you now see any trace of them?

5332.arabic: وَجاءَ فِرعَونُ وَمَن قَبلَهُ وَالمُؤتَفِكـٰتُ بِالخاطِئَةِ
5332.en: Pharaoh and those before him and the people of the overturned habitations all engaged in the same great sin.

5333.arabic: فَعَصَوا رَسولَ رَبِّهِم فَأَخَذَهُم أَخذَةً رابِيَةً
5333.en: They did not follow the Messenger of their Lord, and so He seized them with a severe grip.

5334.arabic: إِنّا لَمّا طَغَا الماءُ حَمَلنـٰكُم فِى الجارِيَةِ
5334.en: Verily when the water rose to great heights, We bore you upon a floating vessel (i.e. the Ark)

5335.arabic: لِنَجعَلَها لَكُم تَذكِرَةً وَتَعِيَها أُذُنٌ وٰعِيَةٌ
5335.en: so that We might make it an instructive event for you, and retentive ears might preserve its memory.

5336.arabic: فَإِذا نُفِخَ فِى الصّورِ نَفخَةٌ وٰحِدَةٌ
5336.en: So when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast

5337.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ الأَرضُ وَالجِبالُ فَدُكَّتا دَكَّةً وٰحِدَةً
5337.en: and the earth and the mountains are carried aloft and are crushed to bits at one stroke,

5338.en: on that Day shall that indubitable event come to pass;

5339.en: when the sky will be rent asunder, the grip holding it together having loosened on that Day,

5340.arabic: وَالمَلَكُ عَلىٰ أَرجائِها وَيَحمِلُ عَرشَ رَبِّكَ فَوقَهُم يَومَئِذٍ ثَمـٰنِيَةٌ
5340.en: and the angels will stand on the sides, with eight of them bearing aloft the Throne of your Lord on that Day.

5341.arabic: يَومَئِذٍ تُعرَضونَ لا تَخفىٰ مِنكُم خافِيَةٌ
5341.en: That will be the Day when you shall be brought forth (before Allah) and no secret of yours shall remain hidden.

5342.arabic: فَأَمّا مَن أوتِىَ كِتـٰبَهُ بِيَمينِهِ فَيَقولُ هاؤُمُ اقرَءوا كِتـٰبِيَه
5342.en: On that Day, he whose Record is given to him in his right hand will say: “Lo! Read my Record!

5343.en: Verily I was sure that I would be handed over my account.”

5344.en: Then he shall find himself in a life of bliss;

5346.en: the clusters of whose fruit will be hanging low to be within reach (of the inmates of Paradise).

5347.arabic: كُلوا وَاشرَبوا هَنيـًٔا بِما أَسلَفتُم فِى الأَيّامِ الخالِيَةِ
5347.en: (They will be told): “Eat and drink with good cheer as a reward for the good deeds you did in the days that have passed by.”

5348.arabic: وَأَمّا مَن أوتِىَ كِتـٰبَهُ بِشِمالِهِ فَيَقولُ يـٰلَيتَنى لَم أوتَ كِتـٰبِيَه
5348.en: As for him whose Record will be given to him in his left hand, he will exclaim: “Would that I had never been given my Record,

5349.en: and had not known my account.

5350.en: Oh! Would that the death that came to me in the world had made an end of me!

5351.en: My riches have not availed me,

5353.en: (A command will be issued): “Seize him and shackle him,

5354.en: then cast him in the Fire,

5355.arabic: ثُمَّ فى سِلسِلَةٍ ذَرعُها سَبعونَ ذِراعًا فَاسلُكوهُ
5355.en: then fasten him with a chain, seventy cubits long.

5356.arabic: إِنَّهُ كانَ لا يُؤمِنُ بِاللَّهِ العَظيمِ
5356.en: He would not believe in Allah, the Most Great;

5357.en: nor would he urge the feeding of the poor.

5358.en: Today he has been left here friendless;

5359.en: and has no food except the filth from the washing of wounds,

5360.en: which only the sinners will eat.”

5361.en: But no; I swear by what you see,

5362.en: and by what you do not see,

5363.en: that this is the speech of an honourable Messenger,

5364.arabic: وَما هُوَ بِقَولِ شاعِرٍ قَليلًا ما تُؤمِنونَ
5364.en: not the speech of a poet. Little do you believe!

5365.arabic: وَلا بِقَولِ كاهِنٍ قَليلًا ما تَذَكَّرونَ
5365.en: Nor is this the speech of a soothsayer. Little do you reflect!

5366.en: It has been revealed by the Lord of the Universe.

5367.en: And if he \[i.e., the Prophets\] had forged this Discourse and thereafter ascribed it to Us,

5368.en: We would surely have seized him by the right hand,

5369.en: and then severed his life vein;

5370.arabic: فَما مِنكُم مِن أَحَدٍ عَنهُ حـٰجِزينَ
5370.en: and not one of you would have been able to withhold Us from doing so.

5371.en: Surely it is a Good Counsel for the God#fearing.

5372.en: We certainly know that some among you will give the lie to it,

5373.en: and surely it will be a cause of regret for the unbelievers.

5374.en: Certainly it is a Truth of absolute certainty.

5375.en: So glorify the name of your Lord Most Great.

5376.en: A beseecher besought the visitation of chastisement,

5377.en: (a chastisement meant) for the unbelievers, one which none can avert;

5378.en: a chastisement from Allah, the Lord of the ascending steps,

5379.arabic: تَعرُجُ المَلـٰئِكَةُ وَالرّوحُ إِلَيهِ فى يَومٍ كانَ مِقدارُهُ خَمسينَ أَلفَ سَنَةٍ
5379.en: by which the angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in one Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.

5380.en: So, (O Prophet), persevere with gracious perseverance.

5381.en: Verily they think that the chastisement is far off,

5382.en: while We think that it is near at hand.

5383.en: It shall befall on a Day whereon the sky will become like molten brass,

5384.en: and the mountains will become like dyed tufts of wool,

5385.en: and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends

5386.arabic: يُبَصَّرونَهُم يَوَدُّ المُجرِمُ لَو يَفتَدى مِن عَذابِ يَومِئِذٍ بِبَنيهِ
5386.en: although they shall be within sight of one another. The guilty one would fain ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his children,

5387.en: and his spouse and his brother,

5388.en: and his kinsfolk who had stood by him,

5389.arabic: وَمَن فِى الأَرضِ جَميعًا ثُمَّ يُنجيهِ
5389.en: and all persons of the earth, if only he could thus save himself.

5390.en: By no means! It will be the fierce flame

5391.en: that will strip off the scalp.

5392.en: It shall insistently summon him who turned his back and retreated,

5393.en: and amassed wealth and covetously hoarded it.

5394.en: Verily man is impatient by nature:

5396.en: and tight#fisted when good fortune visits him,

5398.en: and are constant in their Prayer;

5399.en: and those in whose wealth there is a known right

5400.en: for those that ask and those that are dispossessed,

5401.en: those who firmly believe in the Day of Recompense,

5402.arabic: وَالَّذينَ هُم مِن عَذابِ رَبِّهِم مُشفِقونَ
5402.en: and fear the chastisement of their Lord –

5403.en: surely the chastisement of their Lord is a thing none can feel secure from –

5404.en: and those who guard their private parts,

5405.arabic: إِلّا عَلىٰ أَزوٰجِهِم أَو ما مَلَكَت أَيمـٰنُهُم فَإِنَّهُم غَيرُ مَلومينَ
5405.en: except in regard to their spouses and those whom their right hands possess, for in regard to them they are not reproachable,

5406.arabic: فَمَنِ ابتَغىٰ وَراءَ ذٰلِكَ فَأُولـٰئِكَ هُمُ العادونَ
5406.en: but any who seeks to go beyond that, it is indeed they who are the transgressors,

5407.en: and those who fulfil their trusts and their covenants,

5408.en: and those who are upright in their testimonies;

5409.en: and who take due care of their Prayer:

5410.en: all these shall live honourably in the Gardens.

5411.en: But what is the matter with the unbelievers who are hurrying towards you

5412.en: in crowds, both on the right and on the left?

5413.arabic: أَيَطمَعُ كُلُّ امرِئٍ مِنهُم أَن يُدخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعيمٍ
5413.en: Does everyone of them wish to enter the Garden of Bliss?

5414.en: By no means! They know that which We have created them from.

5415.arabic: فَلا أُقسِمُ بِرَبِّ المَشـٰرِقِ وَالمَغـٰرِبِ إِنّا لَقـٰدِرونَ
5415.en: I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests that We have the power

5416.arabic: عَلىٰ أَن نُبَدِّلَ خَيرًا مِنهُم وَما نَحنُ بِمَسبوقينَ
5416.en: to replace them by others who would be better than they; and We shall certainly not be overpowered.

5417.arabic: فَذَرهُم يَخوضوا وَيَلعَبوا حَتّىٰ يُلـٰقوا يَومَهُمُ الَّذى يوعَدونَ
5417.en: So leave them to engage in vain talk and to amuse themselves until they come face to face with the Day which they are promised,

5418.arabic: يَومَ يَخرُجونَ مِنَ الأَجداثِ سِراعًا كَأَنَّهُم إِلىٰ نُصُبٍ يوفِضونَ
5418.en: the Day on which they will hastily come forth from their graves, as though they were hurrying on to the altars of their deities.

5419.arabic: خـٰشِعَةً أَبصـٰرُهُم تَرهَقُهُم ذِلَّةٌ ذٰلِكَ اليَومُ الَّذى كانوا يوعَدونَ
5419.en: Their eyes will be downcast and disgrace will overwhelm them. Such is the Day that they were promised.

5420.arabic: إِنّا أَرسَلنا نوحًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِ أَن أَنذِر قَومَكَ مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
5420.en: We sent Noah to his people (and directed him): “Warn your people before a grievous chastisement comes upon them.”

5421.arabic: قالَ يـٰقَومِ إِنّى لَكُم نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
5421.en: Noah said: “My people, I have certainly been sent as a clear warner to you,

5422.en: that you serve Allah and fear Him, and follow me;

5423.arabic: يَغفِر لَكُم مِن ذُنوبِكُم وَيُؤَخِّركُم إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى إِنَّ أَجَلَ اللَّهِ إِذا جاءَ لا يُؤَخَّرُ لَو كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
5423.en: He will forgive your sins and will grant you respite until an appointed term. Indeed when Allah's appointed term comes, it cannot be deferred; if you only knew!”

5424.arabic: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّى دَعَوتُ قَومى لَيلًا وَنَهارًا
5424.en: He said: “My Lord, I called my people by night and by day,

5425.en: but the more I called, the farther they fled.

5426.arabic: وَإِنّى كُلَّما دَعَوتُهُم لِتَغفِرَ لَهُم جَعَلوا أَصـٰبِعَهُم فى ءاذانِهِم وَاستَغشَوا ثِيابَهُم وَأَصَرّوا وَاستَكبَرُوا استِكبارًا
5426.en: And every time I called them so that You might forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears and wrapped up their faces with their garments and obstinately clung to their attitude, and waxed very proud.

5428.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنّى أَعلَنتُ لَهُم وَأَسرَرتُ لَهُم إِسرارًا
5428.en: and preached to them in public, and also addressed them in secret.

5429.arabic: فَقُلتُ استَغفِروا رَبَّكُم إِنَّهُ كانَ غَفّارًا
5429.en: I said to them: “Ask forgiveness from your Lord; surely He is Most Forgiving.

5430.en: He will shower upon you torrents from heaven,

5431.arabic: وَيُمدِدكُم بِأَموٰلٍ وَبَنينَ وَيَجعَل لَكُم جَنّـٰتٍ وَيَجعَل لَكُم أَنهـٰرًا
5431.en: and will provide you with wealth and children, and will bestow upon you gardens and rivers.

5432.arabic: ما لَكُم لا تَرجونَ لِلَّهِ وَقارًا
5432.en: What is amiss with you that you do not look forward to the majesty of Allah

5433.en: when He has created you in stages?

5434.arabic: أَلَم تَرَوا كَيفَ خَلَقَ اللَّهُ سَبعَ سَمـٰوٰتٍ طِباقًا
5434.en: Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one upon the other,

5435.arabic: وَجَعَلَ القَمَرَ فيهِنَّ نورًا وَجَعَلَ الشَّمسَ سِراجًا
5435.en: and has placed the moon in them as a light, and the sun as a radiant lamp?

5436.en: And Allah has caused you to grow out of the earth so wondrously,

5437.en: and He will later cause you to return to it and will then again bring you out of it.

5438.en: Allah has made the earth a wide expanse for you

5439.en: so that you may tread its spacious paths.”

5440.arabic: قالَ نوحٌ رَبِّ إِنَّهُم عَصَونى وَاتَّبَعوا مَن لَم يَزِدهُ مالُهُ وَوَلَدُهُ إِلّا خَسارًا
5440.en: Noah said: “My Lord, they did not pay heed to what I said, and followed those (nobles) whose possession of wealth and children has led them to an even greater loss.

5441.en: They contrived a plot of great magnitude.

5442.arabic: وَقالوا لا تَذَرُنَّ ءالِهَتَكُم وَلا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلا سُواعًا وَلا يَغوثَ وَيَعوقَ وَنَسرًا
5442.en: They said: “Do not abandon your deities; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yaghuth, nor Yauq, nor Nasr.

5443.arabic: وَقَد أَضَلّوا كَثيرًا وَلا تَزِدِ الظّـٰلِمينَ إِلّا ضَلـٰلًا
5443.en: They have misled many. So do not enable these evildoers to increase in anything except straying (from the Right Way).”

5444.arabic: مِمّا خَطيـٔـٰتِهِم أُغرِقوا فَأُدخِلوا نارًا فَلَم يَجِدوا لَهُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ أَنصارًا
5444.en: And so they were drowned on account of their sins, and then cast into the Fire, and did not find any other than Allah, to come forth to their help.

5445.arabic: وَقالَ نوحٌ رَبِّ لا تَذَر عَلَى الأَرضِ مِنَ الكـٰفِرينَ دَيّارًا
5445.en: Noah said: “My Lord, do not leave out of these unbelievers even a single dweller on earth,

5446.arabic: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرهُم يُضِلّوا عِبادَكَ وَلا يَلِدوا إِلّا فاجِرًا كَفّارًا
5446.en: for certainly if You should leave them (alive), they will mislead Your servants, and will beget none but sinners and utter unbelievers.

5447.arabic: رَبِّ اغفِر لى وَلِوٰلِدَىَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيتِىَ مُؤمِنًا وَلِلمُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِنـٰتِ وَلا تَزِدِ الظّـٰلِمينَ إِلّا تَبارًا
5447.en: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and forgive all believers, both men and women, and do not increase the wrong#doers in anything except perdition.”

5448.arabic: قُل أوحِىَ إِلَىَّ أَنَّهُ استَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِنَ الجِنِّ فَقالوا إِنّا سَمِعنا قُرءانًا عَجَبًا
5448.en: Say, (O Prophet), it was revealed to me that a band of jinn attentively listened to (the recitation of the Qur'an) and then (went back to their people) and said:

5449.arabic: يَهدى إِلَى الرُّشدِ فَـٔامَنّا بِهِ وَلَن نُشرِكَ بِرَبِّنا أَحَدًا
5449.en: “We have indeed heard a wonderful Qur'an which guides to the Right Way; so we have come to believe in it, and we will not associate aught with Our Lord in His Divinity”;

5450.arabic: وَأَنَّهُ تَعـٰلىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنا مَا اتَّخَذَ صـٰحِبَةً وَلا وَلَدًا
5450.en: and that “He – exalted be His Majesty – has not taken to Himself either a wife or a son”;

5451.arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كانَ يَقولُ سَفيهُنا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا
5451.en: and that “the foolish among us have been wont to say outrageous things about Allah”;

5452.arabic: وَأَنّا ظَنَنّا أَن لَن تَقولَ الإِنسُ وَالجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
5452.en: and that “we had thought that men and jinn would never speak a lie about Allah”,

5453.arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كانَ رِجالٌ مِنَ الإِنسِ يَعوذونَ بِرِجالٍ مِنَ الجِنِّ فَزادوهُم رَهَقًا
5453.en: and that “some from among the humans used to seek protection of some among the jinn, and thus they increased the arrogance of the jinn”;

5454.arabic: وَأَنَّهُم ظَنّوا كَما ظَنَنتُم أَن لَن يَبعَثَ اللَّهُ أَحَدًا
5454.en: and that “they thought, even as you thought, that Allah would never raise anyone (as a Messenger)”;

5455.arabic: وَأَنّا لَمَسنَا السَّماءَ فَوَجَدنـٰها مُلِئَت حَرَسًا شَديدًا وَشُهُبًا
5455.en: and that “we tried to pry (the secrets of) the heaven, but we found it full of terrible guards and shooting meteors”;

5456.arabic: وَأَنّا كُنّا نَقعُدُ مِنها مَقـٰعِدَ لِلسَّمعِ فَمَن يَستَمِعِ الـٔانَ يَجِد لَهُ شِهابًا رَصَدًا
5456.en: and that “we would take up stations in the heaven to try to hear but anyone who now attempts to listen finds a shooting meteor in wait for him”;

5457.arabic: وَأَنّا لا نَدرى أَشَرٌّ أُريدَ بِمَن فِى الأَرضِ أَم أَرادَ بِهِم رَبُّهُم رَشَدًا
5457.en: and that “we do not know whether evil is intended for those on the earth, or whether their Lord intends to direct them to the Right Way”;

5458.arabic: وَأَنّا مِنَّا الصّـٰلِحونَ وَمِنّا دونَ ذٰلِكَ كُنّا طَرائِقَ قِدَدًا
5458.en: and that “some of us are upright and some of us are otherwise for we follow widely divergent paths”;

5459.arabic: وَأَنّا ظَنَنّا أَن لَن نُعجِزَ اللَّهَ فِى الأَرضِ وَلَن نُعجِزَهُ هَرَبًا
5459.en: and that “we thought that we will neither be able to frustrate Allah on earth, nor frustrate Him by flight”;

5460.arabic: وَأَنّا لَمّا سَمِعنَا الهُدىٰ ءامَنّا بِهِ فَمَن يُؤمِن بِرَبِّهِ فَلا يَخافُ بَخسًا وَلا رَهَقًا
5460.en: and that “when we heard the teaching of the Right Way we came to believe in it; he who believes in His Lord shall have no fear of suffering loss or being subjected to any injustice”;

5461.arabic: وَأَنّا مِنَّا المُسلِمونَ وَمِنَّا القـٰسِطونَ فَمَن أَسلَمَ فَأُولـٰئِكَ تَحَرَّوا رَشَدًا
5461.en: and that “among us some are Muslims (Those who have submitted to Allah), and some of us are deviant. So those who became Muslims found the Right Course;

5462.en: but those who deviated from the Truth, will be the fuel for Hell.”

5463.arabic: وَأَلَّوِ استَقـٰموا عَلَى الطَّريقَةِ لَأَسقَينـٰهُم ماءً غَدَقًا
5463.en: If people were to keep firmly to the Right Way, We would have vouchsafed them abundant rain

5464.arabic: لِنَفتِنَهُم فيهِ وَمَن يُعرِض عَن ذِكرِ رَبِّهِ يَسلُكهُ عَذابًا صَعَدًا
5464.en: so that We might try them through this bounty. Whoso turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to suffer a grievous chastisement;

5465.arabic: وَأَنَّ المَسـٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلا تَدعوا مَعَ اللَّهِ أَحَدًا
5465.en: and that “mosques belong to Allah, so do not invoke anyone with Him”;

5466.arabic: وَأَنَّهُ لَمّا قامَ عَبدُ اللَّهِ يَدعوهُ كادوا يَكونونَ عَلَيهِ لِبَدًا
5466.en: and when Allah's servant stood up to call on Him, they well#nigh swarmed him.

5467.arabic: قُل إِنَّما أَدعوا رَبّى وَلا أُشرِكُ بِهِ أَحَدًا
5467.en: Say, (O Prophet): “I call on my Lord alone, and I do not associate aught with Him in His Divinity.”

5468.arabic: قُل إِنّى لا أَملِكُ لَكُم ضَرًّا وَلا رَشَدًا
5468.en: Say: “Surely neither it is in my power to hurt you nor to bring you to the Right Way.”

5469.arabic: قُل إِنّى لَن يُجيرَنى مِنَ اللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَن أَجِدَ مِن دونِهِ مُلتَحَدًا
5469.en: Say: “None can protect me from Allah, nor can I find a refuge apart from Him.

5470.arabic: إِلّا بَلـٰغًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِسـٰلـٰتِهِ وَمَن يَعصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ فَإِنَّ لَهُ نارَ جَهَنَّمَ خـٰلِدينَ فيها أَبَدًا
5470.en: (My task is no more than) to deliver Allah's proclamation and His messages. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, surely the Fire of Hell awaits him; therein he will abide in perpetuity.”

5471.arabic: حَتّىٰ إِذا رَأَوا ما يوعَدونَ فَسَيَعلَمونَ مَن أَضعَفُ ناصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
5471.en: (They shall not change their ways) until they see that against which they had been warned, and then they will know whose helpers are weaker and whose supporters are fewer in number.

5472.arabic: قُل إِن أَدرى أَقَريبٌ ما توعَدونَ أَم يَجعَلُ لَهُ رَبّى أَمَدًا
5472.en: Say: “I know not whether what you are promised is near or whether my Lord will prolong its term.

5473.arabic: عـٰلِمُ الغَيبِ فَلا يُظهِرُ عَلىٰ غَيبِهِ أَحَدًا
5473.en: He is the Knower of the Unseen, and He does not disclose His Unseen to anyone

5474.arabic: إِلّا مَنِ ارتَضىٰ مِن رَسولٍ فَإِنَّهُ يَسلُكُ مِن بَينِ يَدَيهِ وَمِن خَلفِهِ رَصَدًا
5474.en: other than to a Messenger whom He chooses (for the bestowal of any part of the knowledge of the Unseen), whereafter He appoints guards who go before him and behind him,

5475.arabic: لِيَعلَمَ أَن قَد أَبلَغوا رِسـٰلـٰتِ رَبِّهِم وَأَحاطَ بِما لَدَيهِم وَأَحصىٰ كُلَّ شَىءٍ عَدَدًا
5475.en: so that He may know that they have delivered the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge their surroundings and keeps a count of all things.”

5477.en: Stand up in Prayer by night, all but a small part of it;

5478.en: half of it, or reduce it a little;

5479.arabic: أَو زِد عَلَيهِ وَرَتِّلِ القُرءانَ تَرتيلًا
5479.en: or add to it a little; and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.

5480.en: Behold, We shall cast upon you a Weighty Word.

5481.arabic: إِنَّ ناشِئَةَ الَّيلِ هِىَ أَشَدُّ وَطـًٔا وَأَقوَمُ قيلًا
5481.en: Surely getting up at night is the best means of subduing the self and is more suitable for uprightness in speech.

5482.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِى النَّهارِ سَبحًا طَويلًا
5482.en: You are indeed much occupied during the day with the affairs of the world.

5483.arabic: وَاذكُرِ اسمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّل إِلَيهِ تَبتيلًا
5483.en: So remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with exclusive devotion.

5484.arabic: رَبُّ المَشرِقِ وَالمَغرِبِ لا إِلـٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ فَاتَّخِذهُ وَكيلًا
5484.en: He is the Lord of the East and the West; there is no god but He. So take Him alone for your Guardian,

5485.arabic: وَاصبِر عَلىٰ ما يَقولونَ وَاهجُرهُم هَجرًا جَميلًا
5485.en: And bear patiently the vain things they utter, and gracefully forsake them.

5486.arabic: وَذَرنى وَالمُكَذِّبينَ أُولِى النَّعمَةِ وَمَهِّلهُم قَليلًا
5486.en: Leave it to Me to deal with the affluent ones who give the lie (to the Truth), and bear with them for a while.

5487.en: We have heavy fetters and a blazing Fire in store for them;

5488.en: and a food that chokes, and a grievous chastisement.

5489.arabic: يَومَ تَرجُفُ الأَرضُ وَالجِبالُ وَكانَتِ الجِبالُ كَثيبًا مَهيلًا
5489.en: (They will come across all this) on the Day when the earth and the mountains shall tremble violently and the mountains shall crumble into heaps of scattered sand.

5490.arabic: إِنّا أَرسَلنا إِلَيكُم رَسولًا شـٰهِدًا عَلَيكُم كَما أَرسَلنا إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ رَسولًا
5490.en: Surely We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness over you, just as We had sent a Messenger to Pharaoh.

5491.arabic: فَعَصىٰ فِرعَونُ الرَّسولَ فَأَخَذنـٰهُ أَخذًا وَبيلًا
5491.en: But Pharaoh disobeyed Our Messenger, so We seized him with a terrible seizing.

5492.arabic: فَكَيفَ تَتَّقونَ إِن كَفَرتُم يَومًا يَجعَلُ الوِلدٰنَ شيبًا
5492.en: If you persist in disbelieving, how will you guard yourself against the (woe of the) Day that will turn children grey#haired,

5493.arabic: السَّماءُ مُنفَطِرٌ بِهِ كانَ وَعدُهُ مَفعولًا
5493.en: the Day whose severity shall cause the heaven to split asunder? Allah's promise is ever bound to be fulfilled.

5494.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰذِهِ تَذكِرَةٌ فَمَن شاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبيلًا
5494.en: Indeed this is nothing but a Good Counsel; so let him who will take a way leading to his Lord.

5495.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقومُ أَدنىٰ مِن ثُلُثَىِ الَّيلِ وَنِصفَهُ وَثُلُثَهُ وَطائِفَةٌ مِنَ الَّذينَ مَعَكَ وَاللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ الَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ عَلِمَ أَن لَن تُحصوهُ فَتابَ عَلَيكُم فَاقرَءوا ما تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ القُرءانِ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكونُ مِنكُم مَرضىٰ وَءاخَرونَ يَضرِبونَ فِى الأَرضِ يَبتَغونَ مِن فَضلِ اللَّهِ وَءاخَرونَ يُقـٰتِلونَ فى سَبيلِ اللَّهِ فَاقرَءوا ما تَيَسَّرَ مِنهُ وَأَقيمُوا الصَّلوٰةَ وَءاتُوا الزَّكوٰةَ وَأَقرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرضًا حَسَنًا وَما تُقَدِّموا لِأَنفُسِكُم مِن خَيرٍ تَجِدوهُ عِندَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيرًا وَأَعظَمَ أَجرًا وَاستَغفِرُوا اللَّهَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
5495.en: (O Prophet), your Lord knows that you sometimes stand up in Prayer nearly two#thirds of the night, and sometimes half or one#third of it, and so does a party of those with you; Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He has shown mercy to you. So now recite as much of the Qur'an as you can. He knows that there are among you those who are sick and others who are journeying in the land in quest of Allah's bounty, and still others who are fighting in the cause of Allah. So recite as much of the Qur'an as you easily can, and establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and give Allah a goodly loan. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you shall find it with Allah. That is better and its reward is greater. And ask for Allah's forgiveness; surely He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

5496.en: O you enveloped in your cloak!

5498.en: and magnify the glory of your Lord,

5501.en: and bestow not favour in order to seek from others a greater return,

5502.en: and persevere for your Lord's sake.

5503.en: When the Trumpet shall be sounded,

5504.en: that will surely be a hard day,

5505.en: not an easy day for the unbelievers.

5506.en: Leave Me with him whom I alone have created,

5507.en: whom I have endowed with abundant riches,

5508.en: and sons ever present with him,

5509.en: and for whom I have smoothed the way (to power and riches),

5510.en: and who still greedily desires that I should bestow upon him more.

5511.en: By no means; he is stubbornly opposed to Our Signs.

5512.en: I shall soon constrain him to a hard ascent.

5513.en: He reflected and then hatched a scheme.

5514.en: Ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?

5515.en: Again, ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?

5518.en: then he retreated and waxed proud,

5519.arabic: فَقالَ إِن هـٰذا إِلّا سِحرٌ يُؤثَرُ
5519.en: and said: “This (Qur'an) is merely a sorcery of yore;

5520.en: this is nothing but the word of a mere mortal!”

5521.en: Him shall I soon roast in Hell.

5522.en: And what do you know what Hell is?

5523.en: It spares nothing; it leaves nothing intact;

5526.arabic: وَما جَعَلنا أَصحـٰبَ النّارِ إِلّا مَلـٰئِكَةً وَما جَعَلنا عِدَّتَهُم إِلّا فِتنَةً لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا لِيَستَيقِنَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتـٰبَ وَيَزدادَ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا إيمـٰنًا وَلا يَرتابَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتـٰبَ وَالمُؤمِنونَ وَلِيَقولَ الَّذينَ فى قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ وَالكـٰفِرونَ ماذا أَرادَ اللَّهُ بِهـٰذا مَثَلًا كَذٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدى مَن يَشاءُ وَما يَعلَمُ جُنودَ رَبِّكَ إِلّا هُوَ وَما هِىَ إِلّا ذِكرىٰ لِلبَشَرِ
5526.en: We have appointed none but angels as the keepers of the Fire, and We have not made their number but as a trial for the unbelievers so that those who have been endowed with the Book will be convinced and the believers' faith will increase, and neither those who have been endowed with the Book nor the believers will fall into any doubt. As for those in whose hearts there is a sickness as well as the unbelievers, they will say: “What did Allah aim at by this strange parable?” Thus does Allah let whomsoever He pleases to go astray, and directs whomsoever He pleases to the Right Way. And none knows the hosts of your Lord but He. (And Hell has only been mentioned here) that people may take heed.

5528.en: and by the night when it recedes,

5529.en: and by the day when it dawns (with its radiance),

5530.en: surely (Hell) is one of the greatest Signs,

5532.arabic: لِمَن شاءَ مِنكُم أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَو يَتَأَخَّرَ
5532.en: a warning to everyone of you whether he would like to come forward or lag behind.

5533.en: Each one is a hostage to one's deeds,

5534.en: save the People of the Right Hand

5535.en: who shall be in the Gardens, and shall ask

5538.en: They will answer: “We were not among those who observed Prayer,

5539.en: and we did not feed the poor,

5540.en: and we indulged in vain talk with those who indulged in vain talk,

5541.en: and we gave the lie to the Day of Judgement

5542.en: until the inevitable event overtook us.”

5543.en: The intercession of the intercessors shall then be of no avail to them.

5544.en: What is the matter with people that they are turning away from this Exhortation,

5545.en: as though they were frightened wild asses,

5547.arabic: بَل يُريدُ كُلُّ امرِئٍ مِنهُم أَن يُؤتىٰ صُحُفًا مُنَشَّرَةً
5547.en: No indeed; each one of them desires that open letters be sent to each of them.

5548.en: No indeed; the truth is that they have no fear of the Hereafter.

5550.en: So, whoever wills may benefit from it.

5551.arabic: وَما يَذكُرونَ إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ هُوَ أَهلُ التَّقوىٰ وَأَهلُ المَغفِرَةِ
5551.en: But they will not benefit from it unless Allah Himself so wills. He is worthy to be feared; and He is worthy to forgive (those that fear Him).

5552.en: Nay, I swear by the Day of Resurrection;

5553.en: and nay, I swear by the self#reproaching soul!

5554.en: Does man imagine that We will not be able to bring his bones together again?

5555.arabic: بَلىٰ قـٰدِرينَ عَلىٰ أَن نُسَوِّىَ بَنانَهُ
5555.en: Yes indeed; We have the power to remould even his finger#tips.

5556.en: But man desires to persist in his evil ways.

5557.en: He asks: “When will the Day of Resurrection be?”

5560.en: and the sun and the moon are joined together,

5561.en: on that Day will man say: “Whither the refuge?”

5563.en: With your Lord alone will be the retreat that Day.

5564.arabic: يُنَبَّؤُا۟ الإِنسـٰنُ يَومَئِذٍ بِما قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
5564.en: On that Day will man be apprised of his deeds, both the earlier and the later.

5565.en: But lo, man is well aware of himself,

5566.en: even though he might make up excuses.

5567.arabic: لا تُحَرِّك بِهِ لِسانَكَ لِتَعجَلَ بِهِ
5567.en: (O Prophet), do not stir your tongue hastily (to commit the Revelation to memory).

5568.en: Surely it is for Us to have you commit it to memory and to recite it.

5569.en: And so when We recite it, follow its recitation attentively;

5570.en: then it will be for Us to explain it.

5571.en: Nay; the truth is that you love ardently (the good of this world) that can be obtained hastily,

5572.en: and are oblivious of the Hereafter.

5573.en: Some faces on that Day will be fresh and resplendent,

5574.en: and will be looking towards their Lord;

5575.en: and some faces on that Day will be gloomy,

5576.en: believing that a crushing calamity is about to strike them.

5577.en: Nay; when a man's soul reaches up to the throat,

5578.en: and it is said: “Is there any enchanter who can step forward and help (by his chanting)?”

5579.en: and he realises that the hour of parting is come,

5580.en: and calf is inter#twined with calf.

5581.en: On that Day you will be driven to your Lord.

5582.en: But he did not verify the Truth, nor did he observe Prayer;

5583.en: on the contrary, he gave the lie to the Truth and turned his back upon it,

5584.en: then he went back to his kinsfolk, elated with pride.

5585.en: This (attitude) is worthy of you, altogether worthy;

5586.en: again, it is worthy of you, altogether worthy.

5587.en: Does man think that he will be left alone, unquestioned?

5588.arabic: أَلَم يَكُ نُطفَةً مِن مَنِىٍّ يُمنىٰ
5588.en: Was he not a drop of ejaculated semen,

5589.en: then he became a clot, and then Allah made it into a living body and proportioned its parts,

5590.en: and then He made of him a pair, male and female?

5591.arabic: أَلَيسَ ذٰلِكَ بِقـٰدِرٍ عَلىٰ أَن يُحـِۧىَ المَوتىٰ
5591.en: Does He, then, not have the power to bring back the dead to life?

5592.arabic: هَل أَتىٰ عَلَى الإِنسـٰنِ حينٌ مِنَ الدَّهرِ لَم يَكُن شَيـًٔا مَذكورًا
5592.en: Was there a period of time when man was not even worthy of a mention?

5593.arabic: إِنّا خَلَقنَا الإِنسـٰنَ مِن نُطفَةٍ أَمشاجٍ نَبتَليهِ فَجَعَلنـٰهُ سَميعًا بَصيرًا
5593.en: Verily We created man out of a drop of intermingled sperm so that We might try him, and We therefore endowed him with hearing and sight.

5594.arabic: إِنّا هَدَينـٰهُ السَّبيلَ إِمّا شاكِرًا وَإِمّا كَفورًا
5594.en: Surely We showed him the Right Path, regardless of whether he chooses to be thankful or unthankful (to his Lord).

5595.arabic: إِنّا أَعتَدنا لِلكـٰفِرينَ سَلـٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغلـٰلًا وَسَعيرًا
5595.en: For the unbelievers, We have kept ready chains and fetters and a Blazing Fire.

5596.arabic: إِنَّ الأَبرارَ يَشرَبونَ مِن كَأسٍ كانَ مِزاجُها كافورًا
5596.en: The virtuous shall drink from a cup tempered with camphor water.

5597.arabic: عَينًا يَشرَبُ بِها عِبادُ اللَّهِ يُفَجِّرونَها تَفجيرًا
5597.en: This will be a gushing spring wherefrom Allah's servants shall drink wine, a spring from which they will take out channels wherever they wish.

5598.arabic: يوفونَ بِالنَّذرِ وَيَخافونَ يَومًا كانَ شَرُّهُ مُستَطيرًا
5598.en: These will be the ones who fulfil their vows and dread the Day whose woe shall be spread far and wide;

5599.arabic: وَيُطعِمونَ الطَّعامَ عَلىٰ حُبِّهِ مِسكينًا وَيَتيمًا وَأَسيرًا
5599.en: those who, for the love of Him, feed the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,

5600.arabic: إِنَّما نُطعِمُكُم لِوَجهِ اللَّهِ لا نُريدُ مِنكُم جَزاءً وَلا شُكورًا
5600.en: (saying): “We feed you only for Allah's sake; we do not seek of you any recompense or thanks,

5601.arabic: إِنّا نَخافُ مِن رَبِّنا يَومًا عَبوسًا قَمطَريرًا
5601.en: we fear from our Lord a Day that shall be long and distressful.”

5602.arabic: فَوَقىٰهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذٰلِكَ اليَومِ وَلَقّىٰهُم نَضرَةً وَسُرورًا
5602.en: So Allah shall guard them against the woe of that Day, and will procure them freshness and joy,

5603.en: and will reward them for their steadfastness with Paradise and robes of silk.

5604.arabic: مُتَّكِـٔينَ فيها عَلَى الأَرائِكِ لا يَرَونَ فيها شَمسًا وَلا زَمهَريرًا
5604.en: There they will recline on elevated couches and will be subjected neither to the burning heat of the sun nor to bitter cold.

5605.arabic: وَدانِيَةً عَلَيهِم ظِلـٰلُها وَذُلِّلَت قُطوفُها تَذليلًا
5605.en: The shades of Paradise will bend over them, and its fruits will be brought within their easy reach;

5606.arabic: وَيُطافُ عَلَيهِم بِـٔانِيَةٍ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكوابٍ كانَت قَواريرا۠
5606.en: and there shall be passed around them vessels of silver and goblets of crystal,

5607.en: goblets bright as crystal but made of silver, filled to exact measure.

5608.arabic: وَيُسقَونَ فيها كَأسًا كانَ مِزاجُها زَنجَبيلًا
5608.en: Therein they shall be served a cup flavoured with ginger,

5609.en: drawn from a spring (in Paradise) called Salsabil.

5610.arabic: وَيَطوفُ عَلَيهِم وِلدٰنٌ مُخَلَّدونَ إِذا رَأَيتَهُم حَسِبتَهُم لُؤلُؤًا مَنثورًا
5610.en: There boys of everlasting youth shall go about attending them: when you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.

5611.arabic: وَإِذا رَأَيتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيتَ نَعيمًا وَمُلكًا كَبيرًا
5611.en: Whitherto you look around, you will see an abundance of bliss and the glories of a great kingdom.

5612.arabic: عـٰلِيَهُم ثِيابُ سُندُسٍ خُضرٌ وَإِستَبرَقٌ وَحُلّوا أَساوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَسَقىٰهُم رَبُّهُم شَرابًا طَهورًا
5612.en: They \[i.e., the virtuous\] shall be attired in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade and will be adorned with bracelets of silver. Their Lord will give them a pure wine to drink.

5613.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰذا كانَ لَكُم جَزاءً وَكانَ سَعيُكُم مَشكورًا
5613.en: Behold, this is your recompense and your endeavour has been appreciated.

5614.arabic: إِنّا نَحنُ نَزَّلنا عَلَيكَ القُرءانَ تَنزيلًا
5614.en: (O Prophet), indeed We have revealed the Qur'an to you in portions.

5615.arabic: فَاصبِر لِحُكمِ رَبِّكَ وَلا تُطِع مِنهُم ءاثِمًا أَو كَفورًا
5615.en: So persevere with the command of your Lord and do not pay any heed to the wicked and the unbelieving,

5616.en: and remember the name of your Lord, morning and evening;

5617.arabic: وَمِنَ الَّيلِ فَاسجُد لَهُ وَسَبِّحهُ لَيلًا طَويلًا
5617.en: and prostrate yourself before Him at night, and extol His Glory during the long watches of the night.

5618.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰؤُلاءِ يُحِبّونَ العاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرونَ وَراءَهُم يَومًا ثَقيلًا
5618.en: Verily they love (the good of this world) that is hastily obtainable and are oblivious of the burdensome Day ahead of them.

5619.arabic: نَحنُ خَلَقنـٰهُم وَشَدَدنا أَسرَهُم وَإِذا شِئنا بَدَّلنا أَمثـٰلَهُم تَبديلًا
5619.en: We created them and strengthened their joints; and whenever We wish, We can change their faces entirely.

5620.arabic: إِنَّ هـٰذِهِ تَذكِرَةٌ فَمَن شاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبيلًا
5620.en: Verily this is an Exhortation; so let him who so will take a way to his Lord.

5621.arabic: وَما تَشاءونَ إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ عَليمًا حَكيمًا
5621.en: But your willing shall be of no avail until Allah Himself so wills. Surely Allah is All#Knowing, Most Wise.

5622.arabic: يُدخِلُ مَن يَشاءُ فى رَحمَتِهِ وَالظّـٰلِمينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُم عَذابًا أَليمًا
5622.en: He admits to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. As for the wrong#doers, He has prepared for them a grievous chastisement.

5623.en: By the (winds) sent forth in quick succession,

5625.en: and raise (clouds) and scatter them around,

5627.en: and then cast (Allah's) remembrance (in people's hearts),

5628.en: to serve as an excuse or a warning.

5629.en: Surely what you are promised shall come to pass.

5630.en: So when the stars are extinguished,

5631.en: and the sky is rent asunder,

5632.en: and the mountains are blown away,

5633.en: and the appointed time to bring the Messengers together arrives, (then shall the promised event come to pass).

5634.en: To which Day has this task been deferred?

5636.en: What do you know what the Day of Judgement is?

5637.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5638.en: Did We not destroy many a nation of the earlier times?

5639.en: And We shall cause those of later times to follow them.

5640.en: Thus do We deal with the guilty.

5641.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5642.en: Did We not create you of a mean fluid,

5643.en: which We then placed in a secure repository

5645.en: See that We had the power to do so. Great indeed is Our power to do what We will.

5646.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5647.en: Did We not make the earth a receptacle,

5648.en: for the living and the dead,

5649.arabic: وَجَعَلنا فيها رَوٰسِىَ شـٰمِخـٰتٍ وَأَسقَينـٰكُم ماءً فُراتًا
5649.en: and did We not firmly fix towering mountains on it and give you sweet water to drink?

5650.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5651.arabic: انطَلِقوا إِلىٰ ما كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبونَ
5651.en: Proceed now towards that which you were wont to deny as false;

5652.arabic: انطَلِقوا إِلىٰ ظِلٍّ ذى ثَلـٰثِ شُعَبٍ

5653.arabic: لا ظَليلٍ وَلا يُغنى مِنَ اللَّهَبِ
5653.en: which neither provides (cooling) shade nor protection against the flames;

5654.en: it indeed throws up sparks like castles,

5655.en: which seem as though they are yellow#coloured camels.

5656.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5657.en: That will be the Day on which they will not (be able to) utter a word,

5658.en: nor will they be allowed to proffer excuses.

5659.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5660.en: That is the Day of Judgement on which We have assembled you as well as all those who went before you.

5661.en: So if you have any ploy, try it against Me!

5662.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5663.en: Behold, today the God#fearing will be amidst shades and springs,

5664.en: and the fruits that they desire (will be ready at hand).

5665.arabic: كُلوا وَاشرَبوا هَنيـًٔا بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
5665.en: Eat and drink and may every joy attend you as a reward for your deeds.

5666.en: Thus do We reward those that do good.

5667.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5668.en: Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while. Surely you are evil#doers.

5669.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5670.arabic: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُمُ اركَعوا لا يَركَعونَ
5670.en: When it is said to them: “Bow down (before Allah),” they do not bow down.

5671.en: Woe on that Day to those that give the lie to the Truth!

5672.en: In what discourse after this (Qur'an) will they, then, believe?

5673.en: About what are they asking one another?

5674.en: Is it about the awesome tiding

5675.en: that they are in utter disagreement?

5676.en: No indeed; soon will they come to know;

5677.en: again, no indeed; soon will they come to know.

5678.en: Have We not spread the earth like a bed,

5679.en: and fixed the mountains like pegs,

5680.en: and created you in pairs (as men and women),

5681.en: and made your sleep a means of repose,

5682.en: and made the night a covering,

5683.en: and made the day to seek livelihood,

5684.en: and built above you seven strong firmaments,

5685.en: and placed therein a hot, shining lamp,

5686.en: and sent down abundant water from the clouds

5687.en: so that We may thereby bring forth grain and vegetation,

5689.en: Surely the Day of Judgement has an appointed time;

5690.arabic: يَومَ يُنفَخُ فِى الصّورِ فَتَأتونَ أَفواجًا
5690.en: the Day when the Trumpet shall be blown, and you will come forth in multitudes;

5691.en: and when the sky shall be opened up and will become all doors;

5692.en: and the mountains will be set in motion and become a mirage.

5693.en: Surely the Hell is an ambush,

5695.en: therein they shall abide for ages,

5696.arabic: لا يَذوقونَ فيها بَردًا وَلا شَرابًا
5696.en: they shall taste in it no coolness, nor any pleasant drink

5697.en: save boiling water and wash of the wounds;

5698.en: a befitting recompense for their deeds.

5699.en: For indeed they did not look forward to any reckoning,

5700.en: and roundly denied Our Signs as false.

5701.en: And everything have We recorded in a Book.

5702.en: So taste (the fruit of your deeds). We shall only increase your torment.

5703.en: Surely the state of triumph awaits the God#fearing:

5705.en: and youthful maidens of like age,

5707.arabic: لا يَسمَعونَ فيها لَغوًا وَلا كِذّٰبًا
5707.en: Therein they shall hear no idle talk, nor any falsehood;

5708.en: a recompense from your Lord and an ample reward

5709.arabic: رَبِّ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُمَا الرَّحمـٰنِ لا يَملِكونَ مِنهُ خِطابًا
5709.en: from the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of that which is between them; the Most Merciful Lord before Whom none dare utter a word.

5710.arabic: يَومَ يَقومُ الرّوحُ وَالمَلـٰئِكَةُ صَفًّا لا يَتَكَلَّمونَ إِلّا مَن أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحمـٰنُ وَقالَ صَوابًا
5710.en: The Day when the Spirit and the angels are ranged row on row. None shall speak save he whom the Merciful Lord will permit; and he too will speak what is right.

5711.arabic: ذٰلِكَ اليَومُ الحَقُّ فَمَن شاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ مَـٔابًا
5711.en: That Day is sure to come. So let him who will seek a resort with his Lord.

5712.arabic: إِنّا أَنذَرنـٰكُم عَذابًا قَريبًا يَومَ يَنظُرُ المَرءُ ما قَدَّمَت يَداهُ وَيَقولُ الكافِرُ يـٰلَيتَنى كُنتُ تُرٰبًا
5712.en: Lo! We warn you of a chastisement near at hand; the Day when a man will look on what his own hands have sent forth, and the unbelievers shall say: “Oh would that I were utter dust.”

5713.en: By those (angels) that pluck out the soul from depths,

5715.en: and by those that speedily glide along (the cosmos),

5716.en: and vie with the others (in carrying out their Lord's behests);

5717.en: and then manage the affairs of the Universe (according to their Lord's commands).

5718.en: The Day when the quaking will cause a violent convulsion,

5719.en: and will be followed by another quaking.

5720.en: On that Day some hearts shall tremble (with fright),

5721.en: and their eyes shall be downcast with dread.

5722.en: They say: “Shall we indeed be restored to life,

5723.en: even after we have been reduced to bones, hollow and rotten?”

5724.en: They say: “That will then be a return with a great loss!”

5725.en: Surely they will need no more than a single stern blast,

5726.en: and lo, they will all be in the open plain.

5728.arabic: إِذ نادىٰهُ رَبُّهُ بِالوادِ المُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
5728.en: When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,

5729.en: and directed him: “Go to Pharaoh, he has rebelled,

5730.arabic: فَقُل هَل لَكَ إِلىٰ أَن تَزَكّىٰ
5730.en: and say to him: 'Are you willing to be purified,

5731.en: that I may direct you to your Lord and then you hold Him in awe?'”

5732.en: Then Moses (went to Pharaoh and) showed him the Great Sign;

5733.en: but he denied it as false and disobeyed,

5734.en: and then he turned back to have recourse to his craftiness,

5735.en: and gathered his people and declared:

5736.en: “I am the supreme lord of you all.”

5737.en: Thereupon Allah seized him for the chastisement of the World to Come as well as of the present.

5738.arabic: إِنَّ فى ذٰلِكَ لَعِبرَةً لِمَن يَخشىٰ
5738.en: Surely there is a great lesson in it for whoever would fear (Allah).

5739.arabic: ءَأَنتُم أَشَدُّ خَلقًا أَمِ السَّماءُ بَنىٰها
5739.en: Is it harder to create you or the heaven? But Allah built it,

5740.en: and raised its vault high and proportioned it;

5741.en: and covered its night with darkness and brought forth from it its day;

5742.en: and thereafter spread out the earth,

5743.en: and brought out of it its water and its pasture,

5744.en: and firmly fixed in it mountains;

5745.en: all this as provision for you and your cattle.

5746.en: But when the great calamity will come about

5747.en: on the Day when man will recall all his strivings,

5748.en: and Hell will be brought in sight for anyone to see:

5750.en: and preferred the life of this world,

5751.en: most surely his abode shall be Hell.

5752.arabic: وَأَمّا مَن خافَ مَقامَ رَبِّهِ وَنَهَى النَّفسَ عَنِ الهَوىٰ
5752.en: But he who feared to stand before his Lord, and restrained himself from evil desires,

5753.en: most surely his abode shall be Paradise.

5754.en: They ask you about the Hour: “When will it be?”

5755.en: What concern do you have to speak about that?

5756.en: Its knowledge rests with your Lord.

5757.en: You are only a warner to him who has a fear of it.

5758.arabic: كَأَنَّهُم يَومَ يَرَونَها لَم يَلبَثوا إِلّا عَشِيَّةً أَو ضُحىٰها
5758.en: On the Day they see it, they will feel as though they had stayed (in the grave) no more than one evening or one morning.

5760.en: that the blind man came to him.

5761.en: How could you know? Perhaps he would cleanse himself,

5762.en: or he might be mindful and good counsel might avail him.

5765.en: though you are not to blame if he would not cleanse himself.

5766.en: But he who comes to you running,

5768.en: you pay no heed to him.

5769.en: No indeed; this is only a Reminder.

5770.en: So whoso wills may give heed to it.

5771.en: It is contained in scrolls highly honoured,

5773.en: borne by the hands of scribes,

5775.en: Accursed be man! How stubbornly he denies the Truth.

5776.en: Out of what did Allah create him?

5777.en: Out of a sperm#drop did He create him and then determined a measure for him,

5778.en: and then made the course of life easy for him,

5779.en: then He caused him to die and brought him to the grave,

5780.en: and then, whenever He wishes, He will raise him back to life.

5781.en: Nay, but man did not fulfil what Allah had enjoined upon him.

5782.en: So let man just consider his food:

5783.en: We poured water, pouring it in great abundance,

5784.en: and cleaved the earth, cleaving it asunder;

5785.en: then caused the grain to grow out of it,

5790.en: all this as a provision for you and your cattle.

5791.en: But when the deafening cry shall be sounded

5792.en: on the Day when each man shall flee from his brother,

5793.en: and his mother and his father;

5794.en: and his consort and his children;

5795.arabic: لِكُلِّ امرِئٍ مِنهُم يَومَئِذٍ شَأنٌ يُغنيهِ
5795.en: on that Day each will be occupied with his own business, making him oblivious of all save himself.

5796.en: Some faces on that Day shall be beaming with happiness,

5798.en: Some faces on that Day shall be dust#ridden,

5800.en: These will be the unbelievers, the wicked.

5801.en: When the sun shall be folded up,

5802.en: when the stars shall scatter away,

5803.en: when the mountains shall be set in motion,

5804.en: when the ten#months pregnant camels shall be abandoned,

5805.en: when the savage beasts shall be brought together,

5806.en: when the seas shall be set boiling,

5807.en: when the souls shall be rejoined (with their bodies),

5808.en: and when the girl#child buried alive shall be asked:

5809.en: for what offence was she killed?

5810.en: and when the scrolls of (men's) deeds shall be unfolded,

5811.en: and when Heaven is laid bare;

5814.en: then shall each person know what he has brought along.

5815.en: No indeed; I swear by the alternating stars

5817.en: and by the night as it recedes,

5818.en: and the morn as it breathes.

5819.en: Verily this is the word of a noble message#bearer;

5820.arabic: ذى قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِى العَرشِ مَكينٍ
5820.en: one mighty and held in honour with the Lord of the Throne;

5821.en: there he is obeyed and held trustworthy.

5822.en: (O people of Makkah), your companion is not mad;

5823.en: he indeed saw the message#bearer on the clear horizon;

5824.en: nor does he grudge (conveying this knowledge about) the Unseen;

5825.en: nor is it a word of an accursed Satan.

5826.en: Where to are you then heading?

5827.en: It is nothing but Good Counsel for everyone in the world,

5828.en: for everyone of you who wishes to follow the Straight Way;

5829.arabic: وَما تَشاءونَ إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ العـٰلَمينَ
5829.en: but your wishing will not avail unless Allah, the Lord of the Universe, so wishes.

5830.en: When the heaven is split asunder,

5832.en: when the seas are made to burst forth,

5833.en: and when graves are laid open,

5834.en: everyone shall know all his deeds, both the earlier and the later.

5835.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا الإِنسـٰنُ ما غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ الكَريمِ
5835.en: O man! What has deceived you about your generous Lord

5836.en: Who created you, shaped you, and made you well#proportioned,

5837.arabic: فى أَىِّ صورَةٍ ما شاءَ رَكَّبَكَ
5837.en: and set you in whatever form He pleased?

5838.en: No indeed; (the fact is that) you deny the Reckoning, declaring it a lie;

5839.en: you do so the while there are watchers over you;

5842.en: Surely the virtuous shall be in Bliss,

5843.en: and the wicked shall be in the Blazing Fire.

5844.en: They shall enter it on the Day of Recompense

5845.en: and then shall never come out of it.

5846.en: What do you know what the Day of Recompense is?

5847.arabic: ثُمَّ ما أَدرىٰكَ ما يَومُ الدّينِ
5847.en: Again, what do you know what the Day of Recompense is?

5848.arabic: يَومَ لا تَملِكُ نَفسٌ لِنَفسٍ شَيـًٔا وَالأَمرُ يَومَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ
5848.en: It is the Day when no one shall have the power to do anything for another, and all command shall be Allah's.

5850.arabic: الَّذينَ إِذَا اكتالوا عَلَى النّاسِ يَستَوفونَ
5850.en: those who, when they take from others by measure, take their full share;

5851.en: but who, when they measure or weigh for others, give less than their due.

5852.en: Do they not realise that they will be raised to life

5854.en: a Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the Universe?

5855.arabic: كَلّا إِنَّ كِتـٰبَ الفُجّارِ لَفى سِجّينٍ
5855.en: No indeed! Verily the deeds of the wicked are in the Record locked up in the prison#house!

5856.en: And how would you know what the Record of the prison#house is?

5858.en: Woe, then, to those that give the lie,

5859.en: those that give the lie to the Day of Recompense.

5860.arabic: وَما يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلّا كُلُّ مُعتَدٍ أَثيمٍ
5860.en: Yet none gives the lie to it except the transgressor immersed in sin;

5861.arabic: إِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِ ءايـٰتُنا قالَ أَسـٰطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
5861.en: who, when Our verses are recited to him, says: “Mere tales of olden times!”

5862.arabic: كَلّا بَل رانَ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم ما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
5862.en: No indeed! The truth is that their hearts have become rusted on account of their evil deeds.

5863.arabic: كَلّا إِنَّهُم عَن رَبِّهِم يَومَئِذٍ لَمَحجوبونَ
5863.en: No indeed! On that Day they will be screened off from seeing their Lord,

5864.en: and then they shall enter Hell,

5865.arabic: ثُمَّ يُقالُ هـٰذَا الَّذى كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبونَ
5865.en: whereafter they will be told: “This is what you used to give the lie to.”

5866.arabic: كَلّا إِنَّ كِتـٰبَ الأَبرارِ لَفى عِلِّيّينَ
5866.en: No indeed! Verily, the deeds of the virtuous shall be in the record of the exalted ones.

5867.en: And what do you know what the Record of the exalted ones is?

5869.en: which the angels placed near Allah to safeguard.

5870.en: Verily the virtuous shall be in Bliss;

5872.en: You shall see upon their faces the glow of bliss.

5873.en: They will be served a drink of the finest sealed wine,

5874.arabic: خِتـٰمُهُ مِسكٌ وَفى ذٰلِكَ فَليَتَنافَسِ المُتَنـٰفِسونَ
5874.en: whose seal is musk – so let all aspirants aspire after that –

5875.en: a wine whose mixture is Tasnim,

5876.en: a fountain at which the chosen ones shall drink.

5877.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ أَجرَموا كانوا مِنَ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا يَضحَكونَ
5877.en: Behold, the wicked were wont to laugh at the believers:

5878.en: when they passed by them they winked,

5879.arabic: وَإِذَا انقَلَبوا إِلىٰ أَهلِهِمُ انقَلَبوا فَكِهينَ
5879.en: and when they went back to their families, they went back jesting,

5880.arabic: وَإِذا رَأَوهُم قالوا إِنَّ هـٰؤُلاءِ لَضالّونَ
5880.en: and when they saw the believers, they said: “Lo! These are the erring ones”;

5881.en: (they said so although) they had not been appointed watchers over them.

5882.arabic: فَاليَومَ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا مِنَ الكُفّارِ يَضحَكونَ
5882.en: But today the believers are laughing at the unbelievers;

5883.en: seated upon their couches, they are looking around.

5884.arabic: هَل ثُوِّبَ الكُفّارُ ما كانوا يَفعَلونَ
5884.en: Have the unbelievers been duly rewarded for their deeds?

5885.en: When the sky is rent asunder

5886.en: and hearkens to the command of its Lord, doing what it should;

5887.en: and when the earth is stretched out

5888.en: and casts out what is within it and is emptied,

5889.en: and hearkens to the command of its Lord, doing what it should.

5890.arabic: يـٰأَيُّهَا الإِنسـٰنُ إِنَّكَ كادِحٌ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدحًا فَمُلـٰقيهِ
5890.en: O man, you are striving unto your Lord and you will meet Him.

5891.en: Whoever is given the Record in his right hand

5892.en: shall be called to an easy accounting,

5893.en: and shall return to his people joyfully.

5894.arabic: وَأَمّا مَن أوتِىَ كِتـٰبَهُ وَراءَ ظَهرِهِ
5894.en: But he who is given the Record behind his back,

5896.en: and will enter the Blazing Fire.

5897.en: He used to live joyfully among his people,

5898.en: thinking he would never revert (to Us).

5899.arabic: بَلىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كانَ بِهِ بَصيرًا
5899.en: But no; (how would he not revert)? His Lord was ever watching him.

5900.en: Nay; I swear by the twilight;

5901.en: and by the night and what it enfolds,

5902.en: and by the moon, when it reaches its fullness:

5903.en: you shall proceed onwards from stage to stage.

5904.en: So, what is the matter with them that they do not believe,

5905.arabic: وَإِذا قُرِئَ عَلَيهِمُ القُرءانُ لا يَسجُدونَ
5905.en: and when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate themselves?

5906.en: Instead, the unbelievers reject it, calling it a lie.

5907.en: Allah knows best what they are accumulating (in their Record).

5908.en: So give them the good news of a painful chastisement,

5909.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ لَهُم أَجرٌ غَيرُ مَمنونٍ
5909.en: except for those who believe and do good deeds. Theirs shall be an unending reward.

5910.en: By the heaven with its impregnable castles;

5912.en: and by the witness and what is witnessed:

5913.en: the people of the pit were destroyed

5916.arabic: وَهُم عَلىٰ ما يَفعَلونَ بِالمُؤمِنينَ شُهودٌ
5916.en: and were witnessing what they did to the believers.

5917.arabic: وَما نَقَموا مِنهُم إِلّا أَن يُؤمِنوا بِاللَّهِ العَزيزِ الحَميدِ
5917.en: Against these they had no grudge except that they believed in Allah, the Most Mighty, the Most Praiseworthy,

5918.arabic: الَّذى لَهُ مُلكُ السَّمـٰوٰتِ وَالأَرضِ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَىءٍ شَهيدٌ
5918.en: to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Allah witnesses everything.

5919.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ فَتَنُوا المُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِنـٰتِ ثُمَّ لَم يَتوبوا فَلَهُم عَذابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُم عَذابُ الحَريقِ
5919.en: Surely those who tormented the believing men and the believing women and then did not repent, theirs shall be the chastisement of Hell, and theirs shall be the chastisement of burning.

5920.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ لَهُم جَنّـٰتٌ تَجرى مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهـٰرُ ذٰلِكَ الفَوزُ الكَبيرُ
5920.en: As for those who believed and acted righteously, theirs shall be Gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great triumph.

5921.en: Stern indeed is your Lord's punishment.

5922.en: He it is Who creates for the first time and He it is Who will create again,

5923.en: and He is the Ever Forgiving, the Most Loving

5924.en: – the Lord of the Glorious Throne,

5925.en: the Executor of what He wills.

5926.en: Has the story of the armies reached you,

5927.en: the armies of Pharaoh and Thamud?

5928.en: The unbelievers are indeed engaged in denying it, calling it a lie,

5930.en: Nay; but this is a glorious Qur'an,

5932.en: By the heaven, and the night#visitor,

5933.en: what do you know what the night#visitor is?

5935.arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفسٍ لَمّا عَلَيها حافِظٌ
5935.en: There is no living being but there is a protector over it.

5936.en: So let man consider of what he was created.

5937.en: He was created of a gushing fluid,

5938.en: emanating from between the loins and the ribs.

5939.en: Surely He (the Creator) has the power to bring him back (to life).

5940.en: On the Day when man's deepest secrets shall be put to the test

5941.arabic: فَما لَهُ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلا ناصِرٍ
5941.en: he shall have no power, and no helper.

5942.en: By the heaven with its recurring cycle of rain,

5943.en: and by the earth ever bursting with verdure,

5944.en: this (Qur'an) is surely a decisive Word,

5947.en: and I too am devising a guile.

5948.en: So leave the unbelievers to themselves; respite them awhile.

5949.en: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High,

5950.en: Who created all things and fashioned them in good proportion;

5953.en: and then made it into a blackish straw.

5954.en: We shall make you recite and then you will not forget,

5955.arabic: إِلّا ما شاءَ اللَّهُ إِنَّهُ يَعلَمُ الجَهرَ وَما يَخفىٰ
5955.en: except what Allah should wish. He knows all that is manifest and all that is hidden.

5956.en: We shall ease you to follow the way of Ease.

5957.en: So render good counsel if good counsel will avail.

5958.en: He who fears (Allah) shall heed it,

5959.en: but the wretched will turn away from it.

5960.en: He will be cast into the Great Fire.

5961.arabic: ثُمَّ لا يَموتُ فيها وَلا يَحيىٰ
5961.en: Then he will neither die in it, nor live.

5962.en: He who purified himself shall prosper,

5963.en: remembering his Lord's name and praying.

5964.en: No; but you prefer the present life,

5965.en: whereas the Hereafter is better and more enduring.

5966.en: This, indeed, was in the ancient Scrolls,

5967.en: the Scrolls of Abraham and Moses.

5968.en: Has the news of the overwhelming event reached you?

5969.en: Some faces that Day shall be downcast with fear,

5971.en: they shall burn in a Scorching Fire;

5972.en: their drink shall be from a boiling spring.

5973.arabic: لَيسَ لَهُم طَعامٌ إِلّا مِن ضَريعٍ
5973.en: They shall have no food except bitter dry thorns

5974.arabic: لا يُسمِنُ وَلا يُغنى مِن جوعٍ
5974.en: that will neither nourish nor satisfy their hunger.

5975.en: On that very Day some faces shall be radiant with joy,

5977.en: They will be in a lofty Garden

5978.en: wherein they shall hear no vain talk.

5979.en: In it there shall be a flowing spring,

5984.arabic: أَفَلا يَنظُرونَ إِلَى الإِبِلِ كَيفَ خُلِقَت
5984.en: Do (these unbelievers) not observe the camels: how they were created?

5985.en: And the sky: how it was raised high?

5986.en: And the mountains: how they were fixed?

5987.en: And the earth: how it was spread out?

5988.en: So render good counsel, for you are simply required to counsel,

5989.en: and are not invested with the authority to compel them.

5990.en: But whoever will turn away (from the Truth),

5991.en: Allah will chastise him with the most terrible chastisement.

5992.en: Surely to Us is their return;

5993.en: and then it is for Us to call them to account.

5996.en: and the even and the odd,

5997.en: and by the night when it departs.

5998.arabic: هَل فى ذٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِذى حِجرٍ
5998.en: Is there in this an oath for one endowed with understanding?

5999.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ كَيفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعادٍ
5999.en: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with Ad

6000.en: of Iram, known for their lofty columns,

6001.arabic: الَّتى لَم يُخلَق مِثلُها فِى البِلـٰدِ
6001.en: the like of whom no nation was ever created in the lands of the world?

6002.en: And how did He deal with Thamud who hewed out rocks in the valley?

6003.en: And with Pharaoh of the tent pegs

6004.en: who transgressed in the countries of the world

6006.en: Then their Lord unloosed upon them the lash of chastisement.

6007.en: Truly your Lord is ever watchful.

6008.arabic: فَأَمَّا الإِنسـٰنُ إِذا مَا ابتَلىٰهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقولُ رَبّى أَكرَمَنِ
6008.en: As for man, when his Lord tests him by exalting him and bestowing His bounties upon him, he says: “My Lord has exalted me.”

6009.arabic: وَأَمّا إِذا مَا ابتَلىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيهِ رِزقَهُ فَيَقولُ رَبّى أَهـٰنَنِ
6009.en: But when He tests him by straitening his sustenance, he says: “My Lord has humiliated me.”

6010.en: But no; you do not treat the orphan honourably,

6011.en: and do not urge one another to feed the poor,

6012.en: and greedily devour the entire inheritance,

6013.en: and love the riches, loving them ardently.

6014.arabic: كَلّا إِذا دُكَّتِ الأَرضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
6014.en: But no; when the earth is ground to powder,

6015.en: and when your Lord appears with rows upon rows of angels,

6016.arabic: وَجِا۟ىءَ يَومَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ يَومَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الإِنسـٰنُ وَأَنّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكرىٰ
6016.en: and when Hell is brought near that Day. On that Day will man understand, but of what avail will that understanding be?

6017.en: He will say: “Would that I had sent ahead what would be of avail for this life of mine!”

6018.en: Then on that Day Allah will chastise as none other can chastise;

6019.en: and Allah will bind as none other can bind.

6020.en: (On the other hand it will be said): “O serene soul!

6021.en: Return to your Lord well#pleased (with your blissful destination), well#pleasing (to your Lord).

6024.en: Nay! I swear by this city

6025.en: – this city wherein you have been rendered violable–

6026.en: and I swear by the parent and his offspring:

6027.en: Verily We have created man into toil and hardship.

6028.arabic: أَيَحسَبُ أَن لَن يَقدِرَ عَلَيهِ أَحَدٌ
6028.en: Does he think that no one can overpower him?

6029.en: He says: “I have squandered enormous wealth.”

6030.en: Does he believe that none has seen him?

6031.en: Did We not grant him two eyes,

6032.en: and a tongue and two lips?

6033.en: And did We not show him the two highroads (of good and evil)?

6034.en: But he did not venture to scale the difficult steep.

6035.en: And what do you know what that difficult steep is?

6036.en: It is freeing someone's neck from slavery;

6037.arabic: أَو إِطعـٰمٌ فى يَومٍ ذى مَسغَبَةٍ
6037.en: or giving food on a day of hunger

6038.en: to an orphan near of kin;

6039.en: or to a destitute lying in dust;

6040.arabic: ثُمَّ كانَ مِنَ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَتَواصَوا بِالصَّبرِ وَتَواصَوا بِالمَرحَمَةِ
6040.en: and, then besides this, he be one of those who believed, and enjoined upon one another steadfastness and enjoined upon one another compassion.

6041.en: These are the People of the Right Hand.

6042.arabic: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا بِـٔايـٰتِنا هُم أَصحـٰبُ المَشـَٔمَةِ
6042.en: As for those who rejected Our Signs, they are the People of the Left Hand.

6043.en: Upon them shall be a Fire that will hem them in.

6044.en: By the sun and its heat and brightness,

6045.en: and by the moon as it follows it;

6046.en: and by the day as it displays the sun's glory,

6047.en: and by the night as it envelopes the sun;

6048.en: and by the sky and by Him Who made it;

6049.en: and by the earth and by Him Who stretched it out;

6050.en: and by the soul and by Him Who perfectly proportioned it,

6051.en: and imbued it with (the consciousness of) its evil and its piety:

6052.en: He who purifies it will prosper,

6053.en: and he who suppresses it will be ruined.

6054.en: In their presumptuous insolence the Thamud called the Truth a lie

6055.en: when their arch#criminal rose up in rage.

6056.arabic: فَقالَ لَهُم رَسولُ اللَّهِ ناقَةَ اللَّهِ وَسُقيـٰها
6056.en: Then Allah's Messenger warned them: “Hands off the she#camel and her drink!”

6057.arabic: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَعَقَروها فَدَمدَمَ عَلَيهِم رَبُّهُم بِذَنبِهِم فَسَوّىٰها
6057.en: But they rejected his statement as a lie and hamstrung the she#camel. For that crime their Lord rumbled down upon them, utterly razing them to the ground.

6058.en: He has no fear of its sequel.

6059.en: By the night when it enshrouds,

6060.en: and by the day when it breaks in its glory,

6061.en: and by Him Who created the male and the female:

6063.en: As for him who gave out his wealth (for Allah's sake) and abstained (from disobeying Him),

6064.en: and affirmed the Truth of goodness:

6065.en: We shall facilitate for him the Way to Bliss.

6066.en: As for him who was a miser and behaved with aversion (to Allah),

6067.en: and denied the Truth of goodness:

6068.en: We shall facilitate for him the way to Hardship,

6069.arabic: وَما يُغنى عَنهُ مالُهُ إِذا تَرَدّىٰ
6069.en: and his wealth shall be of no avail to him when he perishes.

6070.en: Surely it is for Us to show the Right Way,

6071.en: and to Us belong the Next Life and the present.

6072.en: I have now warned you of a Blazing Fire,

6073.en: where none shall burn except the most wicked,

6074.en: who rejected the Truth, calling it falsehood and turned his back on it.

6075.en: But the God#fearing shall be kept away from it,

6076.en: the Godfearing who spends his wealth to purify himself;

6077.arabic: وَما لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُ مِن نِعمَةٍ تُجزىٰ
6077.en: not as payment for any favours that he received,

6078.en: but only to seek the good pleasure of his Lord Most High.

6079.en: He will surely be well#pleased (with him).

6081.en: and by the night when it covers the world with peace:

6082.en: (O Prophet), your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased.

6083.en: Indeed what is to come will be better for you than what has gone by.

6084.en: Verily your Lord will soon give you so amply that you will be well#pleased.

6085.en: Did He not find you an orphan and then gave you shelter?

6086.en: Did He not find you unaware of the Right Way, and then directed you to it?

6087.en: And did He not find you in want, and then enriched you?

6088.en: Therefore, be not harsh with the orphan;

6089.en: and chide not him who asks,

6090.en: and proclaim the bounty of your Lord.

6091.en: (O Prophet), Did We not lay open your breast

6092.en: and relieve you of the burden

6093.en: that had well#nigh broken your back?

6094.en: And did We not exalt your fame?

6095.en: Indeed, there is ease with hardship.

6096.en: Most certainly, there is ease with hardship.

6097.en: So, whenever you are free, strive in devotion,

6098.en: and turn to your Lord with longing.

6099.en: By the fig and the olive;

6101.en: and by this city (of Makkah), a haven of peace:

6102.arabic: لَقَد خَلَقنَا الإِنسـٰنَ فى أَحسَنِ تَقويمٍ
6102.en: surely We created man in the best mould;

6103.en: then We reverted him to the lowest of the low,

6104.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ فَلَهُم أَجرٌ غَيرُ مَمنونٍ
6104.en: except those who have faith and do righteous deeds. Theirs is a never ending reward.

6105.en: Who, then, can give the lie to you, (O Prophet), about the Reward and the Punishment?

6106.en: Is not Allah the Greatest of all sovereigns?

6107.en: Recite in the name of your Lord Who created,

6108.en: created man from a clot of congealed blood.

6109.en: Recite: and your Lord is Most Generous,

6111.en: taught man what he did not know.

6113.en: for he believes himself to be self#sufficient.

6114.en: Surely to your Lord is your return.

6115.en: Did you see him who forbids

6116.en: a servant (of Allah) when he prays?

6117.en: Did you consider: what if he is on the Right Way,

6119.en: Did you consider: what if he gives the lie (to the Truth) and turns away (from it)?

6120.en: Does he not know that Allah sees everything?

6121.arabic: كَلّا لَئِن لَم يَنتَهِ لَنَسفَعًا بِالنّاصِيَةِ
6121.en: No indeed; if he does not desist, We shall drag him by the forelock;

6122.en: by the lying forelock steeped in sin.

6123.en: So let him summon his helpmates;

6124.en: We too shall summon the guards of Hell.

6125.en: No, not at all. Never obey him. But prostrate yourself and become nigh (to your Lord).

6126.en: Behold, We revealed this (Qur'an) on the Night of Power.

6127.en: And what do you know what the Night of Power is?

6128.arabic: لَيلَةُ القَدرِ خَيرٌ مِن أَلفِ شَهرٍ
6128.en: The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.

6129.arabic: تَنَزَّلُ المَلـٰئِكَةُ وَالرّوحُ فيها بِإِذنِ رَبِّهِم مِن كُلِّ أَمرٍ
6129.en: The angels along with the Spirit descend in it by the permission of their Lord with all kinds of decrees.

6130.en: All peace is that night until the rise of dawn.

6131.arabic: لَم يَكُنِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن أَهلِ الكِتـٰبِ وَالمُشرِكينَ مُنفَكّينَ حَتّىٰ تَأتِيَهُمُ البَيِّنَةُ
6131.en: Those who disbelieved – be they from the People of the Book or from those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity – will not desist from unbelief until the Clear Proof should come to them;

6132.arabic: رَسولٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ يَتلوا صُحُفًا مُطَهَّرَةً
6132.en: a Messenger from Allah, reciting from Purified Scrolls;

6133.en: in writings wherein are scriptures, absolutely true and unerring.

6134.arabic: وَما تَفَرَّقَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتـٰبَ إِلّا مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَتهُمُ البَيِّنَةُ
6134.en: Nor did those to whom the Book had been given split up until after the Proof (of the Right Way) had come to them.

6135.arabic: وَما أُمِروا إِلّا لِيَعبُدُوا اللَّهَ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ حُنَفاءَ وَيُقيمُوا الصَّلوٰةَ وَيُؤتُوا الزَّكوٰةَ وَذٰلِكَ دينُ القَيِّمَةِ
6135.en: Yet all that they had been commanded was that they serve Allah, with utter sincerity, devoting themselves exclusively to Him, and that they establish Prayer and pay Zakah. That is the Right Faith.

6136.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن أَهلِ الكِتـٰبِ وَالمُشرِكينَ فى نارِ جَهَنَّمَ خـٰلِدينَ فيها أُولـٰئِكَ هُم شَرُّ البَرِيَّةِ
6136.en: Those who disbelieved – be they from among the People of the Book or among those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity– shall be in the Fire, and will abide in it. They are the worst of creatures.

6137.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ أُولـٰئِكَ هُم خَيرُ البَرِيَّةِ
6137.en: But those that believe and work righteous deeds, they are the best of creatures.

6138.arabic: جَزاؤُهُم عِندَ رَبِّهِم جَنّـٰتُ عَدنٍ تَجرى مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهـٰرُ خـٰلِدينَ فيها أَبَدًا رَضِىَ اللَّهُ عَنهُم وَرَضوا عَنهُ ذٰلِكَ لِمَن خَشِىَ رَبَّهُ
6138.en: Their recompense lies with their Lord: Gardens of eternity beneath which rivers flow; therein they shall dwell, forever and ever. Allah is well#pleased with them, and they are well#pleased with Him. All this is for him who fears his Lord.

6139.en: When the earth will be shaken with a mighty shaking,

6140.en: and the earth will throw up all her burdens,

6141.en: and man will cry out: “What is the matter with her?”

6142.en: On that Day it will relate all her news,

6143.en: for your Lord will have commanded her (to do so).

6144.arabic: يَومَئِذٍ يَصدُرُ النّاسُ أَشتاتًا لِيُرَوا أَعمـٰلَهُم
6144.en: On that Day people will go forth in varying states so that they be shown their deeds.

6145.arabic: فَمَن يَعمَل مِثقالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيرًا يَرَهُ
6145.en: So, whoever does an atom's weight of good shall see it;

6146.arabic: وَمَن يَعمَل مِثقالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ
6146.en: and whoever does an atom's weight of evil shall see it.

6148.en: then raise sparks of fire (by their hoofs),

6150.en: and blaze a trail of dust,

6151.en: and penetrate deep into a host.

6152.en: Verily man is most ungrateful to his Lord;

6153.en: and he himself is a witness to that,

6154.en: and surely he loves riches with a passionate loving.

6155.arabic: أَفَلا يَعلَمُ إِذا بُعثِرَ ما فِى القُبورِ
6155.en: Is he not aware that when whatever lies (buried) in the graves is overthrown;

6156.en: and the secrets of the hearts are laid bare (and examined)?

6157.en: Surely on that Day will their Lord be fully informed about them.

6160.en: And what do you know what the Calamity is?

6161.en: On that Day human beings shall be like scattered moths,

6162.en: and the mountains shall be like fluffs of carded wool in varying colours.

6163.en: Then he whose scales weigh heavier

6165.en: but he whose scales weigh lighter,

6166.en: his shall be the deep pit for a dwelling.

6167.en: And what do you know what that is?

6169.en: The craving for ever#greater worldly gains and to excel others in that regard keeps you occupied

6171.en: Nay, you will soon come to know;

6172.en: nay, again, you shall soon come to know.

6173.en: Nay, would that you knew with certainty of knowledge (what your attitude will lead to, you would never have acted the way you do).

6174.en: You will surely end up seeing Hell;

6175.en: again, you shall most certainly end up seeing it with absolute certainty.

6176.en: Then, on that Day, you will be called to account for all the bounties you enjoyed.

6178.en: Lo! Man is in a state of loss;

6179.arabic: إِلَّا الَّذينَ ءامَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّـٰلِحـٰتِ وَتَواصَوا بِالحَقِّ وَتَواصَوا بِالصَّبرِ
6179.en: save those who have faith and do righteous deeds, and counsel each other to hold on to truth and counsel each other to be steadfast.

6181.en: who amasses wealth and counts it over and again.

6182.en: He thinks that his wealth will immortalise him forever.

6183.en: Nay, he shall be thrown into the Crusher.

6184.en: And what do you know what the Crusher is?

6185.en: It is the Fire kindled by Allah,

6186.en: the Fire that shall rise to the hearts (of criminals).

6187.en: Verily it will close in upon them,

6189.arabic: أَلَم تَرَ كَيفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصحـٰبِ الفيلِ
6189.en: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephants?

6190.en: Did He not bring their plan to naught?

6191.en: And He sent against them swarms of birds

6192.en: which smote them with stones of baked clay,

6193.en: and made them like straw eaten up (by cattle).

6195.en: accustomed to the journey of winter and summer,

6196.en: therefore, let them worship the Lord of this House;

6197.arabic: الَّذى أَطعَمَهُم مِن جوعٍ وَءامَنَهُم مِن خَوفٍ
6197.en: Who fed them against hunger, and secured them against fear.

6198.en: Did you see him who gives the lie to the Reward and Punishment of the Hereafter?

6199.en: Such is the one who repulses the orphans away,

6200.en: and urges not the feeding of the needy.

6201.en: Woe, then, to those who pray,

6202.en: but are heedless in their Prayers,

6203.en: those who do good (in order) to be seen,

6204.en: and deny people the articles of common necessity.

6205.en: (O Prophet), We have surely bestowed upon you good in abundance.

6206.en: So offer Prayer and sacrifice to your Lord alone.

6207.en: Verily your enemy alone has been cut off from the roots.

6209.en: I do not worship those that you worship

6210.en: neither do you worship Him Whom I worship;

6211.en: nor will I worship those whom you have worshipped;

6212.en: nor are you going to worship Him Whom I worship.

6213.en: To you is your religion, and to me, my religion.

6214.en: When the help comes from Allah, and victory (is granted),

6215.arabic: وَرَأَيتَ النّاسَ يَدخُلونَ فى دينِ اللَّهِ أَفواجًا
6215.en: and you see people entering Allah's religion in multitudes,

6216.arabic: فَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ وَاستَغفِرهُ إِنَّهُ كانَ تَوّابًا
6216.en: then extol the praise of your Lord and pray to Him for forgiveness. For He indeed is ever disposed to accept repentance.

6217.en: Destroyed were the hands of Abu Lahab, and he lay utterly doomed.

6218.arabic: ما أَغنىٰ عَنهُ مالُهُ وَما كَسَبَ
6218.en: His wealth did not avail him, nor his acquisitions.

6219.en: Surely, he will be cast into a Flaming Fire

6220.en: along with his wife, that carrier of slanderous tales;

6221.en: upon her neck shall be a rope of palm#fibre.

6222.en: Say: “He is Allah, the One and Unique;

6223.en: Allah, Who is in need of none and of Whom all are in need;

6224.en: He neither begot any nor was He begotten,

6225.en: and none is comparable to Him.”

6226.en: Say: “I seek refuge with the Lord of the rising day;

6227.en: from the evil of all that He created;

6228.en: from the evil of night's darkness when it spreads around;

6229.en: from the evil of the women who blow on knots;

6230.en: and from the evil of the envier when he envies.”

6231.en: Say: “I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind;

6234.en: from the mischief of the whispering, elusive prompter who returns again and again,

6235.en: who whispers in the hearts of people;

6236.en: whether he be from the jinn or humans.”
